AgxcfbobrbgC2zO9umJ3bQ.text: I've heard a lot of good things about Bachi burger yet never made the time to actually try it out. The reviews on here are mostly positive from what I've seen, with the majority of the problems coming from complaints over service/having to wait (which I think is a ridiculous thing to complain about in the first place). Customer service is a big deal to me, but since everyone says the food is on another level, I finally decided to give it a chance. And OH BOY am I glad I did!  I came in around 5pm and I could tell it was pretty busy at first glance. I was almost instantly greeted by a friendly young woman, despite the rush. I believe she said her name was Bianca. I was almost taken aback since it seemed pretty hectic and she was still so polite and charming. After reading the reviews on here I was expecting much worse right from the start! I can't stress enough how impressed I was though, she seemed to be doing more than one job yet still made it a point to update me on how long I'd be waiting (about 20~30). Left a great first impression and actually ended up waiting shorter than expected even!   I took a seat at the bar with a buddy of mine and I have to point out how they had the menus organized. Everything was easy to find and having the ingredients all on there for each item is a simple, convenient idea. Aubrey was also very helpful in explaining the menu, the variety of drink choices, and just how everything worked there in general. She really knew her stuff!  Everything looked tempting to try honestly, but I was feeling more of a ramen mood than burgers. I'm a huge fan of ramen and I'm constantly trying to find the best of what Vegas has to offer.  And if you're a fan of ramen like i am, Shoku ramen is definitely a MUST. Oh man, it blew me away. I kept it simple with an order of the spicy tonkotsu and was considering ordering extra ingredients, but I was assured the serving size would be more than accommodating. (And I'm so grateful for that advice) The bowls were a little larger than what I usually expect and I was very happy about that! Especially considering how delicious it was. The broth fused perfectly with all the ingredients and that tontoro is seriously out of this world. I even had to order extra of it because it was so good, literally melts in your mouth. I got a lychee soda paired with that which was super tasty, a little too sweet for me to finish though. I also tried a 21+ caramel milkshake which was pretty interesting. Maybe a little "too spiked" but really nothing worth complaining about because it was still great.   The staff all seemed really nice and while I noticed some of them did appear to be "goofing off" with each other, it really didn't halt or even delay any service. I can appreciate a restaurant with friendly people working there, and it's always nice to see staff get along. With the service getting so much gripe on yelp I was expecting the worst, but then again I'm not a stickler for little things. I know how it is to work in a fast-paced environment and a busy restaurant. I know how it can get so maybe that's why I'm a little more sympathetic toward it, but as long as everyone is handling their work and getting stuff done in the restaurant, it's no reason to give anything less than 4 stars. A lot of the complaints I've read on here are now starting to sound more trivial, appearing to be people upset over things not being catered specifically for them. Just cut the workers some slack, and try to realize they're working hard to get things done for everyone in the restaurant.  Besides that though, I definitely plan on returning soon to try one of their famous burgers! I noticed that some of them were pretty huge, but if it's too big for you to handle you can easily cut it into smaller portions. If you're someone who doesn't sweat the small stuff, and don't mind waiting then I definitely recommend giving this Bachi a try. If you're in it for some delicious food and a friendly atmosphere then this is the place to go!  Don't let the negative reviews steer you away, it's definitely worth your time to try it out at least once! Your taste buds will thank you :-)

ixhnZZkx_r-YB36G-WplMw.text: 1st complaint- Completely overpriced.  $12 burgers with no side and a $10 beer!  2nd complaint- Burgers were eh. Asked for medium, got practically rare. Flavorless. N-N-Out makes a better burger for a fraction of the cost.  3rd Complaint- I'm in my 30's and I don't love loud music but I don't mind it and it's not something I would usually complain about but when techno trance music is playing so loud on a Monday afternoon that you can't even have a conversation with your own party... it's too loud.   Last and BIGGEST complaint- I'm still in shock by this... I ordered iced green tea.  I took one drink, it was horrible. Tried to pass it along to my friends but everyone thought it was horrible. I told the waitress she could take it because I didn't like it.  Her very first response was "Well did you already drink out of it?"  What??!!  Are you kidding me?!  What was she gonna do, give it to someone else?  My natural response to her was "of course, that's how I know I don't like it!"   Her next response shocked me more than the first... I kid you not, she said "Hmmmm, I'll have to find out about this"   HMMMM????   I almost walked out then.  She came back several minutes later to let me know her manager would take it off the bill this time.  If I would have drank half the tea, I'd understand but there were 3 drinks taken out of it.  Worst manager ever!   Waitress was all around horrible btw.  The whole experience was horrible.  $70 for 3 people. 3 burgers, 1 order of fries and 1 beer.

wtYy5u-NvKHVCbcs877rfQ.text: Burgers are excellent... especially for Las Vegas.  There isn't a crazy plethora of burger places here like there are in So. Cal.    However, its too busy and super disorganized.  Its a poor use of space and the staff isn't trained well enough.  They should learn to maximize use of the space and at least seat people.  They're not the most accommodating so its hard for me to bring people or go back even though I loved the food.    The service isn't great.  They tend to forget things and they can't seem to keep everything moving.    I wish I could make this a regular spot because its just as good as umami (which has smaller portion sizes) and stout (with more food options... but much less beer choices) but I won't wait this long just to get a burger.  It would be great to have a bar area or find a way to get people in more quickly.

ZLR0PC_lMhjmtoQnc5XGyg.text: I'm middle of the road on this one. After watching this local joint on Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives Guy F. did a great job talking this place up. I think it left me with super high expectations, so I'm trying to be fair here.  The food itself was really good. I had an entree salad, hubs had oxtail fries. I don't think the portion sizes matched the price tag; after tip $28! I get that you pay for quality ingredients, but on an entree salad I doubt the amount of chicken I was served really justified a $10 price tag considering the portion size.  I was a little bothered by the lack of description of the dish. My salad for example said: House Salad, description: free-range chicken. Nothing else. What bothered me is I had to ask about dressing, didn't think to ask about what else is in it as house salads are pretty generic. So color me shocked when it came with walnuts. Um, what if I had a severe nut allergy? Don't you think that might have changed my order?  The atmosphere was... dull. Waitress had 0 personality, the clientele was yuppy-hipster types (not my thing). The place had no personality, just some enlarged photos of Japanese store fronts.  I don't know. I just didn't get it. 5 star on taste, 2 star on everything else, meet in the middle for a 3 star on yelp.

WddtRsmZamLnG1yv2d309A.text: For day two of my friends' bachelor/bachelorette Vegas extravaganza we went to Bachi Burger for lunch.  Menu: - Oxtail Chili Cheese Fries ($11.50) - Salt and Pepper Garlic French Fries ($4.00) - Truffle Parmesan Fries ($4.00) - Shogun Burger ($25.00) - Kalbi Burger ($9.00) - Kiki's Burger ($10.00) - Ronin Burger ($10.00) - Portuguese Donuts with Coffee Gelato - Mandarin Orange Tangerine Soda - The Katsushiro  Our party of 11 arrived around 1:30pm on a Monday. The restaurant was about half full, but there was no space large enough for our group. We waited about 20-30 minutes before a table was cleared. Since we had to wait for a table we already knew what we wanted to order when we were sat.  Our server was pretty nice and relatively attentive.   The Oxtail Chili Cheese Fries with garlic aioli and fried egg was delicious! The chili was pretty tasty and I loved the fresh cilantro and jalapeno slices the fries were garnished with. The portion is pretty big so sharing this is a good idea. The other fries were also pretty good, nothing particularly outstanding, but good enough.  I decided to go with the Kalibi Burger (Angus beef, kalbi marinade, house made kimchi, green onions, and ko chu jang mayo) because I love Korean food and Korean flavors. This burger was delicious. I asked for my burger medium, and while it was a little more of a medium rare, it was well seasoned and juicy. The house made kimchi was pretty good and the ko chu jang mayo was tasty, too. The burger also came with a little side of kimchi style cucumbers, which were delicious. I would totally get this again.  Two of my friends decided to go with the Shogun Burger (Waygu beef, unagi, poached asian pear, pan seared foie gras, miso butter, yamamomo peach). This was delicious, and it better be for $25. All the flavors married really well together and made this burger really tasty. Both who ordered it were very satisfied. I had a bite of the Ronin Burger (Angus beef, caramelized onions, Japanese cole slaw, miso goma dressing, fried egg, katsu BBQ, yuzu citrus aioli), which was pretty tasty, as was Kiki's Burger (Angus beef, sauteed shiitake, enoki and eryngi mushrooms, caramelized bacon, sweet onion marmalade, gruyere cheese, garlic chili aioli), which was also pretty tasty.  For dessert we ordered the Portuguese Donuts with Coffee Gelato after seeing a picture of it posted at the entrance of the restaurant. I think it looked better in the picture than it tasted. The donuts were a little doughy and dense. I liked the coffee gelato, but I mean, it was coffee gelato.   The Mandarin Orange Tangerine Soda was pretty tasty. The Katsushiro (alcoholic) was also pretty good, according to the bachelorette.   Overall, I thought Bachi Burger was pretty tasty. I'd definitely come back here for a burger.

RbD3ZcEGE_BILJj5uDhGIg.text: My husband and I shared the Moco Loco and fries for lunch (plenty for us). It was delicious.  The burgers being served at the other tables looked amazing. We just flew into Vegas and wanted to get lunch before checking into our hotel. This was perfect - easy to get to before hitting the strip. Service was awesome - very friendly and also made sure our drinks we were "ok" without being intrusive.

dCNLXBS7RX2F1TzUL2oHAw.text: This isn't the great Bachi burger that we all remember. It's completely changed in terms of service and quality of food served. It's very sad because I've visited 3x over the last year and half and it's been the same poor service and quality each time. I'm completely heartbroken over this because I always used to bring guests Bachi Burger. I honestly won't ever come back again. The evening began with getting seated in the ramen room. They were cooking something like onion or something spicy. Everyone seated in the room was literally in tears from whatever they were cooking.  Server brought some of our drinks then just disappeared. The meal was as follows: garlic edamame with no flavor. We sent them back. She had them remade but they came out with so much salt that we were cringing while eating them. Both batches were the same. We didn't bother sending them back because it wasn't worth the hassle. We asked for our fries and burgers to come out at the same time. Our fries came out 10 minutes before and were cold. The burgers finally came out and were  just warm. The eggs in two of our burgers were overcooked. The other person helping the waiter brought our desserts WHILE WE WERE STILL EATING.  it was the most bizarre thing ever. We told them to take them back until we were done. Finally when we ask for the desserts again, we asked for a candle. The waiter said they were out of candles and they didn't sing happy birthday . Okay fine, that's not a huge deal. It's a bit weird, but i won't hold that against them. The food, however,  was bad as was the service. It honestly pains me to write this because I truly loved Bachi burger, but this is the 3rd time we have had bad service and bad food so I feel it's my responsibility to let people know that Bachi Burger is no longer a good place to eat...

r8JoAmdIpu71D18_Kakm8g.text: Very tasty we all had different burgers. The parm truffle fries did not last long. Burgers consumed were miyagi san, bahn mi, m ronin and basic bacon cheese burger. Full stomachs and a great lunch!

R3qwiRRwyR_r0vXCNZehOw.text: I cannot believe I didn't write a review of this place! My husband and I brought our son here with us on our Spring Break trip this year. I had read that they had a foie gras burger and since we are Californians and denied the joy of foie anymore, we had to come.  Our picky eater son had the fries which he loved. My husband and I started with the chili fries with the oxtail. OMG. Like OMG. We both had the Shogun Burger. It was like angels sang and wept. THE BEST! The manager came by later and we told her how much we loved the burger. She said a lot of Californians come in and are enraptured by it.  It's a hipster kinda place with Japanese influence but don't let that scare you off.

1Qhz-36EdT7F_ZeNJE8ykQ.text: Its been a long time coming back because of service. I had family in town that wanted to try it out. Our server was great and she was patient as we had alot of questions. She also helped out with making sure that my sisters food was gluten free. The food was amazing!! I dont remembering it being that good before. Will be back.

eCOcmKkESe_2dM5rI0AQ_Q.text: First time ever to Bachi Burger. It was delicious and service was fantastic. We had the oxtail fries (definitely a highly recommend), spicy miso burger (one of the most delicious burgers I have ever had), and than my friend has the crusty crab (also pretty decent).   About the service, waitress asked of we had any allergies that they should know about. I do not have any, but this is the first time I was ever asked this question. It is a very considerate question to ask. Also, when my friend and I provided our credit cards to pay she asked for our IDs!? It is the little things that count. In a world so full of identity theft I really appreciated this question.   Amazing food and service. This location is kind of far from my house, but I will be visiting the closer one more frequently now!

bzJEL8Ea_LR05nKj4ACVyg.text: Food is great!  Service is good, music does not fit!  They need to play things that relax you a bit.  Too loud.

6WeHOTwqavlauK1og7qKgQ.text: Omg the Miso burger is beyond delicious!! And the Parmesan fries!  I looove this place, I literally crave it every couple months and have to come.  They have more than burgers on the menu too so you not limited.  Staff is always friendly and well educated on the menu, they always answer all questions with ease and detail!

t5P3jWch71QsIZlGN4Z3og.text: Bachi was like other upscale burger joints. I was disappointed in the flavor of my burger because I upgraded to the wagyu and was not impressed.  All in all, presentation was on point and the fries were solid.

NYVpmLDjGAovyTLknZU8kA.text: Been going here for years.  I always get the Kiki burger.  So freaking good. I honestly haven't tried any other burger! I get the truffle fries with that too and it's always a winner for me.  The meat itself is perfect and grade a. Very creative dishes there and it's a fun casual environment for everyone including kids.

YEwDAYSSLfzxYCOCsSwelA.text: Like many of the other reviewers here, I first heard about Bachi Burger while watching the Food Network.  The burgers that they highlighted on that episode were nothing short of remarkable in terms of their creativity and I could practically see the flavors jumping out of the screen and performing kabuki theater on my tasebuds.    Two of my favorite things - Asian Food and Burgers - combined into the same meal?  Sign me up!!  So, it practically goes without saying that my next trip through Vegas contained "Bachi Burger" at the top of my TO-DO list.  And I wasn't disappointed.  This place is incredible!  I've been here twice now and though I still have several of their burgers yet to try, my personal favorite has been the Kalbi Burger with Kimchee and the pork-belly steam buns.  Seriously some of the most flavorful creations I have ever encountered.  My friends had the Miagi San and the Black and Green Burgers and everyone was no less than amazed.  The creators of Bachi Burger have created a winner here.  I hope that their success continues so that I won't have to go all of the way to Vegas anytime that I want one of these Zen burgers.  Of course, for the time being, I'm more than willing - because they're worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steam buns. Yuuuuum.

v1JhdRiG5HJa4mWjyX697g.text: Came here with a party of 9 on a Saturday night. Previous comments were unhappy on the service but I think the owner listened because we were served in the 30 minutes they told us. They even came out to tell us the previous table has paid and just needs to pack their leftovers.  Food here was up to the hype. I am a big fan of burgers! I had their shogun burger, that's wagyu and unagi with seared foie gras... This burger melted in my mouth. I tasted the buttery foie gras and when I asked for medium, it came out medium so there was no hesitation there. The appetizers were good. I recommend the oxtail fries with an egg over. Truffle fries were good too but nothing extraordinary.   This will be one of the spots I will come back to everytime I'm here. See you in June for sure!

nyY7ATPmo8aCq54qftVBJQ.text: If you're in the area, forget about in and out or ANY burger place, don't hesitate and come here!  Got tipped off by a guy at the rental car place to come here instead of in and out. Thank god we took his advice because the food was phenomenal! Oxtail fries are a must. The burgers were well cooked and artisanal, toppings did not really overpower and complimented everything very well. My next vegas trip, I'll definitely have to visit again! Also, beware this place gets busy. We arrived 30 minutes after they opened and there was a line of about 12 or so already formed.

pVyXSyeLevnWaCKBw7o0kw.text: The burgers, beer and fries are very, very good. Unfortunately, the service sucks.  It's hit or miss anytime you go. This is a very popular restaurant. They've been open long enough to get their sh*t together. They just don't seem to be able to serve customers consistently. Sometimes it is fine, other visits can be a total disaster. You can experience MIA waiters, an abandoned check-in stand and delayed or confused orders.   The poor service really puts a damper on your dining experience and will make you forget how fun the food is. You have to be strategic about your dining times so you don't get lost in the chaos.

l595vSSyBlZg3ycEEI1gkA.text: The food was good, service was great and atmosphere was inviting.  That being said, it wasn't my cup of tea when it came to the burger I ordered.  They get 4 stars because I will go back and try other things but I'm more of a plain ol good beef and cheese type burger guy.  These are a bit too gourmet for my taste but I can see why they are popular and I'd recommend for anyone to give this place a try!

zFwIzI73qRdld9d2bvlYDw.text: My favorite neighbor hood restaurant interesting and tasty burgers.  For me it needs a bar if they had a bar wow it would rival all bars it that area

Why would you name your restaurant "BAD LUCK BURGER" what the hell, we eating bad luck for lunch?? hell NAW!!! thats bad for your body thats bad luck i want good luck all the time!! We were greeted by a grumpy old white man at the front and he sat us down and grumbled and mumbled some words under his stinky breath, I could smell the air comin out of his mouth hole, it was like cigarettes combined with a jar of pee pee left in the sun for 3 days! oo man oo man bam it made me so hungry! I think some of his dandruff fell into my water cause i looked into my glass and it looked like a snow-globe in there! it was very cute but i dont wanna drink old white dry skin flakes! thats nasty basty! everytime he walk by he would be talking to himself, i do that too, i usually say inspirational quotes to myself to get my mind through the day cause lately i been feeling depressed and down and i dont like it. so i recorded him with my android robot 4 phone and used the CSI voice analyzer app to hear what he was saying. turns out he was just saying the lyrics to the Jug Jug song by Jimmy Crabbits. i was let down yet again by this man. cVFZ6zx41hHZTRP5zd6vbA.text: Quite good burgers, other interesting stuff on the menu, fast service, clean, easy parking.

DRSmkh3_C21xsOu2V9QWUw.text: The burgers here are so flavourful, juicy, and delicious! We had the miyagi burger? I think? Anyways, the buns were cooked to perfection and the toppings worked very well to enhance the burgers' taste!! The regular fries were thin and crispy, just how I personally like them. We also tried their shoyu ramen which was also amazing. The broth was perfect (not too salty, not bland), and the noodles and egg(s) were cooked nicely as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shoyu Ramen :)

a9AicikGMgQxrP-FyCuYoA.text: Amazing food! Seriously, the mr miyagki burger was one of the best burgers ever. The pork belly buns are delicious. There were 3 small buns so definitely craving more. The milkshakes are worth the extra calories. The salted caramel toasted marshmallow was addicting!   Only getting 4 stars due to poor, inattentive service :(. And that they ran out of the top seller burger (bahmi) within an hour of opening. They didn't tell us until we ordered it. Am disappointed we couldn't try it

ottntKOd27txQX4Kz1xhjA.text: Saw this place on the Food Network last year... I go to Vegas every 2 months and something always comes up to distract me from going. Insisted we go this trip. Was it good? Hell yeah!! Was it epic? Nahhh. Pros: Great burger my goodness! Great menu... less is definitely more (on the menu)... good sign of a great food establishment.  Hate to see a 4 page menu of a bunch of silly stuff...ranging from chicken wings to liver and onions...geeeze... just give me the goods! Fresh ingredients! Ok a couple of us had the famous burgers...fried eggs 'n all. Wow! I had the spicy miso ramen. Enough for 2.. as authentic as you can get too... omg was it tasty. The "regular" spicy is perfect along with the "house hot sauce. I think the "extra spicy" soup may have been a tad too hot for me. We tried the listed parmesan garlic fries,  and onion rings (not on menu) they were tasty!  The cons, hence the missing star: busy busy busy which can be a great sign, but it's too small. This place deserves a larger place, not sandwiched in a tiny corner strip mall connected to subway. Wait at 3pm (to me that should be an "off time of day) was 45 minutes for 5 of us. Most tables are for 2, maybe a couple for 4. Prices were okay for appetizers.. too much for ramen and burgers.  Burgers were tasty as heck but on the smaller side..Come on people.. $18 for a bison burger? Sure in a cool location at a popular casino.. but not in a corner strip mall.  All In all great food. One tip.... move your rat trap from the front door by the trashcan... to another location. In the States this isn't a good sign.  *Revised Update: Just found out they were closed down for roaches or something. Sometimes I think they cant avoid it in a outdoor strip mall...Darn it, wanted to go one more time.  I believe there is another location somewhere!

dxYQKBfaF89OGlom-HpVmA.text: My 500th review.... WOW. FIVE HUNNIDD. 5 hundred ones.  On my 2nd trip back to Vegas in as many weeks, I just had to have more of Bachi Burger. I met a grade school classmate who lives in town at the original location on Windmill. It was my first time at this location. It was just a little after 11am on a Friday. I had just landed at McCarran. From the airport, I got my rental car and drove the short distance to Bachi. I was seated right away being that they just opened. I was seated towards the back by the window on the way to the restrooms but still had full view of  the entire restaurant.   Waited a little while for my friend as she was in transit but stuck in traffic. The waiter we had made sure to check on me a couple of times and I started off with the oxtail cheese fries. It was served just in time as my friend sat down. Great timing!.. The oxtail chili cheese fries were as good as I remember. Perfectly crisp fries, tender strips of oxtail strewn about amongst cheese, chili (with beans), jalapeno slices & cilantro. Oh and dont forget the fried egg on top... Good stuff.  For my entree, I ordered the pork belly steamed buns (3 pieces) instead of a burger. It's just so tasty and perfect in its bite sized form. The soft & delicious still warm steamed bun, cradling the slightly crisp on the edges but buttery soft pork belly with hoisin sauce, sliced hard boiled egg & cilantro (i dont even like cilantro!) combination is so damn good. Its one of my most favorite cravings these days. Thankfully the Sawtelle location opened the same exact day I was at the OG location. I'm definitely going there to get my fix and to support my friend's cousin who is a line cook there.   My friend ordered the Miyagi-san burger with furikake, fried egg, chili mayonnaise, honey bacon and onion rings. It was good but the patty was overcooked to well done as my friend specifically ordered it medium-well. I also found it to be super sticky eating. Even the bun was kind of sticky. It could have been better.  Service was good, attentive. I thought the place could be a little cleaner. The windows I was sitting at needed some dusting and I didnt like seeing a couple of flies buzzing by the window blinds. Parking was plentiful because its in a shared lot with several other businesses. Bachi gets full in a hurry. Within a half hour of me being seated (11:15am) the place was packed...Shoku Ramen's (formerly next door) menu is served at Bachi Burger now, so the paper signs say. Thank you Bachi Burger but I think I like the Summerlin location better. You know what they say about first loves... They  never die. And Summerlin won me over at first bite.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. miyagi-san
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. the E special
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. pork belly steamed buns

Q9fk21sqn4JglAF8NazxhA.text: I had High Expectations for this place. Been wanting to try them since their episode on Diners Drive Ins and Dives...  I came here for one thing, the Pork Belly!. I am from San Francisco where chinese food such as Peking Duck, Pork Buns etc. are in abundancre. However, I couldn't wait to try the Pork Belly at Bachi's. So? the Pork Belly Bao's are just oka6y. I imagined them tasting sooo much better from watching the episode on Diners. The actual chinese steam bun was not hot or even warm, they were cold. The worst part of a cold bun is that when a chinese steam bun gets cold it firms up, so the warm and soft texture of the bun is no longer. Also, the pork belly was not executed well. In the Diners episode it shows they dredge the pork belly lighly in corn starch then deep fry to give a suttle crunch texture, then they pan sautee it with the actual pork belly marinade. This clearly was not the case when we dined there. The pork looked as if it was only tossed in a pan with some oil.   The Ox Tails fries sound better than they actually taste. Literally there is no taste distinction that will cause you to identify actual Ox Tail in the chilli. It could be turkey for all I know. Literally tastes like your traditional chilli, with their asian inspired mayo over it. Not much fusion here.  Miyagi burger was actually good. The burger was executed nicely and all the flavors were on point. I hate to say it, it also took about a solid 7 minutes for us to even get some service to our table. And the worst part was there was only 2 other tables being served in the entire resturaunt at that time.   I would rate both Food & Service a 6.5 out of 10 across the board!   Unfortunately, I probably wont be dining here again. $98 for a meal that I waited for, for years just to be left unsatisfied.

btxrbP2pDak08JxlqpoCwQ.text: Burgers are so amazing each bite delivers a different amazing combo of flavors. Take all our out of town guests to try. Never disappoints. Little wait to get in but not bad.

aS6eTSnuKmswlrJYWGGJSA.text: Food is excellent, but the service is extremely slow. Had to go to the front counter and ask for the check.

Fu1UO3LB15fyImkPhTZ2Cw.text: Burgs! Nothing better than a good burg. Bochi produces a pretty notably good one too. I enjoyed the oxtail fries more though. Those things are nuts...it's sweet and spicy and meaty and cheesy. Everything you could ever need to make your taste buds dance! It's a huge portion too. We split it between 3 people and were stuffed before our burgs even came out.   I don't recall the name of the burger I got but it was one of their popular ones with onion strings, fried egg, and ca realized bacon. Oh that bacon! So good. They cooked it medium rare perfectly, which I always appreciate. It was super juicy when I cut into it. In all honesty though, it didn't have a ton of flavor. I thought the spicy mayo would come through more. The bacon was the best part. And the bun was super good too. Really fluffy and slightly sweet.   Definitely a place to try! Everything's got a bit of a Japanese twist so it's interesting.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ronin

5WJMG_D-fayw6TLiLY4n-w.text: So we arrived to vegas a bit late and craved burgers. I've heard good things about bachi burgers and the pictures have always made me drool. Finally we got to try it and I wasn't disappointed!  I'm not sure why so many people had such bad service, but we must've came on a good night. The service was great for us and the guy was really funny.   Truffle Parmesan Fries - Definitely loaded w/ black truffle flavor! It was enough to share between the 4 of us. Nice and crispy, not oily at all  Oxtail Chili Cheese Fries - Their most popular item, presented beautifully! The over easy egg on top made everything delicious. Again, fries were cooked perfectly crispy, but I do wish they added more oxtail. Not that the fries were bad, but I actually prefer the truffle fries.  Shogun Burger - $25 for a burger?! My bf ordered this and I got to steal 1/4 of it. It sounded like the ultimate most delicious burger ever w/ all the ingredients listed: wagyu beef, unagi, pan seared foie gras, miso butter, peach YUMM. Unfortunately though the flavors were all lost in translation to me. The only thing I could taste the whole time was the unagi...This burger isn't worth $25 imo  Kiki burger - I love shrooms! (I know it's vegas, but I'm talking about food here people not the other kind of shroom lol) There were 3 kinds of mushrooms in this burger: shiitake, enoki, and eryngii. Instead of angus beef, I paid extra to get the wagyu beef patty. The caramelized bacon and mushrooms made the burger stand out. This was my 2nd favorite burger  Miyagi-San Grass Fed Wagyu Burger - My 2nd favorite burger!! Again, that fried egg w/ the oozing yolk made this burger taste its best. The crispy onions & furikake added the extra oomph to it. For first timers I would recommend getting this to start!  Spicy Miso burger - It's not spicy at all. The burger wasn't bad, but flavors didn't pop or stand out compared to Kiki & Miyagi-San.  The patties here were all requested to be cooked medium rare and they came out good/juicy. I really like the taiwanese sweet buns here which makes the burgers unique. However, after trying Gordon Ramsay's BurGR in PH, I believe the burgers there are a lot better. I wouldn't mind coming back though next time I'm in vegas and craving asian fusion burgers

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Miyagi-san cross section
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy miso cross section
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shogun burger cross section

YK9IBQyRgZ2hCT6_0SuP0g.text: Get your sweatpants on and your oversized pajama shirt ready for this feast because you'll be needing the extra room to fit this baby--burger baby specifically into your belly.  The food is absolutely delicious and heavy. We started out with ox tail french fries and pork belly steamed buns. The ox tail portion resembled more like sauce filled with shreds of ox meat blended in there to give it the goopy texture. I've never had ox tail like this and I'd highly recommend this item if this was the only time you could go here.   I ordered the Kiki burger and despite not being hungry, finished the entire patty and the contents inside. The buns were only for my visual pleasure. The patty was a heavy Angus beef  with sauteed mushrooms, caramelized bacon, onion marmalade, gruyere cheese and garlic chili aioli. And when I say, heavy, you can feel the weight drop on your hand.  On the scale of gourmet burgers, it ranks very high. For its price, you get the comparable weight of two Big Macs. I may not appreciate that as much, but boy, was it delicious.

CCLHtp6S3W9v4232x6sgIQ.text: Beware of the service here on weekends. Yes, you drove your asses all the way over here and now there's a 45-75 min wait. But you know what? The food is amazing and they know it. And they will use that to their advantage.  The hostess really knows how to make your experience a shitty one. No smiles, very stern voice, and absolutely no common sense. We had to wait next to an empty table for 4 for about 30 min while she was "building a table" for a bigger party. There was no, "Sorry for the wait" or "Thanks for your patience". But once you get past her incompetence, it's smooth sailing from there.  Food is great, you MUST order the oxtail chili fries. That is the only reason I will put up with the crappy hostess. I've tried most of the burgers and they have all been mouth watering. The best part is that each burger will come with their own little surprise that will have you asking, "Excuse me, what is this, and what is it for?" You'll understand when you see it.

yvA-Zjnev7EMojdeH9_kWQ.text: Y U M M Y!!!! Their burgers are juicy, succulent, and absolutely original!! We started off with:  Oxtail fries: This is more like chili fries with oxtail bits in it...to be honest I wasn't a huge fan. Plain unseasoned fries with chili and dry bits of meat...ehhhhh it's okay. I would rather go for regular fries next time.  Sweet potato fries (garlic truffle): I've never tried garlic truffle SWEET potato fries before...so it was interesting. I think I prefer the garlic truffle on normal fries, but it was a good experience. Regardless, the fries were cooked well and overall well received.  I can't really go over all the burgers, but everyone loved their burger and I could see messy juices running down chins and onto tables...banh mi burger and Mr. Ho are some MUST TRYs. If you have a smaller appetite, then go for the steamed buns. There are 3 dinky little buns that still taste great, but like I said...just smaller portion (definitely not for Hungry Hippo Me, but to each their own).   I can't wait to come back during my next Vegas trip and try more of their delicious burgers! DEFINITELY a must have!

QIbu1bwmFjSf5x1TEx7fjQ.text: My husband and I absolutely love bachi burger! We have made it a tradition for the last three years to make this a mandatory stop on our way back home to SoCal from a Vegas trip. We have only been to this location and every time we have the best experience. The customer service is great and the food is top quality! We always put in at LEAST 2 orders of the pork belly steamed buns (bao). Yesterday, I tried the black garlic Tonkostu ramen. They have a separate ramen menu. Anyways, the ramen was amazing of course. f51T4ZwbRKdIEiIReVaDbA.text: DISAPPOINTING BURGER EXPERIENCE My group was waffling between Gordon Ramsey's BurGR and Bachi Burger.  Having been to BurGR, we decided to give Bachi Burger a try.  However, this was a HUGE disappointment.  We started our experience with the often-raved oxtail fries.  Although they were tasty, the fries were not crisp and were "eh."  [Not certain if the oil was old or exactly why the potatoes were borderline soggy other than the chili on top of it.]  The taste was good, but if the fries were actually crispy, it would've been great.  My friend ordered a chocolate and peanut butter shake.  As shake consumers, we LOVE shakes.  However, this one lacked flavor.  In fact, you could barely taste both the chocolate and peanut butter.  [My friend barely sipped her shake so I sampled it wondering why it was almost untouched.]  As for the burgers - the main attraction - we shared two different burgers:   Kim Chee burger and Kiki's burger.  The Kim Chee burger was plain and was essentially kim chee and jalapenos thrown onto the burger.  Kiki's was tasty with carmelized onions and the and gruyere cheese, however, there was a sauce - korean mayo? - that did not pair with the burger taste.  I will say that the hamburger buns are fantastic, but that's about it.  If you are into burgers, I would suggest that you journey to Gordon Ramsey's BurGR.  You will not be disappointed by their menu, food quality and taste.  Bachi was okay, but certainly not at those prices for ala carte burgers.  Even In and Out burgers are more satisfying and at only a fraction of the cost and time.  DON'T GO OUT OF YOUR WAY!!!

BMtlNCAsqAVF0RgyXTmrnA.text: A very very different take on burgers and bar food!  I heard a lot about this place, but being from the bay area back in CA, I don't visit Vegas often to check out most of these places. Asking my local friends about where to eat, they all recommended this one. Theres another location in LV, but this was closer to our destination. I think it was a weekend, so we had to wait about 45~ minutes. I wished there was a bigger waiting area, its only a little nook near the entrance.  Once seated, we were assisted right away, which is a plus in my book. We decided to check out some of the fries as appetizers. Specifically, we got an order of Ox Tail Fries and Truffle Parmesan. The Truffle Parm fries were good, but if you needed to try something, you gotta go for the Ox Tail ones. Imagine chili cheese fries, but super duper upscaled. The meat is super tender. I'd probably get an order to myself when I go again!  For the main course, I ordered the Miyagi Sans Burger. Its like an upscaled version of a western cheeseburger. Grassfed Beef, onion rings, and an egg! It was sooooooo good. They have a lengthy menu, that I would love to try more and more.  Definitely check them out! Theres a burger for anyone!

Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail fries

_-CzZtz-efEHabhwvvokxA.text: Bachi Burger brings the perfect asian fusion burger. My favorite is the Ronin burger, which comes with caramelized onions, fried egg and Japanese cole slaw. Definitely recommend it! I've also tried a bit of the Miyagi-san's Grass Fed Burger and the Spicy Miso burger which were both perfectly packed with flavor. The beef itself were also juicy and always cooked to perfection.   The only burger I did not like was the Black & Green Burger. It sounds good on paper - spinach, blue cheese, bacon, and mushrooms - but I think the mushrooms overpowered the burger way too much and left me with a weird taste. I was pretty disappointed with it.   The Oxtail Fries are a must! It's a great appetizer to share. The Sweet Potato fries are also really good as well and come with a delicious yuzu citrus aioli sauce. The Truffle Parmesan fries were good too but it has some sort of gravy (it's called black truffle porcini cream in the menu) that some of my friends didn't like.   All in all, there's so many options to choose from and most of the time it will leave you with a happy tummy! Bachi Burger is definitely worth a try!

S9-9KctunmA7-Mnt2Ipv6g.text: I love this burger place! I usually stick to the Ronin burger and I get my patty done medium rare. It comes with a fried egg and it's done over easy which is perfect. It is a bit pricey here but it won't disappoint you. A burger and a side of fries usually comes out to around $20 but it will be worth it!

KwuZQHEVyRWnVisRY1n8vQ.text: I love this place and seen it on Food Network before I moved here from NY. The first meal I ever ate when I moved to Vegas was at Bachi Burger. And now I visit it atleast once a month. The Pork Belly buns are so good with the hoison sauce on the side and I always get the Miyagi San Burger with the fried egg and Onion ring on it and it is nothing short of spectacular in my onion and nice and juicy. I also love their truffle fries which I usually order. The service is very friendly and. If you want a good burger with an Asian twist you definitely need to check this place out.

sRurlqt67mPDHDnj-W4Ysg.text: Wonderful food....BUT, we had a 20min wait to get seated and then it took 10min before I got up from my seat to walk over and talk to a hostess. We didn't have anyone visit our table or take our drink order until then. Got our burgers in fair time, but it took 30min before we got our Ramen.

xerlyiLZtkVJiB9oaCJccw.text: I also happened to see this on a food show, so maybe my expectation was too high.  We decided to order, Shogun burger: the one has wagyu beef, unagi and seared foie gras , Black and green burger and Oxtail cheese fries.   Fries: blehhh.. the egg was overcooked so no more running yolk. Oxtail with chili sauce that had weird flavor, too much bean? maybe not for me.   Black and green burger: Hmm compare to Roam burger in SF.. it was about the same and Roam was so much CHEAPER. Shogun. I think this was the best burger that they had. 26$ but because of foie gras and wagyu , I think its okay.   Service? ehhh..?!!!! . Noone refill water and coke for us until we pay the bill?!!!! Last but not least, we stayed at Encore so the round trip taxi for us to go back and forth was70$ +70$ for the bills. 140$ total. Worth it? Nooooo.  Definitely not gonna come back here again.

eWoDGPkyV753PFTWcxg2Lw.text: Nom nom nom! Seriously, amazing burgers. Creative toppings, awesome sides. They pork belly buns were super tasty too, next time trying the oxtail fries!

-FtMBYIZVO9-AfjfsZTJYQ.text: Came here,  waited for so long and it wasn't even busy.  Waited for over 20 minutes to be seated then waited 10+ minutes to finally have someone acknowledge us. Then we were told the Shoyu ramen place is closed.  I wish they had told us when we waited because they should in case people want to get ramen but they failed to do so.  Terrible.  Walked out and won't be coming back.

ymPEg4_LAJ0vv28SwFdKpg.text: Its been SIX years since my last visit where i said i wouldn't return, and STILL Bachi manages to fark up the service portion of my meal.   So disappointing. I brought my Grandma/pa so that he can eat a burger and my Asian grandmother can have ramen (perfect, or so i thought). Ordered, ramen for her, a burger for me and pops, 2 fries, and a milk shake. Ramen comes out in normal 12-14 minute time frame. Milkshake comes out next 8-10 minutes later. 15-18 minutes from there (yes, over a half hour and 70% through her ramen our burgers come out. And how about another 10 minutes for our fries when i was taking my last 2 bites of my burger. What the hell?! No updates from the waitress, no apology or even explanation for the delays or for our meal coming out deconstructed. We asked for no lettuce on one of the burgers and it still came out with it on. I simply do not understand! Its simple... other restaurants can handle a simple burger with NO LETTUCE, why cant you? You did it six years ago when we asked for no onions. AMAZING!   People make the comment that it takes time to make a good burger. I may be ok with that if you can at least bring out the meal so we can eat TOGETHER. And maybe get the order correct at LEAST. Part of the dining experience is service, and Bachi fails at this and has not attempted to remedy it since they opened years ago.

6Umd16Y8FHGpayuE5BMWww.text: Bottomline:  Food is inconsistent, wait times are ridiculous, and service was painfully slow, yet kind.  I have been following this place for awhile now but I've never gotten a chance to try it until now.  We had a party of 9 and waited an hour for our table...even though they could have pushed together a couple of tables.  What's worse was that our food took another 45 minutes to arrive.  Kitchen was backed up like a constipated monster.   Here's a breakdown of the food:  Oxtail fries - Woooahh there.  They need to ease up on the sugar in this "chili" oxtail sauce because it was as sweet as Kate Upton's Dougie.  The fries came out nice and crisp however.  Truffle Parmesan fries - These were pretty good but they should really call it a poutine instead.  The brown gravy on it was amazingly tasty but...where is the truffle flavor? The dipping sauce they give you was good...but it's just mayo and sirracha.   Miso Burger with extra patty - I ordered medium rare and it came out perfect.  The juice was flowing and the sauce was tasty.  Miyagi Burger - Ordered medium on this guy and it came out well done.  Should have sent this back because it was almost inedible.  How can you possibly overcook a burger this much? FAIL.  The waitress asked us if we wanted dessert and we all replied with a quick no...we really didn't feel like waiting another hour for our food.  To sum it up, the food is decently priced because the burgers are huge and are very tasty...IF cooked properly.  Service was S-L-O-W, from the waitstaff to the waiters to the kitchen.  3 SLOW stars.

r4eQjJRhDalmBtjwCkKIlw.text: We love this place and always bring out-of-town friends and family. Hands down they have the best burgers in Las Vegas. Our favorites are the Shogun (with foie gras!) and perfectly seasoned Banh Mi burger. Also go for the Ox tail chili fries and the Pork belly buns.  What impressed us more during our last visit is that they've expanded their menu. Must try are the North Shore Shrimp Truck (if you've ever been to Oahu and tried the shrimp trucks, you will know what this is about) and the Bone marrow jam (long bone cut longitudinally in half for you to scrape out the marrow's fatty goodness).   Just so happy with this place. So many things to enjoy on the menu. Haven't even mentioned ramen menu from Shoku Ramen Ya which used to have its own entrance.

LuEwQyqfrYGdM3GVTo9Ylg.text: We got here around 7:50p and was seated in 25 min.   Our server,  Kevin was very friendly. We ordered: 1.  Oxtail chili fries - kiddos loved it. This is a must try item.  2.  Chili garlic wings -  the wings are crunchy, however the girl told us that they ran out of sauce; not impressed at all.   They should have let the customers know ahead of time if they are ran out of certain item not until you brought it out.   What can we do at that time?   Anyhow,  Kevin was nice enough to offered us different dipping sauce.  3.  Kiki burger -  the meat was tender,  a good choice to try out.  4.  Spicy Miso burger -  meat was good and savory but not spicy at all. 5. Kalbi burger -  my daughter loved it but too kimchi on it which making the buns to soggy.  6. Miso -  too salty; nothing special with it.  Overall,  if we're coming back to Vegas, we will definitely give it a try again.

v_ZOEKHhbz2kwWmbbXYMMQ.text: Saw this on my favorite show of "Drivers, Dive-ins,&Drives" and had to check this place out before going into the strip.   We started off w/ the Oxtail Chili Cheese Fries based on all the awesome pics on Yelp, & these were soo delicious! The tender oxtail, chili & cheese oozing over the crispy thin fries w/chopped green onions,cilantro & spicy little kick of jalapenos on top was yummy. The chili wasn't overpowering so that was a plus for me. Definitely recommend trying!  For my main entree, I decided to order the kalbi burger. I love korean food, so this was the perfect burger for me w/ the kalbi marinade&kimchee. Boy oh boy, I'm drooling thinking abt it! The bun was soft, the meat was cooked medium rare like I had asked, the kalbi marinade was absolutely flavorful&sweet, & the kimchee altogether added a nice crunch.  Overall, awesome first experience as the food did not disappoint. Really cool concept w/ the Asian-fusion food. Def recommend checking this place out!!

-VvvtuC48rVoyTivVMc7wA.text: Absolutely delicious! My favorite place that we ate at while in Vegas. The food and service were absolutely amazing. We had the ox tail chili cheese fries, with the pork belly and steamed buns. We also had the burger with the Kobe beef and onion rings, I can't remember the name of it. But all three were equally delicious, and you could tell all the ingredients were fresh and good quality! Must eat if you are in Vegas!!

OGG7oBjFFLm9RkP2PLODQA.text: I think the food is pretty good, and reasonably priced at $10 per burger.  Unfortunately the service here sucks beyond belief!!!  Truffle Parmesean fries - below average  - I would've given this an average rating but I couldn't taste the truffle at all.  The dipping sauce it comes w/ is delicious tho.  Oxtail Chili Cheese fries w/ fried egg - below average - The chili was waaaaaaaay too sweet.  I couldn't put my finger on it but I've never tasted sweet chili before.  Wasn't a big fan.  The presentation of this dish is beautiful but it didn't live up to the hype.  Miyagi San Grass Wagyu Fed Burger ($10) - Slightly above average.  The shrimp tempura inside the burger was a nice touch, & gave it a nice crunchy feel.   They over-cooked my burger tho.  I ordered medium rare and it came out medium; almost felt like I was eating an in-n-out burger or something.  Kiki Burger ($10) -above average.  I dug the garlic, onions, bacon, & mushrooms.  It's a solid burger.  Basic, but solid.  Tips: -Service sucks beyond belief.      -They had our table set up but didn't seat us till 10 minutes after the table was ready.    -Food took about 30-40 minutes to come out after placing the order    -I ordered some extra sides of sauce and they never brought it  -Food is gonna be messy.  I tried the Miso burger (also pretty good) and there were piles of sauce everywhere; this isn't an insult to the dish mind you, the burger itself was still pretty good.  The food is good and prices are pretty cheap, offset by horrible service.  3 stars.

eWyeoBRWp8fh604o4e_RKg.text: This is purely service based review. I have tried to eat here 4 times. Twice it was really busy and I didn't want to wait an hour for a table, once I waited 40 minutes only to be told as we were being seated that the credit card machines were down....    Last night was my final attempt. Me and my boyfriend arrived and waited at the "please wait to be seated" sign for about 10 minutes, about 5 minutes in the guy that was waiting in front of us left, I guess he'd waited too long too. We waited another 5 minutes (the whole time staff buzzing by and looking at us but avoiding eye contact). Someone finally asked if we had been helped to which we replied no.  They took our name and said it would be just a few minutes. Keep in mind we could plainly see 3 or 4 open and set tables ready to go. We sat down and waited another 15 minutes.... and then left. I will never try to eat here again.

0pR8owO8tC1DaHqWVjb4AA.text: Hubby and I are here in Vegas and coincidently Bachi Burger was featured on DDD, so we had to check it out and OMG....it is worth the drive off the strip. We had the oxtail chili fries as an appetizer. I liked them, but hubby was not impressed. He thought they were a little sweet, but they are dressed with garlic alioli that is quite tasty. I had the Bachni Burger, which was the BEST BURGER I HAVE EVER HAD!!!  The meat was extremely flavorful and the condiments that accompanied the burger were wisely chosen and accommodated the flavor of the burger perfectly. We also had the pork sticky buns which were tasty as well. All in all, I would HIGHLY recommend.

BFMfF4ydJ4ZD2KJopDr4cw.text: I have lived in Las Vegas for 15+ years and have burgers from the greatest restaurants at Las Vegas has the offer chefs like Gordon Ramsay Wolfgang Pok and the Kiki's burger here is the best burger I've ever had in my life

g3gtk_CD1_ebzG5Rh_8slQ.text: Better than burger bar... Where else can I get my island taste than with a Burger...   First off: Oxtail Fries are a must Secondly: MIYAGI is my favorite... so much so that I'm scared to try other things because I won't have that favorite burger taste...   MUST BRING YOUR FRIENDS

ZcCYJIBO9FxQe_cHHb_nkg.text: Absolutely delicious. I would definitely recommend trying the oxtail chili fries WITH egg!

24fE5cTyfu4oktrfBVRV-w.text: Are here twice and don't think it's all that good.. Don't understand why so many good review. Overrated in my opinion !! I order Banh Mi Burger, it wasn't bad. The flavor is sweet with a hint of fresh mint and a side of fish sauce(which I don't dip)  Kiki burger was good.. Oxtail fries..I give it 3 star.. Taste like chili flavor fries, can't even tell if there's oxtail meat in it.. The price is high, I'm better off at my favorite In n Out Burger(cheap n good)

pBI1x0BTX9-83uHdEVVlSQ.text: My brother and his family took me here when I was visiting them in vegas, and I saw many great reviews but was a little disappointed in the food. Maybe I had too much of a high expectation, perhaps?   We shared the oxtail fries, which is a highly recommended item on their menu. It was okay, it honestly just tasted like spicy chili fries, and I couldn't really taste the oxtail at all (bummer)  Burgers were decent, good flavors, a little messy and hard to eat though. I believe this place is an Asian inspired burger joint so the flavors and seasoning threw me off a little. Clean and nice restaurant, the staff was pretty nice. Might come back and give it another try in the future. Down fall is that this place is off the strip.

jpEvjG68PbTpw3gcGBS-sQ.text: FINALLY!!! After seeing this yummy burger spot featured so many times on Food Network & Cooking Channel shows I finally got to experience it...TWICE in one weekend! :D  I wasn't planning on eating a "dirty" meal our first night we got to Vegas since I wanted to still look somewhat lean for the Olympia Expo (cuz everybody that attends that convention and show is just shredded to the max and I can't go in lookin' like a flabby chump) but I ended up fasting for over 22 hours and I needed a place to eat STAT! So I ended up here, at Bachi, alone since the SBBF had his own team dinner to attend.  I didn't have to wait long to be seated even during their busiest dinner hour (7-8pm). Once I was seated I knew exactly what I wanted for my appetizer to start, the Oxtail Chili Cheese Fries of course! I love the fact that the table of 6 seated right next to me ordered the same appetizer, but for their entire table. And I loved it even more when my fries came out and I literally devoured that ish like a BEAST and I could tell that party of 6 were either horrified watching, or completely entertained. As I was scarfing these fries down I could taste every bit of authentic flavor to this dish. OMFG! Seriously the best of the best chili cheese fries I've ever had! I love how crispy these fries were and the oxtail flavor was just orgasmic. The raw jalapenos mixed in with the garlic aioli was heavenly. And the final cherry on top to this dish, that fried egg...omg, as I broke into that egg and it seeped down through all the fries, I seriously was jizzing all up in my panties right then and there!  Now onto the burger! I ordered the Miyagi-san's Grass Fed Wagyu Burger which came with the most delicious beef patty, chili mayo, fried egg, furikake, caramelized bacon and crispy onion rings. The bun itself had the right crunch and chewiness to it. I enjoyed every bit of this burger. Thanks Kristi (my waitress) for the recommendation!  **The following night...around 11:30pm we returned to Bachi! Technically, I returned here and just brought the SBBF along.**  Appetizers:  1) Truffle Parmesan Fries with parmesan reggiano, black truffle porcini cream slathered all over it with a sun dried tomato aioli as the dip. The fries were delish! That black truffle cream hit the spot for these fries. There's really no need to even dip into the aioli because I felt it took away from that black truffle flavor on the fries. 2) Sweet Potato Fries dusted with sea salt and a yuzu citrus aioli for the dip. You can honestly never go wrong with sweet potato anything! These were bomb diggity, end of story.  Burger: I went for the Kalbi Burger this time with angus beef, kalbi marinade, green onions, house made KIM CHEE and a ko chu jang mayo. I think because of the fact that I'm a kim chee whore, this burger totally topped the burger I had the night before. OMG! Flavor was just amazeballs! And the pickled cucumbers that came on a little side dish was heavenly! Mmmmmmmm baby!  I also ordered their hot Japanese matcha green tea both times I came here. You get free refills with their teas and it was delicious.   Service is top notch here. They are very attentive and efficient. I'm definitely returning to Bachi the next time we're in Vegas. It's a f*ckin must I tell ya!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail Chili Cheese Fries!
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle fries, sweet potato fries and Kalbi Burger.

bEXuCpknaohzA_RsWRRuBQ.text: Service sucked first of all. They served the kids meals last! ... After both parents and glasses were refilled. Glasses were only refilled when we asked. Food staggered out of kitchen. All food was not hot and 'fresh' ... probably sat by expediter longer than it took us to eat it. Honestly one of the worst experiences. They even asked if it was our first time, which it was. You would think they would go the extra mile to make us like them. Instead, they slouch walked the restaurant floor barely smiling.   For the prices, I was expecting more, especially since it's competitive with Las Vegas strip prices. Instead, the flavors were that of a poser. Very unsatisfied with all we ordered.   When the bill came, they put at the bottom of the receipt how much gratuity to give. Tip should be estimated before taxes, not after. Needless to say, but they got less than what they 'asked' for.  Not coming back.

5ucWw78WA5PqzN35GITVrA.text: Black and green burger. Blue cheese with greens, mushrooms and bacon. One of the better burgers I have ever had!!!  A little pricey but worth it.

rUbTlmxZpDcQzZBRv_W53Q.text: You can't go wrong to come here! They really have a great selection! Not a big menu but perfectly picked to give everyone in your party an option they would love. Our server  Emily was so beyond amazing! So kind and had the best patiences with my party she gave everyone suggestions how to customize our dish. Thank you Emily.  Also the food will take a while to come out I would 100% order an appetizer. Either then that the restaurant flow was perfect.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The bear miso I&#39;ve ever had!!

B3VvD3BX1kf9Lpn5autAzg.text: I tried Bachi Burger after reading many positive accounts of their food. Maybe it was all the hype and build up, but the experience was underwhelming (think I once had a lover say the same thing about me, but that's neither here nor there. what?).  The Miyagi-san burger came out perfectly cooked, but it wasn't anything to jump for Jesus over. The truffle fries...man I do not know what to make of those. They seemed soggy and the truffle sauce tasted like gravy. Expensive gravy.  Making matters worse wss that the service was bad, and I really hate saying that because any service industry position can be a real pain when dealing with the public. That being said, the server seemed rather disinterested and only stopped by to take the order and bring the bill (no refills or checking in to see how average the food was); it wasn't halfway full, either, and they appeared quite well staffed. Could've gotten her on a bad day, I suppose.  Overrall, if you're looking for an overhyped burger delivered with unenthusiastic bristle, this is the place!

8CInUwlrDeDwz36vi_JrsA.text: I am always hesitant to drive somewhere to eat off of the beaten path when vacationing in Las Vegas because there are so many great places on the strip.  I was brought to Bachi Burger as a place we had to try, and the food did not disappoint.    My first impression was that of skepticism since it is in a strip mall with not too much else around.  The looks of the place are pretty underwhelming when leaving the glamour and all the lights to the dusty roads of the dessert, but the food was definitely worthy of the visit.  I ordered the Kalbi burger, with no mayo, and fries. The burger had an excellent flavor that was on the sweet side. It actually tasted like what I thought it would judging by the picture and the ingredients.  It definitely satisfied my burger craving.  The fries were regular, but they came with pineapple ketchup.  That also tasted like what I hoped for.  It had a mild pineapple flavor that was not too overpowering.  It was a very tasty meal overall.  I am never too keen on leaving the strip when visiting Las Vegas, but Bachi Burger was worth the drive.  There are a couple of burger places in Vegas that I prefer, but they have unique burgers and ingredients here that make it worth a visit.

eLf_fAsVHPhINVxhfQGOPA.text: I came in with high expectations for this place, especially with all the positive reviews already listed.    I had the shogun burger, which I picked mainly for the foie gras.  It was good, but not $30 dollar good.  The burger itself was on the sweeter side (good or bad depending on your preference), a bit sloppy due to the sheer size of it and its layers, but I did not enjoy the soggy buns.    Unfortunately, the poor service I received here overshadowed the food experience.  I understand restaurants get busy, but there really isn't an excuse for excessive waits and horribly bad service.  1)excessive wait to order drinks after we're sat(who is our server?) 2)wait an absurd amount of time for drinks  3)wait more to order food because drinks were brought by someone else (where is our server?) 4)appetizers finally come out after a long wait, but more annoyingly, having some appetizers come after the main dish because it was forgotten(really?)  To top it off, receiving the wrong bill after the poor service was completely aggravating.  Of course we had to wait for our lost server to come back and tell us :)

IhpcLhKajKVUKWRsD4P9aw.text: There service alone was worth 4 stars. Food was great! Try this place!! It's a must if you come to Vegas

3k1JoCjYU1GUXIdw9UrCAQ.text: Subpar burgers. Had higher expectations for these bad boys. I tried the Kiki burger (mushrooms) and Kalbi burger as well as their oxtail chili cheese fries. I can pass on the fries for sure. The burgers were a bit hard to eat given its height. Nothing memorable about this place. I do remember I enjoyed the Kalbi burger the most. I found everything a tad salty. I would suggest going to In-N-Out instead.

yY_tmjBhF7mF-x_MkgvK3g.text: Stopped by to get some lunch here after a long 8 hour drive from San Francisco. My gf had gotten a couple people to recommend this place to her and she saw it on Diners Drive ins and Dives which convinced her to have to check it out. The place is a bit strange as it is combined with a ramen place next door, never really seen that before but it didn't conflict with my experience. We started with the oxtail chili cheese fries, wow were they great! A ton of delicious cheese and chili on top of thin cut fries. The meat and Asian jalapeno peppers gave it a nice kick as well. For my entree I decided to go with the Kiki burger. I decided to get the sweet onion marmalade on the side since I was a bit skeptical and I'm glad I did as it did not compliment the burger at all in my point of view. The meat was a bit more well done than I hoped but good none the less. The mushrooms really made the burger, great flavor and a good amount of them in the burger. Overall I had a good experience here and the price and wait time was fair. I recommend it!

QppDEeNsgealJeCUX5PoEA.text: Went here while in Vegas for the weekend. A friend told me about it and I also saw it on Diners drive inns and dives so we had to check it out. My girl ordered the oxtail fries and I ordered a burger. The burger was done perfectly, the way I like it well done. It was still juicy and the bun was great. The service was pretty good also. The only reason I didn't give a four star is the fries. They were the main reason we both wanted to come here. There was absolutely no oxtail on our fries. They came out with three plates, one for our table the other two for the guys at the table next to us. Offcourse I we both peaked over to see there plates and yes they had chunks of oxtails on their fries. Otherwise the taste was great but it left us yearning for more. #oxtails#wheretheyatthough.

u4NMtcnstAWFcoFw643hDg.text: Great gourmet burger when you're looking for one  1. Truffle Parmesan Fries are awesome!   2. Crispy Fried Onion Rings were good because they are lightly battered but I found them to be a little soggy for my liking.   What I ordered: main course   3. CUSTOM MADE BBQ BURGER BBQ Bachi Burger 7oz Angus Beef- Fried Egg, Grilled Onions, Cheddar (3 slices), Ketchup, Mayo, Lettuce, Tomato, Onion.  The burger was amazing!!! I would come here again and again!  4 stars because of the oily/soggy Onion Rings but if I have to rate just the Burger it would get a 5 star rating!

ErtR3WPm2YpAlm29KrulYA.text: Soooooooo GOOD!!!  Best burger I think I've ever had. Service was great. The Miyagi-San.....just YUM!!

zk300SF6RVL285IJRsk2MQ.text: This is the first time I came here.We just walked in and have seats right away. Great services. Friendly staffs. Food is good. I don't really like the matcha green tea here.

pYrXOnRpiZP5URc-x1dn5A.text: The experience of eating at Bachi Burger is evidently experienced when actually *eating* the food, which is a wonderful fusion of Asian and American influences with no small amount of creativity on the part of the chefs. Admittedly, with some dishes the fusion can seem a tad hamfisted, you can trust that almost any dish you get can promise a reasonably satisfying novelty taste experience.  However, the severe downside to Bachi Burger is the physical establishment itself. God awful, repulsive, marketing focus group chosen music played at ear-splittingly abhorrent volumes, sure to prevent you from speaking to any fellow patron more than one and a half feet away. Sitting down and eating at Bacchi Burger is a contest between your impulse to enjoy your admittedly excellent tasting meal slowly and your other impulse to escape ASAP. The gruff and oftentimes unhelpful waiters and waitresses greatest ease is to inform you that a seating area is closed (for no apparent reason) and  greatest displeasure is to give you the time of day or, god forbid, return a polite smile.  The best way to enjoy Bachi Burger is to mercifully spare yourself the trip and order via UberEats, which, all things considered, is the godsend in all of this.

U6Hsr6sypS5Le_vnAUGTfQ.text: We go to Bachi Burger pretty much every time we visit Vegas. We love it! They make an amazing burger and their oxtail chili cheese fries are to die for! The Loco Moco burger is my favorite. It's bunless and served on risotto. We haven't tried their ramen yet, but it always looks amazing. Definitely one of my favorite burger places ever.

V7b-qmB7ZK6BTaDSuThYFQ.text: My first time ever coming to this location as I've never heard about it before today but my friend said it was amazing and let me tell you I think I just had the best burger in my life and I've eaten a lot of burgers.  Annna was my server and she was so friendly and helpful it possibly even could be love at first sight .  The atmosphere and music are very welcoming.  The place was spotless.   It's definitely not a typical burger joint.  I will be back.

QwGS3u-7uW4iZTe0aeYfBQ.text: Best Burger in Vegas Came here upon one of our visits to Las Vegas, was lucky enough to get in around a 20 minute wait but very worth it. The place is a few miles off the strip, but if you're able to take a cab or uber its very worth it.   I have only had a few items, from the menu, but I highly recommend trying everything which just means multiple trips to Bachi Burger.   I hope I am able to visit next time I am in town.

8rTfKc9-ySTGUSA-tZ1Fqw.text: I tested this place out for a quick bite to eat. The menu is centered around burgers, who would of guessed with such a name. They do have unique items such as banh mi sliders and dry rub chicken wings. I had "Kiki's Burger" and it was tasty. My favorite thing was the bun, extremely soft and a nice change from a regular hamburger bun. My only gripe is that the burgers come a la carte. Fries and an additional charge. Good burger but for the price you can find a better one that includes a side of fries.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Gc3Bv6LWKMjZaT__S6QSXg.text: I've had this place on my yelp bookmark list forever.  Finally returned to Las Vegas two weeks prior and had a rental car available to take me here.  From the main street, it looked like the place was closed because there was a screened patio and no one was sitting there.  When we came by the front and entered we realized it was certainly NOT closed.  Place was pretty full on a Friday afternoon.  We were fortunate to get a seat.  From reading so many reviews, I opted for the Miyagi-San burger (requested medium) and a side of truffle fries.  My husband decided to order off their Shoya ramen menu.    The burger came, excitement level 9000!  It tasted...good.  But I was severely disappointed that they overcooked my burger!  It was medium well.  No ways around it.  I really feel it being overcooked distracted me from what would otherwise be very delicious flavors.  The Truffle Parmesan fries were good.  The black truffle porcini cream was very tasty.  I wished it had more.  I really didn't taste much of the parmesan however.  The sun dried tomato aioli was forgettable.  Overall, I may have overhyped the place for myself as I left feeling a bit disappointed.

1UEAWI4L2iFtHL6LoHxQ8Q.text: Delicious burgers. Delightful atmosphere. A good stop in Vegas!

0g45YP2J7Ojw-Sy0xnz1fQ.text: It has been years since I have tried bachi burger. But this time it was nothing short of excellent. Since it was National french fry day I had to try my go to Oxtail chili Cheese fries. Then ordered the pork belly bao and the Mr. Ho burger add the fried egg. The menu is innovative and seasonal which can accommodate to many foodies out there.  The interior is updated with a bar that serves alcoholic beverages, signature drinks, and shakes. As well as an extension of shoku ramen which is also included into the bachi menu.  Service was accommodating and friendly. They were able to cater to our order promptly and was able to guide us to the process of ordering. Great job and keep up the great work.

dSaHvlDIi6ONb6_GXikQsQ.text: First... The food was amazing! I saw it on diners drive-ins and dives and had to go while I was in Vegas. I brought five coworkers with me. We all agreed that the food was unique and excellent. However... The service was poor. We had to ask for plates, we had to ask for napkins, they were sold out of almost all of their draft beers. And we felt like an inconvenience to our waitress. Great food. Bad service.

ozQeUgITJNHtBTRVhk-wSQ.text: Although I'm not usually big on burgers, Bachi Burger takes burger on a whole another level! I got the Miyagi, and it tasted like perfection. The buns were nice and soft, and I love how they added an asian twist to these burgers. In addition to the burgers, the oxtail fries is a must get!! They add a sunny side egg to the fries, which adds a nice creamy texture!

XToLjJmqs0OUBln-OjumCQ.text: This was my second time here and I was honestly not very impressed. I felt that my disappointment stemmed from the high expectations that I had for the food and that it was not what I expected.  I have heard about this place from many of my foodie friends who rave about their oxtail fries and burgers. I went a few years back and tried one of their other gourmet fries which was not oxtail fries and that was utterly delicious to me. So upon returning I was determined to try the fries. Being Jamaican I grew up eating amazing oxtail and it is actually one out of two of my favorite foods, fries being the other one. So I came back and ordered the dish and the miyagi burger. The fries are served in a huge portion that you can split with 3-4 people. When I tried it, I didn't even recognize the oxtail, it tasted like chili. It really didn't meet the hype that I've heard about it. The burger on the other hand was really good, but I felt that I've had gourmet burgers like this before and that it was whatever to me. I just really was not impressed with the caliber and taste of their dishes.   In terms of service, the waiter was helpful and we did not have to wait long for a table. I felt that they weren't as attentive especially when we were looking for our checks. The restaurant has a very modern and clean look to it. We were put in a separate room because it was a big party of us. I felt that we were very separate from everyone else so I don't think I got a good feel of the entire restaurant. But from my perspective, there were a lot of people there yet it was not cramped at all.   All in all, I do want to give this place another chance. This time I will not have such high expectations and see if I can find the fries that I enjoyed before.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail fries
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sGk2wAWOpRhl5HEcENO4jA.text: Still my favorite mid-range priced gourmet burger joint.  The Kiki burger is one of my favorite picks from here.  Kiki burger has juicy angus beef, sauteed Japanese mushrooms, caramelized bacon, sweet onion marmalade, gruyere cheese, and a yummy sweet chili aioli!! Yum! This burger and aioli go so well together.  The buns they use for their burgers are so soft.    It's also great that they joined the menu of Shoku Ramen next door.  So your gourmet burger and ramen craving can be satisfied all at one place!  Servings of ramen are big! Very filling.    Tried the Portuguese donuts for dessert.  Very dense donut though.  Raspberry sauce on the side was great along with the coffee ice cream.    Definitely one of my fave burger joints.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tonkotsu Shoyu Ramen
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Belly Buns

8knuBHBTvYnbsvMuKTA6KA.text: My wife and I stopped here for lunch on our way home from Utah yesterday. We specifically went here after seeing it on Diners, Drive-In's and Dives not long ago.   Last start with the service. She was in training and did a solid job. She gets full stars.  We ordered the Brussel Sprouts as an appetizer. The flavor was fantastic, but he sprouts needed about 2-3 more minutes steaming. They where very hard. 2 stars for this.   Then we ordered the Kiki Burger (wife) and I got the Bhan Mi Burger. Her medium cooked burger was way pink inside. Not medium at all. That was the only problem with hers. My burger was Med Rare and absolutely AWESOME! Seriously one of my top 3 burgers of all time. 3.5 stars for her and a solid 5 stars for me.   The truffle fries, well they sucked. Hard and flavorless unless you soaked them in sauce. 1 star at best.   All in all I'd say it was a 3.75 stars. I will without a doubt be back for another Bhan Mi Burger next time I'm in Vegas.

G9vY7EFDq7rcaff7gId8JQ.text: UPDATE:  Steiners, the rudest bar in vegas, told us we could stay there for burgers so we came here and my god it was good. I regret all the bad things I said. Salt and pepper fries, sweet potato fries, the waugi?-San( the one with crispy onions) and my boyfriend had the one with shiitake mushrooms. The wait was really long but the moment I took the first bite it was all worth it. We ate in silence it was that good. Really the best burger in vegas, so perfect in every way. Flavor, sauce, texture, juiciness. Maybe I just got the wrong burger, or maybe it was because I got it to go? All I know is I'll be back for you, bachi!!!!   Picture is featuring a fish burger that I had when I was a pescatarian and it is hands down the best I've ever had!

tTk4SzHxOr1HNvyv-4PFrg.text: My boyfriend and I are under the impression that the duck was not thoroughly cooked. Approximately two hours after writing the review, I experienced food poisoning. We did not eat or drink anything else before or after dining here. My boyfriend solely ate the red meat and french fries and was feeling perfectly fine which leads us to believe that the duck was the reason for the vomiting.

AxCwLftX2NZL1IPhGrfpsg.text: This place is a joke. Food is mediocre, manager treats staff like slaves and apparently they split tips?!!? That's what the server told us when we went to tip extra for the good service but I guess the service would be great when someone's whipping you like an Egyptian building the pyramids.

QOhxLKY3sgFNdrPzKZAK1A.text: Wow Finally a place that lives up to the hype!! A solid find! step in to a funky little urban joint... right away it was comfortable. good solid service, I got there just before the lunch rush and ordered the "No Meat Here Burger" it was so good, only... like all the new "trendy" places fries do not come with... Arrrgh, hate that trend!!! Ordered "just fries" they were delicious with a hint of sea salt, I didn't care too much for the pineapple ketchup... but, nothing a little sriracha couldn't fix Oh yea that's what it needed, So my first visit went well, now I'm a big fan... So I'll be back and I hope you will too, The menu has alot more goodies to try...

Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pix says it all... Yummy!!
