XEt43KABoklW_f3d4Zz69Q.text: Restaurant shut down due to severe health code violations and the people that work at this restaurant act like rabid dogs. Stay far away!  Before our flight back home, we had some time to grab lunch, so we looked up their website, and it stated that this location is open, and it opens at 11.  When we get to the restaurant, it was closed because they are cleaning for "annual maintenance."  We were upset that we took an Uber from the strip, relying on info on their website. We didn't have time to go to another restaurant since our flight was at 1:30, so we told the hostess that. The hostess was extremely dismissive, never apologized and walked away. That upset us even more and we voiced our discontent at how she handed this situation. The rest of the restaurant staff responded to us by doing the following:  1) Telling is "get the fuck out and never come back to Bachi Burger" 2) surrounding my friend and I. (Btw I'm five feet tall). There was 7-8 staff members that surrounded me and a friend. 3) pushing my friend-yes, a busboy actually placed his hand on my friend.  4) videotaping us and flipping us off. 5) Lying to us about the reason why they closed-they are cleaning bc the health dep't shut it down immediately following an inspection held on November 16. Its not due to "annual maintenance"  There was no manager to mitigate the situation.

HU57YmMIv1QXKft2Ltjzgg.text: Pretty much my favorite burger place ever. I fell in love with this place the first time I've been to Vegas and I fell in love with their chicken/turkey burger. At that time, I couldn't eat beef so I had to opt for either chicken or turkey and they're usually so dry and bland but the moment I bit into this chicken burger it was like my soul left my body.   Now that I can eat beef, I came back to try their beef burgers and it was just as amazing. I got the Miyagi burger and it was just a burst of heaven in my mouth.   I usually only like to try restaurants in a different city once to give more places a chance but this is one of the few restaurants that I would definitely come back to again and again when I'm in Vegas.

pka-W4Acv_6tUAT3OLWb_w.text: So the day's goal of going to Bachi Burger came to a conclusion after visiting our third location. The first was closed due to pest infestation. The second was closed with no notice on the door. The third was open and in close proximity to the strip.  Although that this review is for this particular location, it's hard to not let the unexpected setbacks and disappointment at the two prior locations spill into the review of the third location. However, this Bachi Burger was far from perfect. Service was not terrible. We were seated immediately (mainly because it was empty) by someone helping out in the kitchen. You could tell because she was putting together a dish and wearing latex gloves when she noticed us coming in the front door.  We ordered the spicy miso burger and the kalbi burger. They sounded appealing on the menu, but the fact that the menu was a printed and formatted Microsoft Word document was a red flag. The burgers came out shortly after we ordered. They were artisanal burgers but they lacked in balance of flavor. The spicy miso burger came with swiss cheese, which we substituted for gruyere cheese. However, we were charged as if we had swiss AND gruyere cheese on the burger. The miso flavor was a little funky, resembling an old miso soup. The burger to bun ratio was off, causing the bottom bun to get completely soaked and fall apart halfway through consumption. The kalbi burger had good flavor but again, the bun problem. In addition, the fried egg that came with the burger was cooked over hard, completely eliminating the allure of the runny yolk on a juicy burger.  Lastly, the most frustrating part was that it took about three times as long to have the server collect our check and credit cards than it did for them to take our orders and deliver our food. Looking over, the servers were just shooting the shit and clowning around instead of looking at our raised arm to collect the bill so we could be on our way.  Bonus negative experience for the Christmas decor reminiscent of a lazy elementary school teacher's bulletin board and no functioning lock on the men's restroom door.

dx3LsZj4rRVnICXQ8Ns6-w.text: Been here a few times and it is always pretty tasty! I highly recommend for when you are craving quality food yet casual and fun.  Got there a bit earlier than my friend that I was meeting so I put my name in for a table and waited at the bar. It took a few minutes to order but they were really busy and the moment the bartender freed up he promptly acknowledged me and got my drink immediately. I ordered a cucumber mojito. Yum!!! It was really yummy and made with Japanese cucumbers. I have never had a Japanese pickle so I don't know if they are typically bitter but the ones in my drink were so I avoided them after my initial bite. Trust me... Didn't stop me from sucking down the delicious drink whatsoever!  My friend arrived and we were seated. I immediately ordered the pickles as I have had them before and absolutely adore them. Now this isn't your typical dill pickle by any means. It's actually a variety of pickled veggies including watermelon radish, green onion, garlic, etc. Huge problem with this appetizer is that it's so tasty that I didn't want to share! We also ordered the truffle fries which were also extremely tasty but they came with a dipping sauce that didn't really seem necessary since it didn't enhance the flavor.  For the main event I ordered the Kiki Burger which was delicious but the bacon didn't make as much of an appearance as I would have liked. But then again, I'm a bacon whore. My friend got the Black and Green and was really happy with it. Our server was friendly and attentive. She also came back to make sure my friend was happy since she pretty much likes her burgers raw. We will be coming back for sure but I'm not sharing the pickles next time.

They wouldn't let me order a burger and sub a chicken patty.   Waiter: we don't have chicken patties Me: but you have a chicken burger on the menu. Waiter: yes, but we can't use the patty for burger style you want.   We've been here a million times and they have always done it. Place is under new management. Asked for the manager contact info and he said they don't have any of those.

JVZuS5yBSDqoCWRw74CECw.text: A climbing friend highly recommended this eatery and so glad I got a chance to eat here! The food is not something I usually eat, but it was extremely tasty and I found the presentation of the dishes to be very visually appealing. The waitstaff is very attentive. I had the Bone Marrow Jam appetizer, Bachi Fish Burger, hot Macha Green Tea. Ate here March 2018.

-EllcWiSSFjtSCv-J0NDjg.text: BACHI BURGER, PLEASE COME TO ORANGE COUNTY!  WE WILL WELCOME YOU WITH OPEN ARMS!  I PROMISE.  So like a majority of reviewers, I too became entranced by Bachi Burger after seeing them on Diners, Drive Ins, and Dives.  Despite the fact that Vegas is pretty much my home away from home, I never got the chance to hit up Bachi Burger until recently.  I was staying off the strip during EDC weekend, and was hungry.  Quickly Yelped something and Bachi Burger came up only a few miles away.  Finally!  The stars have aligned!  Bachi Burger it is.    We got there around 3 pm, the perfect time in my opinion because the lunch rush was over but the dinner rush had not started.  The place looks pretty small from the front but is actually quite large once you explore inside.  It looks like it expanded recently.  Downside is that the bathrooms are single stall.  There were quite a few empty tables but they still had a slight wait, only 5-10 minutes or so.  Ken and I took those few minutes to glance over the menu.    If you are looking for a burger place with an Asian twist and a lot of variety, seriously look no further than Bachi Burger.  EVERYTHING and I mean EVERYTHING sounded delicious!  Not just their burgers but all the other things they had on the menu, baos to bone marrow, it was like a nice spectrum of food.    We settled on the Kiki burger substitute Angus beef with Wagyu beef, the Ronin Burger and oxtail chili cheese fries.  Personally, I thought Bachi Burger had an amazing menu selection.  They were different than your other burger places because of their extensive menu.  The ingredients within the burgers were very good and complimented each other very well.  I will go into more details later but I have to say, meat patty wise, Bachi Burger was good but definitely not the best meat patty I have ever had.  I think what carries them is how unique and different their burger combinations are.  Oxtail Fries:  Order this!  Awesome starter dish or even the main dish, it was a pretty large dish and the fries came crispy.  The oxtail was tender and blended in well with the chili.  Ken asked why they called this oxtail chili cheese fries.  I picked up a piece of meat and showed it to him.  He seemed surprise that there was actual oxtail in the dish.  Kiki Burger:  It was an additional $3 to substitute Wagyu beef for Angus.  I did not taste much of a difference.  This burger has 3 different types of mushroom, carmelized bacon, sweet onion marmalade and gruyere cheese.  The gruyere cheese made it taste a lot like the Fathers Office burger from LA.  I did not really care much for this burger.  The many different mushrooms made it mushy and the gruyere cheese made me want Fathers Office.    Ronin Burger:  Now this...this was good!  Carmelized Onion, Japanese slaw, fried egg, katsu bbq, and miso goma dressing.  Everything went together beautifully, it was very good.  I only ate half of the burger because I filled up on the fries and ended up eating the other half the next day, still delicious!    I wish I could try more from their menu.  I am happy that they have locations in SoCal, but come on!  Expand to the OC, we will love you, I promise!  Just think about it?  Okay?

q2UCGUH8aNQd9Bpey8mqSg.text: Lunch at 11:30 on a Friday. Still ample seating at that time but when I left a little afternoon there was a line out the door, so this is a popular place. Greeted and seated pretty promptly, but then the service went down hill. Way too long before I was greeted by my server. After my order was taken, another very long wait before I had my tea and place setting.   The menu was an extensive list of premium burgers as well as premium ramen. Ramen looked very tempting, but I opted for the burger. Ordered the house salad ($5) and the Black and Green burger ($16). For $16 you only get a burger - anything else is extra so this is a pricey place. The salad was exceptional. I ordered the Wagyu beef burger medium but it arrived well done - ugh. It was a beautiful burger, and it tasted good, but for $16 is has to be perfect as ordered, and this was not.   Glad I gave this place a try, but there are much better burger places with better food and better service for $21 of value. With better management and more attention to detail, this place could be very good.

PtoCpAaS9vWOmFudWPxtCg.text: Things have changed here. ..  I'm disappointed.   I really loved this place,  brought family here,  told friends to try it,  and was so happy when they opened one in Pasadena.  Cane back to visit.   Wasn't busy.   We were seated as soon as we walked in.  Things have changed.   I was aware they added the Pho side,  menu now reflects that.  But service was a little slow.   Slower rhan it should be when they dont have all rhe tables filled.  And i was sad that they had removed the chocolate lava cake I loved so much.  but I  was surprised even more that my favorite burger tasted not so great any more.  It lacked the great flavors and the egg was oveecooked. The salt, pepper, and garlic fries were just OK, not fantastic as I remembered  them.  And hubby was soooo disappointed when his medium rare burger came well done.  Instead of sending it back he ate with a smile because this meal was not going to ruin our vacation.  I wish we could do 1/2 stars, this would be 2 1/2 and not 3.  But I dont know if we'll be back on our next visit or try and find another burger place...

elOxpHt5L-lQlanX6MluOA.text: The food... Was a 3-4 star.. That being said  Burgers came out over done  Server forgot two appetizers  Server forgot salads  Server forgot our initial drink order and came to Re ask us not realizing he all ready took our order   They auctioned off the food not knowing what seat ordered what   Everyone was on edibles or something. Bad experience.  Adding to that... Asked for change for 100 and brought us 70!!!

PmVXDsl3vsLDAMlMa1LJTw.text: I've come here twice, and loved both visits! I'm so happy that we have Bachi Burger in So Cal now, although I haven't had a chance to visit the new locations yet. I really enjoy Asian fushion bar food, so I had this place on my food wish list for a long time before my first visit here.   Since this place is super popular, try to come for an early lunch or dinner to avoid the crowd. You must order the oxtail chili cheese fries, this dish is perfect to share and is absolute perfection. I love oxtail, cheese, fries and fried eggs so this dish has my name written all over it! Get this, or you'll definitely regret it! For burgers, I've tried the Ronin, Miyagi-San, and Spicy Miso. My fave was the Spicy Miso. I enjoyed the others but found the Miyagi-San to be a bit too dry. I usually order my burgers well done, but I get them med well here so it won't be so dry. Don't forget to order a delicious beer to wash all this yummy goodness down, they have a nice selection.   Awesome place, and I always try to come here when I'm in Vegas! Can't wait to visit the new locations in So Cal! :)

Tykpe8I1zHRxl8KcfYJkQQ.text: The food was amazing but not as amazing as David C. ! My friends and I LOVED him. Honestly the best server we ever had at a sit-down restaurant. Outstanding service , great personality , everything. Request him as your server !! Please.

t5aM9ttGy3Q0ArfvMw4n-g.text: We arrived before 6 pm and were immediately seated.  The service was prompt. The waitress was sweet and attentive. We ordered 3 appetizers, the Parmesan fries, Brussel Sprouts and the pork belly buns... all fantastic and soon gone. We then ordered the shogun burger with foie gras, omg. To die for.  All in all, extremely satisfied.  Very full bellies.

KqtWJXXxYyyCydyqgp8AXw.text: * Bachi Burger had a very island vibe which made you want to bob your head. The workers were also very friendly and answered all the questions we had to ask.   * The "burger" was unlike any that I've seen before; it had no buns, or any typical qualities of a burger. The patty itself was okay, nothing to rave about, but the rice underneath was very unique tasting. It had a creamy texture and this tocino sauce to mix with it. (Tocino is a sauce that most Filipinos use for recipes) The burger came with the macaroni - typically found in Hawaiian restaurants. I normally don't like that style of macaroni so, like-wise, I wasn't a big fan of the macaroni. Although some may like it more than I did. The truffle Parmesan fries were amazing though. It had that slight sweet taste of chocolate and the beautiful cheese texture -- btw. I love cheese, so that was a plus -- sprinkled on top. This entire thing fed 2 people and filled us both to the rim. We were stuffed.   * Pricing were around the ranges of $20, but there were like 2 burgers that were $8; although, the burger I ordered was $17. The overall price for the fries and burger came out to be $27.   * Would I come back? Maybe, but not something I would probably say "oh. Let's go to Bachi", but just in-the-moment kind of drop-bye.   * Rate: 8/10 * Pricing: $$

cpyy7SpF7SsIYNatgbeN6g.text: I was so excited to go here heard the burgers were amazing. However the service is not. Seems like there is not enough employees. It took about 10 minutes for an employee to acknowledge us. I could tell the server was trying to give us decent service but it wasn't cutting it. The food is amazing so I would say go at least once if your curious but the service ruins it for me.

SAas4kVWgNelpIp0yZoD5g.text: Okay.  Final thoughts on bachi burger:   My hopes were so high.    If you completely deconstruct the burger I ate, everything was amazing.   The bun fantastic.  Meat.  Fantastic.  Slaw. Fantastic ... you get the point.  All together it looked like an infant had the shits and it was just gross.       The fries were soggy and nothing was on them. I got all the fixings on the side which just throws the balance off.    Listen, I'm a total dipper - so that's saying something.  However the porcini (spell check) sauce was AMAZING.  I'll try it again - but only as a dine in. I get it.  Some things don't deliver well.  Please let this be one of them.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pf8LTr53zYdfjyV9suvreg.text: 4 1/2 Stars. I was pressed for time since I needed to return a rental car and catch a plane. This southeast Bachi Burger location worked out conveniently and parking was easy to find since it's located at a strip center that  provided plenty of parking.  Since I had a late breakfast, I wasn't real hungry and opted for just the Kiki's burger - Angus beef, shiitake & eryngii mushrooms, enoki onion marinade, gruuere cheese and garlic chili aioli. The burger was perfection - cooked medium but still juicy. The bacon along with the mushrooms and aioli on the side was unusual but absolutely yummy. Service from my waitress was friendy and spot on!  Overall, I was impressed with my experience with Bachi Burger and I'm looking forward to returning and trying some other items on the menu!

Also had the truffle parmesan fries which are a must if you go! Would definitely come back!

c5oaNivNSf9d_DuG7RQXtw.text: After teaching class I had no better way to get my food fix than to find a burger joint!   With burger joint so finding a place that had high quality meats and different varieties of their super important to be!   My husband and I shared the ox tail chili fries and they were GONE in two seconds! Fresh French fries with their special sauce and among ox tail chili, light cheese, fresh jalapenos and a sunny side up egg?! YES MA'AM!   I chose the Banh Mi burger and hubby got the miyagi-San burger! He loved his choice and I wanted to keep mine and picture frame it! The ingredients were fresh, the burger was perfectly medium and the nuk mam dipping sauce was sweet and savory!   Sides don't come with the burgers but for their prices around $14 each they were large in portions and super satisfying!   We didn't taste any beers on this visit but WILL BE back to sample some of their neighboring restaurants ramen and other menu selections including desert!

SIQOsk47oMy5CmTE0XsAtw.text: Terrible Customer Service, almost like it is a social experiment to see if they can give horrible service because the burgers are so good.    Bachi has unique and delicious burgers, but the service at this location is consistently terrible. I walked in with my wife and they tried to seat us ahead of some others who had been waiting. When we did get seated, we spent at least 10 minutes waiting to be greeted, menus clearly to to the side. Waiters just kept walking by, no recognition. We eventually walked out, and on our way out saw the larger party that had been ahead of us, still waiting to be seated, just staring at the table that they were told would be ready and in fact was. I do think Bachi was understaffed, but that's no excuse for no greeting. Usually I'm of the opinion that you go to restaurants for the food, not the service, but when there is literally no service, there can be no food. Try the other location.  As to our prior visits, the service has consistently been terrible. This location severely needs training in terms of service and, possibly, to hire more staff.

aLGV48YWvRveJJqinR6h2A.text: Came here and the first thing the waiter tells us is about all the missing items from the menu! I do not understand how a place in that size and reviews not managing to control inventory, i do not eat meat and the one veggie option was out so i stayed hungry and watched all my friends eat but me! When you only have 1 veggie option you need to make sure it is available!!!! I am so dissatisfied with this place  Giving them 3 starts is only for not running their business correctly. Now i will go eat some Thai food.

Lo6y4vsjJhICGC6DpMct_w.text: Came back again and waited for about half an hour... But still worth the wait. This time I took my other half and she was glad I took her!

9kVobqygwa1zwfdt31rUQQ.text: Our first stop and Vegas and what a disappointment. We had 12 people total, but decided to get seated separately so we wouldn't have to wait as long. First party got seated in 40 minutes after writing our names down while the other party waited outside anxiously. I was in the 2nd party. I was walking in and out to check on my friends and I saw plenty of tables leaving and clearing up. After like 20 minutes, I asked how long the wait will be and the hostess didn't know.  I see my friends got fries but no burgers yet. After another 10 minutes, we see so many EMPTY tables so we ask if we could get seated. We even pointed at the empty tables and they told us we will get seated when they were ready... 10 minutes later, we still didn't get seated and our friends that were seated earlier didn't even have burgers yet.   We all left and went to the Subway next door. What a joke

dPD8PP2RA4lM_ygbg9ueyQ.text: By far the best burger ive EVER tasted. Everytime im in town in vegas, this is usually my first stop for lunch. Absolutely delicious. Every burger just has so many bursting flavors from the patty to whats with the burger to their sweet bun.   I usually order the crabby patty, but its not in season. Sooo I ordered the kiki burger (angus beef, with eryngii mushrooms and caramelized bacon) with a side of truffle fries which is just as delicious. But what took me by surprise was the Mr. HO burger which I really need to order next time. Its the burger with a taro bun, I had a bite from my cousins and wow, amazing.   I genuinely love this place. A family own restaurant and great service. Came here when it just opened and ive been raving about this place so im extremely late on my review. Anyways, excited to have bachi burger open in LA, just hoping its just as good as the original.

wU22o6kmDeVkO6UzgRRGkA.text: Definitely starting to go down hill. Service is exceptionally slow. Not busy slow. But the type of slow where the servers deliberate if they will come to your table. When they do they go through the motions as if time were of no consequence.   Food takes a long time to come out now.  It's not fast food so don't think that way.  The amount of time it took for a kid's hamburger with ketchup only to make it to the table seemed to be as long as watching paint dry.   Now it's over priced hipster food that hipsters won't eat.

FKzqWWYcv7AFdeT5VnRfWQ.text: So glad I was introduced to this place the last time we came to Vegas. Located off the strip, it's still a definite must have every time we go to Vegas! I love the way they use Asian fusion style in their burgers. The flavors go so well.  I've tried the Ronin burger and Miyagi San burger. Both really good and comes with a fried egg inside. We also shared the Parmesan truffle fries. Tastes great but my only complaint is that the fries are so small. It's like we were eating the small crumbs as opposed to whole sized fries. No biggie. My dining experience was still so worth it because of the burgers. The food does take a long time to come out (~20 min) but it's definitely worth the wait. They're cooked to perfection.  Next time I would love to try the Banh Mi burger. You really can't go wrong with trying any of them!

tdn6C5-hQ4n_-C-GggBxow.text: One of the best burger places in Vegas. And that's saying a lot. We have some of the best burger places in the world here, but this is my favorite. Taste is incredible and the quality is excellent!

1SlFbTrSOgwlB31VtAXK_w.text: We were on our way to the airport and stumbled on to this terrific place. That would be thanks to Yelp! They have a very eclectic Meier to say the least. A combo of gourmet hamburgers, fries, soups/salads and about 8-10 Asian dishes.  I had the Kiki burger and it was a 10! The salt and pepper fries with a garlic, mayo and red peppers sauce laced with jalapenos  was totally great! I observed other folks meals and I hardly saw a morsel left on a plate. Do yourself a favor and try this quaint place and eat to your heart's content!

AprCU2E6MX4QC9BMew2E7A.text: It has been a couple of months ago so excuse the late review but I have eaten at this location four or five times even though I'm from California. So now that the disclaimer is out of the way, onto the review.   Bachi burger are for those who like their taste buds to rome wild.  Bachi is connected via a door way to their sister restaurant Shoku Ramen. Which closes earlier even though they share the same space.   I started with Salt and Pepper Garlic fries. It's served with Jalapenos and a garlic chili aioli sauce.  This is great way to start off a meal. It's an explosion of tastes and it lights up your tastes buds begging for more.   Then the Miyagi-San burger arrives and I instinctively bow my head in a gesture of respect to this masterful burger.  After practicing my wax on wax off techniques (if you understood that reference you just dated yourself) I begin to indulge myself by bitting into the burger.  I enjoy a fried egg in my burgers and if you have never had an egg in your burger, Bachi is definitely the place to venture out of the norm.  Your mouth is challenged by the opposing textures. The hamburger bun is soft as a cloud and paired with the crispiness of the onion straws, all you can do is close your eyes and enjoy the sensory overload. At that point the flavors of the caramelized bacon and sauces kick in, and when you least expect it you are in a blissful comatose.   I recently tried the chili fries and it's an out of body experience. Don't be afraid of the ox tail and you will pleasantly surprise your taste buds. Bachi is not where you come to be conservative or play it safe. Be adventurous and you will walk away a happy camper.   If you want an amazing burger and avoid the strip, this is the place the come.  Since I work so often in Vegas, this is definitely one of my safe havens.

OGpS2q3Vdz4eksYyLqWOww.text: Mediocre burgers. Mediocre ramen. Mediocre everything. You can tell most of the employees that work there aren't happy to be there and the chefs are always screaming from the window. This place has really gone down hill. The tables are all scuffed and the floor is always dirty. Maybe with a little effort and money management could get this place up to par.

I love that the buns are hawaiian buns, it adds the perfect amount fi sweetness. The oxtail chili cheese fries are to die for!! It is a MUST if you're going to eat here!

Even though there is a generous portion of hamburger meat placed between a nice soft bread bun, this doesn't taste anything like a burger.  Lol.  It's delicious, though!  I really liked my Miyagi-san burger.  Husband got the Ronin, but I didn't think it was as good as mine.  Oxtail chili-cheese fries with the fried egg were good.  I wouldn't NEED to eat those again, though.  Salted caramel shake tasted a bit like a caramel frap.    5 stars for the Miyagi-san.  The rest of what we ordered would be 3 or 4 stars.

er8G30TZB0SvBMfCft3H5A.text: Heard this place was good from the locals so we decided to check it out on a Saturday night just before 10 pm. However, our excitement and hunger quickly turned into frustration and WTF? when the host told us the chef just closed his kitchen not too long ago. We were like wtf? You're supposed to close at 11 and it was a Saturday night with a semi full restaurant. We voiced our displeasure and left. Probably will give this place a try during lunch hours when they're actually open.

5M9zxlpvkqJy21vqSV1UEg.text: Omg, I love the oxtail fries! It's a must order if you come here. We  killed that huge plate in a few seconds! Very interesting and a change in fries from the typical mexican fries. The wait can be a little long even though we came here one Monday night. Very crowded for a Monday night. I tried two burgers, the Ronin and the Miyagi-sans Wagyu Burger. I would say that the latter is more appetizing and more flavorful than the former burger. I would come back here!

4n61PQIaWKxlPMN2q4seWg.text: My new favorite spot, stopped by randomly and enjoyed every last bite. The quality of the food is amazing, the service was beyond good and we only waited about 2 minutes to be sat.

yGVrTk-3IddyM2boNr4ktw.text: It was a bit pricey, and the burgers weren't worth what they were charging for it. There was nothing about the burger that made it stand out, nor the fries that we ordered either.

SBK6ikX4saudTvzOxjdiuQ.text: Cool twist on burgers! Most of the specialty burgers have some Asian influence in the ingredients. We started off with the oxtail chili cheese fries topped with a sunny side up egg that were off the hook but a tad bit on the salty side. Can't go wrong with all the ingredients but put together YUMM!  Ronin Wagyu burger: onions, Japanese cole slaw, fried egg and Katsu BBQ. Great burger with a Japanese twist and the buns seem like the bread used in a Chinese baked pork bun.   Miyagi Wagyu burger: another burger with Japanese influence. Fried egg, furikake, bacon and onion rings. C'mon that sounds good right?  Both burgers have some sweetness due to the sauces they add so they are a little sweet and savory. Kinda reminds me of the Fathers Office burger joint in Santa Monica, Ca. Gotta try when you come to LV.

Halfway through the fries I had to beg the waitress to take it away before I ate everything (had to save some stomach room for the burgers!)!  I ordered the foie gras burger... to die for! It was SO rich, fat was dripping down the patty. I could not finish the burger (on account of the fries) but I would definitely come back and do it all over again!

hF75k_QibNsIgd74u1HpEA.text: We hit up BB after the Yelp Olympics, and after some Zumba, Bootcamp, and Cardio Combat, a bunch of us yelpers were ready for some Bachi action.  After we got seated,we were getting looks and stares from the kitchen because they reconoticed who we were, and they had some not-so-great reviews, so I just gave them a "this is your chance to step it up from my last visit" kinda smile.  I was hella hungry, so I ordered the following:  Bachi Pickles  Fried Chicken Appetizer  Bachi Fish  Fries with Pineapple Ketchup  (I shared the chicken, pickles, and fries with everyone; I wasn't THAT hungry!)  The pickles were very good, but my favorite were the pickled garlic cloves. The chicken was crisp on the outside and juicy on the inside. Bachi Fish was absolute perfection and the ketchup was addicting!  I even savd a little room for dessert because I wanted some White Chocolate Yuzu Gelato, but was sadly denied because they no longer have it on the dessert menu....bummer.  BB has definitely stepped it up since my last visit and has earned its 5th star...ALOHA!!!

Kalbi burger- never knew Kimchi would taste so good inside a burger! ordered this with a fried egg. the patty was thick and the sauce was amazing!  I will definitely come back to try other things from their menu!

oc3Uf8NbcbamDxJSv95c9Q.text: We were visiting Vegas for a girls weekend and my roommate suggested this wonderful restaurant before catching our flight back to Colorado. Everything we had was delicious! We had the fried chicken, oxtail chili fries, ramen, kalbi burger, and a few other things to share with a table of 4.  The oxtail chili fries were surprisingly sweet but still had a good kick. The kalbi burger was bomb and I had to eat it the next day due to the ridiculous amount of food we ordered (still flipping delicious).  The ramen was good but not out of his world. Good hearty portion that hit the spot.   It was so delicious that I returned to Vegas 2 weeks later with my boyfriend and requested that we eat here. I ordered the miyagi burger this time and it was amazing and definitely a good sized burger. Highly recommend and will return the next time I'm in Vegas! We were exhausted and hungry after driving 11 hours and there was no line and we were seated promptly.

uGuH-6HfUcKyc02Yvh8opA.text: The oxtail fries were excellent! Fresh jalapeno weaved in a textured crunch and perfect layer of heat. The fries were well seasoned and even with the topping, we enjoyed crispy ones all throughout. The chili was rich and tasty. We also had the Kiki's Burger. Loved the caramelized bacon and topped with a perfect amount of spring mix greens. The buns are fantastic- soft and the perfect size! I enjoyed a draft Stella Artois with our meal that was the perfect compliment. 2 of us split these items and it was the perfect amount to walk away satisfied but not too full.

eo7ioPKNn0ijp6xFEwuy7A.text: One of be best burgers in town Asian inspired American crafted to perfection  Recommend truffle fries and shogun burger you'll fall in love but spend about 30$ before drink and tip.   Worth it compared to BURGR by Gordon Ramsey

reIZWd2FfUIPZmWWEqyPKQ.text: I wanted to rate a 4 because the food is amazing, but service was so off today!!!  We were greeted and seated right away, which is a plus for noon (we came at just the right time - right after the restaurant filled up). We were started with waters to drink, which was perfect.  However, during service was not what it usually is - our server kept paying attention to one table, which seemed to be friends of his, he refilled everyone's water in his section, but mine (drinks refills are huge with me, and the fact that my water was empty and NO ONE refilled it definitely took a whole star away), and he didn't do a check back with us until we were practically done eating.   Once we were clearly done eating and I are most of the ice in my cup (see picture), STILL no refill and a few other servers walked passed our table, let alone attempt to pre-bus or offer dessert. Our server finally came back, asked if we were all done (no shit, Sherlock!) and we asked for our check. And still - no water refill!!!! The worst part about it is there was another server right next to us with a water pitcher, looked at our glasses and he walked right passed us.  I love the food here, but man this experience sort of ruined it for me! Maybe I'll have to check out the Bachi on the west side of Vegas?  Note: forgot to add a few things - burger was medium well, when it was supposed to be medium - the burger itself was not seasoned - oxtail chili cheese fries were 80% beans - oh, and didnt I mention I didn't get a water refill? (Just kidding!)

Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail chili cheese fries - excellent to share!
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Worst. Service. Ever. (See review for explanation)

Idt08vasiK5fRXa_igCALQ.text: Do NOT get the boba drinks here. All made w/ powder, nothing natural, tastes way too sweet and expensive! We tried the honeydew milk tea. Ick.   Ok having said that, the burgers were delish!!  Bachi is located in a strip mall. Nothing fancy. We came on a Sunday for lunch, and had to wait bout 30 minutes for a table of 4. We ordered the Ronin burger, Kalbi burger, spicy miso burger, truffle fries and onion rings.   The burgers were all pretty sizable and the patties were juicy and very thick! Very well flavored beef. I tried the ronin and the spicy miso first and I'm glad I did because the kalbi was VERY FLAVORFUL because of the marinade and the kimichi. The taste stuck a bit more in my memory then the ronin and the miso. But I thought all the burgers were delicious in their own way. The buns were nicely toasted too. The fries and the onion rings were good, with the onion rings being thinner and a little on the oily side. I really also enjoyed the sun dried tomato dipping sauce and the garlic chilli aioli. so addicting!   Service was pretty good. It took a little while for the burgers to come out, but it was worth the wait. The burgers were very satisfying without being heavy. Great meal off the strip!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0b44Wm-tv_lcJqHxQmI8Bg.text: AMAZING burger.  The kimchi burger, that first bite was FREAKIN amazing.  My burger with the egg and fried onions on top was not as good- DEFINITELY get the kimchi burger- it sounds weird, but it was delicious!!!!  It's the most unique (and best tasting) burger on the menu I think.  I actually ordered the pork buns which were disappointing for dinner, and after taking a bite of my friend's, decided to order a burger.  The pork for the pork buns was not cooked well, was super fatty (not as meaty), I would not get this again. The oxtail chili fries were good, but nothing extraordinary (couldn't taste the difference between oxtail and another meat), a nice way to start off the meal!  The Kimchi Burger- the flavor of the kimchi, plus the meat, with a slight sweetness, was soooo good, a MUST GET!!!

VIwPVAVw_UisG1LTkLHPJQ.text: I think it's overrated. The food was good. Presentation was great.  Customer service was horrible. When we left, I asked for extra sauce to take home. The serve then gave me a container to put the sauce that I had already eaten out of with my half eaten burger. I told her there's barely anything in it. Then she said it extra charge, which I didn't mind paying for.  All she had to say was we charge extra. I told her I have no problem paying. So then she gave me a half filled sauce. I was then really upset. I felt like she acted like we couldn't afford the food. Bill was $95+$25 tips, as I walked out she didn't even say thank you. I wouldn't go back even if they offered a free meal.

mkOO_ZdDQ2nhOohm1y7zIQ.text: This is my favorite bachi burger!!! I love it cause it has the ramen place with it as well... It's kinda like a 2 for 1 win hahah  The restaurant itself is very chic and cute. Our waters are always refilled and the staff are very friendly! The service is always a hit or miss because I have had a different server the 5 times I've been here.  Their food has been perfect every time. I love the kiki, ronin, and the spicy miso burger, they're a faveeeee :)))) I will never go to another bachi except this one and village square, the jones location sucks in service and food and serves soggy burgers!!! Please visit this amazing location on windmill :)

58Zywwxe2b8rbaHQdrsTsw.text: Yucky!! There's very unique combinations of foods here. Which is great but there should still be an option for plainer simple burgers and fries too. Not my kind of burger joint. It was packed and people loved it.

YfQjkZyU_xNqdQJo16dOGA.text: Just like everyone else said get the of tail fries! Mmmm. I got the ronin burger that was quite good as well. At the table we had sweet potato fries that came with a really good spicy ranch sauce and this fries went real quick.

sdner9Gu-oI79SI3cyEJNA.text: I went here with my BF and went here and the service was two thumbs up.  Since it was our first time Dan explained to us what their burgers were, which was most popular, etc.  I ordered the No Meat Here burger and that burger is super huge!!  I had to smash my burger in order to make it more proportioned.  Since it was a veggie burger the thing fell apart eventually.  It also contained some egg plant and fresh spinach (which is a big plus).  Dan was really attentive to our table and others as well and I appreciated that.  I'd definitely like to come back here and try something else on the menu.

wt1hs0YSs4rlM8GY-lJi3A.text: Food Ordered: Mr Ho's burger, Garlic Parmesan fries, bachi pickles, pineapple ketchup  food:  mr ho's burger was served on a taro bun!  this was very unique and different. there was a slight sweetness to the bun, and a hint of taro to it. very good, I like!  Bachi pickles were kinda interesting... it  was like a mix plate of different types of pickled radishes and cucumber. Fun when they were added to the burger.  Garlic Parm fries were delicious.  the pineapple ketchup was delicious! pineapple sweetness and flavor infused in the ketchup - very tasty  Service: our waitress was very informative and patient, as it was our first time visiting Bachi burger.  Gave us some great suggestions.   Parking: plenty of parking spaces in a small strip mall.    misc:  came here early on a Saturday morning ~11:30am and didn't have problems getting a table.  When we left at about 12:30pm, there were lots of people waiting outside for a table.  Bachi Burger and shoku? ramen are right next door to each other, they share the same entrance door, and you can order both burger and ramen at the same time.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mr Ho&#39;s burger on a taro bun!
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic truffle fries &amp; pineapple ketchup
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bachi pickles

jEIeQJ5oSvs-5aGEtY4OrA.text: Coming from California, we have a lot of great burger places.  Being a fan of burgers, my sister, her friend and I decided to try out this place.  We're glad we decided to eat at Bachi Burger vs. pigging out at one of the buffets.  Why, you ask?  Because I dare to say (and a friend of mine will agree it is a bold statement) that if there is a Bachi Burger put in Los Angeles, this place will easily knock out my Number One burger spot!  We got the ox tail chili fries and the truffle parmesan sweet potato fries.  Hoo Lee S***!  The truffle sauce and tomato aioli on the sweet potato fries are fantastic, and the chili fries are amazing!  I needed to look for my mama because I needed to slap her; yes it's that good!  And we didn't even get our burgers yet!  The red velvet shake was good, but was not something that stood out (maybe because I was having a food orgasm with the truffle fries!)  The burgers were just as mind blowing.  I got the Miyagi-San burger that has a Wagyu beef patty, onion rings, fried egg, Furikake infused bacon and chili mayo.  Our friend got the Mr. Ho burger, with Angus beef, green onion, cilantro ginger, Hoisin mayo, Lup Cheng, Mizuna and mushrooms... ON A TARO BUN!!!  My sister got the Ronin that has Angus beef with caramelized onions, Japanese cole slaw, fried egg, Katsu BBQ, Miso Goma dressing,  and Yuzu citrus aioli.  ALL THREE BURGERS WERE FANTASTIC!!!  I almost needed to look for my dad now and slap him too, it's THAT good!!!  I must say we will now be coming to this burger place every time we visit Vegas.  As I finish up writing this review I realize I didnt get to critique the asthetics of the restaurant itself.  WHO CARES!?  If you are reading this and are in the Vegas area, get your rear to Bachi Burger and grab some bomb a** food!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mr. Ho&#39;s Burger
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Miyagi-San Burger
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Ronin

07ckUs6Ap5hkodwHJ3nCqg.text: Delicious 1st (take-out) experiance here! Miyagi-san burger and sweet potatoe fries hit the spot..Service was very fast, friendly and I look forward to returning again soon! highly recommended....yum!

f-oHeEN5vYOuvOCr1yAr6Q.text: The server overcharged our table for things that we didn't order. Attention to detail is important.   The burgers are a bit too sweet. The chili fries dissapointed, looked great though. They need to put more fries and make sure the chili and cheese comes out hot and not luke warm.  I would go back and try it again. The bread is a nice touch.

ohrluVcfVNB-IRPQQBLlKA.text: Recommended by a friend and did not disappoint! Took off 1 star because we had a long wait, but the food really was worth it!!  Our table ordered so many different items and every single one was delicious. Service was good once we were seated. We will definitely be back!

wb177QFnf4iJRBo7uojgpw.text: I called in for pickup and they gave me an estimated time of twenty minutes. When I showed up twenty minutes later, the food wasn't ready and it took another half hour of waiting. The hostess did not seem to be listening when I walked in earlier- and fails to meet our needs. Slow service and mediocre food.

K-3jjV8GOge0cWQCo3ZuBw.text: Just ok at best. I know they are trying to be different and all that, but they miss with the taste. I rather have a regular burger over some crazy combination. The line is also very long every time you go. Don't ask me why!

B0I0ONZs4NjEyqppmLjJtQ.text: Best burger I ever had!!!!!!!! Neat place where the locals go for great burgers.  The truffle fries are the bomb.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FrtNvozrXZ4ieezXL8xSbg.text: Boy would I kill for a Bachi's in the South Bay.   My visits to Vegas rarely include venturing off the strip, but a good friend of my boyfriend suggested this place. I was not in the mood for a burger AT ALL, but the second I looked at the menu I was sold.   Service was great, and everything on the menu looked so good it was extremely difficult to decide what to get.   I eventually (reluctantly) decided on the Kalbi Burger which did not disappoint. Kimchee is the best condiment on the planet IMO and having it on a burger was an awesome addition. (I've had it on hotdogs and it's also thebomb) My boyfriend ended up ordering the Miyagi burger and it had such a balance of flavors and the onion rings on there were seriously perfect.   All the buns on every single burger were fluffy and light and held up to the size and juiciness of the hamburger.   Also order the salt and pepper fries because those things are legit crave-able. So crave-able that when I got back to the bay I immediately went to the grocery store and grabbed similar ingredients and attempted to recreate them at home.   Stop at Bachis, order something, be happy.   Easily one of the best burger experiences I've ever had.

ps6H09o4vrsAAfpKyAT1AQ.text: First time here and the food was amazing!! Definitely try the Miyagi and Oxtail chili cheese fries.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail chili cheese fries. So awesome

57wma6xggIFsFQBM7xNOiw.text: The service here felt like I was eating dinners at a strangers house. Was not a pleasant experience and very weird energy. From the hostess to the waitress they were very unprofessional and unfriendly. Especially VID. Loud and constantly giggling and talking about the customers. Our waitress was OK but that was towards the end.

UN8YY_Uv6NFxJT5EiI95mg.text: i have to say it hurts to give this rating. I was soon excited to get here ever since i saw the episode of DDD. I decided that today was the day. Well it was kind of a let down. I got to the restaurant and sat at the bar. The bartender was nice enough and got my name and even acknowledged it was my first time there.  i ordered the oxtail chili fries and asked what was a really good shake. The salted marshmallow  and caramel. Boom done. Kind of down hill from there. I was there right at 1 and there was not a lunch rush going on. i counted. I was very specific about the dish, the egg, scrambled. I have never ever ever eaten an egg any other way. Sorry Wylie Dufresne, I just cant.  Fries came out, over easy egg. I give it back and all that was done was the through it in a pan and just mashed it up and put it back on the plate. After seeing that show and watching the regulars next to me get the presentation and visual quality of the plate. I waste down. Also no silver ware.  I finished the fries and they were good, not great. i guess i wanted to wash them down with my shake that never came. I was done and about to ask for my check, when the shake came.  I have seen pics on line of what it looks like. it was not picture worthy. truth be told anyone that follows me or knows me on Instagram knows that my IG account is nothing but food and the restaurants i go to with descriptions of wha tim eating to the minutest detail.  I paid my check, left a tip for the effort and left. sadly, disappointed.

BzndRhg_Tcul01h0BzUFNg.text: The food here was very good. The prices were high ($15 for a burger and that doesn't even come with fries! Really?) and we had a bit of a service issue, but overall it was good.  We ordered the oxtail chili fries. They were good but not much better than basic chili fries you could get anywhere else. We also got the pickled veggies, which were good if you like that sort of thing. I thought they were delicious, especially the garlic, but the waitress said many people don't like it.  The burgers were the best thing. I got the Miyagi San and the wife had the spicy miso. Both were great. We also tried the vanilla honey orange shake and it was good. My only issue with the food, as I said before, was the price. It's about 25% more than it should be considering the portions.  The service was also flawed. Our server started out nice but didn't seem knowledgable. Then after we finished our food we waited over twenty minutes to even be acknowledged! We had to ask another waitress for a box. Then since we wanted a milkshake for desert it was like they got confused about who our server was supposed to be. They were nice but someone should have noticed us waiting that long.  So anyway, this place is worth a try. I would go back again if I got a discount or coupon, but I can't see being a regular.

0MQRLxjhy8uep2aHEFBZCw.text: It's a rare occasion when horrible service completely outweighs good food. This is that occasion. I can no longer eat here due to the garbage fire that goes on in their front of house. Glacial service, lack of regard for the guests and just an overall feeling of contempt for the customer. After many second chances I must file this away in my "used to be good" folder.

1E3zMIrVyMRCpIqpTFVP1Q.text: I am a fan! I have heard about Bachi Burger forever and was happy to see it and when I drove by, made a U turn!  The way I judge a burger is by the flavor of the meat. I cannot eat gluten so I do not get to have the joy of a bun, so when a burger is seasoned well it is a pleasure for the palate. Bachi Burger does it oh so right that I did not miss the bun. I was in heaven. We both ordered the Kiki Burger, and I wish one would have tried a different one but I now have a reason to return! The meat,the carmelized onions, mushrooms and cheese was pure decadence. I give the server props for letting me know the sauce was not gluten free! That was a touch I truly appreciated. I also liked that there was extra lettuce to make up for the bun, it is a great touch because it is annoying to pay the same for getting less. It was just juicy and oh so good.  We shared the oxtail fries. They were very good and the portion is very large. In fact, half came home. The meat was tender, flavorful and a nice kick. It was too spicy for my Mom even without the jalapenos but I was happy to finish them off. Next time if I ordered the fried it could be with another side as it was too much food! I want to try the other fries as well, so I will be returning'  I hear it is busy all the time, so as far as service goes I suggest not going at peak service as it is not large, so one may have to wait for excellence.The concrete floors and high ceiling makes it a little noisy but that is also the urban vibe. We had one main server but several different servers and busses came by to make sure we were taken care of!  The is one of the best burgers I have ever had, 5 Stars!

pva7rPQ1oBRUipNrsfKjzA.text: Saw Bachi Burger on the Food Network so I really wanted to try it and overall very satisfied!! :)  Ordered:  Ronin Burger (Medium done): yummm, juicy and flavorful, the citrus aioli sauce made it very sweet  Oxtail Chili Cheese Fries: loved this!! Very flavorful and perfect amount of cheese, don't mix the whole thing though, gets soggy quick!  Miyagi-san Grass Fed Wagyu Burger (Medium Done): You can really taste the batter of the onion rings in this one! Flavors are a good mixture and do not overpower .. tasty!  Service is great, but then again I went at 11AM when they just opened :P, plenty of parking available.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. ronin burger

1bJfE0qa7LE3fwHlEUkJIg.text: I've been wanting to go here for a while, so when I had the chance to go whilst in Vegas for a short 22-hour stint, I made sure this place was on my list.  Oh, I am so glad we waited the 30 minutes or so to get in here. We ordered the oxtail chili cheese fries, onion rings, a couple of Miyagi-San burgers and a Ronin.  I don't know about the Ronin, but my Miyagi-San was freaking delicious! And the oxtail fries were not a letdown. I cannot wait to go back.  The only reason I'm giving this place 4 stars is because I wanted to order a drink from their menu that's behind the bar and the waitress told me that the menu was obsolete. Weird. Maybe that should be taken down?

Me5_oRdjkAobFE4ECGZ0KA.text: This place has gone down. Food is mediocre and waiting time for food is about 2 hours. I would avoid this place. We come to Vegas every year and we had a wonderful meal here Last year but this year is different.  My kids fell sleep waiting for food. Stay away....

8BsXwK8oVPO_sibSyMavNQ.text: Shogun burger was DELICIOUS. The seared foie was so buttery and went so well with the poached Asian pear. I asked to have my burger cooked mid-rare and it was perfectly cooked.  Kiki burger and Mr. Ho's burger were also very good.   Also got the oxtail chili fries. Personally, I thought the beans in the chili were just barely undercooked but it was awesome besides that and three of us killed the plate.    Service was great. Even though the place was packed, someone was always making sure our water was filled and we had everything we needed.

Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shogun Burger

YbbFjYUOxXgLxP6756DlrQ.text: I never heard of this place until a friend recommended it.  It was so yummy and actually the burgers are very reasonable.  I really like the banh mi burger because of the sauce that comes with it.  The oxtail fries were the bomb!!  I need to fly back to Vegas just to try the rest of the menu!  Service was excellent.  The servers were so friendly!

1iLnuALr2sFDT4tn0stPOQ.text: Such a disappointment!!!!!!  I've had Bachi burger bookmarked for the longest and even had friends who went and loved it! So, today, while choosing a place to eat, I chose Bachi over Max Brenner. Yep. Big mistake.   We ordered the truffle parmesan fries and salt and pepper fries. For our burgers we ordered the ronin burger and spicy miso.  We waited 30 minutes for our fries and after complaining, our waitress said she didn't know we wanted the fries to come out first. Wthh.... . She gave us the sauces free of charge which was nice of her. Even though ALL the sauces tasted weird and citrusy. I thought the pineaple ketchup would taste like the special ketchup at Umami but it didn't. As matter a fact it tasted like regular ketchup.  Our fries finally came out and I was disappointed with my truffle parmesan fries. The truffle sauce were drizzled lightly and only got on the first layer of fries. Our burgers came out looking so delicious! We both ordered rare. Taking the first bite of my miso burger, I could taste a slight miso taste and then just like that, it went away. And that was it. No other taste! From that point on it tasted like i was eating tasteless meat. The meat were tender but not juicy. I didn't even bother trying boyfriend's burger because he said the same thing about his.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ronin burger, spicy miso burger, truffle fries and salt n pepper fries

avrZjxlARyYhg565ppytSg.text: The Oxtail Chili Cheese Fries are amazing, so many wonderful flavors and textures on hot fries, bomb! I'm from Hawaii, so I love Teriyaki burgers... the Ronin did not disappoint, oishii! The best Asian fusion burger I've had. The Pb Chocolate Souffle is oozing with warm chocolate and peanut butter with vanilla ice cream, oh baby! I will be back for more :)

Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. ronin burger... this was perfect.

uPOoPefDVPX17-B2pP5FZw.text: This is one of my favorite burger joints in Vegas!  Great burgers, great fries and other many other options too.

yotUxpQ2AumymWyfLcg7lQ.text: Best burger joint in Vegas! Not even a contest. Nothing else even remotely compares.   Oxtail fries-a must! So delicious!  Kiki burger with a fried egg on it...pretty much a lifestyle change. You go from commoner to elite after consuming this.   Truffle fries-another must.   Seriously, just writing this review makes me want to go there today. So good!

_YaKtAUv4A9yD6pI8HvrMQ.text: After hearing about Bachi Burger for oh-so-long, we decided to make a stop over on our way back home. Luckily, there wasn't a long line and a group of 8 of us were able to sit fairly quickly. We were placed right in front of the TV so we were also able to watch the last game of the World Cup. Score! Service was really good. Food... amazeballs. They have different kinds of burgers, but honorable mention goes to: Kiki Burger and MIyagi-san. The oxtail fries and the truffle fries were also really good. I would definitely come back!

uoOHNRjpbfqGCc-EXiYf0w.text: Very casual atmosphere. Ate at the bar because there was a line but fun to watch the kitchen and see all the tables! Great food! Large portions! We had the lamb burger and the fish sandwich! So good as in over the top! The dessert of Portuguese donuts and ice cream was sooooooo good! A must stop when near Vegas!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is a fish burger! So interesting and tasty!

sxNfLzEIyFTBuFK29L8IPw.text: Sat down at a table just my boyfriend, myself & twin babies. Wasn't acknowledged for 10 minutes. No menus, no drinks. A group of 4 men came in a few min after us & we noticed they already had menus & drinks with a waiter taking their order shortly after being seated.   My boyfriend went up to ask the hostess who sat us down for menu & she just handed it to him. When that happened I decided we were going to leave. We weren't up to paying for neglected service.

SaVKbc076gUUB_5-i1dRnQ.text: One of my favorite burger stops! The unique flavors here have me coming back whenever I'm in Vegas, going on six years now. You really can't go wrong here, the entire menu is great. The Ronin and Miyagi-San burgers are my two favorites, and honestly two of the best burgers I've tasted..patties cooked and seasoned perfectly, wonderfully crafted for maximum flavor. The Ban Mi, Kalbi and Kiki's burgers are very good as well. Their Yuzu aioli sauce perfectly compliments the sweet potato fries, truffle parmesan fries very tasty as well. Only issues I have, their boba teas are too heavy on the milk here for my taste..and beef patties are ground very fine here, but the texture has grown on me.  Service here is always spot on, maybe because we avoid the busy times.  Bachi Burger truly is outstanding and lives up to all of the hype.

ByJkDHrw_cciieX7qOpGJw.text: Food tasted great. The servers are super friendly. The prices aren't too bad either. This one had a ramen house merged with it so we were able to order off their menus too. The Ramen broth was a little on the sweet side for me but it was still tastey and I finished my bowl. The bachi burger was delicious I would recommend that. The oxtail fries had beans with it too but not too much that it was overwhelming  I would've liked it with no beans at all though.

dxnDFxWQkdopMUPytsQkxw.text: Great ramen and great burgers. Very impressed with the quality of the burger. I would absolutely recommend this place.

xsT1dsnWRmr76UOZ_o82bw.text: Had the shogun which is the most expensive burger but it was well worth it. Actually cheaper to have this stuff in a burger than by itself.   Seared foie gras Unagi Waghu beef Asian pear  It's a rich taste with every bite. See you next month and everytime we come to vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ov4ue3RLfiQCcybsihflXw.text: Great food! I opted for a quick ramen bowl as I had visited for lunch. The atmosphere was great and I even went for a Lychee Boba which had tons of flavor, not crazy sweet, and was icy cold. The ramen bowl had tons of veggies, bean sprouts, fresh noodles, and a flavorful broth (not greasy) as I went with the seafood (Tantanaki??) option.  Those who I dined with opted for pork and chicken stating these options were quite salty. Whatever you choose, the bowls come packed with plenty to spare. You will definitely leave stuffed. Wouldn't advise wearing white for splash purposes. I also saw some crazy oxtail chili fries and a stacked burger before I left. If youre on a diet ABORT MISSION. Overall, chill experience.

pO_HcPOs9xPa9PZaW0yLSA.text: if you don't care to have terrible service, go ahead and go to bachi burger! the food can be good, but for the price, the quality for the overall dining experience is compromised. management of this place is poor toward customers and employees. go to gordon ramsay burger or holsteins! around the same price point with much better service!

WPeUWrq4bpoAzqKIkhnX2w.text: Front of house makes you wait although get plenty tables, Mus b to make like really busy? 10 minute wait turned into 20 wit plenty open tables.  One hour after arrival we finally got out oxtail fries, was ok but look a whole lot better than tasted. Because we order appetizers we had to wait a whole lot longer for our burgers! Everyone around us who sat down after got their burgers first! Wow das how they take care us Hawaiians? Hey bro... Kanaka lives matter too! Any how got the bahmi burger, was small size patty wit big bun, neva look like the one I seen on tv. Burger was ono, but overall experience, I no goin came back, Aloha

qovnioFY4u8Pkj3NgGSWtg.text: Ok so first time here and we ordered the bachi pickles which is actually an assortment of different veggies including habanero peppers which was not a welcome addition... After having a mouths burned off for 20 minutes we had truffle fries which are quite good. We both got the myogi San burger but I asked to substitute the onion rings because I can't eat them. Unfortunately they do not do substitutes and charge which I did but still not good business in my opinion... The waitress we had was quite impersonal and rude... We would ask for something and she would roll her eyes and walk off. Other then that the burgers were beautif and delicious.  UPDATE: So since going here last night I have become pretty sick... I'm assuming due to that stupid pepper that some genius decided to put on an appetizer plate with the title Pickles! BEWARE

jywuzma0SvL6kdzT1gbkCQ.text: Dan was our server for our first visit and was crazy awesome and honest!  He warned me about portion size and what to add on or what to leave the way the chef recommend and im huge on Food Network places. I was personally on MAN VS FOOD Cleveland for MELT BAR AND GRILLED and this place remind me of the edgy vibe of east coast restaurants and i climaxed. The food was so sick i climaxed.....this server though needs a raise or some you rock free DRANKS. He seriously was slammed and gave epic service...I work downtown serving and I can juggle and I was impressed....thank you guys a zillion...I need and really wanna try those damn oxtail fries soon though....one thing I was Un happy about was my meT was way way over cooked for MR...

7AsEj8nPWRF3-tp6Qsr87g.text: I wanted to like this place,  I really did, ive seen lots of reviews so I came and was excited to try. Im a big fan of burgers but this place disappointed me in every aspect.   We order three burgers so we could try, the pork belly bun, and the fries with gravy I forget its  name. We tried three different burgers all medium rare and they all came well. It was a total disappointment, I would have asked to have for it to me remade if the waiter did not look so pre occupied (ill get more to that later). I forget the names now but all the burger were dry dry dry and some of the flavors we surprising not in a good way. I love pork belly buns but these buns were sub par. The flavors didnt stand out anf not memorable at all.  Now let me get to the service.   They seated us really quickly which was great since they had only six tables occupied, one large table which was already eating when we were sat. It took them a while to take our order, get our drinks.  When the food came, the waiter disappeared, from our table I mean. The food came and it looked epic which made the disapoointment greater. I had to ask him for ketchup and share plates.  But then he left for awhile and I wanted to ask for utensil but he didnt come back until we were ready to leave. I didnt understand why the service was so poor when they looked like they had more than ample staff walking around, just not near our table. They didnt refill our waters and while we were eating, some lady in the kitchen was yelling or talking quite loud. Really unprofessional.    Will not be back

Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Looks great but bone dry
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5yeUxxIOEgDnJeA2C8yENw.text: Oh Bachi burger, as seen on Guy Fieri's Diners, Drive Ins, and Dives, it truly looked out of this world! But sadly, the experience was still on this world and I would rather enjoy Guy's actual restaurant (see previous review)  We arrived in Vegas on Saturday and came by just about 11:00am, their opening time, with already a packed house and waiting patrons! That seemed to be a good sign! The interior is simple, modern asian-esqu themed, bamboo and wood but it was a calming atmosphere.   Our waitress was nice and friendly, and gave suggestions on items  today we ordered the following:   Shogun burger: wagyu beef, unagi, foie gras, poached asian pear, miso butter and Yamamoto peach; overall, for $26 i think this burger is ridiculously overpriced.. the beef, (i have had wagyu before) was very bland and overcooked; the sauce around it was good however; the foie gras was virtually minimal and the unagi was gone in a bite; the peach was very interesting to eat first too though and sweet! the bun was fresh and soaked up the flavors nicely; overall, a 3/5 for the burger  oxtail chili fries: these were very good but could have been better; the fries were nicely cooked, chili was delicious! oxtail was tender and mounded over everything! the egg was as tiny as can be and gone in two bites; the garlic aioli was also not enough  pork belly bao: this came as three, and the menu stated it came with "boiled egg, cilantro, scallions, hoisin bbq and vinaigrette; well there was no egg, no scallion and almost no cilantro...the sauce was good but overall definitely not a good boa  kale salad: this was okay...mom ordered this and I did not try it  chili fried chicken: this was probably the best dish of all; chili, garlic, ginger, not too spicy, juicy, flavorful, 5/5!  Overall, I think Bachi is kinda overrated, especially the original location i expected a lot more; MAYBE a return to the LA locations closer to home

Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shogun burger.... this would have been a 10/10 if the quality and seasoning of the meat was better

xMCKFz8jNuEUP8L9tRhCaA.text: I've attempted to come to Bachi Burger the last 3x I've been to Vegas and I FINALLY got to try it this last trip! There's always a long wait and now I can see why. The hype was real.   We started with oxtail chili cheese fries and truffle fries. Both made my stomach so happy. If that were the only things I got to try this trip I would've left completely satisfied. I'm pretty much a sucker for anything with a fried egg on top. The fries were crispy, the chili was tasty, and the sunny side egg just completed the dish. The truffle fries came with a brown sauce on top. I have not the slightest idea of what it was, but it sure added to my truffle fries experience.  Also on the list of things I ordered were pork belly steamed buns with the houses sauce on the side. The pork belly was crispy on the sides and had so much flavor! (I'm drooling again...) BF ordered the spicy miso burger medium. It was saucy and messy and just the way I like my burgers. My experience with burgers have always been... The messier they are the happier I am with it.   They also own the ramen spot next door and you can order ramen if that's more your craving. I can't wait to come back for more oxtail fries.

At least I can say I've tried them.. I rather go to In and out and order a #3 with hot peppers and a drink for under $6 bucks and you can really taste it

SLmlrqNPh25vx2EKlg4t1Q.text: We generally enjoy Bachi because it allows the family to have a variety of options if we're all hungry for something different. Unfortunately, when we visited today they weren't serving ramen, which is what my wife was hungry for. As we further explored the menu and started thinking of other things to order we learned that they were also out of chicken wings, duck steamed buns, the chefs special burger and other items. We ended up not ordering off the limited menu and chose another restaurant for dinner.

fwKssncKV0gtWVdvmjGGYA.text: Came here due to recommendations from my cousins who raved about it being the best place for a burger in Vegas. So on my way back home we drove by this place to give it a try.  We got here right as it opened, so there was no line to deal with.  A friendly and enthusiastic staff member greeted us and sat us down. He asked if we had ever been to Bachi Burger and when we said no, he did a quick introduction of some of the more popular items on the menu.  There were three of us and we got the following:  Truffle Parmesan Fries: ($5.50) which included  Parmesan Reggiano,  black truffle cream with sun-dried tomato aioli on the side.     - I thought it was decent. I didn't really taste the truffle flavor as much as I hoped for, and I preferred my fries to be a bit crispier.  I would probably pass on getting this the next time.  BBQ Bachi Burger: ($13.00)  8 oz Grass Fed Wagyu, lettuce, tomato and onion.   - This is the burger to get if you want a simple, juicy and flavorful burger where you let the bun and the meat shine. My friend enjoyed it thoroughly and didn't see the need for extra toppings or sauces.   Black & Green Burger: ($14:00) American Wagyu Grass Fed Beef, sauteed mushrooms, spinach, bacon, Point Reyes blue cheese,roasted garlic   - No doubt this is a flavorful burger, just reading the ingredients makes you salivate.  My friend liked the burger and the combination of flavors. He said he would get it again.  Shogun burger:  ($26.00): Wagyu Beef, unagi, pan seared foie gras, poached Asian pear, miso butter, and a Yamamomo Peach palette cleanser.  - I got the ultimate flavorful and tasty burger I have ever tasted. Over indulgent, perhaps.  However, the flavors surprisingly work well together.  Granted I was in search of foie gras coming from California which has now banned the delectable item so it was a no brainer that I chose this burger when I saw it on the menu.  It is a very rich tasty burger and slightly oily, but that is a given. The foie gras was pan seared so it was soft and melted slightly over the beef so there was a lot of texture going on with the poached pear.   Our waiter came to check on us after our food was delivered and told me that I should have the "Yamamomo Peach" before I eat the burger as it is a palette cleanser to prepare your tastebuds from all the flavors before you bit into the burger. Just remember that there is a small pit in the marinated peach.  I can see that the Shogun burger is not for everyone, but I enjoyed every bite of this burger.  The menu if fairly extensive and has a little bit of something for everyone.   Our server mentioned they plan to open a Bachi Burger near UCLA soon and another place called Healthy Life Kitchen.  Why 4 out of 5 stars? Well, I was a bit disappointed with the truffle fries.   Service was fine. Parking is plentiful. Prices are higher but I suppose you get what you pay for.   I would definitely come here again if I was ever in Vegas.    p.s. I was tempted to get the oxtail chili fries, but my companions were less adventurous. Darn!

L7-Spx9n8OHzwYmXKx28xw.text: Unreal burgers with a crazy Asian influence. Please don't ask me to write the names of any of their burgers, but their food is like an explosion of flavors!!!! When you visit Las Vegas, you have to try this place.... But after one of their burgers get ready to take a nap

gwRPiUXRXpxzfLAIcM1CtQ.text: I don't believe in 1 star or 5 star ratings, yet this is like a 4.9 ish haha.  Overall for even some of the younger employees, they're prompt and professional.  The burgers at any Bachi hits the spot and tastes well.  I like the different tracks they use for the music.  This one in particular has a joint menu with Shoku Ramen next door so yeah, that's pretty sweet.  Ramen if you change your mind and the bar offers some decent drink choices for those wanting some brew or hard liquor.  My favorite Bachi Burger spot for sure, if amongst my favorite places in vegas

tCtdFU8M8PTGMNGnXvt-UQ.text: *military discount*  Went 9-6-15 around 12:30 PM.  Once we were seated I realized that Shoku Ramen and Bachi Burger are in the same restaurant whaaaaaat??? I almost lost it.  I was so torn...do I get a burger or ramen???   $39.40 got me the pork belly bao buns, a wagyu burger with an egg on it, a jasmine milk tea with boba, and a kale salad.    This was my first experience with wagyu...I felt pretty fancy eating my hoity-toity burger.  I dunno if it was worth the price tag but it was pretty good.  I kept getting huge pieces of peppercorn and having to spit them out...maybe other people like that but I didn't.   The pork belly buns....while pretty tasty I don't think they are worth eleven bucks.  Maybe if they were five bucks.  Hipsters will eat anything with pork belly in it.      Next time I'm going to try the ox tail fries and some ramen!

YBUwBoxRbPwlr2gnNmaGDQ.text: It's an expensive burger but it's super delicious!! The Miyagi-San's burger is very flavorful. The egg, and onions add a dynamic element to the burger, making it the delicious creation it is. Aside from the burger, I would also recommend the ox tail fries :)

ubUZ5by8cwVVnTT7MKfn-w.text: Wow.. Wow.. how can you not loved this place! We're from Long Beach California.. this is our first time to this location, have me to another also. hRErxK3QLTdzZpi_lmCakg.text: I love the food here but I'm giving the two stars only because the rudeness of the staff when I came to pick up my food. I placed an order for pick up I talked to Steve and when I arrived the hostess came up and asked how she could help.  I told her I called in an order and talked to Steve.  I gave her my name and instead of talking to Steve she started walking around looking confused.     I was standing at the bar and another server, a red head definitely looked overworked asked if I was being helped.  I said yes, I placed an order to go and the hostess was helping me.  In a very rude tone she said have a seat and we will find it.    After watching the hostess walk past the bag with my food in it sitting on the counter and talking to two other people neither one Steve, she finally brought the bag over.  I was so pissed with the attitude and how I was treated i gave her my money, took my food and left.  I won't be back any time soon, they are just too rude for me to spend my money there....there was no reason or justification for the server to talk to a customer like that.  She never looked at me and never did anything to help find the food but had no issue being rude..

NloEgH5jF1o4Fksg5rokxg.text: We went here on a Saturday afternoon and it wasn't hard to get a table.  I used to love their Kiki burger and onion rings but this visit was disappointing.  The onion rings are no longer on the menu but you can still order them.  I was disappointed that after I ate one, my fingers were dropping with grease :(  The burger was ok.  My friend ordered ramen, French fries and strawberry lemonade ($4.50).  He said the ramen was ok, but the French fries were undercooked and wilted.  The biggest problem was the drink - the non-refillable lemonade was just a glass of ice with just a little bit of juice!!  I will attach a photo that shows how much ice was left after he drank the juice!  Unbelievable... and we will not be coming back.

BeRy5qr5qpFaLwutFKIxjg.text: The best burgers I've had, yes they are specialty burgers but sometimes you just got to try and if you're looking for a little different this is they place. If you're just out for a regular burger this may not be the one.  The onion rings are great and the ox tail fries are fantastic. ndd0n1Qj-mMDlg8-pCre9g.text: Saturday night in Vegas - Woohoo!!!  Post workout grub, errand and Zzzzzzzzz... vtXKgZPh5NUxYq0KMVUUZQ.text: A little expensive and fancy for burgers but I continue to return.   Try the oxtail fries.

0Q1wqrznZLyPozq_SQ77Cg.text: Wow. This place blew me away from their wonderful service to their tasty burgers.   This Asian inspired BBQ joint brings burgers and fries to a whole new level!  The truffle parm fries were so good, but even better with the little orange dipping sauce. I like my fries thin and crispy so it was the perfect texture and crunch!  The oxtail chili cheese fries were pretty good. You can definitely taste the oxtail meat in the chili. Since I'm a fan of crispy fries, the chili soaks up my crunchiness.  great flavored and worth trying, but I like the truffle fries better.  I ordered the Kalbi burger which has Kim chee on the burger and it was DE-LICIOUS!  I'm a huge fan of Kim chee so I may be a little biased with this particular burger.   Being greedy, I also took a bit of the friend's burger, the Miyagi San, and it was quite tasty also! If you like onion rings, this is your burger.   And to continue being a fatty, haha, I also took a couple of bites of the KiKi burger with a fried egg.  BOYYYYYY!!!!!!! If you like mushrooms, this is your burger! The mushroom flavor in this burger is so strong and powerful, but not too much like garlic. I was so full from snacking on everything else, I still took another bite.    Each burger and fries concoction has its own flavors and ingredients. You wouldn't be able to taste the same flavors in another burger based on the items we ordered today. This will be a place I stop for every time I visit Vegas.   What happens in Vegas.......gets posted on YELP!
