eivKvPgnHT9-zCzhtwxBEg.text: The restaurant was busy the night I dined. So the wait was about 30 mins. But after having dinner there is was worth the wait.  For appetizer we had the oxtail chili cheese fries. It had an sunny side egg with it, nice touch. We also had the pork bellied steamed buns. The pork was nicely cooked. I had the miyagi-sans wagyu burger. The onion rings and egg taste great with the burger. The others in my party had the spicy miso burger and bachi fish sandwich. They were very happy with their selection.  I'm definitely going back to try the other burgers.

ZSX5R2ZLPafPbw7_RfLK-Q.text: Ok it's about time I update my 2 star rating I gave them years ago. Being that I've been here and to the other locations a bunch of times.  Bachi Burger oh yeah I'm a fan of their burgers, not all of them, but enjoy most of them. Their kalbi burger is right now my #1 favorite at Bachi Burger. It's a little messy to eat, the sauce can go running down your arms while eating it if you're not paying attention but I can never turn it down. Kalbi in a burger how awesome tasting does that sound. Well it's more like a burger with kalbi sauce and kim chi but if it was kalbi short ribs it would be really awesome. Hope someone makes that somewhere soon. Always the kalbi is delicious. Sometimes I'll eat it so fast, cause it's messy, that I'm done before everyone else and I'm like do I order another one.  As always they have their oxtail chilli cheese fries which are excellent to share in a group. Their various burgers, spicy miso not spicy but tasty you should ask for some hot sauce. Not a fan of their truffle fries. You can also order their ramens, was gonna try it but again can never turn down an opportunity to eat the kalbi burger.   Customers service at most times are good but sometimes when they're too busy it seems like their overwhelmed, you no the usual.   I'll definitely be back. I'll try not to order the kalbi or spicy miso burger cause I need to try something else but no guarantees.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalbi burger. My favorite.
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail chilli cheese fries

Dq5EDRSXG8cfxi2CY8e8hQ.text: My boyfriend, Matthew, has been hyping this place up since I moved to Vegas a year & a half ago. And maybe that's why I was so disappointed with how my meal turned out...... and then again maybe not. This place was downright awful. And by awful, I mean I can't believe I paid for my food.   For so long I believed that presentation was everything, and then I started eating at places like Bachi Burger. Though artfully crafted, all three items I ordered were beyond bland and expensive to say the least. After doing some Yelp picture stalking, I ordered the Oxtail Chili Fries and Pork Belly Buns and requested that both be served as entrees instead of appetizers as Matthew and I like to have all our food at the same time so we can have a variety of items to munch on. My Oxtail Fries came out long before anything else, which was an annoyance, but nothing I was gonna raise a stink about so we proceeded to dig in.   My sweet Buddah were those fries disgusting. When I'm dining at a place that's charging $11 for a plate of chili fries, I'm expecting quality ingredients and exceptional flavor, and these fries lacked both. If I hadn't known any better (and I guess in some way I don't) I could swear they were covered in a can of Bush's Beans... and nothing else. Not even the fried egg that topped it could add any flavor to this disaster of a dish.  The Oxtail Fries were followed by my Pork Buns and Matthew's Miyagi San Burger that he requested to come out medium. Brown meat through and through is not "medium," people. Yet despite the obviously overcooked hunk of beef, we tried our best to power through the rest of the meal, and let me tell you, it was rough. The grease from the onion rings on the burger was enough to give you a stomach ache and the "Buns" around my pork belly where gummy... literally.. it was like eating thick gummy candies with cold pork....  I asked our waitress what condiments they offered so that we might at least get something into our system. Matthew inquired about a sweeter dipping sauce, and she proceeded to tell us they had a pineapple ketchup. I don't care much for sweet things, so I asked what other condiments they had, and finally decided on a garlic chili aioli. Our waitress brought both dipping sauces to us, which I thought was a very kind gesture considering we only wanted the aioli... until she charged us for both of them!   First of all, if you are going to charge people for condiments at a RESTAURANT.. you need to tell the customer that there's an extra charge. Second of all, don't bring out a condiment that I didn't ask for and then charge me for it.  Matthew and I left all our food on the table and left. We won't be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail Chili Fries.. you&#39;ll find better at a baseball field
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beware: they charge for dipping sauces &amp; don&#39;t give fair warning they&#39;re doing so.

6930Z3VJZwXXcAAGgtLwdA.text: This is not an average place, but the food was underwhelming. Great menu, including ramen. But execution not so much. And when the food is not up to par with price I'm stilled annoyed the next morning.   The $4 fresh squeezed lemonade nothing special, pass.  The pork belly buns, pork fat was not rendered well, left 2 behind. Bbq sauce served on the side is good but not needed. Not executed well.  The ox tail chili fries - hyped up wayyyyy too much. All the components are great individually but not balanced combined the way they were. Loved the fries and chili aioli but the oxtail chili was too all over the place. It needs some acid, smaller serving and a major price drop. $10+ bucks for that will piss people off. Also have you thought of a cilantro jalapeno aioli to go with the chili aioli OMG. That chili aioli is major.   Miyagi burger, too much going on as well. The patty with just the bun would be an all star burger. The onion rings were all star. I wanted a side of onion rings after eating what was in the burger. The candied bacon I see the concept but it's out of place and hijacks the flavor from everything else. But this burger needs some acid, some freshness. You got bread, burger patty, egg, bacon and onion rings. A tomato perhaps? Thin slices of fresh pickled daikon, something ...  We came because of diners and dives, it's one of the places you want to give another try ... but not trying to throw more good money after wasted money.

8Q4GCq2WtaHgg3fQ24HB-Q.text: Have been to Bachi Burger a few times. I have tried the Spicy Miso burger and it was super delicious. After being exposed to ramen, I no longer have the burgers. lol I get the Spicy Miso Ramen with extra noodles and extra spicy. My boyfriend gets the same but regular spicy. We almost always take some home, which we don't mind because it's just that good! They also have this salted caramel milkshake that is amazing! UlnRD3_TkJnb3EVg7Q6lAw.text: Great burgers here and very friendly staff!  The food has a lot of flavor and their options are a bit more unique than other burger joints.  Not a long wait for food.

Mc_F7rZII-5mKpa5A8agoQ.text: With locations now in California, there's no doubt Bachi Burger's popularity isn't dying down. With a couple thousand reviews, there's not much to add except that I'm a fan of the Asian inspired burgers with the extensive beverage menu. I just go in knowing that I'm going to drop a couple extra bucks and there will most likely be a wait for a table. You'll usually also find a drop off in service with increased wait times due to the high volume of patronage. But you're sure to find a burger with great flavor and a beverage to pair with it.  My favorite is the Kiki's burger which is basically a cheeseburger revved up with bacon, mushrooms,  sweet onion marmalade, and a garlic aioli. I would also recommend the oxtail chili cheese fries if you've got somebody to share them in order you not be too full for your burger because you polished off a whole order of fries on your own.  On our last visit, I had the Shogun burger with a Sam Adams Rebel IPA. Although I appreciate the combination of foie gras, unagi, asian pear, and miso butter combination, the wagyu beef gets lost. The pear was actually the most overpowering. I did think the yamamomo peach was interesting as a palette cleanser. If you like a little more simplicity with your burgers, I would not recommend this burger with a price tag attached of $26.  Bachi Burger will always be on the radar when we're looking for a unique, quality burger.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shogun Burger
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yamamomo peach with the Shogun Burger

szbjGvcyQWFvnNhVI8sohw.text: I usually get the Shogun Burger. This burger is everything, let me tell you. It's sooooo good! If you like foie gras, this burger is your answered prayer. It has wagyu beef, unagi, foie gras, poached Asian pear, miso butter, and yamamomo peach. Dreamy right? I've been here many times and what can I say. I'm addicted

0wW5J973iiNPoVNy-GdUKQ.text: Wanted to stop by to buy some groceries during our vegas trip and Bachi was right across the street so we just had to stop by. We started off with the oxtail chili cheese fries which was okay. However, the chili was pretty amazing. Meaty with a bit of spice. MMMM Everyone ordered an item off the burger list but since I'm not a huge burger fan, I opted for a specialty sandwich which I feel that they don't advertise much of. I ordered the Lonely Bird which was large enough that I was able to save a bit for dinner. I was also able to try a bite of the ronin burger which I would recommend if you love eggs and fried things lol.

CGtoeBriRt7kZfMFS5PeVQ.text: It was good. We felt rushed, but otherwise everything was tasty. The wait was nominal. The food looked exactly as pictured in the menu...that was a welcome surprise.

QOxYYsffitTXchaDs6_E3w.text: Came in with a group of 6 and omg we ordered so much food. An asian infusion burger place, we had to try this place out.   Appetizers Edamame with garlic butter and truffle oil - yummy, my fingers were so oily from it but soo good ahha Edamame with garlic ginger and chili - I don't like spicy things and it wasn't that spicy but I didn't like but my friends did Out of the sea salt fries with pineapple ketchup, garlic salt & pepper fries with garlic chili aioli, and truffle parmesan fries with sun dried tomato aioli, the truffle parmesan was my favorite, something about truffle that just makes it soooo flavorful and tasty mmmmm  Burgers  Most of my friends got the ronin burger which I cant speak for first hand but they loved it My bf got the bachi american wagyu burger - which was freaking one of the most expensive but he seemed to enjoy it a lot saying the quality of the meat was really good. He was actually savoring it and eating it slowly instead of scarfing it down like usual... or maybe he was getting full from the appetizers? I wanted to try the crusty crab but unfortunately they took it off the menu :[[ so I got the grilled bachi fish which was yummy! The only bad thing about it was that since its cod and the fish was flaky (in a good way) the burger didn't hold, it pretty much fell apart, so I had to eat my burger with a fork ahah  The server was nice and pretty attentive, constantly filling our waters and taking away plates pretty quickly.   We left happy, definitely will be one of our stops when we come to vegas

zuioXWti5_0FWPU_ZtsHKw.text: Food was great. Beers were cold on a hot day. Little bit of a drive from the strip, so if your taking a taxi from the strip, expect a $50 round trip...

hh6p4zEbGTCicj4VBBhfCA.text: My goodness! I got the Kiki's Burger and it was amazing. The parmesan black truffle fries was so delicious that I ate the whole thing....really. And I ordered the calamansi lime soda to drink...very refreshing. I can't wait for the Summerlin location to open because that's only 5 mins away from my house.   The service was friendly and all the servers worked together. I did have to wave them away because they wanted to ask questions and all I wanted to do was eat! Wonderful place to eat good and relax.

m_eVuu4WeWHH2sZnYX_5Ow.text: This is our first Triple Ds joint and it did not disappoint. Great food and good service. Oxtail chili cheese fries- sweet, and savory oxtail goes really well with the crunchy texture of the fries.  Grilled Kurobuta & Arabiki Sausage- it was just ok. Pork Belly Steamed Buns- although pretty fatty looking but it just melts in your mouth, the hoisin dipping sauce is too salty for my taste, should be more on a sweeter side. The Miyagi-san's Grass-Fed Wagyu Burger- very good, soft and light sweet buns compliments the burger perfectly. Shogun burger- a monster burger with foie gras, unagi, and pear.  Overall a very good restaurant, will definitely come back to try their other stuff on their menu.

eZSMEJHEwT0b_Ra_aBS5Yg.text: I love this place I don't even know where to start I all ways go in without eating breakfast so I can fill up on the good stuff and omg there is so much to choose from the Thai tea is so good then I get the oxtail fries witch might I say are to die for  I all ways bring my friends in to they get different burgers so we can all share I love the burger buns talk about melt in your mouth And if you have kids mine get the BBQ burger and all ways clean there plate what more could I ask for its  such great food

kD47dxxLyklqndBtquaaIQ.text: This is the best burger place I have ever enjoyed!  Super delicious burgers! Try the brandy milkshake...its awesome!

W0y_VOZ_k2KispDTHsaWmQ.text: I have been meaning to get around to trying this place out ever since I saw it on TV. The timing was never right...until now. I have to thank my two friends, Rob & Steph, who finally got me that elusive visit to Bachi! It's not located too far from the strip. But definitely an area I had never even traveled, even living here 7 years. Inside, it had a nice clean, look. They were fairly busy for lunch, but the wait wasn't terribly long, 15-20min. There was 3 or 4 burgers I wanted to try but I suppose I'll have to return to try them all hehe. I decided on the Spicy Miso Burger. I believe my friends had the Bahn-Mi & Wagyu cheeseburger. We also shared the oxtail chili cheese & truffle parm fries. My burger contained onions, shishito peppers, roasted garlic, swiss cheese, apple vinaigrette, a fried egg and spicy miso sauce. I loved the sauce. Little spicy, the subtle savory flavor of miso. And can't argue with a fried egg on any burger or sandwich, at least I wouldn't haha. Great burger. The oxtail chili cheese fries were also awesome, although it did cost twice as much as the other fries. The truffle parm fries I couldn't really taste any truffle. The Ramsay burGR truffle parm fries were definitely alot better. Service was good from start to finish. I absolutely have to return to try more of their burgers!

HrL7NgKudKaGst4xeYsaeQ.text: Looooove Bachi Burger!  I don't get to go there nearly as often as I would like, but their burgers are bomb!  I especially love the Ronin burger, doesn't get any better.

hOMGAJCbUrdL5dyuvg4tnQ.text: In my opinion, I rate this place the best gourmet burger spot in Vegas. They have great service  and even a server that looks and acts like Jimmy Fallon! YEAH! Seriously! HAHAHAHA!!! They change up their dessert menu every so often but they haven't disappointed me yet. Their kalbi, bachi fish, and wagu burger are my favorites. They also have items you can add on to your burger like fried egg, shishito peppers, avocado, and so on. Their sweet fries and truffle parm fries are delicious as well.

gpY91BJg3GnY-63WuxCkzg.text: I've been here a few times, and have never left disappointed! The food is of a great quality, and is flavorful, to boot. They're open late (often until 2 a.m.) and they're pretty consistent in the number of patrons inside (usually 70-80% full). The staff is friendly, and willing to answer questions. Burgers are also offered protein-style for those who don't want--or cannot--eat so much bread.  Their Truffle Parmesan fries are AMAZING, and a real deal at $4. (You can definitely share them among 2 people, but I'd get more orders for a larger group).  The sausage appetizer is tasty, as well; but it's only really for one person.  The only qualm I have about this place is their speed of service; it usually takes about 20-25 minutes to receive your food, so don't arrive starving. That having been said, this remains one of my favorite late-night restaurants in the valley!

fs_Xz_iE-1xNqLIunoOmnw.text: Bachi Burger For those of you, who are Foodies like us, better get ready cuz' my Bruddha's restaurant concept has finally hit the planet. "Bachi Burger"! Come and experience the finer essences of gourmet fast food. A must try burger joint. The ketshup, sweet potatoes fries is a huge treat to enjoy. A must try Las Vegas not heavy on the stomach. Yum!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

s4Fzqruj7qDqF4J9JWfIeA.text: Ox tail fries definitely good. Wait can be very long at times. Tried the Miyagi and Ronin cooked to perfection.

tnybkQLpqWrVf1Tz4HsU5A.text: Very tasty burgers. Came here after we finished a trade show in Vegas. Overall very delicious burgers. Shoe string fries had several dipping sauces, and burgers were cooked perfectly. Want to try the miyagi-San and sho-gun burgers next! Heard this is one of the best gourmet burger spots in Vegas and was featured on the food networks diners drive-ins and dives...

ga989f_EM8XTqySt8OScYw.text: We were greeted by the waiter Matt with "what can I DO TO YOU ladies tonight ? Opps I mean what can I get for you ?" Wow ! Did this guy really just say this ? Joking or not still very unprofessional.   Anyway onto the food .. Tried this place once before when it just opened and wasn't impressed .. Thought maybe we just ordered the wrong thing ? So it got some hype with it being on triple D and with the reviews I figured I'd try it again. Still Not impressed .. Oxtail fries nothing special and for $11? so not worth it .. I'd rather go to California hotel and get a big bowl of oxtail soup with rice for $10 ! I'd stand in line too for an hour and give them an extra $5 for tip ! Also got the Ronin burger .. Again it was OK .. For $10 I would rather them give me 3 of the buns only .. That was the only thing that was good tonight .. Also it's a bit pricey total came to $27 for a burger n fries .. i should've went to In-N-Out with the $7 and put $20 on black at southpoint ! Overhyped I think .. Nothing to go out of your way of .. I'd go here only if McDonald's wasn't 24 hours or if fuku Burger ran outta business .. But we all know that's not happening anytime soon

RN_ahTlBgxgaURVzelJj5g.text: We are frequents to the Las Vegas and Henderson area. Every time my family and I are down, we think of the plethora of great eats in these cities. A couple of weeks ago we found out about bachi burger and their food has opened my eyes. In California, the closest burger to compare (which doesn't match up IMO) is umami burger. At bachi, I tried their miyagi burger, and each bite was full of flavor. The bun was toasted to perfection and for some reason, the juicy richness of the meat never left the buns soggy (twss). If you're ever in town for a 5-star burger that puts all other burgers to shame, give this place a try!

75S0ru3_EsxIo6U7C6Ht5w.text: This place never dissapoints.  Every burger I've tried has been delish and their buns remind me of Krispy Kreme.  Maybe because they're fluffy and baked golden brown...I dunno.  The brandy milkshake is something new I recently tried and didn't disappoint.

DBRrVZOtFVomw8EmoPgRCw.text: I've been here a few more times, so it's time to update my review.  They have such interesting combinations that we always order one of those instead of trying to make our own.  I haven't seen these combinations anywhere else.  I've tried the Miyagi-san and the crab cake burger.  Both were delicious!  My husband always gets the mushroom burger.  I really like the fries with cilantro and jalapeno; it really adds flavor to the fries.  The burgers are really big, so I can never order a shake with burger and fries because that's way too much food for me, but I tried my friend's peanut butter shake and it was really good!  The new Summerlin location is very convenient too!

CiFl1i3803vXavyiN-kZmA.text: The short version: spectacular food, reasonable prices, average (at best) service that just isn't the fault of the servers. The managers and/or owners are waaaaaaaaay understaffing their floor at peak times and it hurts the experience, which would be perfect if not for the service issues.  We started with the pickled vegetables -- revelation. A nice mix of Japanese veggies that calmed the appetite but didn't fill us up. I've had both the Ronin with beef and with the chicken patty (for reduced guilt.) I loved it with both, awesome flavor combo. The fries are special. Truffle parmesan is spectacular, sweet potato not far behind.  Beware the hard sell on the drink menu, both alcoholic and non. Looks like that's where they make up for the reasonable prices on the food menu. If you want a drink, there's a great selection of sodas, beers, wines, etc., but it'll run up your bill in a hurry.  Servers are friendly and helpful, but just stressed out by being stretched too thin. There were two for the entire floor at dinner a few weeks ago and they were running for their lives. For the sake of the experience, please staff up, Bachi!

BQHcW-YVb-vdzbbQgxTOog.text: The spinach dip is very good and the service is exceptional. Dillon gave great recommendations for burgers and drinks and was spot on. Very good.

EV5WoAGrSQNjTXiQEIGT1Q.text: Can't believe I forgot to review this place.   Great gourmet burger joint with some surprising twists.  The burgers are Asian fusion which in some warped way works.  The selection of fries they have are insanely addictive.  The truffle Parmesan fries are my favorite.    The other surprising twist is that this is also a ramen noodle shop.  The ramens are pretty authentic and reasonably priced.  Others I have been there with get ramens, I stick with the burgers.  :)      They also do steamed Bao sandwiches.  The pork belly Bao is to die for.  This place is always slammed so expect a wait for a table.  The food is not cheap and borders on expensive but the quality of the food you gets makes it worthwhile.    The service is bonkers considering how small the place is and hailing your server can be a challenge at times.   The bouncy and interested nature of the staff far outweighs how busy they are.    If you have friends coming to town and want to show them some off strip Vegas goodness, you can't go wrong with Bachi Burger!

7t015CbSbxamIyQUQjE1rA.text: Was dying for a good burger when I got to Vegas. Looked up popular burgers and this place showed up as a Guy Fieri recommendation. I had a Miyagi-San burger and it was INCREDIBLE. Also had the ox tail chili cheese fries...wow.   The atmosphere is really chill. Great place for lunch or dinner with reasonably priced food

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iz6LOJjAmC1Bf5UxBf4Zvg.text: Bachi Burger! This was our first meal in Vegas!!! Got the word that this burger joint was legit and it was pretty good!!   When we entered, it took a couple minutes to get greeted and seated.... so first impressions... not so good!   Now, inside has a cool feel, modern and an Asian twist because they have a burger/Asian fusion and they even serve Ramen which looked really good!   The service...... NEEDS TO STEP UP BIG TIME. The service was so slow, I got annoyed! Again, it took them several minutes to greet and sit us.....  Esteban took our drink order and I came out in a pretty good time.... then we ordered....slow..... when we got our first order which was the Ox tail fries which were delicious!!! Ox tail stew over a plate of fries... the sauce, meat mixed with the fries was great! However, when we received the fries, we didn't get plates or napkins, or utensils.... COME ON!   And I ended up getting all those things myself.... then our burger came which was the kikis burger which was good BUT OVERCOOKED..... I asked for medium rare but it was well done.... but we were so hungry after the flight, I just wanted to eat.... and I even informed Esteban and was hoping for a nice gesture (like a small discount, complimentary fries or drinks) but nothing.   We also ordered truffle fries and it was really good! Nice flavor and the fries were hot!   So there was good things but the service really needs to step up.... but One employee Steven was consistent and worked hard and he actually took over to take care of us... and he actually was pretty good.... but the team needs improvement.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Call this medium rare????
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5XOzktN6M9cExy8cVsXDiA.text: I've had my fair share of Burgers in Vegas, and this place is definitely up there with the best of them.  We had stopped by Bachi Burger around 6pm before dinner rush hour and were served by a very nice and helpful gentleman who was accommodating to any questions you had with the menu. I had ordered the Ronin Burger and I really enjoyed it, The burger was cooked to perfection and everything really went together on this burger. The slaw and dressing were tasty, the yuzu citrus aioli really added something to a burger ive never had before, with a lime flavor to it, my only gripe is that the fried egg was a little overcooked, which is fine because thats what a fried egg is but I like when it is a little runny, (I suppose I should ask for it that way). Along with the burger we also shared fries, which were average.  I think next time I stop into town I will definitely come back and try one of the other creative burgers this place has to offer.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ronin Burger*

YlD_N1UAQpbZPxn1c8O8lw.text: My friend and I came here on a weekday evening about 7:30 and was seated immediately. Service was a bit slow from waiting to take our order, waiting for the food, and even waiting for our server to run our bill. It seemed like it was dying down a bit after we got there and picked up when we were leaving.   I decided to build my own burger. The descriptions of the other burgers sounded overwhelming for my tastebuds and I just wanted something simple since it was my first time here. I ordered a medium wagyu patty with an egg, gruyere cheese, and the onion marmalade with the regular fixings. I got to say, the onion marmalade really exceeded my expectations. I asked for it on the side because I wasn't sure of it yet, but I pretty much smothered it on my burger.   Would definitely come back again and try their specialty burgers this time.

ksrKsQD3OMRzFiO0R--K9A.text: The place is modern looking and service was great. I went in for lunch and ordered the miyagi san burger medium cooked. As the photos show, the burger comes with a fried egg and onion rings. The burger was delicious and will definitely go again.

Not sure if it's this location specifically, but the service was horrible. Went at a time when it wasn't busy and our server was nowhere to be found most of the time. When she did deign to come to our table, she was rude, would reach over and grab things without asking if we were done, and then sulk off when we told her we were still working on it.   Wanted to try this place for the longest and was so let down when I finally did.

5YYjoTkVHYvBeiAxl1pKHg.text: This was our first stop for something to eat after a 4 hour drive from OC. We were STARVING!   It is really hard deciding which burger to get because they all sound so good. I was torn between Mr Miyagi and the Ronin. I followed the waitresses suggestion and ordered the Ronin. When it arrived, I was missing the "wow" factor of the other burgers I saw on other reviews. It was also cooked well done instead of medium like I ordered. It was tasty but not something I would crave next time.  The truffle fries were good.  If I come back, I would try a different burger.

lnKZ_WBtfU2L4RZuAfIKfw.text: The ramen has been closed forever. I really doubt they are reopening it which is too bad.  It is the best thing.   The pickle appetizer is now half the size and the same price.  They have modified the burgers and they are way too complicated now.  The kalbi burger use to be good now they added a fried egg and fried onion rings and it's just too much.  They're usually out of something.   The sausage appetizer has 2 types of sausages and often they only have 1.  They are usually out of the gyoza.   It is frustrating.   They use to be so good but without the ramen I don't want to go back

hPdtPbc5III7xhx8ZsLrCA.text: Almost two hours to eat!  The service was beyond slow!  As soon as we wrapped in the little Spanish lady sad "We are out of ramen noodles."  Later someone made a comment they were two cooks short. It wasn't even that busy. That was our second visit. The first time, three years ago, was a totally different experience. They could have at least offered free fries or dessert. Nothing!!  We will NOT return.

mB0tNCUBcNwblZmpijJ9YA.text: What can I say about Bachi burger you must try! You won't go wrong with anything that you order from the menu. The ox tail fries are yummy, the pork bones are really good, and the wedge salad is outstanding! Too bad we don't have one in California but until the owner of the side open a franchise an hour in California I will have to take it to box for my next wife.

Hh_4u_CFFeUD0g2oty607Q.text: BEWARE OF YOUR CREDIT CARDS! We are from out of town and went here for lunch w/my sisters and my sister paid for the meal and we all noticed how unusually LONG it took to get her CC back from the waiter to the point where we had to get up & go ask for it back and he gave a lame excuse on how they were cashing out the registers (um, u don't cash out mid-day in the middle of a transaction)....cut to a week later my sister's CC had all these ridiculous charges from the area around where we were.  We know it was this place because this is the only place where she used her CC.....such a shame cuz the food was actually good....I guess just pay in CASH next time.  (The waiter was a tall Caucasian man)

1-UOzn-frYVyYNe8DvCRTw.text: Love this burger joint! Yes, it is a bit expensive for a burger but the quality and taste out weigh the premium! A wide selection of fun, fusioned burgers! I love the truffle parmesan fries, they complement the burger so well. Will continue to come back!

sr13uBf2fEf6qqDeOwS3_Q.text: Bachi Burger... what happened... When you first opened years ago, you were a hip fun addition to Vegas. You increased the number of restaurants, for good reason, but the quality seems to have gone down.  Kiki burger, spicy miso burger. Spicy miso was a strange combination. Kiki burger was better. Both sounded great on paper, but both were disappointing.  Garlic fries were dry and sprinkled with light garlic. The aioli sauce that came with it was good, but nothing special. I wanted a wet drenched in garlic fry... ugh.  The restaurant is large and in a popping plaza.

pl1dn8aTjc0KvCjAya-nGw.text: Was recommended this place by a woman at the nail salon adjacent to the restaurant. We ordered a salad which was nothing special, some garlic fries which were DELICIOUS and a protein style burger. The highlight of the meal was the fries so if you go there definitely order some garlic fries (the sauce is comes with is also fantastic). The burger was good, it had a hint of a korean flavor to it (like a kalbi marinade) and I enjoyed it. The salad was really nothing special so I would pass on that.   Service was excellent and the crowd was young and hip. Really enjoyed and will be back soon. Thank you Bachi Burger!

omt0bZ-T5arO2FFUePDR4w.text: Amazing burgers and ramen. Miyagi-san burger was an excellent choice. Oxtail fries as an appetizer and you will not be disappointed.

QVXUJNkyOdd2mrnc_9vA2w.text: Wow. I've been wanting to come here for a while now. This placed definitely lived up to all the reviews that I have seen on here. Atmosphere was great, very casual. They definitely had no problem with kids there (unlike a certain dessert place we attempted to go to yesterday). The waitress was very friendly and checked back on us just the right amount of times (you know. Not too many where it was annoying, but just enough to know they're still keeping an eye on you). The food was excellent. We ordered the oxtail chili cheese fries to start off with. When it came out, hubby and I demolished that plate in about 5 minutes lol. This was our first time getting anything with oxtail in it. And it definitely didn't disappoint. The flavors on that plate were excellent with just enough spice, esp for preggo me. He ordered the ronin burger, I had the kiki's, and little one had the chicken karaage. Omg. Even after the chili cheese fries and my burger, I picked off a couple tiny pieces of the chicken just to taste. And boy, talk about light and fluffy breading haha. Everything we got was good stuff. Great service and food. Definitely coming back to try the other burgers and their ramen!

I sampled 3 different burgers (including the mizumi) and were all unqiue with different flavors and compliment. The patty was juicy and the bun was lightly toasted. One of my fav burger joint!

4t11iZ0EH9Od4nYDeFoDnQ.text: I would give this place a 3.5 stars... Wait was tooo long, service wasn't too great, drinks weren't good, it got quite smokey in the restaurant... the only thing they really had going for them was the food!   We came here on our way home from vegas. Yes we could've gone somewhere else when we heard it would be an hour wait, but we decided to stick it out, because if we had gone anywhere else, it would've been the same.  I was referred here by a co-worker.   We had the Oxtail chili cheese fries, which we alright, you don't really taste the oxtail, it's a bit sweeter, than just regular chili fries.   We also had the Waygu and Black & Green Burgers. Which were delicious! I have to say the best part of our experience here. The drinks were watered down. Even though it wasn't that busy by the time we got our tables, it took a while for us to get our servers attention.  Even with the vents on, it got really smokey inside the restaurant too.   Overall it was alright, would i go back? Yeah, but I wouldn't go out of my way for it.

pUrfvpwtMxuYHhLNn2bQHw.text: I've been a bahn-mi burger junkie for some time, but the miyagi burger blew my mind! My wife always goes for the bachi fish, and it's delicious, but go miyagi!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HbgM27EHH6JCwmJczRwXyQ.text: We had the oxtail chili cheese fries with egg, Miyagi-San and the Shogun burger, along with Portuguese fried donuts. My beverage was the lychee milk tea with boba.   I think if you advertised oxtail chili cheese fries the "oxtail" should be the main focus. In this case it wasn't. What we got was barely-there shredded oxtail meat in a stew of chili smothered over fries and topped with an egg. The chili was good for what it was but the oxtail meat did not shine.  The Miyagi-San burger was very flavorful. I liked it an would probably get it again.   The Shogun burger had interesting and complex flavors. I don't think any one thing really shined. I could've have done without the poached pear. It sounded good on paper but it was just over-kill. The meat patty had a sweet teriyaki sauce and that was plenty sweet on its own. The frois gras was an interesting touch but it had the same texture of the poached pear. I'm not sure how frois gras is traditionally cooked but I would've wished mine was cooked a little more firm and salted more to counter the sweetness. I honestly think the burger was a whole lot of "too much". Frois gras... Unagi... Poached pear... Wagyu beef patties... All wonderful on its own and maybe it should be enjoyed that way. I wouldn't pay $26 for this burger if I can enjoy one of their $13 burgers just as much if not more.  If you're accustomed to drinking milk teas and boba. I would say the lychee milk tea was sub-par. If the idea is new to you, it's a cool thing to try but KNOW there are plenty of better places out there to get the same thing.   Our food came out extremely late and our server was very apologetic and comped our drinks and dessert. I was appreciative but unfortunately that was my first experience.

7GsE5IWmXSadGNv_ZwGX8A.text: The food here is amazing! Been here about 6 times and every single time the service is terrible just AWFUL! I came at a time where there were only 4 tables busy which had their food already and yet somehow the waistress kept getting lost , took forever to take our order and never asked if we needed anything . Who hires these people! I think being lazy, slow and giving zero shits about customer service is a requierement to work here.

6nbTEp7Of2OZLay9Mh6yxg.text: Heard about this infamous burger joint first from one of my co-workers... then as I scoped out the scene here on yelp it totally made me become even more interested in visiting this place... finally during one of my recent trips back to the city of sin I was able to make my way out there to confirm the verdict... and guess what?  It's definitely a thumbs up!  So what is Bachi Burger?  It's a similar concept to Umami Burger that is based in Las Vegas...  Let's jump right into the Pros and Cons... (My new ways of reviewing...)  Pros:   --Great burger!!!  Had the Kiki Burger and it was off the hook!  The size is as big as expected from a gourmet burger joint so nothing special.. it comes a la carte so your fries will always be an extra order on the side... --Great truffle parm fries!  Terrific flavor and definitely deserves a recognition! *totally wanted to try the Oxtail chili fries but didn't get the chance...  The neighboring table ordered one and they literally killed it in about 3 seconds... can't wait to order this entree next time I'm visiting LV!  Cons: --Location is not too hard to find but it's not obvious either... ample parking though... --Price is definitely on the higher side.. oxtail chili fries will be around $11 bucks so be prepared to pay for the food... for us one burger, truffle fries, and iced tea ran around $20... so it's definitely a treat more than anything... --Not on the strip where I'm usually at.. but I guess that's ok... less crazy crowd I suppose.  Verdict:  I will definitely go back!  In fact... my next trip I'm going to verify how delicious that Oxtail Chili Fries really is... and gotta try the Miyagi Burger too!  So stay tuned for an updated review coming soon!

3xVS71boIPC3x0hIyAJ2kg.text: We were excited to visit bachi burger after seeing it on diners, drivers and dives, and we were not disappointed. We started off with some adult milkshakes, which were strong but delicious.  For burgers, we had the bbq burger, the kikis burger, and the miyagi burger. My friend said the bbq was good but nothing spectacular. My husband had the miyagi which was savory with lots of flavors. I had the kiki which was suggested by the waitress, and it lived up to its reputation. It was huge, but I finished every last bite because the burger and dipping sauce were amazing.  In addition to our burgers, we also had the truffle fries which were cut thin and came with a spicy dipping sauce. If we are ever in the area, we will definitely come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious burgers!

_PPfChHFuJwfkTiyd221DQ.text: Excellent food! Service is a 1-2 star.  Items on menu not served anymore, made to order from bar tender and he took 15 mins to take my order.  After order take, 30 mins before order ready to get out (to go).  Not offered anything to wait/drink. Let me be clear, good food, but the service hurts

U7MppaX3g5USmHmO5RLREg.text: This is my new burger favorite.  And will be one of those iconic vegas eateries I HAVE to eat before heading back to LA.    I was so impressed.  Foodwise.  Their service was lackluster as they were understaffed. And our server was seldom seen.    I had the shogun burger. But eventually, tasted everyones burger at our table. everyone had something different and everyone couldn't stop raving about their burger.  i think my favorite was the miyagi san. Egg, Fried Onion Rings and a zesty patty. MM MM!!!  Also notable are the bao sandwiches.  They tasted amazing.  Will definitely be back.

htdBuxre4HVeppA7W0Y05w.text: I always enjoy eating here and wouldn't turn it down if asked if I wanted to eat here. I bring a lot of friends from out of town to eat here and even the people who aren't really into burgers say that they like this place. The last time I came here I ordered kalbi burger, my husband ordered the miyagi burger, and my friend ordered the manga burger. We also ordered the oxtail fries as an appetizer. Everyone enjoyed their meal, tho the kalbi burger was just good, not my favorite. This place is pretty crowded during regular meal hours so be prepared to wait if you come during those times. Service has always been good every time I have gone.

tgs5jbxyusI1SBfZWPnKwA.text: First time here and I've heard so many good things about it... so I had to try it out for myself! I ordered the Kiki burger (without bacon) and boy let me tell you..... That burger is soooo tasty and juicy! And it had mushrooms, which is another plus because I love mushrooms! MUST TRY! We also got the Miyagi, and that too was so yummy. I love the taste of the furikake on the onion rings! We also ordered calamari and I loved that they weren't stingy with the calamari, it was a big serving to share (there were 3 of us). I'm coming back, for sure!   Our server was Chris. He's very nice, helpful.. And on it! Thank you!

sBWtm7emTsdTMl_krkBeQg.text: Everyone must try this place.   My friends told me about this place, because they couldn't stop talking about how great their burgers and fries and pretty much everything on their menu were. I must admit I am one of the biggest fan. After dining here, I've been telling everyone they must come to this place.  From truffles on your fries, Foie Gras, and Delicious mouth-watering Burgers and so forth. I can't say enough.   Their quality of food is top notch.!!! I am in love with this place.   this place has also been on the Food Network Channel Dine-Dinners and Dive In with Guy Fieri

Cx0TA6EdFX54H4-LVDUQTA.text: Good burgers, glad they are coming to LA (sawtelle area). Banh mi burger was the group favorite. The foie burger didnt really taste like anything.

wMHWLh59d0TxNMDViijnHQ.text: I came here for the first time last week and boy, they definitely live up to the hype! The citrus dipping sauce that came with the sweet potato fries was really good. The pineapple ketchup with the regular fries was to DIE for!  Both burgers were very well done. We will go back. B93jsUP_hloOKeetMfcrtQ.text: The best way to put it - I literally created a Yelp account just so I could share with the world how good the burgers are here. They are amazing. The Kiki burger is the best burger I've ever had.... Order the Kiki burger with truffle Parmesan fries, get the edamome stir fry (I believe that's the name of it) as an appetizer.

htlEFSry1qyFkuHdAGG-Yg.text: So, the restaurant sent me a letter after my Yelp post to tell me that they were working on the service speed.  Well, they did!  Based on some other reviews I tried the crab cakes.  Wow!  I had a burger again, which was awesome, but was jealous of the fish sandwich ordered by people at the table next to me.  Well, that just means that I'll be back.  Again, service was much-improved so they get five stars this time because the service was excellent and the crab cake was the True five star surprise.  Enjoy!

lEaAxoiNRQxY_ArHen19Aw.text: Today was the second time we ate at this place and I'm still a fan. For a Saturday mid-afternoon, it was pretty busy. The place is pretty decent, good for intimate 643-8 people. The servers were really friendly.  I introduced my friends to this place and each one of us got the Ronin burger. Perfect serving size to not overwork the kidneys. Although, I was bummed that when I requested to cook the eggs over-easy, the chef said no. That would have been delish! The yolk oozing out....I know.. weird.  The truffle fries were ok. I know right? Chocolate + fries = hmmm..Something I still need to get used to. Also, try the hot green tea. Will definitely aid with digestion:). The bf was the only one that ordered the Kiki's burger and he only ate half; he was definitely FULL which is rare.  The first time we ate here, I got the Kalbi burger, which is also yummy but I prefer the Ronin burger.  Oh, and if you crave for this place on a random Saturday night (midnight-ish) come early or ORDER ASAP! When we called last Saturday, they ran out of buns due to high volume! We were pretty disappointed last night and settled for In & Out.

833FaNxWNM_IZanawr1nFQ.text: I love this place! It's a unique twist on burgers and fries. Only here can you get a milk tea, Japanese chicken skewers and a burger and have it all be wonderful.

CuPkDWpmqx3YwRld3rIy3Q.text: Slowly sliding down too bad the food really has potential!

X7DYpeOTc9HbRLQfQJdjbw.text: I went to Bachi Burger on a friend's recommendation and was not disappointed. I had the Kalbi burger which is prepared medium and was a good choice.  The parmesan fries were very good.  I would recommend the karage chicken as an appetizer, which is something I cannot find in most restaurants and the dipping sauce for the chicken is excellent.  As for the service, I thought it was good.  I have read some reviews where service was a concern.  This was not the case on my visit.  It was a very good dining experience.

kfhvQm72jLcu4z2qHjOA4w.text: Ok after a lot of ranting and raving from other people, we decided to try Bachi Burger. I understand that they are trying to be creative with their Asian fused food. Great concept, however, some times a little too much can be a bad thing. Overall the place was ok but not what I was expecting. I suggest this place if you want a nice atmosphere and finger foods, not if you're terribly hungry or if you have several mouths to feed since everything is a la carte. If on a budget, stick to Fukuburger.  First comment- nice interior and atmosphere. Steady flow of people. Employees were nice. Even though there were other patrons, we seemed to wait a long time for our food. I believe we waited at least 20 mins to get our food and another 15 mins for the check. I mean for a burger this seems like a long time plus there seemed to be a quite a few employees in the back that it shouldn't have taken this long.   Second - the food. We ordered the parm fries, Ronin burger and Short rib steam buns. Parm fries were good however I didn't feel that the sun-dried tomato aioli really fit in with the fries. If anything I would suggest that the truffle sauce replace the aioli because the sauces didn't go well in my opinion. Also I didn't think the aioli had much flavor considering it was sun-dried tomato.   The Ronin was just ok. First I'm surprised they didn't ask us how we wanted it cooked. It came out medium well and honestly I would have preferred it a little more pink. First off, the burger in my opinion is quite small and tries to compensate with a thick patty but still looked delicious that I couldn't wait to take a bite. First bite, bread is soft and great quality of meat but the sauce tends to overpower the flavor of the rest of the ingredients. If you asked me I wouldn't have been able to tell you that there was Japanese Cole Slaw, an egg, caramelized onions or a miso dressing, all I could taste was the katsu sauce. There were 2 sauces on the burger and a citrus aioli on the side. Personally I don't think the aioli or the miso dressing are needed since the katsu sauce is powerful enough by itself.  Short rib steam buns - great presentation making it look like pitas. However, first impression was that's alot of dough for the little bit of ingredients within it. First bite is exactly what happened. I thought that the short rib and the egg didn't have enough flavor to overshadow the thickness of the dough. I could taste the cliantro but other than that, I thought the flavor was very bland. I tried the dipping sauce which was suppose to be a horseradish aioli. Personally I wasn't a fan of it, I would have preferred something with a little more zing like a wasabi ranch dressing or a japanese style salsa. It's a great concept but I think it should be revamped to bring out the flavors of the ingredients they try to fuse together or else again everything gets lost in what is trying to be accomplished.  Finally we ordered the Portguese doughnuts. Eh it was just an oversprinkled cinnamon mini-doughnut with a mini vanilla ice cream scoop. It tasted a little burnt and seems to be covered with alot of cinnamon and brown sugar to hide the burnt taste.   Overall Bachi was just ok, it didn't meet the expectations that I had or maybe I had too high expectations. For two people we spent over $40 and still left hungry so I wouldn't recommend this place if you are starving. Again I like the concept and what they are trying to achieve but for the price I can get the same thing at Fukuburger.

mrM6Iimkge2XfEoQsC2s1Q.text: I live in Summerlin so this place is a good 30 minutes away from me.  When I was finally on that side of town my friend and I decided to check it out!!  I was honestly expecting a little burger joint like in-n-out or something, but this is a nice sit down restaurant.  Casual and trendy.    My friend told me what to order so I didn't even really need to look at the menu, but I was intrigued by their "Burgers with a twist of Asian fling" deal.  There are so many things I want to go back and try, this will definitely not be my LAST time! Our waiter was also very informative. He asked if we wanted to "hear about the menu" and I thought he'd never shut up... He explained EVERYTHING to a T.  I actually felt bad because I was already ready to order before I even got a menu!   We started out our meal with the pickle plate.  I had no idea what it was but we saw it in a newspaper article that  was posted in the front.  My favorite part of the plate was the pickled garlic cloves.  I was expecting way too much garlic flavor, but wow I was surprised.  I would get a bowl of just that!!  The other items were mediocre, but it was worth trying it.  Very interesting idea!   For dinner I had the Kiki's burger with sweet potato fries and sun dried tomato aioli.  It was delicious!!  The burger was amazing.  It came with a chili aoili on the side and that was actually my favorite part.  Next time I want THAT for my french fries too. My friend had the crab cake burger, and it was good!  I like it a lot for a seafood burger.  It was a little sweet which was odd to me, but very interesting flavor.    I ended up spending $17 for a burger, sweet potato fries and the pickle plate.  Not TOO bad, but a little pricey for 1 person at a burger joint.    HOWEVER, I would go back in a heart beat.  I actually can't wait to return so I can try something else!  Definitely check it out, you won't regret it....  The drink menu alone looks amazing.  I drank water, but next time I'm gonna have to get one of those boba milk teas everyone was drinking.

LmtIv56sqRaW008CV-EAIg.text: Best burger I've had in awhile, despite the over use of floral flavors. Waitress was short, but I blame being understaffed. I honestly would eat here anytime, any day, it's amazing.

yYHiJPr_1mpbgIA9HPtv1A.text: Wow, JUST WOW, who knew heaven was just a few files from the strip of LV...A stop I will always make in Vegas...it's just that good. I just had it 2 days from this post and I wanted it again and tried to hit it up before I left the sweet town of LV, but damned it all they are closed on Sundays, DRAT .   Let's take this as a walkthrough, I'd like to be how very detailed in the whole experience.   1. Walk - in, little worried b/c even with good reviews I've seen from yelp that it wasn't that busy, also the few customers we did see didn't order burgers but sandwiches.  2. The Sit Down. It was a nice looking decor, just arriving to LV and was starving anything seemed good, but I didn't know what I was about to get into. We order some waters, get them fast because it wasn't that busy considering it was around 3 PM, We order the fries, sweet potato, the truffle oil, and garlic fries. They come out first.  3. The fries. The Garlic fries were the first I tasted, each basket of fries come out in nice decor and although it's 4 $ each approximately for a little more than a handful you'd expect to get more, but it's really the perfect amount you need. Again well the garlic fries were great, they had good taste, and had a little kick of spice I would think from jalapeno. It was really awesome! Second I tried the Sweet Potato fries, which were cooked to the greatest form...the texture and crispness to the fries was really good. Then I tried the truffle oil fries, by themselves I thought were alright, but when you add them with the sauce / chutney that is arranged with each basket, it definitely does not disappoint. 4. The Burger, Oh goodness....the burger...it was just amazing...I ordered the Kalbi burger, and was actually reluctant b/c the waitress didn't really acknowledge it as a good choice...or even ask how I liked my burger cooked (I ususally get medium-rare, or medium), but it didn't matter...it just didn't...it was just that good. My burger had a perfect bun, wasn't soggy or anything, it held True form as I devoured my burger from first bite to last. The patty! Man if you've had Korean BBQ / Kalbi, then you know that's already money, but on this marinade on the patty! SOOOO GOOD!!!! It also had a thin layer of Kim-Chee and served with a side of pickled cucumber (ouee kimchi, is what I think it's spelled), I wish I could describe it better, there was more to the burger...but I just totally just hypnotized by it's taste.  5. Service, I know it wasn't crowded but service was amazing, it seemed everytime I sipped water, someone would fill it to full right after I put it down. The staff was nice, give you a warm greeting and a happy good bye b/c I think they're glad to see satisfied customers, and I was most definitely one of them.   This was the longest post I've ever written, and even posting this on my FB just to spread the word on this place...

3zh-4c7YM6w8Cpmd_871BA.text: We went here for a late Sunday afternoon lunch - no wait.  Waitress was very nice.  I had the Ronin Burger and it was delicious.  My husband had the Korean BBQ Steam bum which was good too.  My kids enjoyed sweet potatoes fries and chicken karage.  My favorite was definitely the Ronin Burger, so tasty!  We will definitely come back again!

dwfk0EkhW63Z-L6lLzJ6YQ.text: Bachi Burger is always on my list of places to go when I am in Vegas. Went around 10pm on Saturday and of course we had to wait, that is never a problem since the food is always so good. Once we were seated, our server came pretty quickly and was nice. That was the best part of our terrible service! Our server took about 10 minutes to bring our strawberry lemonade to the table and after waiting over 20 to 25 minutes, we received our food but never received out appetizer. When we mentioned it to our server, he said that he would get it put in right away. We opted not to get it anymore as we had seen many other tables that came in after us receive multiple things before we received anything. Our server looked as if he was on drugs, very jittery as he attempted to show us his pad of paper showing us our order and saying it was not his fault. Mid way through our meal, we ordered food to go, we sat and waited for over 20 minutes and finally was approached asking if we have received our food. I proceeded to tell the other server that we were waiting for our to-go order. As he walked away, I saw him go up to the register area and find that our to-go order had been sitting in the counter. I could not believe how terrible the service was at Bachi burger! The food is always good, but I felt like the server should never have been serving people food! He made mistakes on every single table he was helping in our area and instead of apologizing, he made excuses!

PjRnOeWqUUSVuNr3lc6_-g.text: Bachi burger and the ramen joint next door was disappointing.  We ordered a variety of appetizers which included fried calamari, sweet potato fries, octopus fried balls which were all mediocre.  Nothing wow.  Then comes the entrees which included the tiki burger which tasted somewhat like the western bacon cheese burger from Carl's jr.  The garlic ramen was flavorful, but again nothing to get excited about.  Also took home an ordered to go, the banh mi burger, a Vietnamese inspired baguette that that now turned into a burger was nothing to really praise about after having the first bite.  For desert, we went with the donut and ice cream, again very average.    In terms of service, our server was nice; however, the attention to details was not there.   We were not given proper utensils such as knifes for our burgers and spoons for our ice cream.  Also our appetizers that was brought out were placed on our napkins.

ciqpzADB4bA-FWszx9fMvA.text: My family and I loved coming here. After the service we received yesterday, we will NEVER go back. There was 12 of in our party. We were told there was a 20 minutes wait. Of course, when is there never a wait? That was the best experience of the visit. When we were seated, it took awhile for us to get water. We all ordered our meal with our drinks so the server didn't have to come back, nervous she wouldn't. After an hour and 20minutes and no drink refills and a member of our party had to go back to work and left without eating., I asked to speak to the manager to see what the issue was, she sent the server to our table. With that, I questioned the server about the time and why it took so long. The server stated that it was out of her control on why the food was taking so long. I will NEVER go back! I can find better service somewhere else. I will NEVER recommend Bachi Burger again!

ieaG2PxgPMw72lANLjczog.text: My boyfriend and I were visiting from California and my friend suggested this place since it's across the street from where he lives.  Serves was a little slow (Monday around 1pm) but the waiter was friendly and once we ordered the food came pretty quick.  I ordered a BBQ Burger of some kind with the parmesan truffle fries. The prices are high but the food was amazing. I took a picture but never saved it otherwise I'd make your mouth water. We will definitely be back when we visit Vegas aging and I've told all my friends about it. So good.

9fADsEHfG-gHNCeG8qhJUQ.text: Still my favorite burger joint.  I've been coming here since it's opened. I recommend this to visitors and folks who ask for my recommendations in Vegas.  Great apps, great drinks, great burgers. Affordable for what you get and a good casual restaurant.  I'm glad they have made a name for themselves and even opened up multiple locations. This location could get busy during peak times, so make sure you allocate time to wait around. Might as well grab a drink while you wait.

7PMIh3c1rzYHbdbfF0LvMQ.text: It must have been mile 5 or so of the Spartan Super Race when I started to really curse myself for what I got into. Hungry, tired, hot and cold (yes, it's possible), and with a leg that kept cramping. That's when a large group came up behind me encouraging each other. "Do it for Bachi Burger!" "ohhh.. yeaa.. Bachi Burger".. "mmm" and all kind of positive responses ensued. Curious, I asked, what is this Bachi Burger and where can I get it. The reviews there and on yelp ended up being great, so we decided to make sure we checked it out before we left Vegas.   It did not disappoint. First, we ordered the oxtail fries. Yes, I know it sounds strange and not necessarily appealing. But wow! It was really good! The fries were not soggy, the oxtail super tender and they added a fried egg on top. And I really really love a fried egg. Got to try the garlic truffle fries and those were good too. For the burger, I tried the Ronin burger. I enjoyed the quality of the beef and the mix of different and unique flavors. Friends also tried their shakes and really enjoyed them. Definitely a good find! I am excited to see they have opened locations in LA and Pasadena!

VVqXFs9Tm9LOlivsXA4-7w.text: Been here now 6+ times and have tried many burgers.  Love the burgers, love the steamed buns and love the adult milkshakes.  They combined with the Ramen place next door, which is nice as well.

LkPmdmBKUlS5IY3Nap72SQ.text: The burger was good, but 12$ per burger, are you serious? My friends ordered 3 burgers, 12$,12$ and 16$, 40$ for 3 burgers was ripped off, and for the mocha powder tea 4$?  It was too expensive, I would recommend in and out burger. I am surprised people still goes there.

lpde-NrqHJ_xQQgL_Hk0bQ.text: Bachi Burger, thanks for being vegetarian friendly! I really enjoyed my meal here last night with friends. They had two menus available for us to chose from: Bachi Burger and Shoku Ramen. I'm assuming that the Shoku Ramen place (next door) shared the same owners as Bachi Burger, which is why they had two different menus.   ATMOSPHERE Darkened lighting created an intimate atmosphere for friends and couples. Wood paneled walls and skylights made the space feel laid-back and upscale. I was definitely comfortable! It was busy and the tables are spaced far apart from each other so that you have lots of space to have private conversations and can talk loudly without bothering others.  FOOD Alcohol, Japanese appetizers & Ramen offered from next door's kitchen, and Asian-fusion fries and burgers were on the menu. They have a great selection and there are many choices of burgers for all types of appetites. Because I am a vegetarian who eats seafood, there were options from both menus for me! I also liked that they have the option of add-ins and an ample selection of sauces to accompany the yummy fries. Now onto mine and my boyfriend's selections:  1. TAKOYAKI (FRIED OCTOPUS BALLS) $8.00 Delicious! I love that their takoyaki had 6 bites containing lots of flavor, and generous toppings (bonito flakes, ginger, mayo, takoyaki sauce, etc). Could have been crispier on the outside, but the inside was cooked and had a good bite-sized amount of octopus (tako).  2. NO MEAT HERE BURGER (WITH ADDED SWISS CHEESE) $11.50 Had fried eggplant, shiitake mushroom patty, tomatoes, onions, a perfect soft bun and mixed greens. I think it had some sauce in there as well, and combined with the swiss cheese... You think being vegetarian is a curse? No. This burger is a blessing. If I wasn't vegetarian, I would've have tried it. So THANKS BACHI FOR MAKING ME NOT REGRET MY DECISIONS! Arigato gozaimasu!  3. VEGETARIAN MISO RAMEN (WITH ADDED BOK CHOY) $11.50 Good ramen, good (on the sweet-side) miso flavor. I don't know what their regular ramen broth tastes like, but I'm sure it's equally as good. It is missing a bit of a wow-factor though. But points for having vegetarian choices.  SERVICE Very understanding and patient server. My friend is one of those people that asks you lots of questions and takes awhile to order. Our guy server (with curly hair I think?) was patient, and explained everything perfectly. He even brought us our somewhat difficult water order, as we all wanted it "hot", "iced' and "room temperature". I know, the customers we all dislike. But hey, we were accommodated with a smile, so brownie points for putting up with us! Also, more tip for you, sir!  Overall, good night. A little pricey for burgers, but they are well executed and delicious so no complaints here. Will be back

RxJ9WAs6g9tzV9l9J0QN-g.text: My husband and I went to this restaurant with two of our friends. They have given this restaurant such very big rave that they say it should be a must try when you visit Las Vegas. My husband had the Spicy Miso ramen and I had the Kiki burger. We had the takoyaki octopus cake. The takoyaki is okay. There is one small octopus in it so I guess that is a plus point for them but I tasted better than that. I have to admit that the Kiki burger is good. It is good but not that extraordinarily spectacular.

fw7QX2sNEfe8Zg5jY-YdcQ.text: Looking forward to a different take on burgers especially after the positive reviews on Yelp and being on the best burger top 10 list. Food was ok. However, service was awful. Inattentive, disinterested wait staff, french fries came out five minutes after burgers and we had to ask servers multiple times for ketchup.

gmGERACq0rrAHZ-k6wxj5Q.text: I love this restaurant. The burger is absolutely fantastic, i am craving for it now and this rating is from someone who don't really like burger. Shogun burger and oxtail chilli cheese fries are my favorite. Get ready to wait, but worth it. Staff is very friendly and service is good. I am sorry that some of you have bad experience but me and my groups did not have that.

2A7DCrm9SkN58thbvSGFqQ.text: One of the most reviewed and highest places to eat in Vegas, OFF the strip count me in! It was pretty busy for dinner, but we got a great table just a few minutes later. Service was nice, though they were busy, they got our order right and food came out quickly, The menu is very different from any other burger place, takes a while to take it in and narrow down the selection. For starters we had the chili fried chicken LOVE, so crispy, sweet and spicy, perfect! Onion rings and salt and pepper garlic fries, also excellent, piping hot and crunchy with great flavors, win! Kids meal, a great value at $9, full sized burger, fries and a side of fruit and veggies, score! I had the Caesar with Baby Romaine, Avocado, Tomato, Parmesan Reggiano, Organic Jidori Chicken Breast and Spanish Anchovy  Not a fan, basically a plate of cheese, killed the lightness and all other flavors, cold chicken and I tried my way through all of their dressings, liked none and just didn't eat the salad, no bueno. Much better was the No meat here burger with Wheat ,Red Bean, Shiitake Mushroom Patty, Japanese Eggplant , Mixed Greens, Tofu, Chili Lime Vinaigrette Basically 3 veggie burgers in one. The breaded eggplant I can do without, but that Mushroom patty was AMAZING! There was so much going on, so many flavors, so many taste buds that had never been tickled like that! My husband had the The "Banh-Mi" Burger with Angus Beef, Pork, Shrimp, Lemongrass Pork Pate. Fresh Herbs, Curry Aioli Pickled Vegetables, Nuoc Mam Sauce and liked it though, all the different meats in one burger got to him after awhile.  Portions are not huge, but the flavors are so intense, that everything is served in perfect proportion. Can't wait to be back, something to look forward to next time I am in Vegas!

HF6lZXsd5s_DD6fNUqAOow.text: I was somewhat worried about coming to this place because some of the "bad customer service " reviews I sow. But for my first experience, their customer service was EXCELLENT! The food was just Awesome, super D-Lish. Great food, great ambiance, great service.   A most check out place!!!  I'll definitely come back to this place next time I'm in Vegas.

s4vH68LizqqG3zFdvdUP6A.text: a good variety of burgers. sweet potatoes fries were super delicious and they come with a wasabi sauce. they have god drinks, some beer and wine and iced teas. I asked to replace a meat burger with veggie patty for me and they did and it was delicious. It's a good asian fusion place with good customer service.

iweKB706TwUDpLas0c9dpA.text: We came here with relatively high expectations from the great reviews. We ordered the oxtail chili fries and a specialty burger. Let me start with the oxtail chili fries...Not a fan! I hate hate hate hate soggy fries and it didn't help with the hot chili. To be honest, I wouldn't have been able to tell the difference between oxtail or pulled pork... it could have been pulled pork for all I know.   I also ordered a burger with very unique flavors on the menu. I probably wouldn't come back. It may have been that my expectations were too high but whatevs.

jxqWmvxQO4jXHm9DEIJnGQ.text: BURGERS: Want a delicious, melt in your mouth burger? Get the Shogun burger, absolutely amazing! The foie gras with the wagyu beef just melts in your mouth. The wagyu beef is well seasoned and the miso butter, poached Asian pear, and unagi tops it off. If you want to be adventurous and try something different, I definitely recommend this burger. All the components of this burger put together makes for a very rich and delicious burger.   My boyfriend got the Miyagi-san which was a little disappointing for the both of us. The patty was overcooked so it tasted a bit burnt around the edges which overtook the burger making it hard to enjoy.   FRIES: Our table ordered the oxtail chili cheese fries, the truffle Parmesan fries, and salt and pepper garlic french fries. My favorite was the oxtail and salt and paper garlic fries. The truffle Parmesan fries were just okay but could not compare to the other two. The oxtail fries were delightfully the right amount of sweet and spicy, every bite was enjoyable. The salt and pepper fries just made my taste buds ring, the garlic chili aioli sauce that was paired with these fries was also great.   DESSERT: I got the Tahitian vanilla orange milkshake at the end and loved it! The orange aroma paired with the vanilla was fantastic. The milkshake was a satisfying end to the meal. I can't wait to go back here next time to try their other burgers!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sea salt caramel milkshake!
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tahitian Vanilla Orange Milkshake, so good!
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Miyagi Burger

e4NmvvQQEgPG4Fmw1Zwmhg.text: Great burgers at great prices. I had the Kiki burger, which was so good. I also had a bite of the Miyagi-San, which was fantastic too. Both were cooked to medium (perfectly) and the patty was super tender and juicy. The portion size was just right, although I ended up saving a little bit of it for the drive home. It was still delicious!  Another must was the ox-tail chili cheese fries. I accidentally bit my lip and caused it to bleed when I saw it arrive, just to give you an idea of how good it looked. It's a little expensive but the oxtail is so flavorful. Best of all, the chili is not watery, which I hate!  Can't wait to come back. Or to go to the one opening in LA!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Jj9DBruA29hahl-H4x-ssg.text: Service was extremely slow and when I requested an extra well done burger with NO PINK, my waiter said the burgers are already kinda burnt, but he can ask well done. When my burgers finally arrive.... Cut it open and it's damn near rare:/ so I had to wait longer for a well done burger....

B4pO0kWQ7CTistTKsXSmPg.text: Awesome gourmet burger bar.  I just ate lunch there and am in a food coma.  I had the Miyagi-san Grass Fed Wagyu Burger, Salt & Pepper Garlic French Fries and a Dogfish Head 22oz My Antonia Pilsner.   Everything fit together perfectly.  The burger was perfectly cooked and tasted amazing.  The fries were crisp and covered in jalapenos and cilantro with hawaiin sea salt and had a chili dipping sauce that fit together perfectly.   The beer was the perfect accent to the meal as well.  You can always count on Dogfish head.    Overall this place was great, service was great and I will highly reccomend to anyone looking for a great burger experience.   The prices I feel are good for what your getting.  My entire meal was $30 and change.     Bachi Burger is not too be related at all with fast food, In & Out or anything of that nature.  When you come here you are getting the sushi of burgers.  Nothing is spared in the pursuit of perfection to get you to burger nirvana.

syXyNEi3YzehFdhS_7uZiw.text: I can't even begin to describe how delicious Bachi's burgers are.  Simply orgasmic!! And, this is coming from a non-eating red meat individual.  What can I SAY they truly are serving up a one-of-a-kind special burgers.  Not to mention all the side delicious - Ox tail fries hands down simply yummy despite the spicy green peppers floating around, not for the faint at heart.  Although I shared them with My guy who loves the hot spices and for me I just scoop them away. The Myagi-San burger, Parmesan fries, homemade burger buns (Taiwanese sweet bread)  it all Rocked! My banana bread pudding - oh my another home run!!!! My hubby truly loved it as well, In essence, you will not be disappointed and your palette will be submerged in a bliss of delightful flavors, that are heavenly paired together.  OMG! hands down the best burgers EVER - ONLY in Henderson! Now to wait another year before our return trip!  Too bad we didn't know about it last summer!  Bachi burgers you have spoiled us to the point of no return.  Ahhhh my mouth is watery with just the memory of my experience there.  By the way, the staff was right on point each time we return during our stay in Henderson - 3x. Delightfully surprising how much I enjoyed eating these burgers, with no recourse to my stomach.

2uOh41jvW_jtl3NWiUemEw.text: Whenever you hear about "high end" burger joints you always have to wonder what and how they are going to be. Usually I think of In-n-Out or maybe Five Guys for a good burger, but now you can go and get a restaurant style burger for like $10-15. Bachi Burger is a joint like that where they throw the asian flair onto their burger in a fusion manner. I was a bit skeptical when I saw some of the items on the menu but when you try them out the flavor combinations turn out to be very good.  First we started with the oxtail chili fries - now for me oxtail is one of the best things ever, and when you combine it into a chili and then top it on top of fries with a sunny side up egg, you got a winner. It is definitely enough to share as an appetizer - we did for 4 people - and everyone got a taste of the flavor explosion.  Now there are way too many burgers to choose from, so our group of 4 decided to pick 4 different burgers so that we could all taste a little of each one.  We sampled the Ronin, Kalbi Burger, Spicy Miso Burger, and the Crab burger. We got all of the burgers medium rare (which is much better than the recommended medium) as the quality of the meat was actually very good. Overall, every burger had its own unique flavor combination and each of them I would have been happy with getting, but I was glad to share and try each one of them out. The Ronin had a japanese flavor to it, the kalbi as its name implies, had kimchi in the burger and actually went very well with the meat. The spicy miso was also very good and as I am a fan of shishito peppers chose this burger - it definitely was not "spicy" as the name implies and could have used something to give it more of a kick. The special burger of the night was the crab burger that added a crabcake on top of the burger which in itself was quite delicious.  Overall, a very good "high-end" burger restaurant and I would like to go back and try some of their other flavors of burgers.
