Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SU_8n2CJ07nT5L1Hjvs3sQ.text: Love love this place. It was a recommendation by one of my friend and it didn't disappoint. I got the Miyagi Burger (wagyu beef FTW), pork belly buns, & the green tea pineapple with mint leaves. The burger just melts in your mouth and I love that their is a hint of sweetness to the beef. The pork belly was crispy and the buns was nice and soft, love the juxtaposition of the textures. The drink was not bad, it should have gone with something else. I wanted to try the oxtail fries she. I come back! Our server Palm was nice, helpful, and patient with me as it was my first time. Place is always busy so be ready to wait. Definitely coming back here on my next trip!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

J2cyunt9MkpRhBgjCT4cFg.text: Fourth time here and I love it every time. Friendly service and great food. Excellent ramen and the loco moco risotto never disappoints. I get it every time.

ZFyAVayc7fvvA3YXtfbz0w.text: I come here just for the Caesar salad :)... Umami!!! Grilled sausages, house pickles, calamari w/Thai basil won't hurt.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pickles &amp; dog!
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Cesar w/Wagyu patty. LCHF!

ZSr3K2jA7igQbQ7PfwdB-A.text: Bachi Burger is the best place to eat!  From Burger to Ramen.  I always get the Bah-mi burger and garlic pepper fries.  The wait staff is Always on point!  The food is always excellent no matter how busy or slow business is.   Puts Bobby Flays burger palace to shame.

L1638QwFLYNIQYayviU1_Q.text: First off, I typically like my dishes "traditional". For example, if I'm going out for a burger and fries, I want a wholesome American burger and fries, authentic Chinese food, etc. With that said, I'm not usually a fan of fusion restaurants, but this place combines flavors so well - I can't deny the great taste of their burgers!  My favorite from here is the Miyagi-sun burger. It has a great mix of delicious fillings, with the crispy onion rings, caramelized bacon, fried egg and the furikake seasoning. The patty is thick and tastes of high-quality meat. There seems to be some like BBQ sauce (or maybe it's just the caramelized bacon) that makes the burger a little sweet. The onion rings cause the burger to be stacked pretty high but don't be afraid to squish everything together and get your hands a little dirty :P The burger tastes amazing with the combination of the different textures of the fillings and it's awesome to get a little bit of everything in each bite! The buns are nice and soft too (that's what he said? Haha). My bf and I also shared an order of the salt, pepper and garlic fries.. The metal cone they are served in is deceiving as it is not entirely filled with fries (stops about halfway through). Nonetheless one order of fries was perfect to be shared between the two of us. The garlic chili aioli it came with was also good, not spicy at all.   The wait was a little longer than I would have expected for our dishes, especially since it didn't seem particularly busy when we came by. We dropped in around 3pm on a Friday and there was no wait to be seated. I've also come with a bigger group and they do seem to seat parties pretty quickly. Parking is decent since it shares a bigger lot with the rest of the stores in the plaza. Service was nice and polite.   Definitely worth stopping by for a delicious and unique burger if you're in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy with my Miyagi burger :)
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salt, pepper and garlic fries
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Miyagi-sun burger. Try it!!!

SjkS1PIYqujKB-pyy4yxBg.text: I get it. I know, I'm a vegan going to a burger joint. But...if there's a meatless burger on the menu- it needs to be tasty. It wasn't. It was big enough, but not good enough. My friends ordered the Bachi burger, and the Kiki burger and they both liked it. But ...vegetarians beware.  The service was fine. The place was clean. And the music was too loud.

Ai6qn9QeIMmXMdTh5SWuZg.text: Food was good. The mix of flavors was ono too. We had a little taste of everything....dessert was pretty good too. The servers were also nice and helpful.

XFbtnKYrKjzSdRcKkYCdiA.text: Great burgers.  The quality of meat is amazing.  No sauce needed. Fries are extra but the burger is usually all I can handle.  They are pretty big.

d1BXjo9-rpCbjPBLsPniGg.text: Totally delish! Perfectly cooked, medium-rare "Kiki's Burger" -- which is angus beef, sauteed shiitake, enoki & eryngii mushrooms, caramelized bacon sweet onion marmalade, gruyere, and garlic-chili aioli. I would have given 5 stars if I were only rating the burger.  However, I also got french fries. They were just not worthy of Bachi Burger.  Absolutely unremarkable wimpy skinny limp french fries. The dipping sauces were wonderful tho. I will go back many times for the burgers.  Maybe Bachi Burger will improve their fries and make it a 100% 5-star experience!

vNhO-PnSzXTNeBgFAKpcNA.text: We still love it here. Food is bomb and the whole wait staff and manager are super awesome! Thank you!

xzm-Gvruh1J9Xo9nKoh1SQ.text: What can I say! Bachi Burger is the best.....  When I have out of town friends,  I always bring them to Bachi Burger for the Ox tail fried and the burgers. One time I had to pick up friends from the airport. The first thing the say to me I want to eat at the burgers place. No hello etc., That Burger place. Lol!  Food and service is the best. Also the donuts is amazing. No matter how full we are, there is always room for donuts. Just need to share.

Z_ZTokwehNAp6ZmEHltg3w.text: [No Bachi for coming here]  T-Shirt wearing tenders are all you need to understand what the scene is in here. It's burgers - and no need to explain the "Bachi" part - only that my thought is its in mixing the 2 cultures ingredients that someone may receive negative results - well by the attendance, and the amount of conversation in the air, it seems like its the reverse psychological side.  As a burger lover, you wont find cheddar, definitely not American, and hardley a sign there is a simple beef and cheese combo to be had (although you have the option of constructing your own), but you didnt come here for that anyway. I ordered the Black and Green - this is about the closest youll find to anything not too fusion-i. Their take on Wagyu Kobe Beef, naturally grass fed - open range assumed, but not Wagyu American or Japanese as stated on the front, grilled to your temp, Blue cheese crumbles, spinach, and bacon. There were some other things in there but it wasnt noticeable to note.  Burger is substantial, and to remind you this is Vegas casual, but still upscale, they give you a knife that will not only split your burger, but would probably cut through that ceramic dish they serve it on. I opted for the hands on approach, as I do. Burger is very well done (not the cooking temp, by the way of the flag atop my bun) smooth meat to cut, the quarter pound of weight measure, and was preformed, likely in a cylindrical press as I felt the tight packing, but the slightly flakey outter edge - not to be confused with a frozen pre form that is like eating a freshly sliced sausage.  All the other ingredients really melted into the background. What you actually find is that you can smell this beef, an aromatic experience I've found is reserved for the CAB versions - this is probably a hint you maybe in Kansas of experiences, where the beef is free, and the taste is pretty awesome.

uhZAr1yykGMeZncEtuDgLA.text: Love their fries, burgers and sodas. Looooove the chili cheese fries made with oxtail meat. Looooove bachi fish sandwich - it's to die for!!!! The sauce is Soooooo good with the sweet bread. Also love their peach soda. I also had the mango, kilo, miyagi and ronin burgers., loved them all. Truffle fries and salt & pepper fries are good too. Haven't ordered anything that disappointed me. Oh also, I also liked the pork belly steamed bun. Seriously, what r u waiting for, go to bachi now.  Tip: avoid going on a weekend, the wait is usually an hour

gwb0LL7xfWpIQJibt0tonA.text: Overall, the food had been good here. I don't eat beef, but have enjoyed the veggie burger and the crab cake burger. I've been here with my friends and my family. Generally, they also liked the food, but the portions for children are too much, and there are not many options. Not the best for young children, but older ones should be fine.  Service is still hit or miss and its biggest liability. The staff seem disorganized at times and I've had my food messed up more than once (I've been here more than I've checked in) lately. Sometimes, it seems like some of the servers have never worked in a restaurant before. Other times, the servers have seemed to over compensate becoming intrusive.   I also got the Yelp check in special of a free beer/beverage, but it had the "after 11pm" stipulation and the manager was not as nice to me in terms of getting me the free beverage. (I suggest that they either do away with that "special" or offer it at a time that people would actually use it...)  My first impression was awesome. My following experiences have since been not as positive, and some unpleasant almost to the point of not wanting to come back. So, just be aware that service is inconsistent and tends to be slow. Or, they "disappear" for a while after you've placed and received your order. Food is good; service needs to improve.

vQLR56EkqcT6cYZQXt2mUw.text: both my husband and I got sick. Yea I just can't even come back...like ever. I'm not sure which part of the meal got us like this but we were messed up.

KiT9dQRo2m9Fegl9Y6vwvw.text: A Japanese influenced burger joint? Great freaking idea and it really works! All the burger combos on the menu sounded great and we ended up ordering the veggie and Kiki's burger to spit and try something new. The veggie burger was really yummy but super crumbly and coulda used more sauce as the patty was a bit dry. Kiki's burger was excellent and it arrived and pre-smoosh was about 8 inches tall. With a side of the garlic fries, it was heaven. With a beer and garlic fries, it was nirvana. The service was also excellent and everyone was insanely nice. Highly recommend!

aX2LhC8TwHtTuEWO5fhveQ.text: Never wrote a review before but this place is so good I had to! The Oxtail chili cheese fries and a Kiki burger were the best! I've never been happier eating a restaurant burger. This place is a must if you're craving a burger in Vegas.

ARwRT4vY8gtxvdgmn_ReFw.text: Food was really good. I got the oxtail fries - they were delicious and had a different kick to it. We also ordered the Miyagi burger, which was yummy and the Lonely Bird burger which was scrumptious too!!! The burgers are huge , therefore you can share. And the fries were a big portion too. Prices are decent for what you get as well! So good I will be coming back for sure

b2Q3SXt-qTh6zPLDeBJkJQ.text: I would give this place 10 stars if I could. Come hungry because you will want to order everything..... and you should. Well you should definitely order an appetizer like their steamed buns or french fries. I really admire their sweet potato fries for some reason. Maybe because they come out hot with their own dipping sauce. Actually all of their fries are paired with their own dipping sauce. I've been here twice and I can't help myself from continuing to order the Kalbi burger. I love Korean food and this burger is the perfect combination a Korean themed burger needs. The Kalbi is also served with a small side of pickled cucumbers. MMMMMMMMMM. Watch out because this patty is juicy and it drips all over the place but it will not stop you from enjoying your meal and experience at Bachi. The bun does it's job by holding everything intact. Amazing burger.  They play some pretty banging music too, just wish they had a speaker in the bathroom.  Definitely a must stop if you are in Las Vegas. Hell, Bachi was a huge reason I decided to go back to Vegas last month.

Q8gK-qiJANkioAxgVaIHNA.text: Wasn't as good the second time around but I don't know if that was influenced by the horrible service.  Usually don't complain about service cuz I'm just there because the food tastes good however they were horrible top to bottom this time. Our waiter, the server, the bartender, the host, the cook... Ok probably not that far but all the others mentioned did seem to irk us in some manner that night, albeit slow service or simple lack of attentiveness. Felt bad that I blew this place up to all my friends. And btw the burger was just ok this time.

i0mIKbivrIFyZrQeL6tHkA.text: This is an excellent gourmet burger. It was recommended by a friend, and while I like burgers, I'm no connoisseur of burgers. I didn't expect this place to be amazing. I was very favorably whelmed, not overwhelmed, but it was a pleasant surprise. I'll go back. It's a great burger, for a reasonable price. Crowded...but you have to expect that the crowd is gonna go to the good food.

xZvZK44usJ94kN64-nJsaQ.text: My friend had been raving about this place and how we just had to try it. It's way off the strip, about 5 miles so make sure you're willing to drive or take a cab. I heard it was also on one of those food network shows so it's getting more popular by the minute. When we got there around 1pm on a Saturday afternoon, there were groups of people chilling in the parking lot. I was prepared to wait a little bit but it was kinda insane, since we ended waiting probably about an hour and a half. We had a larger party of 6. So maybe that's the reason. But this place is not very big. They also advertised another location but not sure where that one is located. I def recommend smaller groups visiting or coming right when it opens to avoid the tortuous wait. Anyways finally was seated and got to order. Food takes about 15-20 minutes to come out so I recommend getting fries to tide you over. Unfortunately I didn't get a say and someone said yeah, bring everything at one time (instead of staggered or when ready). So I continued to starve a little longer (given it was almost like 3pm now and I had not eaten since dinner/5pm the previous day). This was a bad idea as I proceeded to scarf down my food super fast when it came to the table and my stomach was not feeling all that great about halfway through my burger. At least that's what I choose to believe over something was wrong with the food (ie contaminated or worse). I tried the Kiki's burger with mushrooms, onions, bacon and cheese. It was pretty darn good. And this is really an eat your burger with a fork and knife kind of place. Yeah the burgers are huge. Not sure how I could fit that thing into my mouth. As for the sides, for our big group we tried the oxtail chili cheese fries and the truffle fries. I love oxtail but was a little disappointed with these fries because I couldn't really taste the oxtail in it. It really just tasted like regular chili cheese fries to me but with an egg on top that made it slightly better. Since it was split up between a bunch of it, I only got to have a little bit so I may have to give it another try next time I'm in town. The truffle fries were really good though and I liked the truffle sauce they have on top. Didn't care too much for the sauce on the side - it's not totally needed IMO. Overall a pretty pricey meal. Burgers start at $10 and go up including the $26 fois gras burger. And the chilli cheese fries were like $11 with the truffle fries at about $4. My share with the gratuity charge they tack on with large groups was $20. Good thing I can only come every once in a while when I'm in Vegas. So many good burger combinations to try.

IXEXC93kc2_hsi1JXYuR0w.text: I was a bit disappointed with Bachi Burger.  For a fancy burger place, I expected more out of the meat.  I got the black and green burger.  I love blue cheese and mushrooms.  But, something about this burger did not blow me away.  It was good, but I was not left with the desire to return to Bachi Burger for more.  I much prefer Umami.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Q_D-zIjiU-m6o3Bml7Uydw.text: I would visit Bachi Burger again for sure! Try the Oxtail fries if you want some yummy Chillie cheese fries.  Service was on point and the place was neat and clean.

vCmnPEsSjZeOHFt7z0RM4w.text: Came in with my friends and I. The restaurant is full but we didn't wait that long because they did have a ramen side. I had asked Erica the hostess  for a recommendation which burger she liked the most and she has referrers miyagi. I'm glad I listened to her because it was delicious. The meat was cooked the way I had asked and from the way it looked, my friends also enjoyed their food. We had cleaned our plate because everything was just delicious. Our service was great: actually everything about this restaurant is great except the qena bathroom was out of order. I would come back for sure.

2mVZdS2jyZV3opH74LfVhg.text: The food is consistently fantastic. Love the Miyagi burger and the salted Carmel shake is AMAZING. Only negative is that the service is kind of hit or miss.  However, they have great take out service so problem solved

MHKPGRrNmsRBhboSl_G0XA.text: Came in around 5:30 yesterday and it wasn't as busy like the last  time I came into this restaurant but it was steady. A very friendly young Asian lady had greeted us and had asked us to give her a few minutes to set up a table. From the way it looked there was only a couple servers and the hostess who had greeted us. Our waiter Kevin was amazing and explained everything on the menu. Our food came out in a perfect time and everything that we tried on the menu was amazing. My group and I had oxtail, miyagi, black&green, and the lamb burger.  This place is a must try. Every time I'm in Vegas, I always enjoy their food! Very friendly staff and amazing food.

RAYBwJnojUhRA3jA4-UQAA.text: Probably the best burger I've ever had in my entire life. Steam pork buns are excellent. Truffle fries are legit.

yjOFdv5TB5IMa0cK6PKmBw.text: After my friend had been super excited and raving about this place, I was disappointed that it's really not that great for vegetarians or vegans. The burger I got just didn't have a tasty flavor. Just kind of sour and sickly sweet. I actually got sick of eating it and stopped..which HARDLY EVER happens to me.

gPA_8OiH2ZU_T9bQ_NfnXg.text: Came here for lunch during my bachelor party.   Ooops, what happens in Vegas stays in Vegas.  Well, it was all over my social network since I saw at least a dozen pictures of the Shogun burger with my name tagged on it.  What is the Shogun burger?  Well, it's the biggest, baddest Japanese style burger you ever feasted your eyes upon.  Imagine a huge kobe beef patty with fois gras (duck) and unagi (eel) topped with some of that secret special sauce.  Let's say that's one of the most unique tasting burger I had in my life.  I never imagined unagi tastes so good next to beef.  Fois gras is default good for those sophisticated eaters.  You're probably wondering what else is on the menu.  Well, they had more earthly hamburgers compared to the heavenly Shogun burger, fries, duck entree, etc.  Just look at the website and you will know but I'll end the review that Shogun burger is the best!  Side note: A shogun is a military ruler (think dictator or general) of medieval Japan.  Essentially they had all the power over their territory.

O8F-uhKUsdK2lkfy01sE4Q.text: Although the food is awesome.. Customer service is horrible. We ordered take out so we don't have to wait. 5 minutes on hold to order, then you wait 20 minutes (time frame they give you) you get there and wait 25 more minutes for take out.. Unbelievable. Staff wasn't very engaging on trying to satisfy customers !

fJoXd2gAEdIJEnR4NWWjHw.text: Forget any burger joint you ever been to; transcendental is my experience..my bill was $120 with drinks for three people, gtfoh, i've spent more on a date with me and my wife. OXTAIL CHILIE FRIES will change your life. The burger came i had the wagyu with the fois; i'm 220lbs and i was stuffed i wanted to go home and eat the rest of my burger later; I ordered pork belly sliders also. Decadent was my word for the day. I think about it at least once a month cant wait to relive my experience. If anything i'll order less food but there are so many little edibles to order before you get your burger. Check the reviews on youtube they were rated against the best burger bars in LV and hands down won. Taste, price, atmosphere everything you love about sushi bars, in strip malls, in vegas; great price, a lot of high quality food but with Burgers!

dsRwb9OU139yWGc7aIK7uQ.text: We went back yesterday close to the brink of starvation ordered the Ronin burger, Kalbi burger and some truffle parm friezz.  Okay, maybe not to the brink of starvation, but boy were we hungry and gobbled everything down in probably 5 minutes flat!  My original fav was the Kalbi burger, but this time Ronin wins.  Who can turn down the fried egg in it and zippy horseradish based sauce on the side.  Delish!  And, as usual, the parm friezzzz were bomb diggity and service was sketchy.    Conclusion:  Still a happy camper over the food.

zuvb-rUCUKFqHRc-Xz7y-Q.text: I have been meaning to give this place a try since reading all the good reviews. I was not disappointed. The burgers were very fresh and inviting. I had the Ronin burger and my wife had the Kiki's burger. We also had the truffle parmesan fries which were quite good. My wife wasn't as impressed as I was. She didn't really like the taste of her burger, maybe she is too used to the American burger taste. But I absolutely loved my burger. It was moist and juicy and the bun was very good. The service was friendly and because it was our first time there, we even got a bowl of shrimp chips on the house. But we were too full to thoroughly enjoy it. They have quite a few other burgers that I am interested in trying. Next time.....

e4r1ngmoJCRgKORKGMWnMA.text: My favorite burger joint in town.  Cutting edge flavors and high quality ingredients.  My favorite is he kimchi burger....never thought a burger could be that good!

evc6P1qQ1bpR8TNQrLcuDg.text: The Burger, Ramen and Fries are worth to come back again and again. Basically food is great here.  However, the service is mediocre.  And when you happened to come across Alex or Aries, beware. This one is so inconsiderate and dishonest.  We signed in for a table snd he gave us 25 mins waiting time.  Since the waiting room is full, we asked him to give us a call instead.  He obliged and promised that he will.  We will just wait  inside our car.   Forty five minutes has passed there was no call and when we checked our status, we learned that he skipped us twice.  Its was not a matter of how many people will fit in available table. That was not the case as it was not his reason when I confronted him.  He even told us to wait for another 10 minutes.  The nerve.  Luckily, John the other server pacified us and gave us another table. And his service and attitude is commendable.   Alex or Aries or should I call him Brutus ( Popeye's enemy) came and apologized but I felt no sincerity in his action.   I bet he is used to saying and promising things he can not deliver.  He is so inconsiderate and dishonest.  He knows that people go there very hungry,  want to eat, be served right away and leave.   There are people who truly deserve  his job and will be an asset to the company.

tyn3yMFcq8QPdrYYPulUjw.text: What a unique take on burgers!! Asian fusion burgers!  When i came here I got the ronin burger and garlic chili edamame with sweet potatoe fries.  Everything was absolutely delicious. Definitely going to be coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The delicious ronin burger!

uzku7FGs9VriLKCDKbVb4w.text: The truffle Parmesean fries is my form of crack. I constantly crave them and I could eat 3 servings in one sitting. I've always created my own burgers so it's always been good. .. fun fusion menu. Hard to go wrong if you ask me

plKthMjr-JI5gM-ZaeHAUQ.text: Lots of different options, love that they also have the Ramen place connected as well

69zC-PCJHA4pC9ypmtu9NQ.text: We went to Bachi Burger before a show at UNLV, and were blown away by the incredible burger and fries selection.  Let's start with the basics.  Bachi is the brainchild of Lori Watada, formerly Roy Yamaguchi's sous chef.  Imagine the best burgers in the world, done in a variety of asianesque styles, with a full compliment of appetizers, Japanese style pickles, entrees for those who don't like beef, and amazing fries...  I got the Shogun, their most expensive burger, a rare and heodistic tribute to all that is fat and good in a burger of wagyu beef, plus pan seared fois gras, unagi (broiled eel for those of you who don't know, a stunningly delicious Japanese staple), poached pear and secret sauce.  The burger was cooked perfectly (medium rare equals rare, but that is how you want American wagyu), and eating it was a nearly religious experience.  My wife got the Keki, smothered in premium mushrooms and a delicious sauce.  The parmesan truffle oil fries were good....but not great, and the sweet potato fries were perfect.  I am going to have to go back and eat my way through the rest of the menu..... Our service was good, especially given how busy it was, and we noticed that they were turning people away 20 minutes after we got there at 6pm becasue the place was full and there was a waiting list.  They serve a limited array of wine, beers sake and drinks....in a casual setting that is just crowded enough to feel like you are part of something.  I have decided that in all Las Vegas this is my new go to burger spot.... The burgers cost $9 to $25 (the Shogun), and I cannot wait to go back!   They are opening a fine dining spot next door....that will be on my list too....

jbxkyxUMRniwwDi8L8pymw.text: Awesome place. It can get crowded but the food and beer is well worth it. They do have a second location that does not seem to be as popular.

TDdqwYJ8lif5o7T7ot2DFQ.text: My absolute fav burger place in the valley. All the burgers are great!! Love the fries as well!! I also love they are open late. My only thing is is wish burgers CAME with fries. The place can get a tad pricy but totally worth it in my opinion! :)

glbBbXKy513QuST3Fg42IA.text: Extremely good burgers and fries!!  The spicy miso burger is soooooo tasty! They also have some specialty beer that's hard to find at other restaurants.

ZZUgkgOVnt-b__YqLcjtPw.text: When we went there, there was no wait line... I think it was on Wed around 3pm? There were only 4 groups of people and the atmosphere was quite chill. I see some people complaining about the customer services, but I thought they were pretty pleasant. It did take quite some times before our food arrived, but they say good things happen to those who wait.   I ordered short rib seamed bun, and my bf ordered spicy miso. We were both happy with the food we've got; just, I thought my steamed bun tasted much better with miso sauce instead of yuzu horse radish aioli. We also ordered Truffle Parmesan Fries which was interesting and creative. It was our first time, and this place has a big menu, so I'm definitely coming back.

1U5UflkOo9xSWuQHs3L9iQ.text: So one of my friends invites a bunch of us to this new burger place that he discovered recently.  Says he and his girlfriend love the food here, and would love to go here as a group.  The burger place in question is none other than Bachi Burger, which appeared to take quite the beating when it came to service.  It had been a while since the place opened, so I figured any kinks in service would be ironed out by now.  Stopped by here tonight and I can safely say that there were no issues with the service.  Drinks were kept full, we were checked on regularly, servers brought extra silverware in case we all wanted to share a dessert etc.  No complaints there.    The reason this place is getting three stars from me is that they seem to pile toppings onto burgers without know when to quit!  I got myself a Ronin burger, and it seemed that the Japanese cole slaw and katsu sauce were both fighting over who gets to my tastebuds first.  Yes, there were carmelized onions, miso dressing, and an egg on the burger, yet all these flavors were overpowered by the cole slaw and katsu.  Even the beef was overpowered by them; they also didn't ask how I wanted my beef cooked.  It was done medium well, while I prefer medium to keep some pink and juicyness in the middle of the patty.  I also ordered a Vietnamese coffee; it wasn't as good as I've had at other restaurants.  The coffee is served and is still being strained when it is brought to your table.  It came out dark and had a strong aroma, which set my expectations high.  Sadly, the coffee wasn't that strong and ended up being overpowered by the milk.  All in all Bachi Burger is alright, and I'd probably stop by every once in a while if I lived nearby.  As is, with me living in the southwest, I doubt I'll be returning any time soon.

e2U9bexGYzqr0xaZ5ZPZpA.text: LOVE this place. Have been here twice, first time got the Ronin burger..thats the one with the fried egg on top and wow, it was pretty bomb. I had never had a burger w/ fried egg and I'm glad Bachi Burger was the first place i tried it, because they didn't do me wrong. It was a bit messy but not where the patty is sliding out of the bun kinda messy, which I hate.   Second time, got the Kabli burger (no bacon) and OMG..best burger ever! It was cooked perfectly, the bun was amazing, the cheese, everything was perfect. BOTH times have gotten the Parmesan truffle fries. Seriously people, do not pass these fries up. They are the best. I love that everything comes with a dipping sauce. I'm a huge fan of dipping!  The wait staff is awesome and very informative..this place is definitely a hit, I hope it sticks around for a long time!

94GfLjgNKqdMcxYIa0evZg.text: I dined at Bachi Burger earlier today for lunch. This was my first time eating here, my friend said we should  try this place out.   The restaurant itself is very contemporary, not your typical burger joint with stools near the kitchen or anything like that. It's Asian inspired with artwork, wooden floors and a clean yet simple set up.   I ordered the Bachi Caeser and BBQ Bachi Burger. They have a menu with American-Asian fused cuisine. Very Hip and Different!  Customer Service was okay. When we walked in there were several people who said Hi and right away set us up a table. Later on , there was only one waitress for the entire floor. I'm guessing everybody else went on break? It took a minute to get a refill or ask for the check.  My only concern was the Salt and Pepper French Fries. My friend ordered them and as we were eating them, we noticed a WORM slithering about the fries! To our disgust, we politely asked the waitress to look at it to prove we weren't insane. She took the fries away and sent the General Manager our way. He was very polite, apologized and offered us dessert. I think that was the best way to handle a situation like that.   Overall, my first experience there was okay. I'll definitely come back another day... but I'll make sure to check the fries for any visitors ;)

YHoXs3ZMsyYSlCNhBJCuoQ.text: Decided to try this place when the Oxtail-Chili-Cheese fries were recommended. I had the Kiki burger and the fries. Wish I had not waited so long to enjoy this place. The burger was well put together, the bun held up well to the Angus burger. The fries was the star of my meal. I would go back just for the fries alone. I took off a star due to the fact that you could hang sides of beef inside.

Hm29JRiZtKy6SZyl9T-Ccw.text: My favorite place to eat burgers. Now being vegetarian puts me in a bind at most places but bachi burger has an awesome grilled bachi fish burger!!! Add sweet potato fries and your in heaven. Wait I can't forget to talk about the BUNS.....to DIE FOR!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kiki burger
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie burger!

cil7dpUo7tUiUCqapBnKrg.text: Ba-Zing!! Thing place is amazing. Great food and service! I love the kalbi burger! Kalbi beef with kimchi mmm!!  The burgers are so big you almost need 3 hands to hold it.

0ZIwqVYyZCl0lnawR25Tlw.text: This is a must do everytime we visit Vegas and usually we are extremely satisfied with the food and service...except for today. Ordered my drink a few minutes before happy hour ended.  Waited a little while before it came to us, which was fine. Ordered salt and pepper garlic fries, the miyagi San burger, and some ramen. Burger came cooked to perfection. Absolutely delicious. Ramen came a little while after, perfect as well. We had to flag down our server because we were waiting for the fries and we needed a refill on our water. He forgot to put it in. So he got it in and waited about 15 mins for it. It was really bad. We usually order it and haven't had issues before but there was just so much ginger in it.  We tried to get at least halfway through but the ginger was so overpowering that we couldn't even get halfway!! So we get the bill and I wasn't charged the happy hour price for my drink. To our waiter's defense, he tried to fix it after I already paid, but I was so ready to leave. We usually have nothing but good things to say about this place and always refer friends and family here as a must have before they leave Vegas. Hopefully this is just an isolated incident because this is the first time we left disappointed.

NKTjyHrWHYDR02kHnHzgjw.text: Here right now and there are 10 plus tables available but me and about 20 other guests have been standing here waiting at the checkin desk to be seated. There is only 1 person in the whole joint that is making an effort to work and that is the chef, a blonde girl with thick glasses. The rest are just lasting around and also arguing with, fighting and bitching this blonde chef. She seems to be the only person filling the orders. They have about 5 other people in the kitchen with her that ain't doing jack shit, moving slow, just bitching and plain old lazy.  I've been here about 30 minutes and still waiting to be seated at an empty restaurant. They purposely are not seating us because the chef is overworked right now and can't handle the existing orders from people already seated. This place is a serious unorganized shithole and the only person working looks as if she is ready to quit.  The servers are running around like chickens with the head cut off.... in an empty restaurant. I've never seen anything like it. No leadership, no moral, no team work. Just terrible.   There is no quality of food that will bring them back from the one star that I will be leaving them.

7oALmd5bzz7ODBbxrZrrmQ.text: After seeing this place featured in Food Network's Triple D, it's been something I've always wanted to try in Vegas. There's never enough time when visiting Sin City but we made sure this time Bachi Burger was on our itinerary. Hopping on over here after a show off the strip, their closing time at 1am was perfectly convenient. OXTAIL CHILI FRIES ($11.50) is a must-order. Most poutine fries I've had other than in Montreal tend to get soggy from all the gravy, but not here. I also love that it's not thick-cut resulting to a most-welcomed crunch on each bite. With beans and shreds of oxtail meat in the chili sauce, topped with garlic aioli, plus cheese and jalapenos, each component delivered its purpose. Let's not forget the cilantro which is my favorite part as it added a clean and distinct finish to the flavor profile. This was the bomb.com! RONIN WAGYU BURGER ($16) normally comes with Angus beef patty but you can request for Wagyu meat for extra $$. I suggest you go this route because I tell you, it makes a huuuuuge difference. One bite and the unmistakable taste I got instantly was from the high grade beef. It had a nice smoky char-grilled flavor that was oozing with all its juicy splendor! WOW! The caramelized onions, Japanese cole slaw, miso goma dressing, fried egg, and katsu bbq all fused well together into this phenomenal finished product. I really love everything about this burger including the bun! Not sure if you need the yuzu citrus aioli on the side because it's already flavorful as it is. KIKIS BURGER ($12) is Angus beef patty with sauteed Japanese mushrooms, caramelized bacon, sweet onion marmalade, gruyere cheese, and garlic chili aioli. After having the wagyu beef patty with my Ronin burger, it was hard not to spot the difference between the two. The former was definitely more delicious however, let's not forget this burger had bacon and everyone knows anything with bacon is good. When in doubt, stick with the Ronin. CHILI FRIED CHICKEN ($7) was good but just not the flavor I was looking for. I was hoping it was more like a Korean chili chicken with a sweet glaze, instead, this was more tangy and on the citrusy side. Packed most of it home and ate it the next day. Surprisingly, it tasted better. Our server was on top of things and was very knowledgeable about the menu. I mean who doesn't like talking to people who knows what they're talking about? The rest of the staff was friendly and in a genuine way. Can't complain! So happy Bachi Burger has now opened its doors in LA. Soon OC, I hope!

Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kikis burger
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ronin Wagyu burger

iwoj6GWkvy8UHzYXbJh0zg.text: Came by on a Friday afternoon.  The wait was about 20 minutes.  I was famished by the time we were seated.  I swear I wanted to try everything on the menu.    When our server came by to ask us what we wanted to drink, we gave him our request.  Right before he left to get the drinks, I said, "We're ready to order."    I guess I may have sounded a bit harsh but only because I was starving.  My sister gave me that look after he left and said, "Sheesh!  Don't be so hANGRY."  Lol  Nevertheless, our server was a sweetheart.  We ended up ordering:  Tonkotso shio ramen: $10 Pork belly buns: $11 Kiki's burger: $12 Oxtail fries: ?  Pork belly buns and the oxtail fries came out first.  Pork belly buns were good but not great.  It could have used a tad bit more pork belly.  I felt the ratio to the pork and bun were a bit off.  The taste was great though.   Oxtail fries were awesome.  They lived up to the hype.  We had big chunks of oxtail and it was very tasty.  Fries were cooked to perfection.    Kiki's burger was delicious and very hearty.  We ordered medium rare and it came out perfect.  It paired well with the oxtail fries.  I would definitely order this again.  Only item I didn't care for was the ramen.  Perhaps I'm biased because I had just dined in at Ippudo in NYC a few weeks prior to my Vegas trip.  The ramen tasted a bit fishy.   All in all, my experience was great and I will be visiting very soon.

cp8SwMi0xM0RpvgC_7QWjg.text: If I'm going to splurge for a burger this is my place. Great food, accommodating staff, and nice craft beer.  A few more good experiences and I'll raise my rating.

9VNY5ScsfDYaZKIsl3n9AQ.text: It has been a couple years since I've been here. I have always loved the food and the atmosphere. UNFORTUNATELY, this time was not so pleasant. It all had to deal with the service. I walked in and waited 7 minutes before anyone even acknowledged me. The guy who eventually did, was not pleasant or polite. Finally sat down after another 7 minutes. They didn't have ramen. And they weren't even busy. Had a question about the menu, they don't allow substitutions on the burgers. (Which I can kind of understand). But by then, I'd had enough. DIDNT EVEN EAT. sad to say, but I don't see myself coming to my "once favorite burger spot" anymore.  There was however one nice woman... so it wasn't all terrible...?

G4PrcHU6p_Feq6j37yn1vQ.text: Went here when I wasn't pregnant and had great food. Then I went when I was pregnant and asked for a well cooked burger. 2 times they gave me meat with pink blood in it. Smh

PaQf-kg26RFTaKTIsmoruw.text: Food: The Oxtail fries were pretty good, not what I expected but very filling and tasty. I'm surprised the two of us finished it haha! The Kiki burger was also very tasty and they cooked it perfectly (med-rare). My boyfriend had the Miyagi burger with the fried onion rings, which we were told is their #1 seller. I thought it lacked some flavor but I really liked the crunchiness from the onions and the fried egg added a nice touch. Overall the burgers were ok...I guess we were expecting a little more?   Service was good too.  Understandably there was a lunch rush so we weren't checked on regularly, but our server was very nice!

PzmbEeRCjqdsv6cfguGYzw.text: What do I do when I first land in Vegas? I start looking at my Yelp bookmarks!  My cousin and I wanted to start things off with a great meal. To the days leading to our Vegas trip, he kept talking about Bachi Burger until my ears had a constant ringing! I finally gave into his pleas and agreed to go. After picking up our rental car we headed to Bachi Burger.  When we arrived, around lunch time, it was semi-busy. The hostess quoted us a seating time of ten minutes. It seemed the wait was shorter than that. We ended up getting a table within five minutes. Once we were seat, our menus were handed to us and was told our server will be right with us. Our waitress came to us within a couple minutes and took our drink orders. After being dry from the airport, I decided to get an alcoholic beverage. I went for the Sake Sanga-Ria.  The Sake Sanga-Ria was a light and refreshing drink. The combination of sake and sangria had an inviting taste, but then knocks you with a light buzz. Who am I to complain about that! The bits of apple in the drink were also laced with the concoction of alcoholic goodness.  For our appetizers we ordered the following, which include these ingredients:    - Pork Belly Steamed Buns: Duroc Pork Belly, Cilantro, Scallions, Radish, Boiled Egg, Chinese Black, Vinaigrette,  Hoisin, BBQ Sauce  - Oxtail Chili Cheese Fries With Garlic Aioli and Fried Egg  The pork belly was melt in your mouth good. The steamed bun was soft to bite. The veggies, boiled egg, and sauces made the steamed bun very enjoyable. Next, the oxtail chili cheese fries. I have never tasted anything like this! I'm only fond of the chili and cheese on fries, but the oxtail takes this appetizer to another level! The oxtail was tender, fries crispy, and the chili thick. Adding the fried egg on top of this dish my sound weird, but it just made it much better.  For my main course, I ordered the Miyagi-sans Grass-Fed Wagyu Burger. This burger was composed of chili mayo, fried egg, furikake, caramelized bacon, and crispy onion rings. When I received my burger, it was piled high with the listed ingredients. I had to split the burger in two to handle this burger. Biting into the burger brought memories of another favorite burger spot of mine in San Jose, CA. Konjoe Burger. The summation of this burger was juicy, tender, and crispy.  The nagging of my cousin about this place was well worth it! This was just our first stop, but I felt like we overdid ourselves. Oh boy!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sake Sanga-Ria

hjoJpfdsZRgWNxtMpY4zfQ.text: It's all delicious.  I wish I knew what they put in their ramen.  The broth was creamy and slightly spicy.  The porkbelly could be a cooked a little more, but the spicy miso ramen was great.  The shogun burger was also really good.  I left my seared pears on the side and nixed the unagi, and the burger was still rich and juicy.  I loved the foie gras and the oils from it enhanced the burger patty that much more.  The oxtail chili cheese fries were also a win.  I would like mine with a little more cheese to balance the sweetness of the chili, but overall, it was a great big dish of yum.  The boba pearls were a little on the chewy side for me, but the black milk boba was refreshing and didn't fill me up.  We showed up for lunch on a Monday and the place is packed.  A table for two would have only taken about 20 minutes, but we opted to sit at the bar.  Service wasn't super prompt, but we were never forgotten.  We wanted to try their fried chicken, but they had already sold out.  Next time Bachi Burger, next time.

WewZVCQe4jhlDp9wlOUVTw.text: Grabbed take out one day and I got the Waygu burger....it was a very good burger! I Also got the truffle fires....they were pretty good. I wish I had time to sit and eat but if the take out was good I'm sure dining in would be better!

W2EL4dYXGiEi4Qzois-XDw.text: Last time we came here the wait was so long we decided to get a Togo order. We waited an hour for our Togo order ! AN HOUR!  so this time, we decided to give them another shot. We called in to get a to go order for pick up. The person who answered the call transfered us to a server. When the server answered I was just making sure that the food would be ready by the quoted time, the server's response was "we can give you a quoted time but if it goes over that time, it's not our fault. So you can either come in and put it an order or take the chances by calling". (In such a rude tone) HORRIBLE. As good of a food you have, this location has bad service !   I'd rather get my food somewhere else or drive all the way to the one on Sahara and fort apache. I hope they make another location so I won't be stuck not getting a bachi burger since this is the one nearby my house. Never again will I come back here nor would I recommend this location to someone else

aduTrER6duLxaV1E6N38Fg.text: AMAZING FOOD! Heard about this place on Diners, Drive Ins and Dives and of course we had to come here. When we first arrived it was semi busy got a seat really fast. Although the food my boyfriend and I ordered took a while it was worth the wait! At first when we looked at the menu the ingredients for the burger were unique and not something you normally have. I got the Kiki's burger which I highly recommend (it was that good). My boyfriend got the Banh Mi burger that is full of flavor! To top it off I forgot to mention that as an appetizer we got the oxtail fries. The fries were gone within 5 seconds!! Highly recommend this place to anyone who come to Las Vegas!

gJPZnqX1hW-iKygQaT4iYw.text: 1. Server ordered wrong cheese for burger 2. Fly buzzing around us entire meal 3. Soup and burger did not arrive at the same time 3. Long wait for food. AKwHWymtuPxvkK3tZtfPLw.text: Two bites in and I was sick to my stomach.  Not only did I order my egg Over Hard which does NOT mean runny yolk (and that's exactly what I received), but the amount of grease was nauseating alone.

tOEPaBifakvB4AYEp80NgQ.text: This was our first stop as soon as we got to Sin City!  The wait on a Saturday afternoon was about forty minutes.  The first time I came to Bachi, there was no wait on a Saturday night.    Truffle Fries- loved the truffle!  Next time I'm gonna ask for crispier fries.  Large amount for the price. Shogun Burger- most expensive burger I'll probably ever have, $26.  It was worth it!  I got my burger medium and it was cooked perfectly.  I couldn't really tell the difference between the wagyu beef pattie vs. a regular pattie.  I love unagi and it was a good compliment to everything else in the burger!  The poached pear added a slight sweetness to all the savory flavors going on.  And foie gras... who doesn't love it?!   Spicy Miso Burger- I had this on my first visit and it's still my favorite.  I love the spicy sauce with the fried egg.   All the burgers are creative, delicious, and huuuge!  I always have half a burger left for the following day!

UlCbmXjaFCLnDFSNZVJBbA.text: I placed an order for takeout and instead of receiving the salt and pepper fries I ordered I received just fries. I had to drive back to work so it wasn't possible for me to comeback and correct the order. The manager on duty, Dylan, assured me that next time my fries order would be comped and that he would be working the same hours the next night. He takes my name and number down on a memo.  I place a takeout order the next night but am told that Dylan isn't in. A lady named Savannah tells me that there's no memo and that Dylan needs to be there to confirm what happened just last night. Not only is this frustrating and embarrassing for me, but this shows the lack of communication and organization amongst management. This was greatly upsetting not just because it made me look foolish but what was promised to me was not delivered.

5qLsqhy7VVwYh2HAxk66WQ.text: Best burger I've ate! So many flavors. Best place to eat that is away from the chaos of the strip. Must try burger place when visiting Las Vegas.

r1vu2yB9WeasszZZbBaqVw.text: I came here for the first time last week on my annual Vegas girls' weekend . The food was pretty good...burger was cooked just the way I like it, medium. 3 of the girls ordered the Ronnin Burger and 2 of the girls ordered the Kiki burger. So as you can tell, those two were probably the more popular ones. I had ordered the Ronnin burger as well, and it was really good. The burger had a fried egg in it...but what made it even better was the citrus aioli. They give that to you on the side, but seriously, that was one of the reasons why I liked this burger. The kiki burger had mushrooms in it and that was great too. But if I had to choose, I like the Ronnin burger more.   They have Strawberry Guava Shake, but I wasn't brave enough to order that...too heavy for me I suppose. I still had to drive 4 hours home. However, I was able to order the Momo..peach and strawberry soda! that was so refreshing and yummy. Too bad it wasn't free refills, otherwise they would have heard from me for more. The fries were okay. We had the parmesan cheese one and the salt and pepper one. Everyone liked the salt and pepper one more. There was this gravy looking sauce on the parmesan fries...not so good. The sauces that came with it were not memorable, I didn't even dip them. The salt 'n' pepper fries reminded me of the asian dish salt 'n' pepper shrimp. No shrimp flavor but that salt 'n' pepper is definitely there!    I wanted to try the spicy miso burger because I heard it was only there seasonal. But maybe next time. I will get that milkshake next time!

UnvxfhsYEDiUCl_WgyOTBQ.text: This place sucks. Overhyped and filthy. Flies are everywhere and tables were dirty and sticky.   The miyagi-san burger was completely burnt and black.... tasted like kalbi, too. This clearly means that the grill has not been cleaned and my burger was cooked with someone's kalbi burger.   Coke was not carbonated and completely flat.  Service was horrible, but the people working there were friendly.  However, I never received an apology of why their patty was completely burnt, not cooked "medium", and tasted like kalbi when I didn't order a kalbi burger.  For two burgers, oxtail fries, a flat soda, and a bottle of beer, we paid over $50.  Definitely not worth your trip out.    If I had to pick a gourmet burger to eat at in vegas, it would be at Gordon Ramsay's BURGR Bar in PH.

9FE1dxIgzXi5YF06zlmt_Q.text: It was alright but expensive (maybe??) . We tried the Ronin and the Shogun one. For me theRonin tasted better. Service was kind slow even the place was not busy and we had to wait 30m.

gT-0B1H6cYq2QWq5UZ_JOg.text: One of the BEST burger joints I've been to! Shoutout to Guy Fieri and Triple D for the recommendation! Service was really good and our waiter was really helpful. I already knew what to order coming to this restaurant after seeing their episode on the Food Network, but our waiter told us his recommendations. Ordered the bahn mi burger, truffle fries, and red velvet milkshake.   It didn't take that long for the food to come out and once it did everything looked absolutely delicious. The presentation of each dish was on point and very creative. The burger was super good! It had the whole bahn mi aspect to it with the flavors/ingredients and the burger was really juicy.  The truffle fries were piping hot, crispy, and the truffle sauce took the fries to another level. Lastly, the red velvet milkshake was the BOMB and it was literally a red velvet cake in a milkshake form.  I highly recommend this place whenever you're in Vegas and a heads up, they have two locations out there. They're opening one in the West Los Angeles area and I certainly can't wait for that!

76u3p-96q0tLc7efwyZaKw.text: Excellent flavors and fusions however pricey for a burger place. Highly recommend any of their burgers; even their basic burgers - fish and chicken sandwiches. You can't go wrong. They now have three locations and I'm sure all of them of good no matter what! No ka oi locals boys from Oahu !

S9usj5VXy8mMv0kxRyMkTw.text: Placed a togo order on the phone at 4:34p... Got there at 4:51p and was told 5-10 mins... Still waiting at 5:20p and being told it's going to be another 5-10 mins... Finally leaving at 5:28p... That's over an hour for a togo order... Just seems a bit ridiculous for an established restaurant.

MInygVC5u3KYos2y85VeaA.text: First heard about this place on Triple DDD and added Bachi Burger to my personal list of places to visit when we're in town.  Last year we visited the other location and it was wonderful.  We just visited this location and again it was wonderful.  We purposely went in the late afternoon on Thursday knowing how busy it can get and there were three parties ahead of us waiting.  Luckily there were spaces available at the bar so we chose to eat at the bar vs waiting for a table.  My husband and I shared the oxtail chili cheese fries, green and black burger and the pork belly bao.  Everything cooked to perfection and so delish...will definitely be coming back each time when we're in town.

v3It5A2OXrFSbhaspJF1hA.text: Heard lots of good raves about this place, so we just had to try it before heading back to SD. We saw a line out the door when we were looking for a parking, so we had our doubts that we might have to eat somewhere else.  Upon checking in to be seated, we got a "not" so warm & friendly greeting from the hostess. I would describe her as one of those people who are not happy with their job...quick tip Erika, look for another profession, or at least force yourself to smile! All the other staff was smiling and just gave a great vibe, most especially Dan!..the guy behind the bar, thanks again for giving us super awesome service! While I ate, I just saw how nice of a person he is to the other customers! As for the food, it was really good! Juicy burgers and my husband just killed the plate of oxtail chili fries! The reviews from our friends were definitely spot on!

djUq123rdpRK-jlOc68WKw.text: The food was good but the service totally sucked.  I'd rather have Holsteins at the Cosmopolitan, but that's just my preference.  Oh well, you can't win'em all!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PhvXU34B-iGgq0ClIo8ywQ.text: Based on several recommendations by my friends in the local area, I had to try Bachi Burger. It appears they have two locations around the Las Vegas area although they are opening one up in West LA in 2013 which is good for me. This burger joint is somewhat distant from the strip, however, well worth the stop. I'd recommend coming during off peak hours. When we were leaving, there was a big line for dinner to this place, a indicator that there is good food inside. The service was really good. The waiters were trained to introduce themselves and to answer any questions that we had about the menu.  As an appetizer, I had a piece of my friend's Pork Belly Steamed Buns It contained Duroc Pork Belly, cilantro, scallions, radish, boiled egg, Chinese black vinaigrette, and hoisin sauce. I typically don't like eating steamed buns, but when I took a bite into this, it was SO GOOD! It made me rethink my stance on steamed buns.  Also, I requested the fries to come as an appetizer. I ordered their truffle parmesan fries which contains parmesan reggiano, black truffle shavings, chives, and comes with a side of sun dried tomato aioli dipping sauce. I was disappointed at their truffle fries. I was hoping that they would have utilized truffle oil to cook the fries. Instead, it tasted your typical french fry you would have at any fast food place. If I had to do it over again, I would skip the fries as their selection of burgers and appetizers are so much more appealing.  Finally, for the main course, I had the Spicy Miso Burger which contains a massive patty of Angus beef, onions, shishito peppers, mayo, lettuce, roasted garlic, cheese, fried egg, and apple vinaigrette sauce. When a took a bite out of this sandwich, I was wondering what happened to the shishito peppers? I didn't really taste the peppers at all. I was completely overwhelmed by the apple vinaigrette sauce. The sandwich was decent, but the combination of ingredients is suspect. Perhaps there is too much going on in the sandwich where it loses its identity as a spicy miso burger.   If I am ever around this part of Las Vegas again, I would definitely stop by to try some of their other burgers such as their Kalbi burger.

qk1OoNlqWTk5zMT4XcmRSA.text: I guess since I'm the Duke of Bachi Burger (as of 9/11/2014) I should relinquish my duties as Duke, whatever those might be, to finally write a review of this place.   It took 60+ visits for me to come on here and officially proclaim: Bachi Burger is the best burger joint in town.  I read all of the 3 star and below reviews and I feel sad for those reviewers.  Not because they don't have good taste, but because they clearly haven't experienced the Bachi that I've come to know and love over the years since it opened.  I will say that even though I am blessing it with 5 stars, I've definitely had moments where I questioned that rating, be it from visits where I experienced awful service, undercooked burgers, or the terrible, terrible practice of their writing down my credit card info every time I make a take-out order.  All of those are forgiven though for me due to the 85% of the time when everything is flawless.  I've had almost everything on the menu.  My absolute favorite order is the Black and Green burger.  When they nail it, they absolutely nail it.   The Wagyu beef, bacon, blue cheese, spinach and mushrooms all form together like Voltron to make one of the best burgers I've ever had.  But there are 70 other reviews where you can read about that.   I also really like the Lonely Bird when I'm not feeling like red meat, which isn't too often.   Miyagi San, Banh-Mi, Ronin, all solid as well and belong in my rotation.     One thing I rarely see mentioned or see people take advantage of is the build your own burger feature.  I've actually had several times just a straight up Bachi Burger with a Wagyu patty which comes standard with Lettuce, Tomato and Onion and anything else you want, but it doesn't even need anything else.  It's nice to know that they're not just putting lipstick on a pig, or in this case, a cow, and that the meat can stand on its own.    I hinted earlier at undercooked burgers and I will say that in my experience Bachi tends to cook on the lower end of the spectrum.   Medium-Rare which is how I would normally like it has come out too rare for me and Medium often comes out the way I'd normally expect Medium-Rare.   So I stick with medium for the most part.   For fries they do a decent sweet potato fry, and oddly enough I just don't get the hype over the oxtail chili cheese fries even though I've had them 5-6 times, once done over sweet potato fries which I think is a special order type thing.   Fries, oxtail meat, and egg sounds like my death row last meal, but each time I found them underwhelming and prefer to just go the Salt and Pepper Garlic french fry route.   The fries aren't at all what keeps me coming back here and I'd like to see them experiment more with different varieties, but it seems to be the same ones from the first day I went there and I'm guessing that won't change anytime soon.  Drink-wise they do a mean sake sangria which I find irresistible, although pricey and they have Rogue Hazelnut ale, so I'm normally happy either way.     Service can be inconsistent, usually due to how it's ALWAYS BUSY, but there are several very solid individuals who work there at the moment and they treat the Duke with respect, as they should.

Ad0XdiPj2m_RWp1M1B2GCg.text: I was so beyond excited to try this place for the first time. When we got there we were served water but after 25 minutes no one had come to get our drink order let alone greet us. And when we asked for a waiter an employee seemed annoyed with us. The service was just all around horrible

geO2rX4TvxFFoD76rJPFgw.text: For some reason, I bookmarked this place without actually reading about it.  I actually thought it was a fast food-ish restaurant.  HAH.  Wrong.  It's a pretty nice sit down restaurant!  Ordered:  Husband tried the Miyagi-sans Grass Fed Wagyu Burger with Chili Mayo, Fried Egg, Furikake, Caramelized Bacon, and Crispy Onion Rings.  The $13 is quite attractive and definitely the way to go if you want the wagyu beef.  A regular wagyu burger starts at $16.  Husband LOVED it!  I ordered the plain BBQ Bachi Burger Angus Beef with Cheddar Cheese.  Thrilling, I know.  I'm such a risk taker.  It was very good and however they cook these burgers is incredible.  It had a slight crispness on the outside, but still juicy on the inside (even ordered well done!).  The bun was perfectly soft, but not too much so that it dissolved around the burger.  Sweet potato fries were really good.  Perfectly cooked, not underdone or overdone.  I was really bummed they don't have ranch.  I mean, what else do you dip your sweet potato fries in?!  I didn't like the accompanying Yuzu Citrus Aioli, so I asked to try the Garlic Chili Aioli, which they charged us 50 cents for.  I hate being nickel and dimed for things like that, especially when I ended up not liking it.  Oh well.  Overall, I'd say my rating would probably be a 3 and the husband would give it 4-5, so I'll round up because I think not liking their creative sauces is a personal problem.  Definitely not a bad place to stop on your way into Vegas, or if you want to get off-strip for a bit while you're in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hRdznVNleF_r5Xi5-Zh-KQ.text: This had become a tradition for my group that I go to Vegas with! We drink, gamble, and when were down to our last $20-30 then we go here! When you come here you forget all the money you've lost and end the trip on a happy note! I personally love onions and egg on my burger and so I recommend getting the Miyagi Burger! It goes for about $13.50. Then add some fries and a coke and the total should come out to around 20 usually. The first time I had the oxtail chili cheese fries and found a hair in it, but they were so nice they gave us a whole new chilli cheese fries and all the drinks were free (about a group of 10-12 of us). The meat they use and bread is just different. It is like the first meal they give you once you get to Heaven. lol I might be over exaggerating, but its definitely my favorite burger (better than Umami, DogHaus, In-n-out, etc).  Recommendations Dont come into the place thinking of all the hype you hear and just judge it for being such great quality. A bit pricey, but not some where you go to eat everyday either. Be ready to spend at least 20 if you want a meal.

e2h7c1Q_c3Qu9navJOa0Rw.text: Warning, DO NOT get the boba tea. They make it with some nasty powdered creamer (per the waitress) and it results in a gross thick consistency. I got the papaya and it had no taste. They could have at least opened a Goya can and poured some papaya juice in.  I am fuming that I paid 4.5 dollars for that slop.  That being said, the burgers and sweet potato fries are really good and worth a return for. I got the bachi burger and it was well-seasoned and juicy.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Powdery tasting boba drink.

Aodqta05uvsQZ7oaj_FAug.text: OMG!!! When is the LA/Sawtelle location going to open!?!?!?!?! I can't just conveniently drive to Las Vegas whenever I'm craving The Miyagi every week.  You guys are my top 3 for burgers.   For Asian foodies or foodies that like Asian food and/or burgers, then Bachi is a must try!! The hype doesn't die down here. Everything is good, every burger is a different flavor profile, and you can even create your own burger!  The Miyagi is my favorite. I love fried egg anything, furikake has amazing sweet & salty flavors, and the crunchy texture from the onion rings makes it a winner every single time! Plus the wagyu beef patty. ooooooooooomahgaaaaaaaawd!!!! drooling & FEIGNING FOR IT RIGHT NOW! Paired with truffle fries, or ox tail fries, or plain fries...perfectly crispy every time. I'm hungry.

WU5O0-5VvmKiBTdb0D2IBg.text: If you want a perfect burger go to BACHI BURGER! The meat, the bun, the fries, the sauces OH EM GEE! Make sure to order the oxtail fries! They are a party on a plate! Service is great and food is phenomenal! My favorite is the spicy miso burger add avocado! So bomb!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail Fries $12

zFnyuHkj81S5eGsAAJZVEg.text: Just an update.  Waiting to be seated now and frustrated at the poor service already. Called at 6:33 and said we were on our way in. Was told they'd put our name on the list but when we got there it wasn't and it's now 7:00 and we're not seated.  Had to show my phone to the receptionist to prove I called then she double checked because maybe I called the wrong place? (Like some other restaurant has my name on the list)?) they could open a new section for us but refuse? All to say... Starting on the wrong foot AGAIN.  Hope server improves our experience.  --    Update.   Seated with good waiter. Live has been rebalanced.

5uR9w2Xy1PXDVQpIVjwu_g.text: Burgers refined & redefined!   Amazing selection of gourmet burgers, which makes it hard to decide, but no matter the choice is sure to please. Our group of 4 (3 adults and 1 child) ordered the Bahn Mi, Miyagi-san, Spicy Miso and a children's cheeseburger. All three gourmet burgers were standouts and the children's burger was a hit too.  The Bahn Mi was our favorite. The depth and range of flavors are indescribably delectable deliciousness.  Only critique, the Parmesan truffle fries are quite unappetizing to look at. Taste is, okay. The appearance of runny brown sauce on top was unexpected. If it were described as a gravy sauce on the menu it would have been less of a shock. Not what we imagined Parmesan cheese fries to look like. A positive, the dipping sauce that accompanies the fries is 100% tasty. Scrape off the brown slime and dip away.  The servers are on their mark. Great knowledge of the products, good descriptions and attentive. Waiter forgot my iced coffee, but was easily forgiven since after the very satisfying meal it was time for a bit of eat and sleep.  Aloha!

Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Miyagi san - oh... The perfectly fried egg letting loose its yolky goodness with each bite made this a close second.
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Miso, more heat would make it more of a treat.

dSXvO15pqlmD497jHfjwyA.text: My mom loves to come here! She raves about it on a daily bases and whenever we want to go eat somewhere she always wants to come to Bachi Burger. The service is great and the burgers and fries are to die for!

EHDMYJpzXl0eNvZPCANG9g.text: This was our second visit to Bachi Burger. My burger was awesome and the fries....OMG, the best ever. How do you go wrong with truffle Parmesan fries, light and crispy. But sadly, the service was lacking. Our waiter forgot about us numerous times. And it was not because they were busy as we went earlier than usual and were one of three tables seated. But because of the waiter delays, by the time we left the place was packed. Dinner service was extremely slow and folks sat well after us had come and gone.

Ha2JvNxci-z8h3jbu41AXQ.text: Yum, yum=spicy angus burger, iced coffee, salt and pepper fries, truffle garlic fries and chili cheese oxtail fries (we like fries)  Service=good, everyone was really nice, waitress was very intuitive Presentation=great  We will be back to try more burgers!

Dv6La2Rk1AHXhMNd7-O6Rw.text: Do your mouth a favor and order the calamari with extra green sauce. If you've ever had crying tiger at a thai restaurant you will recognize some of the same flavors in this dish. This restaurant uses fish sauce in a lot of their dishes which is why they are able to accomplish the umami flavors in their sauces and marinades. This is a gem and not known by most tourists. So thankful someone showed us this place. Will definitely be back. Oh and yes, their burgers are bomb too - ask for a side of Miyagi Mayo for the burger. It's an extra 50 cents but oh so worth it!

0MVEnAsy0jE6dr3Vps26kQ.text: Came here after my flight landed. Late lunch. Got sated right away and the server was very thoughtful and sat us so the sun wasn't in our eyes. Great service. Very attentive. We started with the Oxtail chili fries. It was so good. We tore it up! I had the "banh mi" burger. Very delicious. I usually don't eat all my burger but I did eat almost all of it. The sauce that came with it gave it another whole level of goodness. The sweet potatoes fries tastes so fresh!   Tried the truffle fries. Those were yummy. Prices are decent

GuWQl0HaMLgLQLA0HNG7-Q.text: Third time's a charm? Eh. I've eaten Bachi Burger twice, both were to go orders and it does tend to lose a bit of quality on the drive home. The first time, it was evident that the quality of meat was way better than what most of us are used to. Today, it didn't seem that way. The service was good, no issue there, we got there when they opened which seems to be my thing. I like to avoid the crowd. We ordered the Kiki and Black and Green Burger, we ordered them medium rare. Like most reviews, it was basically well done, a bit dry. It didn't taste bad but there is a difference in taste. And my burger, Black and Green, said it had blue cheese and I don't think it did, it's not a subtle flavor. The app was good, spinach and artichoke dip, we ran out of chips so we used our fries.   Overall, it wasn't bad, it was ok. The flavors are good and it won't hurt you to check this place out. I'd go again to try the Shogun burger.

sbhGUySdNAAqNHkPlgiDIQ.text: Porkbelly Buns: 10/10 [get this] Salt & Pepper Garlic Fries: 10/10 [get this] Kiki's Burger: 8/10 Bone Marrow OxTail Jam: 6/10   The food was awesome except the Bone Marrow Jam, I felt like it was too sweet. 2 people in our party ordered kale salads which came drenched in way too much dressing, missing avocado, pecans and cranberries. The salads were also not properly portioned with one having 1.5x more greens than the other. It was noticeably more. The waitress explained they have a new hire and it was his first time making salad. They just gave the missing ingredients on separate plates so the people who got salads could mix it in themselves. I have no clue how you can completely fuck up a salad. Makes me wonder... Is he smart enough to know he needs to wash his hands before salad prep? Is he high? Was there training? Can he see that there was way too much dressing? Is he blind? If he knew he put too much dressing, why not start over? Does he care? I mean whats going on?????

nFeUiBXY1EvvkrL5b_fanw.text: Great burgers and friendly staff. I'm definitely a fan!  Miyagi-San's burger (wagyu beef, chili mayo, fried egg, furikake, caramelized bacon, and crispy onion rings) - I asked for it to be cooked medium rare, just as how I like my steaks cooked, but I think I'd like it medium next time. Burger was very juicy and tasty, the fried egg was cooked perfectly with the velvety yolk oozing when I cut the burger in half.   Truffle Parmesan Fries (parmesan reggiano, black truffle porcini cream, sun dried tomato aioli) - I wish these were fried a bit longer, they were too soggy for me. Because of that, the cream made it taste more soggy.  They also have a ramen joint connected next door. Will be back to try their ramen!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Miyagi-San&#39;s burger
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Parmesan and truffle fries

fx4IH2wVCEvpPRJ3BKk5iQ.text: If I am asked what I'm in the mood for, I can't say a burger is ever in my top 10 answers. I just can't say I'm fanatical about burgers or adore the ritual of eating one per se... but when the words, "BACHI BURGER?" come up during the erratic game of where-should-we-eat, I'll never say no! This place just dresses up the American classic with unconventional ingredients with the Asian fusion twist -- like ox-tail meat chili, pickled vegetables, or a runny sunny-side-up egg. Everything is just so full of creative flavor that always leaves you satisfied!  FOR HER: - The seasonal MANGA BURGER (grilled wagyu burger topped with crab & scallop dynamite, sunny side up egg, enoki mushrooms & kaiware sprouts). I also order an iced matcha green tea, which comes with unlimited refills (costs 4$).  FOR HIM:  - The specialty bbq burger, KIKI'S BURGER (angus beef, sauteed enoki/shitake/eryngli mushrooms, caramelized bacon, sweet onion marmelade, gruyere cheese, garlic chili aioli). We also both got an order of the TRUFFLE PARMESAN FRIES (fries topped with parmesan reggiano, black truffle porcini cream, with a side of sun dried tomato aioli).  They have happy hour Monday thru Friday from 3pm-6pm, which includes 4$ draft beers, 5$ milkshakes (non-alcoholic), 6$ sangria, & 7$ wine/cocktails/alcohoilc milkshakes.   They also offer ramen now as well, which I believe is connected to the restaurant just next door!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Manga burger x Kiki&#39;s burger
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Parmesan truffle fries.

2NVVYuT8FNnTXnjf2aT7nA.text: Ox chili cheese fries are a must every visit!!! Very busy and the wait is sometimes long, but it's definitely worth it!

gk0V996x6AKwOLEJjjVPNg.text: One of our favorite joints in Vegas...and we only ever eat a few things on the menu because we like them so much.  We always start with the oxtail poutine...because I love poutine.  The gravy/braised oxtail is rich and decadent.  The fries are crispy and well-seasoned...and the fried egg just makes it unctuous...the cilantro helps freshen it up a bit.  The banh mi burger is my husband's favorite non-traditional burger of all time because it does remind him of a banh mi sandwich...flavors balanced well, well-cooked burger patty...really good pickled vegetables and lots of fresh cilantro.  I used to love their pork belly baos, until I tried Momofuko in NYC...but they are still pretty tasty. Service is pretty good here.  They try to push the food out in an efficient manner and the service team does take care of you.   With all the notoriety from Diners, Drive-ins & Dives, this place has gotten much busier over the years.  Waits can be tedious during peak dining times.  We usually roll on in on our way in and out of Vegas because my husband enjoys it so much.  Thank goodness it's been during off-peak hours because our waits have never been terribly long...30 mins at the most.

l-lJZ4uOjCBNb9_gpPPG6w.text: I'm not really a burger fan but my friend hyped this place up.   I ordered their oxtail fries and it was good! I ordered truffle fries and it was just okay. Nothing special.   I ordered the kalbi burger and I like how it came with Kim chi vegetables on the side. The burger itself was huge.   The service was great. Friendly and was there to always refill our water.   It was pretty empty when I came around 2pm.  Overall a nice experience.

Here I found the fries here were not up to par for me. Too much of the chili taste and not enough oxtail coming through. The burgers however were awesome fusion goodness.

Service was good.  Place was clean

N6af1GGWriauMRkiMbCKOQ.text: Definitely recommended! It is a family friendly place with a twist. This place is not only trendy, but also very tasty.  The portions are a bit large. I had the black garlic ramen. It was not my favorite, but I took a bite of the Black and Green burger. I enjoyed the burger more.   We also ended up ordering the fried calamari, oxtail fries, and the truffle fries. These are an absolute must. They compliment the burger very well.  Overall, this place is a great place to visit if you are in town. It is definitely a place to try!

Y_ZH0tON5m8jHFGjOqkuRA.text: The Miyagi burger is was delicious! The wagyu beef was perfeclry seasoned! But what really pop ut this burger iver the top was the fried egg! The yolk kicks up the flavor the the meat! I can see the reason why is most popular!

eyQibEJXkvybUq8jeX4DRg.text: My wife and I finally made it here on our most recent trip to Vegas. I had seen it on DDD and it looked amazing.   We arrived at about230pm on a Friday. It was packed. We had to wait 10 minutes. We had Pork belly steamed buns  Oxtail chili cheese fries were amazing!  And because it is a new thing we tried their Tonkotsu Shio ramen which was amazing also!  We see told there are 2 kitchens: one for ramen and one for the burger for one restaurant. Whatever the food was amazing!  This place is much better than most of the DDD places weave tried. We can't wait to come back on our next trip to Vegas.   Service was 5/5.
