qDFYKmHBnOxxOVDn4PH91g.text: Overall, this place was decent. The staff was very nice and attentive and even apologetic when the food didn't come out very fast.  I wish I were able to have stayed longer to enjoy it more, however I was on a very short lunch break and had to rush.  The Bison burger I had was definitely good; however I don't believe it was worth $26 for a burger, fries, a drink, tax and tip, for lunch for 1.  It seemed like an upscale, trendy kind of place that I didn't feel like it was worth the experience.

imiqrB69J50d4m4ifoO-gQ.text: I ordered the oxtails chili fries based on the multiple rave reviews. Was disappointed in the plate I got! Major flavors were salt and cumin seasoning in the chili gravy. There was not a shred of oxtails that I could see or taste! Could only taste the over powering cumin as if the cook thought he was using black pepper and grabbed the wrong seasoning! Reminded me of canned chili in texture except canned would taste better. Disappointing because I love both home cooked chili and oxtails! The only positive was the egg on top. That was perfectly cooked.   I also ordered a Ronin burger. Great charred taste to go with the sweet onions and coleslaw on it! The burger buns were fresh as tasted good! Glad for the redemption of the Ronin burger because the $50 round trip taxi fare (Saturday, 3pm, light traffic) from the MGM would hurt if I didn't get at least one good plate of food for all I spent!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from the bartender-less bar. The only free seats on a Saturday afternoon
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Only the egg was done right. The cumin flavor and extra salt overpowered the dish. No oxtail flavor.
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Disappointing Oxtails Chili Fries. Flavored with lots of cumin and salt. Missing oxtail flavor.

UT3afBu1v_n_t_bzqVkEJw.text: Finally got around to trying this place with a friend of mine, and I thought the food was pretty good.  I ordered Kiki's burger, and it was just delicious.  My friend ordered the fish sandwich, and I will probably get that next time.  The fish was seasoned so well, and the taste was great.  We also shared an order of sweet potato fries . ..  the sauce tasted like it was horseradish based, which I normally don't like, but it was a nice compliment to the sweetness of the sweet potato fries.  Definitely will be coming back here again.  Just expect to pay gourmet burger prices.

_SjMfOwC2vkAj2phNtpbkg.text: Bachi Burger! Remember that because it's the only place you will ever need to know and go after trying one of their incredibly juicy and delicious burgers.  Here are some tips before you head out there for the first time, assuming you're staying on the strip. Be sure to grab a few (preferably three) of your hungry and adventurous food buddies with you. Then holler a cab and don't forget to get a contact number from the cab driver/company so you can call for a cab when you're done. Bachi Burger is located about twenty minutes away from the strip and there's hardly any cab around that neighborhood. If you don't want to be stranded in the middle of nowhere for hours, remember to get that number. Also, it will run you about $60 cab-fare with tips for round trip. It's not that bad when you split that among four people. Another plus side of having few more people venturing out with you is that you'll get to try few more items on the menu. Yes, it may sound like a lot of hassle and expensive just to try a burger, but that BURGER is worth it!  As for recommendation from the menu, I'd skip Ronin and Kiki Burger and go straight to the juicy and flavorful Miyaki-san's Grass-Fed Wagyu Burger. It's a perfect combination of caramelized bacon, crispy onion rings, fried eggs with chili mayo in the burger. So pull up those sleeves, loosen that belt and get ready for a chow down!

G9i3SvJcJKQBmSRMgZbJ_g.text: What can I say about these burgers that hasn't already been said??? Yummo!!! Ono!!! Awesome!!! Grindz!!! Broke da mouth!!!! All of these apply. Everything that we ordered was mouth-watering and finger-licking good.   The oxtail-chili-cheese-fries were delicious, I could actually taste the oxtail! There were big chunks of meat, not just shredded.  Parmesan-truffle fries are an absolute must!!!! The burgers were cooked to order, and weren't overcooked at all. My plantation iced tea was very refreshing and a perfect compliment to the meal.  You should definitely try this place!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My lunch with friends...we split our burgers into quarters so we could all try each one.

Fw4ShbYUavdzM8-uOZrlFA.text: Came here for lunch to give it a try.. the atmosphere was pretty cool. It's a small place but looks like they keep it fast pace. I was surprised they sell ramen too. I had one of their burgers and their meat was fresh and cooked to the way I liked it. I tried their fries and they were good too. I love thin fries. Only reason why I didn't give 5 stars is because $15 for just only a burger is pretty expensive.

7ywH-VHWssvaAU6GGBgqgg.text: 3.5 stars  We came for dinner on a Monday night and waited about 20 minutes. It took awhile for the server to come by and take our order. The restaurant was definitely understaffed. We ordered the oxtail chili cheese fries, peking duck buns, and the miyagi burger. The oxtail chili cheese fries are overhyped; it looks better than it tastes. The peking duck buns were a bit bland, but the miyagi burger was AMAZING. Every bite was juicy and flavorful. The crispy onions in the burger also added a great crunch.  So definitely come here for the burgers.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. miyagi burger. oxtail chili cheese fries.  peking duck buns.

D8VbqhLP4EOjv9cCCiKD-A.text: I ordered the Waygu burger ($16) and garlic fries ($4).  I'd say the burger was average - slightly better than a McDonalds $4 burger but not as good as a $8 TGI Friday's burger.  I've had custom burgers at other places and they were much better.  At $16 I feel ripped off...  The fries also I felt were extremely expensive for what I got.  They were clearly not home cut fries but rather frozen fries.  For $4 I feel I should be getting something superior but I'd prefer $1 Mcdonald fries.    Wasn't terrible but way overpriced for the experience.  Felt I should have paid around $10 instead of $20.

6mYhc12SCJQokE-vZZp_7g.text: Update and upgrade alert.   I finally made my way back to Bachi after nearly two years and I was pleasantly surprised. We came here for lunch and they were extremely busy. We waited for about twenty minutes before we were finally seated.   I decided to order the Kalbi burger this time around. I was enticed by the kim chi and it definitely delivered. The meat was perfect flavor and was cooked to perfection. I enjoyed the pickled cucumbers quite a bit on the side as well. The bun, which is usually my biggest sticking point for finding a great burger was soft and delicious. My friend's burger was a little on the undercooked side, but still looked good.  Service was a little lackluster and that's the only thing keeping me from giving this place five stars. We waited quite a while to order, then another agonizing wait for our food and then when they finally brought our check, it was incorrect. Another long wait for them to rectify that and we were finally out the door. I wish they came by with refills a little more often as well. Service was friendly, however. I'll definitely be back, but I'll make sure I'm not in a hurry when I do.

Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalbi burger
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalbi burger

WYrcCGidfbGottUcodXJqA.text: This chain sucks. Too expensive for a burger. The staff is rude on the windmill establishment. Hiring a chef to prepare burgers is a waste. Train yourstaff to serve customers. Clear the tables and stop trying to pretend you're a 5 star 5 course restaurant. DENNYS HAS BETTER BURGERS!

XdmeXteOn5cevFUY8DiioQ.text: Came out to Vegas to attend my good friend's bachelorette and us girls made a stop at Bachi Burger (we took a cab to get here)! Best decision ever! We ordered so much food, I tried a bit of everything from fries, a variety of appetizers, and different wagyu burgers, and they all tasted soo good! The wagyu beef patties are incredible! I could definitely taste the difference from other beef patties that I had ever had - definitely the best beef patties I have ever had! Nothing will ever be the same.. and in the words of a good friend of mine (who is also an absolute foodie) -these will "change ya life!"  Thank you to the beautiful bride, my beautiful friend, for suggesting this place - I am forever in your debt. The foodie in me is so happy.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

v0dfI1sUBqK77yTSD28fnw.text: Killer veggie burger - and it's healthy too (which is a huge bonus)... Amazing lamb burger (withy Indian favors which we really appreciate)... Ok ok fries... Sauces were good - not great... Come here just for the burgers... Like literally get nothing else..   They also serve ramen in the same restaurant - which is weird...  The lady who served us was really sweet and patient.. Rest of the staff were ok - it was kinda hard to get their attention. Almost seemed like they were avoiding eye contact to avoid serving us..   Overall - I would def come back and hope that I get seated in one of the tables covered by our lovely waitress!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie burger - so yumm!

SqtsbJiHj-P7BH6ig4SwNQ.text: First time here and I was blown away. The food was so delicious and juicy.  We ordered the Myagi burger. It was huge enough to share. The patty was super juicy and breathtaking. Makes my mouth water when I think about it. Yummy!!! We also ordered the oxtail chili cheese fries...OMG never tasted anything like this before. The portions were good with lots of chili, cheese, jalapenos, and flavor. It's also topped with fried egg. Definitely a must try.  I just found out they are opening a location in LA. Can't wait!!!  Overall, I definitely recommend this place if you are ever in Vegas. You will not be disappointed...

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chomp!

YdjRD1G87488sf5c1Y4brQ.text: Who you callin a Byatch! Bow down for your master! I read my first reviews of Bachi a while back and bookmarked it away for a Vegas trip. Thanks Dave G. and Craig R for enlightening me to the way of the Bachi Burger. My journey is now only 1/2 complete as this young grasshopper is ready to fly, again the voices of Dave & Craig come creeping into my mind. yelp.com/biz_photos/7sPN... You must first journey to the East. Search for the Windmill and the Bermuda, the masters told me and you will find the truth. yelp.com/biz_photos/7sPN... So grasshopper must learn new technique, to follow big nose. yelp.com/biz_user_photos... As I drove up with my top down I could smell good things going on inside. The masters again spoke to me. " Put up the ragtop or your rent a car will get stolen dummy" s3-media2.ak.yelpcdn.com... Finally this journey must come to an end or is it a new beginning? FOOD: Kiki's Burger ... Angus Beef, Sauteed Shiitake, Enoki & Eryngii Mushrooms, Caramelized Bacon, Sweet Onion Marmalade, Gruyere Cheese and Garlic Chili Aioli yelp.com/user_local_phot... Oxtail Chili Fries ... Oxtail chili with Garlic Aioli and a Fried Egg yelp.com/user_local_phot... TASTE: HELL YEA! Kiki's Burger ... one hell of a bad boy, a large burger sportin an eartty mushroom taste like an ugly redheaded stepchild at an Irish fair. This was one great burger! A True 5*****Star Oxtail Chili Fries ... I've had oxtail spaghetti ragu, soup, pho and even a Jamacian oxtail jerk, but never had it as a chili base before. Its marrow/ gelatin rich flavor is an awesome boot in the pants to an otherwise plain beef chile. I reccomend this for anyone going to Vegas.. It kicks tail! My masters are calling me back to Anaheim. yelp.com/biz_user_photos... SERVICE: here is off the hook, you know they got a good thing going and make sure you do too. Clean, polite and willing to help you find the right food for your taste. I'll be back to try so many things that my stomach would not let me this time. I over heard that one is opening in LA sometime soon, Bachi Burgers, On Sawtelle in W. LA., Sign me up masters!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Go here young grasshopper
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grasshopper

8tdaAFYSFXbsAbRD6x2qAQ.text: My friend Andrew N. heard I was going to Vegas and asked if I've been to Bachi Burger. What burger, I asked? Bachi burger! Never heard of it, I said. Well, it's a fusion burger place off the Strip, and it's supposed to be pretty good. Maybe I'll try it, I said, but thinking I probably won't because we might be too lazy to leave the Strip. But right after we checked in, my addicted-to-burgers bestie readily agreed to go even though she was sick and didn't have an appetite. Excited that she showed some interest in food, we passed on eating Earl's with our other friends and went to Bachi instead. When we got there, we didn't have much of a wait since it was kind of late. The interior was pretty open-spaced, simple and clean. We were seated quickly, and my friend wasted no time in ordering her burger AND fries despite having the flu! We ended up with the miyagi-san's grass fed wagyu burger, black and green burger, and truffle parmesan fries. Behold the burgers: miyagi sans (yelp.com/biz_photos/7sPN...) and black and green (yelp.com/biz_photos/7sPN...). Wasn't sure how I was supposed to eat the miyagi-sans burger because it was stacked pretty high, but it sure was tasty. Grass-fed wagyu with fried egg, chili mayo, carmelized bacon, and onion crisps. The flavors were prominent, and the oozing egg yolk on top of a juicy patty was delicious. The black and green burger was pretty good, but not as good in my opinion. It was slightly more bland with an earthly, sweet taste. The fries were drizzled with black truffle porcini cream that was pretty good. Not amazing though. It also came with a sun-dried tomato aoili, which was unnecessary because it didn't pair well with the fries. It was a good meal overall though. If you're looking to get off the Strip for a while, I would say give Bachi Burger a try if you like fusion burgers!

Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. truffle parmesan fries
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. black and green burger

tZmDVt0-sbny2jBs36sRJA.text: Wait was about 30 min at around 1 PM. Parking is spacious though. Bathroom is clean.  Waiters(Waitresses) were sincere but not overly kind. They are there to just do business.  I have to say the food in general is on the sweet side. Don't really like that, but they seriously don't mess with food.  I got the shogun burger the most expensive burger: too sweet, foie gras was slightly undercooked (or is it supposed to be not sure), and the eel tasted fishy. I suggest eat it all there. Taking the leftovers makes the hamburger smell even more. No bueno. I would not get this the second time, but it was worth trying. My friends and I ordered the oxtail chili cheese fries, sweet potato fries, and kale salad. The sides were bomb!!! I have to say ya'll have to try all 3!!!  I would definitely love to come back for other items on the menu. Thank you!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail Chili Cheese Fries, Sweet Potato Fries, Kale Salad, Shogun Burger

3M5FGhp1sT7FQtTW0s_rag.text: We saw the restaurant on TV's Diners, Drive-ins and Dives. It looked like the perfect place to start our gastro tour of Vegas. We tried everything that was featured on the show. The Steamed Buns have seared pork belly seasoned just right. It's a great starter. The oxtail chili fries are so different that you just can't slow down when eating them, which you should because the Burger that is coming next is just delicious. I had the Binh Burger that's made with beef port, and shrimp. Yes, shrimp.  Try the Thatch Tea to accompany your meal.   Great service in s little restaurant way off of downtown or the strip.

bBqkF0rM6VJpBP60-DV7hA.text: This is my first time in Las Vegas and I've heard good things about Bachi Burger from relatives so I decided to spend my birthday dinner here. I honestly should have went somewhere else with the amount of money spent. We showed up around 8:30pm and the place was reasonably busy. We placed our order around 8:45pm (burgers and fries). The burgers came out a little over an hour later. Not only did we wait an unreasonable amount of time for our burgers, my burger was not cooked as I requested therefor I had to wait longer. Also, the fries did not come out until 20 minutes after we received our burgers and they were cold on top of that! Sadly, with my experience with Bachi Burger tonight, I will not be returning nor recommending this place to anyone.

6HpFY4qvrb1tPXY_ha0M9g.text: Second time visiting this location and I loved it just as much as I did the first time. There was no wait for a table at around 1:30pm on a Monday and service was fast and attentive. We ordered some nice cold brews that they have on tap as the waiter made menu recommendations to us. We decided on the oxtail chili cheese fries as an appetizer which was very good however it did have more chili then I would've liked  but that didn't stop me from eating half the plate. We ordered the Miyagi-San burger which is their most popular burger which was 5/5. The spicy miso burger which had a good kick to it and also 5/5. The Kalbi burger which comes with a side of kimchi also 5/5. Burgers were perfectly cooked and the buns had a nice toasty crunch to it.  Prices range from $9 for a basic burger and extra for add ons to $15 for their gourmet burgers. A bit pricey for a burger joint but their gourmet burgers are very filling and portions are huge and can be shared. I will definitely be returning!

cB57VR4AwuSR6Wq5bWXvng.text: Ended up having the shogun burger with fois gras, unagi. Was one of the better burgers I have had. (Also one of the most expensive, but worth it.) They definitely have their own unique take on bone marrow jam and the oxtail chili cheese fries. I wasn't a big fan of the sweetness of the jam, but it was prepared well.

NM1gTaYc2ReK0HtHoMd4OA.text: This place is always behind schedule! Just spend you money elsewhere! Staff is inconsistent and its just a waste of time..... i have been here more than 10 times. Throwing money away if I could give less than 1 star I would...

Zcvr9QZhgOX2z6-yub9ZlQ.text: Great food, absolutely awful service. Hugely disappointed. We will never visit again.

nI9Lx5bZX82fawtAQIR5yg.text: Bachi burger is a good gourmet burger place. Definitely one of a kind. Its a japanese-american fusion restaurant.  I definitely come here for the burger with foie gtas, yes you heard it right, BURGER WITH FOIE GRAS! This burger is so special that they give you a palate cleanser before you eat it.   A must go to place when you're in las vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3tqSZme-h1B9XyCEPTG3NA.text: I love how this place is open until 2AM! It's a great place to satisfy those late night cravings for foie gras! *  We ordered:  1. Oxtail Chili Cheese Fries ($11.50) Oxtail is so good! The braised oxtail fries come with garlic aioli sauce along with a fried egg. The fries are very savory. Some people might not like it because there is a hint of sweetness. My defense is that it's supposed to balance the overall taste and not make it uber salty. A must try! (5/5)  2. Shogun Burger ($25)  I only got this because of the foie gras! Get it while you can since who knows when the government wants to make it illegal as well in Nevada! The burger has delicious Wagyu beef and unagi (marinated eel), pan-seared foie gras, miso butter, and poached Asian pear.   The server told us to eat the Yamamomo Peach first (it's in a little cup) because it's supposed to cleanse our palates to fully taste the foie gras and burger. Neat! Overall, I really liked the foie gras. However, the combinations of the other elements made the burger taste too sweet for me. I felt like they could do without the pear and the unagi. The foie gras was the saving factor. (4/5)  The place is located way off the Strip, so be prepared to make a bit of a drive (not too bad though). The service is friendly and there's cute art decor around the restaurant. There are other yummy burgers on the menu that I would like to try again next time. =)

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shogun burger - pan seared foie gras, poached Asian paid, unagi, wagyu beef, miso butter and Yamamomo peach
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail chili cheese fries with garlic aioli and fried egg

CjmI22LOIq-15WqLao_5ug.text: Unfortunately, yesterday was the worst this place has gotten. My boyfriend brought his mother here and they say it's the worst experience they have ever had in a restaurant. They were out of the pork that goes in the Ramen so they substituted bacon and the meals were inedible. Even worse it took 20 minutes for glasses of water to come out and they were not served until after the meal. Each employee was seen taking a bite of food before exiting the kitchen and chewing throughout the restaurant and even at tables while taking orders, the hostess was even involved in this. They asked to take home the noodles and were told there were no to go containers they "couldn't find them." We will just go somewhere else and tell everyone we know to do the same. There's too many hard workers out there to deal with this poor poor service.

2G-DD2kDDCERCwNQoYv9fg.text: While kind of on the pricey side, it was well worth it for the amazing burgers that my boyfriend and I had here. Their oxtail chili French fries are also a must have! So delicious and large that the appetizer could be a meal in its own! Delicious food that tasted fresh, try also knew about common food allergies and were able to accommodate me without any issues. Will be coming back here in the future

e7ItXJShygCudXtJavWdig.text: Update 4/8/2014. This business called Yelp HQ to try to get my review below removed! This all speaks to how shady this business is and them not wanting the truth to be seen by the pubic.  ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  Update on same visit 3 days later: I just got my credit card bill today and this restaurant charged me and extra $5 without my approval for my takeout order! I'm contesting it through my credit card company which means this restaurant will pay a penalty in addition to the amount contested. They just shot themselves in the foot!!  I HATE dishonest restaurants that pulls these kinds of SCAM! They will FOREVER lose a customer and I will tell every single one of my friends to NEVER visit any of their locations!!  --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Food is very tasty! Very popular so be prepared to wait awhile.  I'm really not into burgers but I do love Japanese food. Since foie gras is banned in California I have to get my fix in vegas! When I saw the shogun burger with foie gras on their menu, I had to go and try it. Everything on the menu is a la carte, so you have to order fries salads separately. I ended up doing takeout because I had to rush back to work. The restaurant is clean but packed on a weekday afternoon, parking was not easy.  The shogun burger was excellent, and well worth the $25. The Kalbi burger was good too, although the kimchi overpowered the Kalbi and I felt like I just got a mouthful of fermented spicy veggies. The pork belly buns I really enjoyed.  Would come back to try the fries next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Take out menu

MpzRrVn7Do-HGru4lMxXLg.text: Great unique flavor. My wife and I asked for a spicy burger and a savory one. She hit it out of the park. Delicious Asian infused flavor.

kJ2L5usFKEbF3LEzK6kn4A.text: DON'T BELIEVE THE HYPE!  Very disappointed with our entire experience. We came on a Monday evening around 7 pm and there was a small wait, about 15-20 mins.  When we got seated, our table wasn't wiped down so there was spilled water and/or ramen on the table that we had to wipe ourselves.  We sat there for about 10 mins and someone brought us water.....ANOTHER 15 mins later, we asked a server walking  by to please take our order! Really!?! 25 mins just to order! We ordered: - House made pickles: not good, don't waste your $6 - Pork belly buns: good, but nothing to rave about - Mr. Ho's burger, Bahn mi burger & Ronin burger: meat itself was good but all the fixings ruined our meals - Black garlic ramen: Tasty - Portuguese donuts: Too greasy  Had to flag someone down to refill our waters. Would NOT go back...they really need to work on their  customer service. Really really disappointed from beginning to end Triple D!

JJSXJiZnqpbyk8gldbZ0KA.text: Gourmet burgers? Heck yes! Thanks Smitcha B. for this recommendation on our weekend trip to Las Vegas.   First off, you will have to wait for a table. They're always packed here but for very good reasons: Asian fusion gourmet $10 burgers. Worth it when you're visiting Las Vegas or live out there.   Plentiful appetizers: Oxtail chili fries (delish), roasted duck Chinese rolls (Bao), yes please.   Gourmet burgers? I don't remember the name of my burger but I think I scarfed it down in a matter of minutes (it was that good). They also have good beers and service here.   This location off of Windmill is about 5-10 south of the Strip (I-15S).

F0L0udYtAe5qxWnCRWeldw.text: This place definitely lived up to the hype. I got the oxtail fries which could've been a meal in itself. So rich, savory and topped with tender oxtail and a friend egg. I ordered the bahn mi burger which was suggested by the server, who was very informative and pleasant. I'm not sure what was on it other than curry aioli but it was probably the best burger I've ever had in my life. It had a sweet element which was a nice contrast to the savoriness of my meal. I've lived by this place for quite some time now and am disappointed that I waited so long to go!

1gZ-3EtcPbVG-8Q3rD53Dg.text: Great ramen place and great burger place! It used to be two separate restaurants with the same owners, but then they knocked out the wall and made it one big restaurant with two kitchens. Yes, as others have said it is a bit pricey. But it's always good and fresh. If you go on a Friday or Saturday night be prepared to wait. And the waiting area is super tiny so you will likely be waiting outside.   The Bachi pickles are really different! It is about six types of pickled items including pickled garlic, pickled radish, pickled carrots. It sounds kind of weird and when it came to our table I didn't think it looked very appetizing but each type of pickle was completely delicious!  Another great appetizer are the brussels sprouts. But they do come with a sprinkling of bacon so if youre  vegetarian beware.   Unfortunately, my entree came out about 10 minutes before my dates entree. I think it's because we ordered from the two different kitchens. (One ramen one burger) But even that was OK.

8Ms_L7-y8XNOpohVyZDdQQ.text: This should have been an update from a previous review that I did, like 4 years ago. I don't know where that review went, for some unknown reason, it was deleted. I think it was about the chicken wings, and that I only gave them 3 stars or something. I've been back here many times since then, and this place is steadily a very good place to munch on a burger. Or anything else that comes to mind.  I recently came back here, after a couple of years, on a whim. I don't know why but for some reason, I feel like I should come back here once in a while. They say that Bachi was inspired by Umami Burger in LA. That could be True or not. But, Bachi is one of those few follow-ups which is better than the original.  I've tried pretty much the entire menu here. Burger-wise, I am one of the few that believe that their Angus is better than their Wagyu. If both meats are temp'd at medium rare, I think their Angus is much more juicier and tender then the Wagyu. Call me crazy. Or call me, maybe.  Still, to this day, I haven't tried their oxtail fries. Or maybe I did. If I did, then I think it tasted pretty good. If I haven't, then I couldn't tell you. Also, they are now connected to Shoku Ramen, so you can get ramen if you don't want a burger. Which is fine, I guess.  I'll probably be back. For some reason, I still get a little irked when I see that I've paid $25 (including tax and tip) for a burger, fries, and Coke. But, i'll get over it. Maybe.

k1aiIn0oYQyYiVtEniY1Ww.text: Customer service was horrible, ramen is mediocre, the Kimchi they make is disgusting and overpriced, and the staff I encountered there was causing scenes infront of people. Really wish I never came here, wasted my time and money.  They have more room for improvement than any other place i've gone to, thats for sure.

zHHbm9dvamL8kkdd6stSEQ.text: I was never into burgers until I tried this place, now I want to try every single one.   I've tried the Ronin, Kiki, and two others that I forgot the name of but they delish as well.     The OXTAIL FRIES are yum-to- ok, I think it's the sunnyside up egg that makes it special.    I'm very excited that they are opening up an L.A. location.   WOOT WOOT!  The PORTUGEUSE DONUTS with COFFEE ICE CREAM are amazing!!!

x7m95j-4tf13lCy6T97TEQ.text: When we arrived here in Vegas, we yelped for restaurants near us. This place was one of the restaurants listed.  The reviews were pretty good, but still I wasn't sure if the eastern western fusion of flavors would work. I felt more at ease with our wonderful server Theresa. She made a bunch of great recommendations to me and our Vegas party.  I ordered the Miyagi-San burger... it was delicious. The flavors and textures all worked well together.  An order of salt-pepper garlic fries and Thai ice tea completed my order. Dessert items looked tempting,  but I didn't want to get to "hate myself level" full, so I passed on dessert.  As for the wait, it took maybe 5-7 mins to get seated for a party of 5. I'd say we were there around 4pm or so.  I did try some ramen that someone in my party ordered... both the ramen and broth were very tasty. The pork was melt in your mouth tender and had a good amount of flavor.  Overall, good food, very clean, and friendly customer service.  When I come back to Vegas, this is a joint I wouldn't mind hitting up again.

VebypPeh0itxrrpg8kiZIA.text: The wait time sucked! 25 minute wait for my burger, but it was worth it. I ordered the Mr. Ho's specifically for the taro bun, and it did not disappoint. The burger itself had bits of lop cheong (Chinese sausage) in it, the veggies were fresh and the sauces were magical. I'll be returning to try something else, hopefully they will pick up the pace

q6enB-WFo87zvsCrsabxAw.text: Shogun burger, it's a sin! Surprise BBQ eel that go with Wagyu beef. Best burger I've ever had in a long time

Bqd3oqlQ_24JcxNXp0M3Wg.text: Best burger place I've been to... ever! If you haven't been, you're missing out.

QtNXo_YoTu27iofNJlhBaQ.text: Yummy in my tummy!! We didn't eat before the Carrot Top show and were looking for a place that served dinner late and we found the perfect spot!!!  I can't say enough good things about this place, we arrived around 10:30 and it was still full but we were able to be seated pretty quickly.  The fries are served a la Carte and they are big enough to share with another person. If you have more people, I would suggest trying all three types they serve.  They also have tons of burgers from beef to lamb to vegetarian and fish!   My boyfriend had the Black and Green with Wagyu, mushrooms, spinach, bacon, blue cheese and garlic and he couldn't stop raving about it and actually said "perfect burger, so good!"  And I had the Bachi fish sandwich and it was delicious!!! It was pan seared to a nice crispy finish which was just delectable and the flavor combination is seriously amazing!    Oh and they have adult milkshakes!!! What???   I would most definitely go back again just to get the truffle Parmesan fries!!!

fqtx4nkBQxSbfiNKBKrOOA.text: This place is horrible staff especially a Filipino boy named Rick!  The worst, I'll never be back he threatened my life and Chef Chris never responded.  So everyone I come into contact with I let them know to stay far away from here!!

0rZ_W3vjh8p6MGEabMkv9Q.text: This is my 2nd time coming here and we originally came for the Japanese food next door.  However, I ended up settling for the Bachi Burger side of the business.  I ordered a 7oz burger well done and it was exceptionally delicious, which is why it got 3 star instead of two stars.  They missed two points for the following two reasons:  1) My iced tea literally took 15 minutes to receive and I had to remind the server twice!  2) Food came out sporadically instead of all together, when I was here with a party of four.  Also, the hostess will not seat anyone unless all of your party is here.  I find the serving of food separately to be very rude to the party you're with, because you can't enjoy it all once.  Food is great, but there are some key elements that be should be improved upon.

1wd3lW3BNKF1eEYLvo9CUg.text: The wait was about 35 min on a Friday night, which isn't terrible but we got it to go either way (keep in mind that we didn't have the full experience).   In my opinion it is a little over priced since it doesn't come with fries or anything ( $15 for the Miyagi).   We had the Miyagi-San and the Kiki's. The burger came  cooked more medium rare than medium but it was not a big deal. The sauce on the Miyagi was definitely the best part. It was perfectly sweet while still allowing you to taste the burger.   If you are worried about the egg in your burger, don't you worry; it is amazing. The egg provides another great dimension of taste and texture.   The to go service was mediocre but I understand on a busy night it is hard to provide excellent service to take-out customers.   I would eat it again. Top 10 burgers I have ever had. Oh yeah the fries are really good (they are like pomme frites).

k2UcoCjWdZ9PZeXDIIQpFA.text: Wow, Bachi Burger does everything right. Asian fusion meets the bun and holy shit does it ever fucking work. My only gripe? Bachi Burger needs a location in LA! Seriously, this place puts all the other burger joints to shame. I mean, this is what Umami Burger should be doing.   Bachi Burger is located 5 miles to the southeast of the Strip in a non-descript shopping center. Being the noObs that we were, the wife and I could not figure out which side the entrance was located at (it's on the north side by the way). Once we entered we were lucky enough to be seated because this place was fucking packed.   After perusing Yelp reviews, we decided to order the famous oxtail chili cheese fries. All I have to say is thank you Yelp for recommending the oxtail chili cheese fries because they were amazing. The chef is Japanese Hawaiian and the minute you see the fries you will see the Hawaiian influence because there was a perfectly cooked fried egg on top! The portion of the fries was huge. As an appetizer, it could easily be shared with 4 people. Aside from the egg and fries, it consisted of tender oxtail meat, cheese, scallions, jalapenos, sriracha mayo, garlic aioli, chili, and beans. I mean the combination of these ingredients was simply bliss. My wife and I hardly spoke because we were devouring the mountain of fries like fucking barbarians.   As for the burgers, my wife had the Kiki Burger and I had the Miyagi Burger. The Kiki Burger was really something. Thick and juicy Angus beef, three different types of mushrooms, caramelized bacon, gruyere cheese, and a sriracha-mayo sauce... oh heaven! As for my Miyagi Burger, it consisted of thick and juicy wagyu meat with furikake (nori flakes), caramelized bacon, crispy onion rings, fried egg and mayo. It was good... a little on the sweet side... let' just say that I liked my wife's burger a little better. Also, if you aren't into fusion burgers, they have a regular Angus burger that you can customize.   So, we were unable to finish our meal. Too much fucking food. I can't remember the last time I went to a gourmet burger joint and was unable to finish my burger. I think my only suggestion for Bachi Burger is that they should offer a sampler platter because they have so many unique burgers and it was a shame that I couldn't try more.   Bachi, I fucking heart you.   *One thing my wife and I noticed was that  a requisite to work here is that you need to be Asian with arm tattoos. But don't let the tats scare you because the servers are super sweet like ramune.

Kss3bWRsoJ4xnJ37jP0oQA.text: I can definitely see why people are fans of this place. However, I'm not in that boat.  Let's start with the wait. We came at a time where it should have been well after lunch time rush but there was still a 20 minute wait. If I'm driving into the middle of nowhere, the food better be damn good!  We ordered the Mr. Ho's burger and the oxtail chili cheese fries.   The Oxtail Chili Cheese Fries: While it was interesting and enjoyable, it's not something I personally would crave. Was it tasty? Yeah I suppose... but the fries itself isn't specially made extra good. While eating it, I couldn't help but compare them to McDonald's fries. They were 11-12 dollars.   The Mr. Ho's Burger: I definitely had better burgers! The bun was taro flavored, or so its said, and therefore it's purple. Unfortunately, you're not able to taste any subtleties because the sauce was so overpowering. We split this burger and I'm raised with the voice of my parents saying there are starving children in Africa if a grain of rice is left on my plate, even till today, but I simply couldn't finish this half of my burger because of how strong and over-applied the sauce was. And this was only half a burger. This was also about 12 dollars.   Perhaps the rest of the menu items are sublime, that's a possibility. But there was definitely a disconnect between the food I got and the raving reviews. It's hip and trendy and could very well be a spot in the middle of West Hollywood or Downtown LA, but I'm very sorry to say it felt like this place was more hype than substance. I know I'm definitely in the minority on this.  Overall: Like the Oxtail Chili Cheese Fries, don't regret getting it but I wouldn't do it again.

SvfbTz24zL9BA-P1UWcRUA.text: I really do enjoy BachI Burger. I have been here about four times now, and they do not disappoint. Now that they have combined with Shoku Ramen, I enjoy it even more.   One of my favorites is the spicy miso ramen.  It's done extremely well, but it's not all that spicy, so if you are looking for something extremely spicy, this is not going to satisfy that craving. However, I do have a very high tolerance for spicy food, so it's worth noting that I might not think it's spicy, but it might be spicy for others. The serving size is on par with most other ramen joints.  As for burgers, my favorite is the Kiki Burger. It is filled with hearty mushrooms and the flavor combination is amazing. No complaints here. The burger is huge and done right.   The truffle garlic fries are also one of my favorites. It's a wonderful combination and I have to get it every single time...even if it's with my ramen.   The service is good here and it has a hipster vibe...I'll leave value judgements about the atmosphere up to the individual, but it's a fun vibe. Overall, always extremely impressed and enjoy them very much.   The only caveat to all of this is how busy they can get, and deservingly so.  The wait has stopped me from eating here a few times, but if you try to get here during down times it's not too bad. If it's a rush hour though, be prepared to wait. My latest time eating here was this past Thursday night around 6:00 pm and there was no wait at all.

KUAXdnIXLeD_jik7smkElQ.text: A friend of a friend recommended this place and what a treat to find it to be as good as they exclaimed.  Our waitress was attentive and friendly.  The place was busy but there wasn't an overly long wait.  We had the Kiki burger with Wagyu and the Miyagi-sans Grass-Fed Wagyu Burger with a shared order of truffle fries.  The burgers were cooked (per chef's recommendation) perfectly and the homemade buns melted in your mouth.  This is not a fast food style restaurant and is a bit pricy, but well worth every penny.

naHq7QmXC4_qv1yyehEjIA.text: I'm only giving this place 4 stars because their burgers are expensive, but I guess that's what you pay for quality burgers.  Their oxtail chilli cheese fries are to die for!  They have a great selection of fries too.  Very unique burger joint.

Fmz2E62JBfktNmTTUxsOpg.text: I considered one star here, but the service from the waiters was alright for how busy they were, so they deserve that. As for the food, I really do not understand the hype surrounding Asian flavors in hamburgers. From all these reviews here, you would think it is a match made in heaven, but honestly, it is exactly what it sounds like: an Asian flavored hamburger. If that's what you like, then you'll love this place. I actually am pretty happy with regular hamburgers and regular Asian food. The price: The burgers cost way more than they really need to cost. You get one burger, nothing else. I also have to agree with a lot of other reviewers here about how their hostess treats you. She was NOT nice. Basically could have been a robot taking names.   I have no idea how this place really is so famous. Must be all those people that follow the triple D to all his food locales.

_i3iJgIIXAV4Xv8cQXdgIQ.text: Just had lunch at Bachi burger. The service was great. Very friendly staff. We had the oxtail chili fries which were so good.  I had the waygu burger with fried onion rings and my husband had the banh-mi burger. Both were excellent.  I would definitely come back to try something else.

EEAB7u-Vaf_y_kcqQ_8ZoA.text: Everytime  we come to Vegas feom Miami.... this makes the list of places to eat. The food is always great!  A bit of a wait, but not too bad.  It's  worth the wait. You leave full and happy.  So good!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wild mushroom Lamb Tikka Masala Burger with Teriyaki Fries....  gained 10 lbs tonight. So delish.
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ox tail chilli fries!  This is beyond  awesomeness.
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly.... sooooo good! A must try! The steamed  buns are nice and sweet.

wQa9E2YL5vafjzuEmOfMaA.text: Yes my friends and I might've came in on their last call for everything but, as a paying customer wise?  You still have to cater to your guest! Period! I have been in the business for 18 years now, from front of the house to being a chef.  To be honest, I do not like to be rushed when I just barely sat down and have not seen the menu!  Anyways, enough with the bitching!  Food so far is not bad , came out fairly quick though?  Hmmmm?   Pork belly bao,  great flavor on point but came out cold! Like it's been sitting in the kitchen for a minute.  Portions on the onion rings? Too little for the portion...  Like I said, food is good. But service could be better!

7b3rUw2Mhhv8WF-I2-g1tw.text: Went here last week. This place has been on our food bucket list for a while now. We had the oxtail fries, miso burger and the pork bun appetizers.  I was disappointed in the fries. The sauce had a weird sweet taste. It would have been good had they omitted whatever they put to make it sweet. I split the burger with the hubby, and while it was good it wasn't anything special.  The pork buns were yummy, but this seems like one of those "trend" foods that everyone is trying to do. You really can't go wrong with these and they were good.  Service was good, I would probably go back and order other things to try.

2tqg12qoWhuHWdhqi_0TWQ.text: Came here because I saw it on the show Diners, Drive-In and Dives. And it was amazing the food was ridiculously good! I come out here once a week for work and I will be making my way back here at Bachi Burger very soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail Fries are amazing!

RF273ytOoxKe0Oxw_A8r7A.text: It wouldn't have been too bad had our burgers come on time. We waited roughly over an hour for our food. Our server 'mark' didn't even come once to check up on our table...someone else had to get our bill. Mark obviously got $0 dollars. As good as the burger is, I'll be going somewhere else for my burger.

D5GZe8A9WWE_TK6eYMo5vw.text: I dream of Bachi Burger.  I visited in February while I was in Vegas on business.  Bachi Burger is the only reason to get a rental car.   A bit outside of downtown and located in an unassuming strip mall Bachi Burger was one of the best excursions.  When I think of Vegas I think of Bachi Burger.  When I think of Burgers I think of Bachi Burger.  Too bad I am so far away.  Best crabcake.  Best sweet potato fries.  Best dipping sauces.  My first try of a Bao Sandwich (Pork Belly Steamed Buns).  Bring a friend because you are going to want to try as many menu items as possible.  Fantastic menu with great thought put into pairing of flavors and ingredients.  I dream of Bachi Burger often.  Oh, and I love that they had food network on one tv and cooking channel on the other.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Belly Steamed Bun

YEE-2gBv1OXVky5jCDeL9g.text: I found this place on yelp and decided to try it out. The oxtail fries were very good.We ordered a wagyu beef burger medium well and it was way over cooked the burger was very dry. I will try the location in Pasadena C.A. The service was good.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asked for medium well but got well done.The burger was a dry bachi biscuit.  @bachiburger
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazingly delicious. Oxtail chili cheese fries @BachiBurger

1v3Dci-uTPyYzc1T33328g.text: This was a great burger hang out joint!  The beer selection was awesome and the fries were amazing. The burgers that we tried were super yummy!  Great prices and Melissa was adorable and efficient!

JiARo0CHawNQn_B-uWxKmg.text: Everyone is sooooo nice here. The customer service is great and of course the food is amazing. Not only will I be coming back as much as possible I will recommend it to my friends. I'm not a huge beef person but I got the lonely bird which was recommended to me and it is more than delicious. Milkshake infused alcohol is amazing as well. Everything is just so perfect about this place.

MBCFz_axHYaiL9qwpQA_5w.text: Their Momotaro strawberry white peach soda is crack! It's been two days and I'm still thinking about it and wishing for more! I WANT IT, I NEED IT, NOW!!!!!! too bad I live in California :(  - Oxtail chili cheese fries: Perfectly fried fries topped with sweet oxtail chili, jalepenos, fried egg, and cilantro. The chili was a little too sweet as if there was too much bbq sauce, but still good!   - Pork Belly Steamed Sandwiches: Glazed pork belly, hardboiled egg, and cilantro stuffed in a steamed bun. YUM, although the bun could've been a little softer.  - Miyagi-san grass-fed wagyu burger: grass-fed beef patty, cheese, onion rings in toasted buns. I loved that this came out hot and steamy! Although the beef patty was cooked to medium-well even though I asked for medium, it was still very juicy. However, I felt that it lacked flavor and I wished the onion rings would have been crunchy to give the burger more texture.  I would definitely come back here again because it has so many burgers that sound delicious! However, I give this four stars because I think they could've done with all their entrees.

LUAUOw9eTQWMyC4ZTS22Wg.text: I'm looking for a negative star, but they did not have it.  Anyways I could've to given any of the star. I came in the late night before they are closed. I ordered Salted Caramel Milk Shake for (6$) and Oxtail Fries for (11$ich). I came to pick it up, yes I okay I understand it takes sometime and I am patient enough to wait for good foods. The lady ( blonde hair who looks old than the other two girls) she gave me my shake ( half of the plastic cup )  and told me that they ran out of whip cream and caramel and it does not even look like in the picture than I expect it from other reviews. I told her that this is not what I saw in the picture of yelp, but then she said mayb it was the different place, I checked on my phone and yes it said it was on windmill branch ( they have two branches) I told her its okay, its just half of the cup and I am not taking it. I would like my money back if she can so refund. The other girls said that I can put more caramel and whip cream if you want ( the blonde hair girl just said that they ran out of whip cream oh! Incredibly, now you guys have whip cream when I want to refund my money ) I was giving an attitude by two girls even tho they are trying to fix my drink, but I don't want half of cup when I actually paid for the full amount of ($6) the drink she gave me worth around 2$ I could've gotten that from fast food place and it would taste better than this. Was so disappointed and will not be returned. I gave one star thanks to the girl that do refund for me and yes I did take my food and it does not taste good at all. I would avoid at all costs!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Void the drink half of cup off. So disappoint with their service and their foods.

llZwROuGdNFvbtAeoChzSA.text: Food was AMAZING. We had the ox tail fries, which where very delicious!!! We also had the pork belly mini burgers. Please forgive me I forgot the exact name of the dish. But it was delicious as well!! So many flavors and the bread!!! To die for! Was definitely a nice experience and a great meal.

y39Xn0BI2HMIYpVi1HlELQ.text: Teresa was freaking amazing made excellent selections for us to try sonce my friend had never been here before. She explained the menu amazingly! I have been to the other location but will only come here new just because if her. Thx Teresa

EY0OK0vwjOR8vo159mCfLw.text: Best burger place ever! I'm not sure how anyone can give this place a bad rating. The burgers are so different yet so good. Like all new restaurants....you should ask the 3 favorite things on the menu!

96M7FAS2QysN90BbPIFA6g.text: On the food network I saw a promo for a hamburger called Bahn Mi burger, the burger looked so damn good that I wrote down the info and even took a screen shot of the note.  This past weekend while in Vegas I decided to head down there to give it a try. Omg! This place is legit, I actually ended up ordering the Ronin burger and truffle Parmesan fries and a 1/4 of my wife's Kiki burger, also so good! Lastly, we ordered the souffle which was more like a lava cake with vanilla ice cream but so damn good too. Only bad part was the 25 minute wait for the souffle; but all in all, I needed to be pallet jacked out of there cz I was so full. Definitely coming back!

Y87rITkBUL00jg8fw01QyQ.text: After hearing about this place for about a month, I finally had the chance to try the burgers. The kalbi burger was solid. The marinade was good and the burger was flavorful. I wish the kimchi were spicier, but it was great nonetheless. I also had the pepper and salt fries. These were also seasoned well.   Bachi burger makes some great fusion burgers for a reasonable price. I highly recommend it.

3ALehRSWidSlicrTm3AimA.text: We came on a weeknight, and there was a substantial wait to be seated. We sat at the bar, and again waited more than 20 minutes before the waitress came and took our order for drinks.  Once we were seated, we ordered oxtail fries appetizer. It was without a doubt outstanding.  We ate every last bite!  We ordered burgers and the pork belly sliders. Everything was outstanding and flavorful and delicious! The service staff was extremely knowledgeable and friendly, and food came out quickly.

YclOuhvJI_kYwfw6wbBUHw.text: Ohhh goodness. My boyfriend has a timeshare in Las Vegas right down the street from Bachi Burger. Everytime we go, we devastate this place.  The burgers are gourmet, Japanese fusion burgers, but so delicious! First off, their quality of meat is great. The ground beef is very tender and juicy, not dry at all. They also offer so many choices of burgers that are so interesting!   -If you really want to splurge, try the Shogun burger. It's the best burger I've ever had, hands down. -Miyagi-san is definitely the best burger if you don't want to take risks. It's not bad, it's a GREAT burger! But if you're not feeling some of that fusion stuff. -The Ronin Burger was awesome. It had so many layers of taste; my friends and I decided that it tastes somewhat like a sushi roll. Sounds weird, but it's really goooood. -Kiki burger is a really good mushroom burger! -Their oxtail chili cheese fries were HUGE. And delicious! However, like everyone else, I do wish for a bit more oxtail in it. But nonetheless, bomb. -Their truffle fries are amazing too! Definitely my favorite truffle fries I've had yet. Not dry at all! Crispy and moist. -Mr. Ho burger. If you like sweet taro bun and pork sausage, try it. It's a bit on the Chinese bun side, it was very interesting, but I couldn't finish it because it was a bit sweet for a burger.  Never had Umami Burger, but my friends at the table are quite the foodies and had quite of a bit of Umami Burger... Bachi blows Umami right out of the water.  Prices are around $9-$15 per burger (except the Shogun, that one is $25), but the burgers are HUGE. Eating just the burger alone, you'll be stuffed. Thick patties, fat bun. No skimping here.  Damn, now I'm hungry talking about all this food.  5 stars!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic truffle fries!
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Shogun burger. To die for.
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Taro bun! Mr. Ho

bJ0rrpAsqC8Flau7LII-xw.text: I have been here around 4 times in the last 3 years. The service use to be really slow but now the service timeliness is very reasonable. Apparently they completed some renovations eight months ago and that probably helped the restaurant become more efficient.  My go to burger is the ronin burger, can't go wrong with that burger. I should probably try other items but why fix something that isn't broken? Also truffle fries are awesome!   The staff here are very friendly and try to strike up conversations with the customers, that's always pleasant.  All in all, I will come here again. Especially because tourists seem to love it. My cousin Jackie for instance, she claims its the best burger joint ever!.

XFeBP9NWhVJVX3TfEAMPRQ.text: Four stars is a bit generous considering my first experience to be maybe above average.   Came on a Sunday night with my girlfriend. Very busy, yet we were immediately seated since the other parties consisted of high volume of guests while I was with just one other. A plus for that!  Upon seating, the waitress courteously greeted us and asked us if it was our first time. Confirming with her question, she gave her suggestion and what is considered the most popular three burgers on the menu. The Ronin, Kikis, and Banh-Mi burger is supposedly the most popular and preferable. My girlfriend ordered the Kikis and I ordered the Banh-Mi.   I normally like my meat cooked in medium rare, however, the server suggested that we cook it to medium well because our patties are more than just beef. My patty consisted of shrimp and pork so medium rare would be overdoing these meats. So my girlfriend and I took her advice.  We waited about 20-30 minutes for our burger. Though busy, that is quite long.  Finally after waiting, our burgers and one serving of "just fries" came.   My burger was good but not great. I have definitely tried much better. Nevertheless, I did enjoy this unique style of burger. On the other hand, my girlfriend's Kiki's burger was delicious. It could use more veggies and more dressing but the meat combined with the bacon was stellar.   Overall, an OK experience. My rating and review is definitely subject to change because my curiosity will bring me back to try the other burgers/ fries/ etc.

8PZyglPrvGMEMRrg_f_13g.text: Every trip I make to Las Vegas usually includes one dining experience away from The Strip, which is easy because I always rent a car for golf purposes. Bachi Burger was my choice on this trip and it was a winner. While this original location is rather small, it is still very comfortable, clean and recently underwent a modest renovation. I won't say it is unlike any other burger destination, but I will say that the burgers themselves are very unique. Good flavor in every bite and really appreciated how the servers asked about food allergies when ordering because of the nature of the menu options. They also have full-liquor and many other drink and food options if your taste takes you beyond simply a burger and a beer. When playing golf in the area on a future trip, this will definitely be my 19th hole.

ew47iofewy_j4cPtK098Xw.text: We drove past Bachi Burger on the way to  visit friends in Vegas.  I thought the sign was cool and later our friends suggested we eat there.  They live down the street and eat there often.  They'd totally get a four+ stars if the service was better.  The decor was great and the menu looked very interesting - I love fusion cooking.  I ordered the Spicy Miso Burger - it was amazing!  Cooked perfectly, juicy and a great flavor combo.  The service was ok at best.  Our waiter spoke broken English and brought foods out in waves.  Finally, after we all had our burgers, the waiter asks what else we needed.  We're like, uh french fries.  By the time we got our fries, we were half way done with our burgers and the fries were cold.

Z6eoztosOt1RSgyVUG43CA.text: BEST truffle fries and chipotle dipping sauce. They are a MUST get. My boyfriend and I split a teriyaki burger and their meat was AMAZING!!! Really kicked back environment, and I would definitely go again. :)

h_slHGrGE5JIna6dIF9FLw.text: First off, I only review burgers.  Heard about this place from my friend Les.  Went here with my mom who is NOT a burger fan.  I wanted to order 2 to split with her so I could try 2 burgers so I was going to pass on the fries.  She said, get the fries, I'll eat my share.  After the food arrived, she appeared to be enjoying the meal.  I asked her, "What is the best burger you've ever had?"  Her answer..."This one."  Update: Buns are like honey glazed dim sum baked Cha Siu Bao.  PERFECTION!  Currently the undisputed best burger in the Las Vegas area for me.  WHAT I ORDERED:   Ronin Burger - 5/5 very juicy and flavorful!  Shogun Burger - 4/5 also very juicy and flavorful!  Kalbi Burger - 4/5 solid!  Garlic Salt & Pepper Fries - 4/5 awesome complement to the main attraction  Truffle Parmesan Fries - 3/5 ok...not sure what the brown sauce was.   Oxtail Chili Cheese Fries - 3/5 ok, but not memorable enough to order again  STAFF:  Nice.  Our waitress was quick and friendly and sported some cool tattoo work.  WAIT TIME: Went a little early on a Friday afternoon and there was no wait.  PORTION:  Good portion. Just the right size.   BANG FOR YOUR BUCK  The portions and quality of burger match the price well.  WOULD I RETURN  Yes!

0HJpAt_gV6SaexlEuLulTQ.text: I've been here a few times.  Great Burgers. They've got a lot of good items on their menu. Whenever I'm in Vegas I always stop here. Friendly staff

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I&#39;ve ordered Mr. Ho&#39;s burger with sea salt and garlic fries

_aWs9RF0PDjp3iTh-kIbUQ.text: This place is pure excellence!  The first time here we ordered 5 different burgers and split them all to share.  It's hard to recommend one particular burger since they all were so good!  But, I can recommend you order a burger with a crunchy element to it.  The crunch really topped it off for me.  That's what set it apart and why we try to always make a stop when we're in Vegas!

9EZfjDDRcl_as-xKxfxaKg.text: The oxtail french fries was amazing!  Go get it!  I might as well make some fries and put an egg on top because I suddenly have a crazing.  The burgers were excellent too.  It's a great way to start Vegas or end Vegas!  Go go go!

zZhwd8Qz3yJHP7hoaqUqpQ.text: So good, i could die, It's a gourmet burger and you really get what you pay for. It's a great vibe, super nice decor, asian fusion style bugers. I come here everytime because all burgers on the strip disappoint. Ronin burger is a great great burger to start off with, come back and try everything. There is boba so that is a huge plus if you are having that asian craving inside you, I know everyone has it. Service is great and I always leave happy and full. My tongue and heart sing in harmony as a take every bite, and the heavens ring as the joy of my stomach reaches fullness and its enlightenment.

VY_S-ZplOPSIlewPQVPg7Q.text: Finally made it to this place last month after many trips to Vegas.  It was excellent.  My husband swears this is the first burger ever he has never had to put anything else on it, i.e,. ketchup, mayo, etc.  He loved it.  Since then he compares all other burger places with this one and none compares.  He had the Miyagi Burger.  Wanted to try to oxtail chili fries but decided to just savor the burgers first and expand on our tasting later.  We will definitely be back!

89B-NAMipfgSfxnVSv0h7Q.text: This is an amazing place.  Staff is super friendly and the food is WOW!!! The oxtail chili fries are the bomb

k_MGEQq1N3MxoZjUR9ohOg.text: Like a lot of reviewers, I saw this place on Triple D and went to check it out. Perhaps I am not the person that should review a gourmet burger place, considering I am quite content with a basic burger, but this place was pretty good. I did not know what half of the ingredients were (hence my statement earlier), but that is not a bad thing. I got a speciatly burger (featured on Triple D), which had pork on it. It was good, but I would have preferred to eat the burger my GF got (a basic bacon cheeseburger). Fries were very good.

Z8qVAH2hzkiJJQvxKmyzHw.text: ***Sucks that Bachi Burger is closed on Mondays- I am a witness to many cars driving up,reading the sign and then sadly driving away....***  On a Sunday we were needing our Bachi Burger fix so we quickly fulfilled our needs.... We were seated right away-it was busy but a table became free for us instantly just like it was written in the stars.... I'll just talk about items I got that I didn't talk about in my last review :  - Fried Chicken Appetizer- Yummy with good dipping sauce- all I needed was a scoop of rice and this could've been my meal. - Shrimp Chips - So good, salty-crispy yumminess... - Crusty Crab Burger- I wanted to try something different than my usual Ronin Burger so I chose this-it was good but a little too seafood tasting for me-  -Kiki's Burger - The BF liked this one but had to ask for extra sauce -Calamansi/Lime Soda- To wash all this yummy food down we tried two of their house made mix soda's- this was tangy refreshing -Lychee/Apple Soda - This one was more on the sweeter side than the other drinks- It was OK but I prefer the Calamansi Drink instead...  Yummy visit and will be back and Oh I have to mention that service has extremly improved and is quick....

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamansi Lime Soda
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sk49X8Pg1SIwjXH7YBvbNA.text: Amazing burger spot just off the strip in Vegas. Brief highlights of what I ate-   Oxtail Chili Cheese Fries- The chili is the best part of this dish, got a decent little kick and melds well with the cheese and fries. The runny egg yolk on the top was also a great touch. Fries were cooked well enough to withstand the barrage of liquid from the other toppings. Our group destroyed these fries pretty quickly  Miyagi-san's burger- Great burger. The bacon/egg/onion ring combo is a classic set of burger toppings, but this burger took it to another level. Great quality ingredients that were combined very well.   All in all, this place blew me away. After trying one of the traditional burgers, I'm even more excited to come back and try the build your own burger option.

Og-ZMps9rO8Wd7bvgon3MA.text: I was looking for a good place to eat that was not on the Strip and found this place with 4 stars and decided to give it a try. I was not disappointed. Not being very hungry, we ordered the Pork belly steam bun, kiki's burger, and ronin burger.  We went for the pork belly instead of the duck for steamed bun because it is all about the fat. They grilled the pork belly to perfection. The fluffiness and chewiness of the steamed bun combined with the crusty, melt-in-you-mouth goodness, the buns were gone in a minute.  I was sold when I read that there is shiitake mushroom and other mushrooms in the Kiki's burger along with caramelized bacon, onion marmalade, gruyere cheese and garlic chili aioli. For me to finish a burger when I am not very hungry, you know how delicious this burger is.  My companion ordered the ronin burger with the wagyu patty and fried egg. It looked impressive, but tasted alright in comparison to my kiki's.   Great place if you have a car when you visit Las Vegas. You will not be disappointed. Did I mention my Kiki's burger was only $11? Tell that to someone in California or New York, they'd be pissed!

WskRLgfwolqtawyOAC3F7A.text: The burgers here do not disappoint! It was about a 30 minute wait to get seated even after the lunch rush.   I ordered the Kiki's burger, which is perfect for mushroom lovers. They also allow you to add lettuce to it for free. The angus beef was juicy, and paired perfectly with the garlic aioli. This aioli is on the side so you can add as much as you want.  I also tried their oxtail chile cheese fries and their pork belly steamed buns. Both were decent but nothing special.. The burgers here are definitely their best menu items!

pVe69AGTnkezCpM2OCn5Ew.text: Tried the bahn mi burger and it was excellent and cooked to perfection.  Had to come the next day to try the Ronin and liked this one just as much. What are you waiting for? Doesn't get any better than this for burger lovers.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Storefront

Rlbm9JeUBnjGDZFxp2e1IA.text: Only been here a couple of times due to a busy life but I would recommend this place first when it comes to an INCREDIBLE burger! Moist and succulent Wagyu beef with a fried egg and crispy onion rings on the Miyagi-San burger is just an intro to the palate. The Japanese BBQ sauce and aioli kick it out if this world! On top of all of that I got the truffle fries and now I think my burger life is ruined cause I don't want any old burger from any where else! These Truffle Fries are the BOMB! Served with a sun dried tomato aioli and drizzled with a truffle sauce and Parmesan cheese-really?! Holy freaking shazbot!! Service here is excellent(attentive, friendly, courteous)! Summer time at this restaurant is going to be busy so get here now and enjoy before the crowds invade!! I'll try the Oxtail Chili Cheese Fries next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside Bachi Burger/Shoku Ramen-ya

1wZDhxkPbb0HicEGHSBzzQ.text: Oh, My. God.  Not sure what location we did go since we are not that familiar with Vegas, and a friend drove us, however, I have to say I really loved the place.  We had to wait like 40 minutes or maybe less to be seated (on a weekday for late lunch) but the wait was well worth it.  Don't you love when that happens?  I ordered the Bah Mi burger and the Morimoto sake Rogue beer, that is kinda hard to find.  I can have that meal all the time for the rest of my life.  With the mini donuts for dessert.  The fries were good I just cannot remember which one we ordered.  Can you please please please open a location in San Diego?

MU-7XlB7RAp3OwoTmt8McQ.text: Try my trio pick... Miyagi San Burger, Pork Belly Bao and The Oxtail Chili Fries. Bomb! Great Food and Great Service. Love it!!! I'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Belly Bao!
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail Chili Fries and the Miyagi San Burger.

xs7wjMgN0a6HNp-D2g7_9w.text: Okay 1 word sums up my whole expirience here. YUM!   The bun on the burger tho! It melted in my mouf! The burger its self was a PARTY in my mouf! And their fries with the jallepeno slices on it YUM!  (I just drooled on my laptop) lol

psQIchRh-i53EdoVwCtU_w.text: 10.14.10  This place is amazing!  If you can venture off the strip and try this place, please do so!  Kiki's Burger: Two types of mushrooms, caramelized bacon, sweet onion marmalade, gruyere, with garlic aioli on the side.  Um, are you hungry yet?

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KIgeUmZlTAu6LNKLU-JmTA.text: I really love the food here but the service so inconsistent I never know what to expect. Sometimes they are spot on and other times they completely forget about you. They won't seat you until your whole group arrives and with the parking situation here you could wait an extra 20 minutes after waiting for a table while your friends park.  The waitress we had seemed to enjoy correcting our pronunciation as we ordered. It's a little showy and degrading.  The food is quite good and unique but with all the other hassles my husband won't go there anymore. Oh well.

OsGqEw-FZsoSGefSegyvnw.text: My friends have been hyping this place up for such a long time. I'm glad I finally got to try it. We came up to Vegas on a Saturday around 1PM. We had a large group of 9 and waited quite some time, at least they were nice about it. It's located off the strip on the South end in a shopping plaza.  Our server was really nice and helpful, he knew we were hungry so we jumped right into ordering.  Miyagi-San Grass Fed Wagyu Burger - Delicious, probably my fav Kiki's Burger - the mushrooms seems a bit misplaced, wish they weren't so soggy, but everything else was super juicy Oxtail fries with fried egg - MUST GET THIS TO SHARE, so bomb, it's like canto restaurant indo fried rice but on fries instead.  All in all, is this the best burger place in Vegas? Probably not. Is this the best bang for the buck burger? Hell yes. These burgers are roughly $11 and they are delicious for the price you're paying compared to other burger spots on the strip.

6FT5kEewEGDqOVRV90ONAg.text: Love this place and now combined with great ramen.   So why so low.... 1pm Monday post Xmas week and 35 min wait. BUT. 10 tables of 2+ free and was told they were seating slow to deal with demand.  WTF. If I owned the place I would die.....only 12 people waiting and a wait with open tables?????   Thought them to be foodie restaurant .. Leading edge....they gave us a coupon to go to their other restaurant 10 miles away.....Really?  Went to Zenshin close by.... Vote with your feet!

iNf5YdkAVKnrnHwbYlxnwg.text: This place is the best. I have had great meals here time after time. I am from San Francisco and this reminds of a place I might frequent back home -- they're just with it on many levels. The Bahn Mi burger is amazing, and they're burger with the Kimchi is amazing too. The only criticism I have is that sometimes the sauces are a little too sweet, but it's a small complaint. My taste buds are still thanking me and my meal was hours ago.

k7gIVuLgLGtqtXABX2KmVw.text: I'm back home in Cali and I already want to go back to Vegas just so I can eat here again!  I saw the Ox-Tail Fries on Diners, Drive Ins and Dives and I craved it so bad.  It was really good.  The fried egg on top just made it even better.  The ox tail meat was savory and soft, melt in your mouth.  I tried the Ronin Burger, which is the most popular but I didn't really like it.  There was too much carmelized onions which I usually love but it made the burger too sweet.  My husband had the Miyagi-san's Wagyu Burger and it was so awesome!!  I ate half of his burger.  It was really savory and just good.  I wanted to try their Boba drinks but I was too full after.  I can't wait to go back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ronin Burger
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

r_iPG9Qb62UD-0r8p4nDmw.text: Best burgers in Vegas & their oxtail fries are the bomb!!!

PBZcYeQFu7gAKwSm9iKosw.text: Ok, ok.. i had 3 friends raving about this place and wtf!!  Ok, the med/well burger was for sure med/raw but because the waiter never came back after we got our food. Also, they were out of 3 menu items. That is crazy to me. The fries were greasy, and the the beer temp was for sure a little warm (bottles). I am not sure about the other location but as for this one i just couldnt do more than a 2. Would have been a 1 but the host was friendy, and when the server went missing for 30 min she helped us out.

XUCA40Te2WQt34PDeRKfow.text: My favorite uppity burger before was probably the truffle burger at Umami in California because I LOVE the taste/smell of truffle oil.  I'm going to go ahead and say that the Shogun burger($26) is easily the best burger I have ever had. The price is high but omfg the taste was off the charts.  What really drew me to order it was because I wanted to try what foie gras tasted like for the first time and it did not disappoint. It's a perfect burger to me.  Juicy patty, fatty truffle foie gras, sweetness from the pear, and the soft crispy crunch around the edge of the bun.  It had all the right textures and flavor.  We ordered the oxtail chili cheese fries like everyone recommended and it was damn good.  We also ordered the Kiki and Spicy Miso burgers.  I didn't really care for them after trying the shogun burger though.  Angus patty wasn't as good as the wagyu but don't get me wrong, they were still good burgers.  Little things bothered me with each burger like how the spicy miso burger had too much sauce for my taste and the bacon in the kiki burger was a salty pop that I thought was too much at times.  Service was top notch.  Server and hostess were great and empty plates and trash were never on the table for more than 3-5 minutes.  Water was always topped off.  Places like this is what 5 star ratings are for.

LHe50gX7jOxuUczwq_F6Vw.text: I LOVE burgers, but after having bachi, it'll change your perspective and have you saying, "I LOVE BACHI!"   Trust me, it's like that.

o3Lnkzc4WBkTXY9oFNpHDw.text: Did the burgers live up to the hype? Yes - very well presented and cooked perfectly. Roughly a 30+ minute wait on weekend lunchtime. Drinks, however, were made from powder, and tasted like it too. My boba were also tasteless, unlike the lightly sweet honeyed flavor I'm used to in LA. $4.50 down the drain.  4.5* for the burgers 1.5* for the drinks  Come for the burgers, skip the milk teas!

_kRyu2DHlMW43OS6cHYmig.text: Seriously the best burger you'll ever have. Every time friends of family come to visit I take them to Bachi Burger and 100% of the time they leave saying it's the best burger they've ever had. But burgers aren't the only hit, the oxtail chili crease fries are always a favorite too. I'm not a fan of spicy food at all but there are many things on the menu that are perfect for me which is always a plus when dining with a group given how picky I can be about food. As for the people who like a kick to their food, you'll be in heaven I'm told by my friends who love the heat!

NBZZeZbPlht9Pu0DkD4Lvg.text: Least favorite burger in Vegas. I am allergic to wheat and gluten free options are very limited. Not a fan.

_JJMpqsP6kQegZrwPiR3Yg.text: Love, love Bachi Burger! Fast and efficient service! Food is amazingly good and affordable! Their burgers and packed with flavor! Also can't go wrong with their sweet potato and garlic fries! Will always keep coming back! Please open more locations!

ppo4-aHrI9K_gQiD7gPxyw.text: Amazing!   Went straight from the airport to getting our grub on. Everyone said to get the ronin (beef, sweet onion marmalade, cole slaw, miso goma dressing, fried egg, bbq and citrus aioli) which don't get me wrong was delicious but the Mr. ho's (beef, pork, sauteed mushrooms, lap cheong on taro bun) was my preferred. The flavor in both burgers had my taste buds going out of control!   Don't forget to order the oxtail chili cheese fries... Addicting!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail chili cheese fries
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mr. Ho and Ronin burger

5nturWjPlejFt7Kod5fvFQ.text: This is the best burger. Ever. Double Wagyu patties, egg, avocado, bacon, chili mayo, and cheddar. No bun.  The sweet potato fries were the best I've had, as well. They stay True to their funky, fun Japanese-burger fusion vision... just taste the yuzu aoli and the burger marinade to find out for yourself.

bG-GBZmJeUMyU9cEfc3RVg.text: You gotta eat here before you die! I wish I had two stomach to try few more items - I am stuffed; eat a whole bowl of spicy miso Raman and a giant spicy miso burger!!!! Ramen is the best I ever had - just damn perfect. If I lived here, I would come lot more.
