7C7JFrN_x9JXQ-D8TzsF0g.text: This place is a cool spot to go to. They have good chill music always playing and good vibes. Their must try is their chili con carne fries with an egg on top. But if you aren't a big chili person don't get it. Just get the truffle fries instead.   Their burgers are delicious! I always get the Kiki.   Not impressed with the ramen though.

xqhSmj73E4i-5Zhw4kvorQ.text: I love your food,  but tonight you guys did horrible, the cook shouldn't be arguing with the servers. My burger was burnt, even though I asked for medium well.  The Filipino dude working all the tables. I love u guys, tonight 100% fail. The Ramen was delicious. Wish i got my money back 100%. Hope u do better next time.

CWN9QRBBhom5KTEUDstZIQ.text: Definitely a fan!   I absolutely love a hearty bowl of ramen especially after a night of drinking.. With that being said, I woke up Saturday morning from a night full of clubbing/drinking to a monstrous hangover! I woke my boyfriend up and said, "we need to get ramen RIGHT NOW." Thankfully, a group of friends of ours recommended Bachi Burger and I'm soo glad they did! At first I was a little hesitant considering the restaurant is called "Bachi Burger" though we were coming for the ramen, but it definitely did not disappoint! For those staying on the strip, this location was roughly 6 miles away and was about a 15 minute drive. We arrived a little after noon and waited about 15 minutes for a table. Dillon, our server, was attentive, polite, and patient - while I indecisively decided on what kind of ramen to order. I decided on the spicy miso ramen based on the numerous yelp pictures/reviews but was a bit nervous due to the amount of spice (sensitive stomach + night of drinking = possible regrets). Safe to say, it was the perfect kick to get me through the day. The spicy miso wasn't too spicy, in fact it was a little sweet. I also asked for softer noodles and they definitely delivered. I was a little disappointed because the ramen had 1 pork belly meat and not as much garnishes as I'm used to :( Aside from that, the meal was great! Perfect spice, generous portions, customizable textured noodles, and oily/rich flavors! I wasn't able to finish the entire bowl and took it to-go. I ate it 2 hours later and it was just as great!! Too bad we don't have a Bachi Burger in California :(

bfjMafpALKcOIcbCinkPOw.text: Fabulous! Will definitely come back next time we're in Vegas. I love finding out of the way spots off the strip and this hit the mark! Shared a Ronin burger (Angus beef) and the Miyagi-San burger (wagyu beef) so we could try both types of meat. They were both delicious, though I preferred the wagyu. Had the salt & pepper garlic fries. One order is enough to share for 2 people. They were out of the brussel sprouts, but want to try those next time!

ezAm2Tq8x8cUVlOgEEL5_w.text: My friends have been raving about this place so I finally had to try it.  I don't live in Vegas anymore but this is right by my pop's place so it was easy to get to.  They got a wide variety of different types of burgers you can order from.  So depending if you like your burgers plain, to having lots of sauce or additional toppings, you can choose how you like them.  The first time I went there I got their Bachi Burger and it was too sweet for me.  The second time I went I got the Banh Mi Burger and that was actually decent.  I got Truffle Parmesan Fries on the side that was good too.  Overall, maybe it's because I like a good ol' fashioned burger, I think this place is just okay.

F82boORnhjAqzGWGqLII5g.text: This was my first visit and will definitely not be last. Came out here for the weekend and I yelped this place at the last min. Reviews do not lie! This place is delicious and unique. The asian fusion that the burger had left a memorable taste.  I ordered the Miyagi-San's Burger...was totally blown away by the flavors. I didn't really know what furikake or wagyu beef was but damn...I'm sure those were the main flavors. They gave it an asian fusion twist to it. The patty was so juicy...perfect! It was a bit pricey but I didn't mind that. I would pay that price again. I'm coming back here when I visit Vegas again to try their specialty fries!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Miyagi-San&#39;s Burger

UFftAzx9UAbaRigLYhH2mQ.text: Another one of those "why do we  keep going to bachi Burger?" Experiences. Shift meeting at 6:00p. Stood at the hostess stand for 10 minutes before another guest went searching for someone.   When the table next to us complained about their ramen, I knew what we were in for. 45 minutes later, the ramen comes out and it's not very good. The ni tamago wasn't seasoned. Just flabby garbage eggs.   I think we are done.

pBWWoBONQDEbp01A-pes5A.text: Best burger of my life. Bahn Mi burger-- totally unique -- if you like Vietnamese flavors this burger is for you. Comes with jalapeno toppings and an amazing dipping sauce with fish sauce flavors.   Also the oxtail fries are totally unique and rich.   All in all -- I wish this joint existed in my home town. I usually don't even eat burgers, but I'll back. New reason to visit Vegas!    Great beers on tap too.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail fries.
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bahn Mi burger-- to die for

X_KBmdZYQNN4oZqsJpdDTg.text: Service was amazing the ox tail chili cheese fries were delicious I had The show gun burger and it was perfect well worth the trip off the strip will definitely stop every time I'm in Vegas

2VWr4GCma2MtIj8xjuoaIg.text: Yelp, you have come thru for me yet again!!! Thank you!! We came to Vegas not knowing where we wanted to have dinner, so I searched on Yelp and I was super surprised to find a place with almost 3000 reviews! The intrigue was too much for me, so we decided let's try this!!   We started with oxtail fries (you need to experience this), garlic chicken wings, and spicy garlic edamame. All three dishes were sooooo good!!! We all got the Vietnamese iced coffee, which unfortunately tasted a bit watered down. It was still good, but didn't pack the punch that I'm used to.  I had the kalbi burger (sooo yummy!!!). The others had the miso burger, manga burger, and black n green burger. Everyone LOVED their burgers. We were completely stuffed,  but we noticed the bread pudding and Portuguese donuts on the menu so we had to try!! Those desserts were amazeballs!!!   Our waitress was excellent. Everything about this place is great. When we walked in and were told it was a 15 min wait, we were kind of excited because it was the first confirmation that this place is legit! I really wish there was a Bachi Burger in my town.  I kind of want to eat here everyday!!

uvdeIfFff5dfUelU7Jy3FQ.text: Rated #2 burger joint in the Vegas area. Disappointed with the burgers. Expect to pay a lot for a burger. 2 burgers, 2 fries, 1 appetizer, 2 non-alcohol drinks and $52 later (plus tip) and we were on our way. Too many other places to try to go back here.

4kc-DwIDWeF7nK4p39Zuhg.text: This is my ABSOLUTE FAVORITE PLACE. EVER!Buuuuuuuuut every time I come here there's about 4-5 tables and it takes 45-1hour to get your food. I'm not gonna stop coming here because I like the abuse and the food so much.

28-45hlD5OqOGrqKkatbCg.text: This place is amazing!   The Ronin burger was beyond delicious.  Sweet potato fries were fresh and hot!  The Brussel sprouts and Asian pears are memorable.  K'Josh was a great host for us and provided top notch service.  Go here and you won't be disappointed.

89xhdxuQoxFiRnOZSxM_tA.text: Stopped by this restaurant on a recommendation from my seasoned Vegas-visiting friends.   The service was prompt, courteous, but a bit brisk for my liking. I sat at the bar with a glass of wine and was leafing through my work while I ate. My waitress was pushing for me to put my food in to-go boxes within 35 mins of me being seated and I had eaten less than half my appetizer and entree. I looked around and saw only half the tables were occupied at 9PM and asked her if they were closing soon- she blushed and said they closed at 11PM. She didn't make me feel comfortable or welcome as a solo diner and I got my check right after and left.  However foodwise-  I ordered the signature Oxtail fries and the Black and Green Burger. Both were solid choices. They both had a great blend of textures and flavors. Sweet, tangy, savory, garlicky, a hint of spice, and some crunch here and there- I would highly recommend both dishes! I appreciated the fact they didn't over-season the fries so it would balance out the intensity of the Oxtail chili flavors and dressed with jalapenos, cilantro, and a garlic Sriracha aioli. The burger also packed an explosion of flavor with the roasted garlic and blue cheese cutting into the savory sauteed mushrooms and beef, using the spinach as a medium to round the flavors out.  The cocktail and wine menu choices were okay, the beer selection was awesome. I wouldn't be able to handle eating here too often but would definitely come back if friends wanted to check the place out.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black &amp; Green Burger, amazing for people who crave intense flavor.
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Oxtail Chili fries that&#39;s put Bachi Burger on the radar of foodies on the West Coast.

ERRQyHJ0cSANjPsF87aKpA.text: We had been so excited to try bachi for the longest. It have to say we were a little let down by the food and especially the service. Our waitress started off fine but then disappeared after our food came out our water stayed empty for forever and had to ask another waitress for water. The bahnmi was a little bit of a let down especially since I love bahnmi sandwiches and the meat was over cooked. The shogun was cooked well and was tasted yum. Oxtail chili cheese fries were good, not mind blowing like I had hoped. Pork belly bao were a let down as well, very little meat and the steamed buns were almost cold and stiff. Our waitress finally came back and apologized for the long absence due to a large order and took our dessert order. Dessert and our to go order took forever. Overall I wouldn't come back.

5rFruSEHN-c2lDV9pnqxFg.text: Monday, 8:30PM.  Quickie: + Food quality + Service + Hygiene + Menu variety + Layout  And then...? After an active day, we did not feel 'as' guilty for gorging here.  ********** Stuffed my face in: 1. Oxtail chili cheese fries      + Cheese and egg = cholesterol goodness      * Oxtail did not differentiate from other meat toppings  Constructive comments: *Source ingredients *Compost options

IhsyZHn0IJR3WFhXlBZ2bQ.text: Best burger in the area and if you're a fan of rich, Asian inspired flavors you'll love it. Only other place that competes is Fuku Burger but Bachi is more refined and the menu has more depth. The menu isnt overflowing with choices, its selections are keen to what tastes best and what works. The steamed buns and oxtail fries are a hit and any of the burgers are great. Whatever you do you need to try the pineapple ketchup

2XnpU4ZnoQ2whX1yBLYI7Q.text: I have been to this Bachi Burger several times since it has opened and I love it. The Asian inspired burgers, fries and ramen are fantastic. We bring guests here a lot or come by for lunch/ dinner.  My favorite is the Shogun burger with seared froie gras. If a plain burger is what you want, you can customize it to just that. One out of town guest, was not familiar with the menu options and opted for a plain burger with lettuce, onions, ketchup and mustard. The staff was more than ok to do it and our guest loved his burger.  The environment is clean and sleek. It is a popular place, so you may need to wait for a table but it's worth the wait. The staff are super friendly and upbeat. Awesome package all the way around.

T6VnkstngD6doT8hAICQWw.text: I have been a ling time fan.  Take the time and het out of the casino if you are from out of town.  Very popular with the locals who are finecky about what they spend there time and money on in a sea of good restaurants.    Black and green is always awesome with the reyes point blue cheese.   Bison come with bacon and brie  Always order medium or medium rare!  For a real treat venture away from the burgers and go for the fish sandwich.  It is incredibly good.   Nice selection of teas that are bottomless including matcha!  Burger aficionados such not miss out on one of the best burgers ever.

AC7Af8MHj5RPZqH8tzXlcw.text: I wanted to like Bachi Burger. I've been here a few times, hoping that the visit before was just a fluke, but nope, Bachi is not for me. The service is fine, the waiters attentive, and I really enjoyed the fries, but there was just something off to me about the flavor of the burgers. Maybe it's just me because the people I go with enjoy the burgers, but it is what it is.  The latest visit was with a friend of mine from out of town and I wanted to take him to a burger joint off the Strip. We ordered edamame as our appetizer and truffle parmesan fries. I ordered a Kiki's Burger (angus beef, sauteed shitake, enoki & eryngii mushrooms, caramelized bacon, sweet onion marmalade, gruyere cheese, and garlic chili aioli) and while I finished the burger, I tried really hard to not show on my face that I thought it tasted off. My friend enjoyed his burger just fine which makes me happy, but I did not enjoy mine. I had hoped it would because I love mushrooms! Everything about the burger on paper sounds great. It's just something about the sauce or something that makes me not want to order it again.

TV_l4C-MYZu0OG_raYxdFg.text: I forgot to update this review after we ate. Anyways... here is my take. We be a long wait to get in, for what? The burgers were expensive and was expecting to have wow taste. I was disappointed. Not worth the price. In the other hand the ramen was great. Probably the best one ive had in vegas. Still my favorite ramen place is in los angeles....santouka ....unbeaten

ztR2fmAUDLlyRkzir2mUpw.text: The mad geniuses behind these crazy and amazing burgers at Bachi should receive a Nobel  Prize for their contributions to to mankind. Not to mention the fact that they have also curated a baddass beer list to accent every bite.  #hitachinoFTW   Now while there isn't much that I can't tell you that hasn't already been talked about what I can offer you is a secret recipe for a Burger Boner which I came to acquire after eating the following items.  Please see below for the formula and note that you can substitute any variety of beer to achieve said boner, however the other 3 items must be eaten in their entirety.  Bachi Pickles + Oxtail Chili Cheese Fries + Hitachino + Shogun Burger =  BURGER BONER

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Miyagi-San

8ZTUTG25n0rozBGoF2GuBw.text: love the banh-mi burger! It was definitively my favorite.  My fiancee and I went here, he loves the typical (plain) American burger and in love a mouthful of flavors. So this is the perfect spot to compromise!   Some may wonder why the burger only comes as itself and not with fries or something on the side, it's because they are HUGE! I can barely finish one, less than with their fries. Their fries are HUGE, definitively something you should share. I love fries, so they had a few flavors to choose from. I usually try the garlic fries or gravy fries. With any actually can't do wrong.  Ambience is nice, wait time can be hot or miss. Either we get seated right-away or we have a log wait ahead of us. No reservations below 10 people, the few times I had called ahead.   Price is mid range, Definitively worth for these 'fusion' mixes of burgers.

Ju9nkxUlOhd5V6heVO-Emg.text: My food was good My wife and my daughter could take it or leave it, but not horrible they said Service not there waited for a table to be wiped off at the front desk for 10 minutes as multiple employees passed it including the person who said it would only be a moment Food took incredibly long Check took a bit to process as the line to get in grew to at least 8 parties deep with no host and open tables everywhere Could have been understaffed, who knows

LG_LIag54r1s2lO7L2SIrw.text: I've eaten here at least ten times - today was the first less than stellar meal...the Brussels sprouts were amazing as usual - but rare burger came out hockey puck style

UKuyBDR0_LISEPwaL3zEGw.text: "What's furikake?" asked one of our table-mates. "Some lettuce thing", our server so eloquently replied. Yeahhh noooo. From that point on, I knew I wouldn't particularly like it..  But the burger proved me wrong. I don't remember what it was called, but it was the pork and beef one, with the taro bun. The bun didn't have much taro flavor, but was a gorgeous color. The seasoning and sauce on the burger were sweet but not overly so. With the pork in the patty, I think it went well together.  FYI furikake is a type of seasoning, usually a mix of seaweed, sesame seeds, dried and ground fish/veggies that you put on rice.

eAHGpzljMJzLuRAdNCk8UA.text: Amazingly delicious Ramen with Pork.  Started off with Truffle Fries a delight.  Great atmosphere and the best thing is their burgers are tasty tasty.  Everyone is happy.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zfGBY9WBsUDhufh28KnEkQ.text: This place has been my go to burger joint for over 5 years.  I've seen a lot of change over the years.  Good thing is the food tastes the same for the most part (truffle fries have tasted different) but you never know what kind of service you're gonna get. My last 3 visits the service has been slow service will be and no one even tries to come around to apologize for the wait or fills your water as it gets low.  So I can say in the past I spent a lot more here but every time I come back another fave was taken off the menu (katstushiro an alcoholic beverage and the bread pudding with coffee ice cream, boba tea drinks as well) so I just order my faves that remain which is the miyagi San, which is delicious by the way.  I do recommend it and is why we come so often.  We also get the oxtail fries, it's a must.  Anyways back to the last visit, the host sat us before people that were there before us and they got so mad that they left before we could even tell the host.  Then once w e got our order in the food took awhile but not only that, when it did come it was just our burgers.  By the time the fries came my husband was done with his burger and the rest of us waited for the fries so the burger was cold by then.  She was nice enough to comp the fries since they came so late which I  appreciate and I'll sure was not her fault but was not cool to have brought friends to the first time to experience this.  They may or may not ever want to go back on their own.  They did enjoy the burger though so they may try it again.  My point I'm trying to make is they need to tighten up on the service.  Not sure what's happening with management but there is new faces every time we come so we never get treated like regulars even though were always here.  Our visits are becoming less because of this.

DOGoiUsdbUBYOiiAG-RhRg.text: Been here twice, the first time my gf (who is a pescatarian) wanted the Krabby Patty, which apparently was discontinued but still displayed on the menu. That was annoying. Second visit we just came for takeout, and were ignored for the first 10 mins. We waited to put in our order, then finally after asking the host, a server came by to take it. We waited at the bar for easily 15 minutes before the bartender noticed us and asked us if we wanted any water. The place wasn't crowded at all, a few empty tables in fact. We were the only take out customers. We waited a total 30-40 mins for the food to finally be ready, and it was cold and soggy. The burgers were ok, (asked for medium rare, it was medium-well). Overall not a great experience. This review refers mainly to the customer service aspect, the food was decent earning a 2 star rating instead of 1.

mfZ3wcYoRJU4UD1mLaTrKg.text: A lot of friends have been asking me about my experience at one of the newest spots to grub in LV, so I thought I'd break it down for you J to the Y style...   Location: It's about 7 miles off the strip. If you don't have your own set of wheels and want to split between 4 in a cab it shouldn't be too bad. I'd say maybe $30? Though, that is just one way...   Wait: Came here on Wednesday night around 8pm. Not packed at all and seated immediately.   Bathrooms: Always a line.   Patrons: A lot of Asians. Go Figures.   Parking: Plenty  Service: Not bad. Our waiter seemed a bit flustered at times and would often repeat itself but I'd chalk it up to a long day.   Food:  1. Ox-Tail Chili cheese fries: Not impressed. Don't let the fancy name fool you. It was just ok and rather forgettable. Also, not a big fan of the cilantro they sprinkle on top.   2. Ronin Burger: Contrary to what other people's Yelp Check-in suggestions may state you might want to re-think about your own taste buds for a second. Had two friends order this burger cause it was "Highly suggested" from the other yelpers they saw who ate there previously and they were both a bit let down. Big surprise...   3. Kiki Burger: I ordered the Kiki burger and I actually really enjoyed it. I had a bite of the Ronin and it just didn't have the same kick as the Kiki...   *If you don't want to splurge for their $22 Shogun Foie gras burger, do yourself a favor and get the Kiki burger. It's bomb.   *The burgers are decent size for the price as well. Slightly bigger than an Umami burger and on par with one from 38 Degrees.   *Jessica Y. and I are both concur that this Burger is great for the area but it isn't something new...Especially if you frequent gastropubs and eat burgers from 38 degrees, Umami, and Slaters.   *Never fear Californians, my inside sources tell me that they will be in fact opening two new locations in the So Cal area in 2014. One will be on Sawtelle and the other in some place in Santa Monica...   ** Bachi Burger in Vegas is  definitely worth checking out once if you're in the area and if you're sick and tired of eating at buffets and if you don't feel like waiting 1 hr 1/2 for pan roast. However, it isn't ambrosia. Manage your expectations and you'll have a great and memorable experience.   Cheers,   Justin "Kiki" Y.   Shoutouts to J to the Y. and the homie Young Rich

U00ITkrmsMIujRO8n3vbxA.text: Waiting for a table is not uncommon, but it's definitely worth it. There was an old couple who had gotten out of there car and were walking to the restaurant. I ended up jumping over a bush and racing towards the front door just so that I could beat them. I haven't ran that fast since I chased an ice cream van and that was at least 2 months ago.   The miyagi san burger is to die for. Literally speaking you would probly die over time if you ate it everyday considering the mouth water sauce, soft bread, onion rings, bacon, and an egg cooked to perfection. As if that isn't enough, be sure to stuff the truffle fries down your throat as well. This place is must!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Miyagi san

6uxupeW4BvOj1zaq8oul9g.text: This is my second time here since 3 years ago.  Came with a group of people.  There food is great, but a tad salty.  I had the Big Fish burger and the others had their specialty burgers.  The ramen is not bad too. The service is good.

1UqIBnpoI5Ap48PZ1Gz_wg.text: Good unique burgers and other dishes....but not as great as I thought it would be. The chili cheese fries were just so so... .

LJqBuOPHhz8eG1Vf9RdA7g.text: I'll start by saying the burgers were good. If you're looking for a good quality burger, you'll get one here.   I downvoted it for the service and the value. The burgers are good, but range from $13-16, with an up-charge for substitutions or extras. For the quality, it should have been closer to $10-15. Same for the sides - $4 but should have been $2-3.   The service was slow and inattentive. We told the waiter that we didn't want anything with heat. However, we ordered garlic fries and didn't notice that it had jalapeno until it got to the table. I would expect the waiter to at least check that we knew it had jalapeno after we were so adamant that we did not want anything hot. Nope. Took our order and disappeared.    Good burgers, but will not be back.

_Un4EaIxNxxZ8CIR0D-hBA.text: All I can say is yum! Oxtail chili cheese fries were amazing! So big we will have to come back to try the burgers

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So good! Oxtail chili fries!

oP2BmrQAvdUdqBu0VQuOIA.text: First time visiting this place and I am greatly impressed. The servers were very nice and prompt, the wait wasn't too bad but it would be great if they could fit in more chairs or put benches outside. Now the food. Every single thing we tried was delicious. We started with the chili chicken appetizer and it was crispy and sweet while the chicken remained so juicy. Combined with the sauce that accompanies it, it tastes almost like eating hot wings. I ordered the Miyagi-San burger which was insanely good. The fresh buns are the softest I have ever held and my burger was cooked just how I wanted it. The fries are crispy and addictive and all the dipping sauces pack a flavor punch. Lastly, order a cocktail because they are all so delicious and make the experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Miyagi-San

OyD_oqiX39y6MmyZ2RUj-w.text: Fantastic burger. I love fresh, creative toppings on my burger (and pizzas) and this burger hit the spot. Had the Ronin burger. Also the salt and pepper garlic fries were excellent, fresh, large portion. Salted Carmel toasted marshmallow shake was tasty but small for $6 and didn't have enough marshmallow flavor. Service was painfully slow (went mid afternoon so not even peak time) though all servers were friendly and we had no issues with our order. Everything was fresh and hot.

lRI6OQ0fr9zg5Q-p9Nylcw.text: Love In n Out? Forget about it, this place will blow your mind! I've never travelled off the strip for a meal. Boy, I was missing out on the best burgers of mah life! I saw stars and angels while I chomped away, while my taste buds screamed out, "Hallejuah! Asian! Burgers! Genius!"  I got to try the miyagi and the kiki burgers and both were divine-okay the miyagi was better because I asked for wagyu beef for my kiki burger and it came out bunless. Not sure if that happens when you substitute the meat or by chance I accidently agreed to no buns?  Bachi Burger, you just made Vegas a whole lot funner for me. Can't wait to come back and try each and every delectable-sounding burger.

AoT2Nlv-1yuC7PETeSP1Ow.text: Started with the Oxtail Chili Cheese Fries which were excellent.   Moved on to the Shogun Burger - great concept and loved the Unagi and foie gras combo.  Only problem is they overcooked the actual burger.   Maybe forgivable at $6 but you lose a star at $26.

Between that and the regular menu the variety of options offered here is perfect.   We ordered the tonkatsu ramen, the flavor was very good, noodles weren't over cooked. We also had a custom burger, the duck buns, French fr

8kfo25pSBgnWP6Pnu6GTNw.text: Delicious. We fly to Vegas just to satisfy our Bachi Burger crave. The ox-tail fries are a must !!! The burgers leave you so satisfied you might just need a nap after!

ESf70qQoYc28QztGvTUdTw.text: Great place! We had the oxtail chili cheese fries for an appetizer- pretty good but could have used a little more cheese in my opinion. For my main dish I had the pork belly steamed buns. So good! I've tried  pork belly a few times before and it can be on the dry side, but not these! And the steamed bun itself was amazing. My boyfriend had the Kiki burger and it was also very tasty and juicy. The portions are generous here so come hungry!

JBPzO1i1jRy1NcINYTHM8g.text: Definitely one of my favorite burger bars in Las Vegas.  My goal is to go down the menu list and try each one of their burgers. So far, I have accomplished 4.   Ronin burger: This was my very first burger at Bachi. It is made up of angus beef, caramelized onions, fried egg, Japanese cole slaw, miso goma dressing, katsu BBQ, and yuzu citrus aioli. So simple, but so good.  Shogun burger: The burger consisted of waygu beef & unagi, pan seared foie gras, poached asian pear, miso butter, and yamamomo peach. There were so many flavors going on in my mouth, it's hard to describe the taste. Is it worth $25? Probably not. Is it worth a try? Definitely yes.  Miyagi-san burger: Another waygu beef burger. Also comes with fried egg, furikake, caramelized bacon, onion rings, and chili mayo. Great tasting burger. I liked how it was not messy, even though it had so much going on in it.  Kiki's burger: The most recent burger I tried. This is Bachi's version of a mushroom burger. It's made of angus beef, sauteed shiitake, enoki, and eryngii mushrroms. There's also caramelized bacon and gruyere cheese. Sauce: garlic chili aioli and sweet onion marmalade. I like it.   If you're feeling extra fatty, get the oxtail chili cheese fries. Pretty heavy. But SO good and savory. Get it to share!  They also serve ramen here at Bachi. I've tried one of their bowls before but it was not memorable. I don't even remember the name of it. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't great. Just stick with the burgers.  p.s. Bachi is better than Umami

c74KrC86PchDhkxpXSw6kA.text: This place is a truly unique experience!  First of all you have to try the Pineapple Tea. If you go and do not try this beverage you're soul will forever be missing a piece.  Next, the burgers are a pleasant mix of barbecue flavor and tender juicy beef patty. Not only are they super delicious but they are also very decent sized. They do come a la carte so I ordered a side of edamame and can I just tell you how satisfying it was to order and enjoy a great plate of edamame at a burger joint?  So much yes.

qFl0LoqAQkMyk-9srVie8w.text: I was looking for a simple, casual, dinner in Vegas and this place was perfect.  It is located in a strip mall with plenty of parking.  We came around 6:30pm on Saturday and we didn't have to wait.  It is a little difficult to find because the sign blends into the building.    The service was great and place was clean.  The food was awesome, quite possibly one of the best burgers I have had.  I recommend the Spicy Miso burger.  The Oxtail Tail fries were awesome.  Who knew that a fried egg on top of the fries would be oh so good.    Loved this place!  I hope they open a branch in LA one day!

_XeTHbwHwnCyFyPDXKpTUg.text: I want to like this location (Windmill). When they opened, I was a regular (one mile from the house); and then the prices went up, the service dropped and it was always crowded. (A good thing for them)   However, the last two times I have returned have been dismal. On my most recent visit, I felt that the objective wasn't on service but on ignoring the empty glasses on the table, the waves by the wife of my friend. (I was hosting another couple) And my table didn't want to order water, we wanted to order (Profitable) beverages.   I finally rose from the table, found our waiter and asked, Has the policy changed? You don't serve second drinks to customers? His response, "Absolutely" Which didn't make a lot of sense, but by that time, we were, in a word, done and not only had we been waiting for second drinks, but we were trying to get someone's attention to pay the bill. Is it me, or should our waiter want to be paid? Our entire party was dismayed by the service, or lack of.  Okay, the service was ... in a word..a failure, so move onto the food. Not to the caliber of the early days, when Bachi seemed excited to deliver a new and exciting product. The foods seems to have been value engineered to the degree that they are counting on tourists to support the revenue goals, i.e. Eat and never come back.   My friend summed it up in one question, "Why did you want us to come here?

vO9Ed6nxheFcjq83qb1kMg.text: Mmmmmmmm mmmm...after waiting an entire year to eat this (bf tried it the year before and raved about it, and our next trip wasn't for another year!), it was very much worth the wait. Since we knew we probably wouldn't be back for another year, we went all out -- oxtail chili cheese fries and pork belly buns to share, and I went for the shogun burger since it has foie gras and it's banned in California.  Oxtail chili cheese fries were my fave of the meal - the perfect bite had a little bit of everything, plus a jalapeno to add some more spice. I would definitely get this every time - and I hope they have it on the CA menu when it opens!  Pork belly buns were good, but not the best I've had. Still really good though, and worth trying if you like 'em. A little oily, and you can't really taste the hard-boiled egg, but still yummy with the soft bao.  Now for the $26 shogun burger -- it came with a beef patty, unagi, and foie gras. That's a LOT of meat, and the menu actually shows it "deconstructed" and I ended up eating it kind of this way too, just because there was so much stuff going on. I liked the patty & foie gras together, and the roasted/grilled pear was a very nice complement to the heavier flavors. It's definitely a rich and filling burger though; I could barely eat half of it. So if you get this, you probably don't need anything else - or you should share it with someone else, along with apps. I wouldn't get it again, just because I can't finish it and it's expensive, but I'm very happy I got to try it and get some foie gras!  And just 'cause they were so good, I have to mention it again -- it's only a day later, and I'm already dreaming of those fries...

Ap-2Go0xPKKGpKmCz9Upgg.text: DAMN GOOD BURGER! I got the Kiku burger, full of all sorts of mushrooms and it was LARGE and DELICIOUS.   Got the oxtail chili cheese fries too. They were delicious, and would probably rank 3rd on my all-time list of garbage plate fries. The one thing that hold them back are that the fries themselves are really simple, but this is pretty typical of chili cheese fries. The waiter said we wouldn't be able to finish a whole order of fries and our burgers...how wrong he was. We frickin destroyed our entrees!  The Oxtail Chili Cheese Fries are currently #3 on my Garbage Plate Fries list

84ov8XIhdiBWSXkXchROPg.text: Really really good burgers here. Waay off the strip, with no good way to get there unless you have a car. But if you can make it, and if you can stand the wait, you're in for a great.   Our group over-ordered, of course. That being the case, I got to try a bunch of dishes. Most memorable were the burgers themselves- I tried so many I can't remember exactly the names. But one had a decadent slab of foie gras, one had a sublime dusting of furikake, and another was indulgent with onion rings and bacon.   And the sides were delicious without a single miss. Oh, and the service was great- the waitresses were nice and patient with our large group.

N7MxYtiQiyiCuxPxpnvIFQ.text: AWESOME find.  One of those,  how did we get there? Im so glad we found this place, kind of experiences for my group of 4.  Service was great- our waiter was funny, attentive and CRAZY fast.  We shared a few plates including the shishito peppers, octopus balls (not the best but not bad), onion rings ( AMAZING, we should have ordered 4 orders instead of 1) and we each got a noodle bowl or a burger for our mains.  Broth was delish of my noodles and the noodles were good, but the chewier ramen from the dish with the XO sauce had better texture.  Pork belly pieces were like bits of porky heaven- honestly it was very memorable and delicious.  Cannot stress enough how good the onion rings were.  As a bit of a onion ring connoisseur I have to say they rank at the top of my lifetime list, and they were incredible inexpensive.  MUST GO BACK!  You need to go and try this place out, now :)

Om4QRDjmEB8PMbioHuFkTg.text: Bachi Burger is a little drive from the strip, head towards Henderson. It's not too far but if you don't have a car or don't like to drive out of Vegas, then you're potentially missing out on an awesome meal. Even though this restaurant is away from all the city lights and sounds, it's still pretty well known as it should be. It seemed like a good amount of their customers were locals. Random out of towners like us would pop up probably either by word of mouth or Yelp of course. We arrived around 1-2 pm and had to wait about 10 minutes for a table. The interior is clean, nothing fancy, simple designs and decorations, but the food is another story.  Service was quite on point. Our waitress was cheery but not overly fake-friendly. She returned numerous of times to check up on us and to make sure our drinks never dipped below half way. Even the manager(s) swung by to ask how everything was. All that was missing was for the chef to come out and greet us which I didn't expect would happen anyways.   Bachi Burger seems like they're a mix combination of Japanese and Korean entwined with a fusion/gourmet twist. I saw both cultures' ingredients on the menu. To start we ordered the Oxtail Chili Cheese Fries - with garlic aioli and a fried egg ($11.50). If you haven't figured it out by now, we Asians love to put a fried egg on everything: rice, noodles, burgers, and apparently now chili cheese fries. Forget house fries; order yourself one of these bad boys. You can easily share it between four people but if you're like the Craig R. who orders EIGHT items for two people, then this may not be sufficient. Check what he ordered in his review. The colossal mix was addicting and the skinny fries are a perfect blend. Then again, I'm biased against fat fries. When the server attempted to take the dish away to make room for our main entrees, I caught myself snarling at her because I wanted to eat the remaining four pieces.   I was seriously stuck in between two places when it came to ordering my burger. Either Kiki's Burger ($9.5) - Angus beef, sauteed shiitake, enoki & eryngi mushrooms, caramelized bacon, sweet onion marmalade, gruyere cheese, garlic chili aioli (doesn't it all sound heavenly) or the Kalbi Burger ($9) - Angus beef, kalbi marinade, green onions, house made kimchi, ko chu jang mayo. The Kalbi Burger won this time, only because Gooch who recommended this place to me told me to try it. Although I have full confidence in the Kiki's Burger, my Kalbi Burger was instant gratification. The mixed blend of Angus and kalbi sauce with the kimchi made me feel like I was eating at a Korean BBQ joint. To knock it out of the park for a grand slam, they should've or maybe I should've asked for them to throw a fried egg in it even though that might have be a little over kill. You can't go wrong with this burger. However, if I was to return I'd like to try Kiki's Burger to compare the two.  I got to sample the Spicy Miso Burger and all I have to say about that is that it's not spicy at all. Also, my Kalbi Burger already had the knock out 1-2 punch so it would be unfair to say that this miso burger was mediocre. At that point, I was already mesmerized with my order.  If you have a car or willing to travel a little out of the Strip, then venture off to Bachi Burger for an appetizing meal. They do close late on the weekends: 2 am, so you have plenty of time to plan your visit. The prices are reasonable, the food is sick (& great presentation), and the service is superb.  Good looking out Gooch Y. for recommending this spot!

NYPCWoahcilGtOM1wr_-zw.text: We started out with the oxtail chili cheese fries. These were quite good. For those that are weary of oxtail meat, you wouldn't tell much of a difference from standard beef. The plate was enough for a few to share. As for the main course, I had a regular hamburger, added avocado and fried egg. It was a tasty treat and I was not disappointed.   The atmosphere seemed to cater more towards a younger crowd. They play pop music, have decent staff and not much to complain about. The prices are mid level but food quality is in line with prices. Would definitely try again

jfriG5PyncqY5cZD_Q0LjQ.text: Definitely did not live up to the hype.  The burger was overcooked (asked for medium, got well done), fries were dry, soda was extremely watered down.  The Shishito Peppers appetizer was pretty awesome, though.  I had the Mr. Hoe's Burger.  It was tasty enough but not something to write home about.  After hearing so many excellent reviews I was let down in a big way.  There are much better burger joints in town.

7GpIMEIqiMrFEUJElO98UA.text: This place seems crowded at all times, so make sure to schedule extra wait time! We were there around 11:20  for party of 6 and waited about 20 minutes to be seated.  The burgers were unique and interesting. I had wagyu burger, and I did not think the beef was better than Angus burger ( but it costs more).  My husband had spicy miso burger (angus) and that was tasty!   I will go back there when we have out of town guests because this place is unique. I do not think we will be regulars there though. It is pricey for burgers.

Osm3HR-35MaAvxaiOJfrPw.text: Absolutely the best burger in Las Vegas... or quite possibly in the US?  Most of my experience comes from the San Francisco Bay Area, and I've tried dozens of places, if not hundreds, from cheap burger joints to upscale restaurants. Like Umami Burger, Roam Artisan Burgers, 4505 Meats, Mission Beach Cafe, SuperDuper, Chow, Marlowe, or even Spruce... Some of them were fantastic, but Bachi goes even further. My wife agrees.  I don't know what makes us addicted to their burgers, but I'm pretty sure they put some kind of cocaine in the ingredients. We need to blow a whistle to invite DEA to stop this madness. But before doing that, please allow me to have one last bite of the Miyagi-san burger... or the Kiki burger... or the Ronin burger... or the Just Fries... oh please help me!

HkaHt6mmPmrbcQzvRvU8qw.text: Was in Vegas and I really wanted to try this place.  So of course, being the spoiled princess I am from my friends, they came with me :'). I loveee my friends.  Anyways, one word, YUM!  My friend got the banh mi one, my other friend got the ronin? and I got the kiki's burger.  Mine was soooo good and man the burgers were freaking huge!  We also had truffle fries and the pork belly baos.  Was seriously stuffed to the max and I had such a hard time finishing my burger.  This place is so worth the try and I can see myself back here again !

pFxVCrQ4ZW1LVjKIAojUeQ.text: Setting of the restaurant was pretty average but their food tho #onpoint Ox tail chili cheese fries is a MUST try, meat is very tender and the cheese they use was a very soft tasting cheese and use thin slices of fresh jalapenos.  If you like spicy I would ask for extra jalapenos! Also got the Banh mi burger, there is a dip that comes with the burger.  USE IT!! Not sure what that sauce was but looked kind of like fish sauce. I will def be going back to try their pork belly/lamb steamed buns. This place needs to expand either in LA, OC, or SD!!!!!!

It's not too salty, it had a sweetness to it which was different but not bad at all. It can get pretty packed fast, so keep that in mind. Service was friendly, I would def recommend it to people!

LQDpvr3Nv4lXR1HuhQiDrQ.text: I don't know why people said the prices are high. For the quality of food the prices are actually fantastic.   We tried the fried calamari which was amazing and one of the sauces that came with it was soooo addicting.   I tried the Shogun burger and it was one of the best I've had in my life.  We got dessert which was the caramel marshmallow shake. They didn't skimp on the caramel and it was a perfect way to top off the meal.   Looking forward to coming back and trying everything eventually on the menu.

IpKHIf2TVdI1tgIBNmA_NA.text: Started off on a bad note b/c someone misquoted the wait time over the phone. With 6 pre-adolesecents in the party = not a happy mamma. I griped to the manager (Frank), who was incredibly patient, heard me out until I got my point across, and was still very apologetic and accommodating. (Thanks to Frank, our party of 12 was back on track.) Seated in 35 min - not what we were quoted but better than the 'up to 45' they quoted when we walked in.  Really enjoyed the food and the service was good. Tried the Spicy Miso burger, along with the Parmesian and Sweet Potato fries, and really enjoyed how flavorful the food was. (If you want it spicier, just ask for some sliced peppers.) Reminded me of bibimbap in the form of a burger. Everyone in our party was happy, esp my husband b/c they served Arrogant Bastard. We all marveled at how the buns reminded us of baos.   Will definitely stop by again the next time we're in Vegas.

ZOZ_ln0yp6L2IfcYhefhPQ.text: Seriously the best Burger and fries I've ever had the pleasure to try.  I ordered the Banh Mi Burger and couldn't even think of one bad thing to say.  The burger was perfectly cooked and super juicy. The herbs and daikon were very fresh and provided a nice crunch. To go with it I ordered the truffle fries, haven't had truffle fries before so I can't really give a good comparison, but these were delicious.  The Vietnamese Coffee I ordered was a bit light. Too much milk, and they didn't use the normal condensed milk. That's really the only bad thing I could think of with this meal.   The service was great, it was nice to see that the manager actually rolled up his sleeves and was helping out taking the trash out and wiping tables when it started getting busy. Usually never see that.   The interior was nice, very clean.  Only thing I could have dealt without was the music, it was very loud for time of day I was there.. Oh yeah, and the hipsters... I could deal without them too but it didn't distract from the amazing meal.

s20tESdpajCyF8IybjzlOQ.text: I was reading about this burger place awhile ago and finally got to try it last month in Vegas. Asian infused burgers isn't something many places have tried making, but they should, because it's delicious!  They're located a few minutes from the south strip outlets. The place is clean and very modern looking. They were busy for the lunch crowd but not hectic at all.  Pork Belly Steamed Buns - Open style steam bun loaded with flavor! Thick slice of pork bun that melts in your mouth.  Salt and Garlic French Fries - I go crazy over garlic fries. The fries were skinny cut and were the perfect size.  Mr Ho's Burger - Featuring Angus Beef , Pork, Green Onion, Cilantro Ginger, Garlic Hoisin Mayo, Chinese Sausage, Sauteed Mushrooms, Mizuna, all inside a Taro Bun. This burger is like a Chinese pork bun burger. I love the Chinese sausage which was implemented in the beef patty. The garlic hoisin mayo was sweet and tangy, and the taro bun balanced out the flavors of the meat.http://s3-media1.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/MGMXM26c3CIDRHT_NsaeSQ/l.jpg  All in all, everyone in our group loved the burgers here. Service was top notch when we were there. I will having seconds, thirds, and fourths here in the future. The unlimited green iced tea is the cherry on top!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mr. Ho&#39;s Burger

KPmR45goMLK0sNKAdfsmAw.text: Seriously awesome food! You have to start with some apps here. The pork belly buns are to die for...can't go wrong with the duck either. If you have more than 2 people with you, try the oxtail fries. All of the burgers are great. Perfectly cooked with a unique Asian fusion spin. But go with he Bahn Mi burger. The combo of shrimp, beef and pork is killer. The Miyaghi burger is wonderful too, as is the one with the Kim Chi. Good beer selection too.   Service is ok but the food is so killer it doesn't matter. We usually go 3 times a year.

AavKwMxZdW8FyJmIJa58pg.text: Tried Bachi Burger for the first time and was so impressed!! I ordered the black and green burger. The patty fit the bun perfectly and the bun was soft and held together. The service was phenomenal as well. Great atmosphere! I would definitely recommend this place.

umrfEDNa-_QqqtZ-uQLlww.text: My first visit! Went here with 3 other friends after work one night. The restaurant was full and we waited about 20 min to be seated. The reason why I'm giving 3 stars is because the service was lacking. I don't know if it was an off night but the service we received could be improved. No one came to our table to even take drink orders for a good 15-20 min. When we did get someone and started ordering, they were out of a lot of food items. Thankfully they weren't out of the burgers we wanted...how ironic would that be? It took a while for our food to arrive as well. I want to say a good 35-40 min. I don't know if that's the average wait time for food at this place but that seems quite long to me. However, I do have to say the burgers and fries were delicious. I got the miyaki-san burger and truffle fries. I tried my friend's garlic and pepper fries and those were good too. While I'm not in a huge hurry to come back to this location, if I were in a mood for their burgers, I would try the one closer to where I live and hopefully that location has better service.

6fHAOIlQv6JeEf1hPpo_kA.text: I've been looking forward to coming here since I made plans to go to Las Vegas a couple of months ago. Since I've been waiting for so long, my expectation has been building up so high. When I get to the restaurant it's anti-climactic. Not today, Not here.   You can smell the burgers from the parking lot. If the smell is half what it taste like, I was going to be happy. It was and more.   We got here at 3pm on A Thursday, only a few customers were present. We got seated immediately.   Here's the rundown: Grilled Kurobuta & Arabiki Sausage - delicious, almost like a JapaDog but skinnier and smaller. It was served with some whole grain honey mustard, perfect pairing. Yum!!  Pork Belly Steamed Buns - OMG Delicious. You get 3 per order. The steamed bun was airy. The pork belly was melt in your mouth goodness. Hoisin sauce made for a perfect little bite. My only quibble would be the boiled egg, which didn't add anything to the dish. A sunny side up quail egg would have been just over the top good on this, but that's just my take on it. It's still a very very good dish.   Oxtail Chili Cheese Fries - another winner. A huge portion of perfectly cooked fries (crunchy outside, soft inside) topped with Garlic Aioli, Stewed Oxtail and a Fried Egg. The oxtail by itself was so good, but adding everything else was just superb. Must order for sure.   Shogun Burger - talk about a decadent burger. The burger is made with Wagyu Beef topped with Unagi, Pan Seared Foie Gras, Poached Asian Pear, Miso Butter, Yamamomo Peach & Arugula. It was salty, sweet, bitter, peppery, savory deliciousness. Is this what they call "Umami" if not I have a word for it "Delicious!!" It's got a hefty price tag, but well worth it.   My son had the Grilled Cheese w/ Fries, Carrots and Apple. It was served with a Bearnaise sauce on the side. My son is a picky eater, but he devoured that grilled cheese. The adults devoured that bearnaise sauce, oh so good. Anything with that sauce would be good.   Usually reality out performs our expectations, not in this case. Reality out performed my expectations and it was high to begin with. Incredible meal.   5 Star Plus I'll definitely be back.

Location is clean, organized, and the servers are very attentive.  Truffle fries are DIVINE. Can't wait to come back  so I can pig out again!

LULOW1S8LU71nPHsSyK_JA.text: Before coming to Bachi burger, I did my homework.  I researched the menu, read reviews on yelp, and even watched "triple D" just so I'd be prepared.    Somehow I just wasn't WOW-ed. Maybe if this place weren't so over-hyped and crawling with other foodies lining up outside, I would've lowered my expectations just a tad.    We ordered the Miyagi and spicy miso burgers with garlic fries.  Both were decent burgers flavor wise. But neither were juicy nor truly satisfying.  The fries were warm, well seasoned, but not crispy.  For the prices, I felt a little ripped off.    Service was pretty good. Food came out in a decent amount of time though it did seem like some other tables were dragging.    Overall decent and if in the area again,  I might give it another try.

PkYgXNJcjmtARo4MVpc9zg.text: I've been here twice... the first time I would've given it 5 stars, but the second time deserved 2 stars, so I went with an average of 3.  The food was DELICIOUS both times, but the service the second time was absolutely terrible.   First, about the food. Oh. My. Gosh. It is cooked perfectly. I'm not even a burger person, and I ordered the mushroom burger both times. My mouth waters just thinking about it. The sweet potato fries and truffle parm fries will also get your mouth watering.   First time I visited the service was spectacular. The second time, it took 20 minutes for the server to welcome us and take our drink order... from there it got worse and worse. The waitress got our order wrong, then never checked on us (I needed a side of ranch!) and the icing on top was that she billed us for another table's food PLUS ours. It was frustrating.   3 stars for this joint. Know you'll get good food, but only a 50/50 chance of getting good service.

hDguq_O4RMafWvGdF56dEA.text: What can I say, this place is amaze-balls!  Honestly you can't go wrong with any burger.  Everything is pretty yummy!  But if I must, let me give you a few suggestions...Kiki burger-Bomb!  Miyagi-San Burger is bomb AF.  Kalbi burger-really do I need to go on....but for real tho...BOMB.com.  Don't forget to order some oxtail fries!  Another winner!  I've also had their garlic shrimp special...this is as close as you can get to Giovanni's shrimp truck on the north shore of Oahu.  Yes I'm from Hawaii, I know what I'm talking about.    Overall, great place to get your burger fix.  Next time I need to try their shakes, heard those were delicious.

QtYKkr96PnKBYCaXtHsUDQ.text: When I say Ricky is seriously the highlight of my entire week, I mean it. He was so friendly and accommodating from the moment we came into the restaurant! He suggested certain food items and they all turned out to be amazing. Quick side note: The Parmesan truffle fries were absolutely fantastic! I truly enjoyed this overall dining experience and will recommend to all my friends. Can't wait to go back and see Ricky :)

Q-tST20z1DS9hmdb1r0QAA.text: Amazing food. The burgers are juicy, crispy, and full of flavor. The brioche bun is warm, fluffy, but holds up to the burger. I went because they were on diners, drive ins, and dives and they lived up to the hype. The variations on fries are amazing and generous helpings. They even have a decent sized beer list with great prices.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HMm0NIEfrTuGSU1oFqm6UA.text: Bachi is short for Hibachi - Japanese type of grill. Bachi itself means karma.  Ordered: - Oxtail Chili Cheese Fries $11 - Kalbi Burger $11 - Miyagi-San's Burger $15  Tina's Treasures and Tribulations - We arrived about 10 minutes after they opened and the place was pretty packed with people waiting and tables full - Only waited a good 6-7 minutes to be seated - This place is definitely an Asian fusion of foods and burgers - So of course my friend and I yelped this place before we ordered to see what was the MUST order items - The oxtail chili cheese fries were good, but a con would be that it has to be eaten right away or the fries get super soggy. It was really good and I'm not even into beans as much as a normal person would love it. Garlic aioli sauce was on point! - The Kalbi burger was taste and different with the kimchi and ko chu jang mayo that was in it. The angus beef was on point so freaking good. For the price, I would say it's worth it.  - We went to Shake Shack the day before and I don't think they compare at all. This place definitely takes the lead for creativity - The Miyagi-San's wagyu burger wasn't as great as the kalbi. I think the wagyu beef seemed a little undercooked, but we did ask for it to be medium rare - it fell apart as soon as we cut it in half. It wasn't melt in your mouth good. It was flavorful and juicy & the onion rings gave it a crunch that I loved. That egg though! - Friend and I decided to order two burgers and share that. Obviously, we are like two little girls who cannot eat as much as a guy can so there were left overs. If you're hungry, I suggest get your own, but I think if you get fries and one burger - you can become full or content - We ended up putting the bread/burger buns aside and ate the meat :) - Will have to come back to try the other options!

2Z4KlgOTZqJ1MNYS7evcog.text: Salted caramel shake Truffle fries  Miyagi burger  Takoyaki Effin amazing this place is ... I dream about their milkshakes and drool over their burgers

aIdmwEdKkotxnOnxx2pAkA.text: This place was a little over-hyped for me.  First thing first.  The wait was around 30min-40min on a Sunday (lunch time). Anyways, the host comes out lets people know there is open sitting at the bar and we immediately go in.  The hosts disappears, so we ask the manager if we could sit at the bar cause it was open sitting (just to make sure), but he tells us to wait and he'll ask the host.  We wait, until two gentlemen behind us, just walk and take those two seats at the bar. WTF? Kind of pissed off, the host eventually comes and we tell her our story and she says there is nothing she can do (-____-).  Keep in mind the MANAGER probably forgot to ask the host, cause she didn't even have a clue.  We get the manager and he eventually finds us a seat at the bar.....  Anyways. The FOOD:  Miyagi Sans Grass fed Wagyu Burger  - Furikake, onion rings, caramelized bacon, fried egg and chili mayo. Pretty good, but not the best burger though. We asked for a medium, but the burger was almost well done...  Ronin Burger - Caramelized onions, cole slaw, a fried egg, with some type of aoili on the side. This burger was ok. Not what I expected. The caramelized onions were a little too sweet and there were tons of it on the burger.  Oxtail chili cheese fries - The chili was a bit on the sweeter side, not your typical "chili", but it was different.  This was very filling, try to split with someone.   Maybe next time I'll try the pork buns, since I heard it was good... but who knows.

2eru0MgX1BwSqkWYmon8_w.text: Stopped in here based on a Yelp search for a place to eat off strip since I had a rental car on this trip.  Easy to find and plenty of parking.  Service was quick and friendly.  The burger I ordered was really good.  It is not huge but it had plenty of flavor and I devoured it pretty quickly.  It was a little messy but very good.  The fries were also really good and you get a nice portion.  Definitely worth a repeat visit.

I29qhUlCUUU73vxB19CgkA.text: Freaking delicious burgers!!  If you're coming here for their ramen, you're coming here for all the wrong reasons. Get. Their. Burger!  And the truffle butter fries!    The spicy edamame starter was a hit.  They were super flavorful and plentiful, but it took a while for it to come out.  5 minutes into eating them, our entrees came out.  The chicken wings were a bit off for me.  They were crunchy, but kinda warm in the middle; not piping hot like fresh chicken.  And a bit on the dry side...  The ramen? I made the biggest mistake by getting their ramen because I almost always instantly regret not getting the burger.  The ramen is good here, but it's super f'ing greasy!  Which is strange because their fries and burgers aren't as greasy as their ramen...?  Service is a hit or miss - depending on what time you come in... I've seen people walk out due to service.  (They've been sitting there so long without service, that I was getting pissed off for them).

KU1bySlSvFPonZ3gFKNyWg.text: They were out of a lot of ingredients and couldn't serve half of their menu. We came in at 12 and they'd been open for an hour.   Service was also really poor. They served our food and we didn't have any space on the table. They could've at least offered to take some plates out of the way. Our server hardly came back to check on us. Only to tell us that they were out of something lol.  The food, or whatever they could actually serve, was alright. One of our orders (wagyu burger) was ridiculously burnt and charred. We got our fries hecka late too.  Don't believe the hype. Or if you do, just don't go to this location.

TA-y6qH6lskh3WJ9zDA9-A.text: I liked my burger here, yes. But the BEST burger in Nevada? I don't know about that...  They have an extensive menu with lots of options but I recommend sticking to a burger and fries (or some pork belly buns for those of you who don't like burgers!). We did NOT like the oxtail chili-cheese fries or the Bachi Caesar salad we ordered. My suggestion is stick to the regular fries without all that gamey meat and what not added on top!!! & do NOT order a salad LOL I give you permission to be a fattie for this entire meal, it was one of the worst caesar salads I've had and we ended up only taking a few bites and then throwing the rest away.   My favorite burger out of the three I tried was the RONIN burger!! Caramelized onions, cole slaw, a fried egg, and all of these delicious sauces... What's not to love?!?! The Shogun burger has a lot of hype because of the foie gras in it but none of the boys liked it. I thought it was tasty, BUT very sweet! due to all the fruit in it and perhaps more suited towards a girl's taste palate. However, there were a lot of different flavors and it could get a little overwhelming if you had to eat the entire thing.  The miyagi-san's grass-fed wagyu burger tasted just like a good ol' fashioned BBQ burger if that's what you like but I felt that it was something I could get at a lot of other restaurants and a little plain for me especially after trying all of the other burgers bursting with flavors.  If you live in the area and like burgers, you should definitely check this place out. We had a good dinner but I don't know if I'd particularly recommend going out of your way if you're only visiting for the weekend and taking the drive off the strip to eat one of these burgers.

MwO9AIuwLixlzvl40j1p7w.text: We ordered the Oxtail Chilli Cheese Fries, Wagyu Burger (done Kiki style) and the Black Garlic Tonkotsu Ramen. The burger and ramen were amazing, and greatly savoured by us. However, the fries were a disappointment - they didn't taste very special and we wished that we had ordered something else instead.   Service wasn't too great either; our server greeted and took the orders of the table next to us even though we had been seated before them, and we had been waiting for a little bit waiting for someone to take our orders. Their food also came out before ours, even though in the end we managed to place our orders before them as they needed more time to decide on their orders.

LsDEuLZdZoJS_IcPZHWz7w.text: The food quality and taste is 5 stars, but service is slow and everything comes out at different times which makes eating together very challenging. Half the party ordered burgers, they both came out separately and well before the two bowls of ramen.  The gyoza appetizers came out last!!  Gyoza is also covered in chili oil with dabs of chili paste which doesn't go well with kids.  We were afraid to send it back, fearing how long it would take to get plain gyoza so we tried to wipe it all off with napkins.   We also ordered the oxtail covered fries, which were delicious.  The oxtail is more like chili so don't conjure images of the oxtail soup you get at the Cal.    We tried to order a shake, but their machine was broken.  The waitress said they could try to see if "the other side" had ice cream to make it with.  At the end of the meal, the waitress asked us if we still wanted the shake as she obviously forgot she never game back to tell us if they found the ice cream.     They really should think about remodeling and making one kitchen so they can time the meals better and probably get more seating to cut down the wait time!    Employees don't seem very happy to be serving you as they're stressed and overworked with the types of crowds you see every day of the week.

V918CjzvbvvFAgX4PMRlXg.text: The service is terrible. We waited 50 (!) minutes for two burgers and fries (don't they have those ready to go?). and the restaurant was busy, but not crazy busy. The waitress didn't even check in on us until we asked a co-worker what was up. Too bad - the food is really good!

EOqnuKXGwu619ZXtu9mleQ.text: The food here is very good but the service was very poor. The only reason for the 2 stars was because I enjoyed the food. The waitress was attentive to our table but the entire time we were there she was in the kitchen yelling and cussing at the back staff about something she was upset about. Another different employee yelled & cussed at a busser for getting in her way. Our waitress also failed to tell me that there was an extra $4 charge for substituting a chicken patty into the Spicy Miso burger, even though both the regular Spicy Miso & Chicken Burgers were the same exact prices. Everyone was either yelling at each other or walking around the restaurant very fast to get around without acknowledging the guests.

5w7H9EUkqEPiGNxNTm-M1w.text: Sitting here at my table right now in discomfort in result to the staff yelling and cussing at each other, in full volume so every customer can hear. In my perspective, this type of action is very unprofessional and it definitely gives the place a very bad and uncomfortable vibe.  Before even being seated, my sister and I heard 2 servers going at it and cussing at each other, to the point where we heard every single word they were saying to each other.  After 20 minutes into eating our meals, a different employee who was carrying 2 packs of beer, made a scene and yelled at their hostess/busboy who did not move out of her way in time, and said "FUCKING MOVE NEXT TIME WOULD YA".  This was not even a foot away from where my family and I were eating.  PLUS next to us we're a family of 3 with a young child, who also heard her as well. Overall, the food is okay but the atmosphere and personalities of majority of the employees here is disgusting. I honestly could not even finish my new because 1.) too much yelling and arguing was happening and 2.) I was just uncomfortable with the vibe in the restaurant. Not going here again and hope they improve the way they speak to their coworkers....

DnQgDxI9NZM4SiLimda6SA.text: They've combined their ramen place next door. Ramen was okay, not the best broth or meat i had on it. Service was a little too rushed. Couldn't split the bill more than 3 ways when most restaurant could. We asked them to split it to 2 different tables and split it that way but it seemed too much of a hassle for them.

uiuQC6D4m4gz5WowjHeY9A.text: Good food but would prefer less roaches "The imminent health hazard closures begin at Bachi Burger on Windmill and Bermuda where the roaches are so comfortable that a health inspector held one in the palm of his hand. " ktnv.com/news/dirty-dini...

6iaz1W4fzgjfhcqQO_s7YA.text: Maybe my expectations were a little too high.. because the burgers here were just "good." Not great, not spectacular, and not even memorable.  In an age where we have options like Umami and BurgR, Bachi's conceptually awesome... but my experience unfortunately left my tastebuds wishing for more flavor.

ul-4fOYrZF9TNAqZ1ovTNg.text: Family in town, wanted to try Bachi, so we loaded into the cars and headed their way, only to find, a line!  It's packed and of course, we gonna wait.  I smell the flavors floating our way while we wait and my mouth is watering like crazy.  Love the Kiki's burger, and as usual the burger is cooked perfect, the flavors so palatable and titillating, I wish I had two!  Love their sweet potato fries.   Good service, very good food, always a good choice for a burger.

6jarl3wJQrRS176YOd_Yjg.text: Food $12 Ronin Burger The Ronin buger was pretty much BBQ and egg. It has a strong Korean BBQ flavor but it was super messy. The mustard that came with it was uncessary since the burger was already flavorful enough.  $10 Shoya ramen The ramen had very few toppings and a slice of fat. The broth was too salty for me.   $4 Shake It's kinda hard to screw up a shake because it's usually two ingredients and that's about it. The shake was nothing special but it looked pretty.   Decor The interior is hip and modern. Women's bathroom was broken ...not that I go there regularly or anything. Their website sucks. It doesn't have the prices and I don't really care about their origin story.  Service The ramen and burger are cooked in separate kitchens so they might come out a different times.   Would I come here again?  Probably, though I would try something different on the buger menu and avoid the ramen menu.

Qi-TYBuPFJ235Ys-Ofp3gw.text: Vegan and Gluten Free review:  I had a salad. It was the only thing on the menu I could eat. I'm totally fine with eating salads, so that is not the reason for the 2 star review. The 2 stars is for the bad service and bleh salad.   I had the kale salad with the candied pecans on the side. I asked if the pecans were candied in butter or if they had any dairy/eggs/etc and the waitress gave me a blank stare and responded quite rudely, "I don't know. We buy them in packages". I asked if there was an ingredient label I could read and she was all, "No". Awkward. I ordered the pecans on the side because someone at my table wanted them for her kale salad (same salad). When my salad arrived, the waitress placed the plate on the table and said, "We ran out of pecans." The way she said it was just so crass and she had a 'too bad' kind of attitude. Whatever. I looked at my salad and it was literally missing more than half the things that it should have had. It was leaves with dressing on a plate. Who thought this looked good before sending it out?! I got the attention of the waitress and asked her about the missing cranberries and avocado. She was like, "oh there aren't any cranberries?" Well, that's what I just said, isn't it? At this point, I was totally over dealing with people. When she returned with the missing toppings, she gave a random (and poor) excuse. That was the end of my interaction with her.  Salad review: I didn't like the dressing because I thought it was way too acidic and there was way too much of it. There was no real balance of flavors in this salad and the toppings did not go well together.   Overall: If you're vegan and your friends really want to eat here, then go for it, but don't say I didn't warn you. If they're up for any burger joint, check out Yardhouse. They have mad awesome service and a great vegan section on their menu (VEGAN BURGER!!!)

gFH_A35DxwFQDNgy3_QzDg.text: I use to live a few blocks from here and when it came to burgers, I had choices from the strip, In-N-Out, and Steiner's.  I wasn't aware of Yelp at the time, so I took the advice from a friend to eat at Bachi and became a fan ever since.  One thing about Bachi is the presentation.  Bachi goes out of the way to make a burger look so beautiful.  I have to admit that I've been here 5+ times and the Sahara location 10+ times in the last 2 years and have yet to try any of their actual burgers. I know, what's wrong with me right?  I guess it's because I love their Bachi Fish (Alaskan Cod), the Lonely Bird (Chicken/Turkey), the Oxtail Fries, and their Bachi Dog.  All are good, very rich due to their sauces, flavorful, and a little messy.  Out of everything I've tried here, their Bachi Fish has to be my favorite.  Couple of side notes about Bachi in general.  Sometimes there's a wait to get your order and served.  Because of this, I rarely hit up Bachi on a weekend.  The Sahara location is bigger and faster in my opinion.  Also, the burgers are little pricey (most over $10).   Overall, I am still giving Bachi 5 Stars even though I have not tried any of their actual burgers.  Based on the other reviews, they're good so don't let my review discourage you from trying them. However, allow my review to encourage you to try the Bachi Fish.  Both restaurants are clean, service always great, and I have never been disappointed with a Bachi visit.

Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lonely Bird
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bachi Fork

aGZ-kIcOmCLkYwVNYAVWHA.text: This place was freakin' awesome. Once again yelp did not let me down.  This place is actually just down the street to the resort we normally stay at, and it is now a must stop for when we come back to Vegas.  We arrived for lunch and was seated promptly. We ordered the oxtail chilli cheese fries and organic edamame for our appetizers. The oxtail chilli cheese fries were crazy good. It had the perfect amount of spiciness and toppings. The wife kept raving about how good the edamame was. If you like garlic then definitely give these a try. They have a very different take on burgers, and from what we tried you can't  go wrong with your selection.  I went with the Miyagi-San burger and it was one of the tastiest I've ever had.  Wagyu beef cooked to perfection. My brother tried Mr Ho's burger and he said it was good.  Tried a bite and he was indeed telling the truth. Wife had the kale salad and she loved every bite of it.  Our server was great.  Actually every worker we came across was great.  So yeah,  the service and staff was awesome.  Everyone was friendly, and our waitress was attentive to our needs.  I definitely recommend this spot, you will not be disappointed!
