vTb6u42w65y6YfOM8JsANA.text: If you want a good, interesting burger in Las Vegas... this is the place.  Good, crispy fries (including sweet potato and oxtail chili!)  The burgers are nuts-- the Bahn Mi and Kalbi burgers are my favorites.  Haven't tried the "wagyu and foie gras" burger yet.  OK, here comes the maybe-not-so-good stuff.  It's kind of a strip mall feeling.  Because it's in a strip mall.  And... the meat isn't the best burger meat I've ever had.  Kind of tastes frozen... or just CAFO-beefy.  Not bad, but not particularly beefy. They definitely focus on dressing up the average burger meat well.    But, they do that.  The burgers are great, and the beer selection's particularly good for Las Vegas, where most places seem hell-bent on serving Lite Beer or Blue Moon and that's all.  Worth a drive and a bit of a search to find if you're anywhere near there.

xTPtZVuZkzrRan2eci06UQ.text: Restaurant was full house so I've waited 15 mins befor getting seated. Everyone works for the place was super nice and friendly. I actually didn't feel like it had been 15 mins. Our waitress, Melissa, welcomed my group with big warm smile and explained menu items in detail since we let her know it was our first visit. We probably waited more than 20 mins for our food. However, its well WORTH the wait!! After my first bite of spicy miso burger, it made me want to sing at the table... yes it was just that good!! Angus beef was cooked perfectly. The medium cooked patty was very juicy and tender. I enjoyed the balance flavors between Japanese shishito peppers, egg and Angus beef. My salivary glands kick in overdrive when I tried to picture that burger and write this review. I also sampled Kiki's burger and Bachi house salad. They both tasted pretty awesome. I liked my Spicy Miso burger better. I was pretty impressed with their house salad. It came with pretty good portion and had mixed greens, avocado, walnuts and yuzu orange vinaigrette in it. This place has Truely won 5 stars in my Yelp book with its mouthwatering food, friendly price and supreme customer services. I will be back very soon to try Shogun Burger (wagyu beef, unagi, pan seared miso foie gras, poached Asian pear, yuzu butter and yamamomo peach)

AMe8W8sE61zIE5o7peDCCw.text: Food is always great. I've been here numerous time and the service is always the same...terrible and slow. It's been 30 minutes now and I'm still waiting for my burger. So far I've only received my water, not even any fries. The sad part is, the table next to me that came after received their stuff and they came after me. Does not make sense! If it wasn't for the food I would never come back.

EISFMZfLhV4FJN1WtviLSg.text: 2nd visit to Bachi - people, this is some damn good food ! But again, can't go 5 star cuz they need to work out the service kinks.  had a very long talk with the owner again - good guy and even with the service problems i'll keep hitting this place.  this time:  garlic/chili edamame - nice hint of lime, good flavor ( under $4)   crab cake burger - my date had this so i only took one bite - great flavor probably better if open faced.  grilled cheese - nice grilled bread but the cheese had an inconsistent melt - 1/2 the sammie melted perfectly, the other 1/2 didn't...strange.  french fries - cheese and i believe truffle oil - excellent !   pork belly buns - nice flavor - buns a little too big .  portugese donuts  cherry pop tart  The donuts = devine ; pop tart ...ok  pics added

xsfsOuC9hpIXdygWK0qXHQ.text: I effin' love this place.  Kalbi burger?  Yes please.  You guys need to open one of these in Chicago.  I will be at your door the day you open, like a hungry, hungry stalker.

WUmFIonT6aapR2aqGoz2eg.text: The best burgers in town. My favorite burger is the spicy miso burger with the truffled fries! It's always really busy so it might be a good idea to check the wait before making the drive. I think they should work on moving to a larger space! The food is so delicious the wait can be worth it.

w3kAv6aPxdQKLFnLZdGADA.text: I came here on recommendation from a friend... If saying the word "kobe beef" and "burger" before jumping in my car even counts as a recommendation....  Although being quite distant from the strip, this place lived up to my expectations. The "asian fusion" burgers were just as I dreamed they would be: flavorful, unique, and damn good idea. The menu was mouth-watering. They had so many items that I wanted to try.  I had the Ronin burger which had "Caramelized Onions, Japanese Cole Slaw, Miso Goma, Dressing, Fried Egg, Katsu BBQ, and Yuzu Citrus Aioli" ~if that didn't get your attention, then there is something wrong with you.  The girlfriend go the Kalbi Burger which was "Ground Beef, Pork, Garlic, Ginger, Chili Paste, Green Onions, House Made Kim Chee, Ko Chu Jang Mayo." AWESOME.  We ordered a side of Truffle Parmesan fries which was equally amazing.  If I hadn't tried the back abbey back in so cal, I'd call this place my favorite burger joint, it was close, but sorry, the best burger award goes to them.

ELRhKHJln7ZCc3zDgi7CwA.text: First time here.  I tried the Ronin burger with bacon and cheddar cheese...OMG absolutely delicious. This place is a must go if you're in town.

ZIf2UeS6NhTJXrV9_reOdQ.text: before you bite my head off, I gave it a 3 based on texture issues and that's a huge thing for me when it comes to food. Ambiance, service & flavor are a 4 but I couldn't get past the texture of the overall burger. Okay. Here we go.   We wanted to try this place after returning from Los Angeles and eating an Umami burger. From some of the yelp reviews this place seems to be a rising star with the exception of the service. I'm happy to say that they took our reviews into account and service is great. Now for the review.  I wanted a great burger, something different in town besides the usual burger joints. After reading about this place, despite service issues, I needed to try it for myself.  My husband and I headed down and we were seated as we approached the front counter. They need a "please wait to be seated" sign because the layout makes one assume that it's a place where you order at the counter. Anyway, we were seated by this adorable waitress and our drink orders were taken immediately.  The menu is simple and unique from any other burger place here. We decided on chili fried chicken appetizer, 2 kiki burgers, one truffle fries and one garlic, and 1 honeydew boba shake. The appetizer was good but luke warm making me assume it sat at the window for a moment. The flavors were really good but the plate wasn't what I expected. It's small boneless nuggets, not wings like I assumed. Still tasted great. The fries and burgers didn't take more than ten minutes and were nicely plated. All the aoilis were great. I was hoping that the aoli was made to order but I think it was made in a large batch. Still it was good and the one served with the truffle fries was so good that we ordered another side of it. As everyone says, all seasoned dries need more seasoning because it's not penetrating the fries but sitting as a sprinkle on top after being put in the cones.   as for the burger, the flavors are right on but here's the kicker-the texture needs work.  Here's what I mean. When you have the caramelized onions, soft greens, soft mushrooms and bacon and then the burger has a pate-like texture, it's slightly off putting. (see my cut open pic). I can see where some feel that the burger is too mushy, because it's texture is super soft rather than having that firmness that burgers have. Despite this, I enjoyed the flavor profile. Nicely done. For those who enjoy the meat flavor in their burgers, places like this aren't for you. This place is about turning other foods into burger form.  I would eat here again but I hope they try to add more textures into their burger. Try a cheese twill instead of sliced cheese to give it a change from the mush and softness of the burger and toppings. Other than that I liked it. The honeydew boba was nice, too.  You should give it a try for something unique. This place is about the experience, and you'll get a good one.

Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tZhhwoj5rf3A6b2M7joiZQ.text: Best burger in Las Vegas.   From the bun to the gourmet burger.  Flavors are so creative and the micro beers are unique.

KNFfTEKXojP6ftHfQgFw_g.text: All I can say is I wish we had a Bachi Burger where we live.  The food is fabulous!  Very creative and tasty.  Highly recommended!

bf12b9hGCCVuE6tdwgvs6g.text: The Kalbi Burger was very tasty. The fries were some of the best I ever had, but I didn't care for the pineapple ketchup. It became too sweet after a few fries. I also ordered a watermelon boba. It was awful, but since I'm not a boba expert I decided not to deduct a star like I might otherwise.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HOku5KOb8QhHmw8mbVw7gQ.text: Why does the most amazing burger place have to open right before swimsuit season? The Kiki burger knocked it out of the park and for only $8, this place could be really dangerous!  I am going to have to go back just to try the deserts!  The staff were nice and very polite about our questions regarding the lack of a veggie burger - chef should have one ready in a couple of weeks.  My only suggestions would be to encourage the waitresses to be more attentive. The lunchtime rush has not kicked in yet, but they still seemed to be a bit on the slow side.

EOZVHZMv1B_JZ8UunxbTdg.text: Why have I not written a review for BB yet? My 3rd visit in 8 months. Oxtail chili fries. Eat them fresh. They do not hold up well. Just recently tried the manga burger. Crab & scallops on the usual burger, pretty good. Had Ronin burger the 1st time. Staff's attentiveness is up & down but overall good. Have they finally solved the sewage odor problem?

pF3KHO_BaMvDUVfvVIs9tA.text: You can smell the burgers cooking as soon as you pull into the parking lot. And they smell great!  The mainstay is a bunch of Hawaiian fusion burgers. They all taste good. The fries, which are also a fusion kinda thing, are also very tasty. I highly recommend them.  There are a few salads. They are good, but it took forever to get the  order to the table and the portion was not that large for the price and time it took.  Then there is the usual drinks plus boba drinks. Good, but pricey.  All in all, I like Bachi Burger. It is a little slow, a little pricey, and not everything on the menu is worth ordering. But, it is a unique place, clean, friendly, and the food tastes great.  I'll go back till I try everything at least once.

cm-DDIcvMFC3o71JhjOVqw.text: First of all, the 4 stars are for food.  Service is one and half stars.  Very slow service, I think it was the waitress maybe forgetting to put in our order?  Several other tables that arrived after the two of us, got their burgers before we did.  Tried flagging the waitress down but she seemed to be avoiding eye contact.   Ronin burger was good, sauce was a bit sweet but creative combination. BF had the Black and green burger, he thought the blue cheese dominated the burger but I liked it.  Loved the buns, soft and light.  Ordered the truffle parmesan fries and garlic salt and pepper fries, loved them both.  Great menu, will be back to try the other burgers.

GHQ0Kb3Gr7AbXh2SpUnf2g.text: Awesome food and service. We had pork belly buns, oxtail chile fries, shogun and spicy miso burgers. All are must have!

lggn8iuIxQnmrUueuvI1xQ.text: Love this place! Great food!! Great service! Vegas need more spots like this

swiLyvwXpNWklKm1nZw6lg.text: Love the passion fruit boba and the sweet potato fries were crispy deliciousness! I didn't like the mustard sauce that came with it so much but they were yummy just plain. My shogun burger was disappointing because the patty was overcooked but the foie gras slab was generous and delicious. They offered to redo my burger but I didn't want them to have to redo a $25 burger so I declined. Later, since I couldn't eat the meat, I wish I had taken them up on their offer. Service is kind of spotty but the facility itself is hip and clean. Worth a try for sure!

MPYUllWyiXW-MPDl7Flpsg.text: Baci burger is a must! Their food is always freshly cooked, the staff is always friendly and the atmosphere is cozy but trendy. I always order the Kobe burger with an egg on it but without the furikaki while my boyfriend leans towards their sensational ramen bowls. They're a bit pricey but it's definitely worth it! Find your way to Baci burger as soon as possible.

J0qaNN-WnQ2ALHY-GWfxvg.text: Good stuff near the airport. We had the brussel sprouts, oxtail fries and meso burger. All were very good. The burger is more along the lines of a gourmet burger, very tasty. The fries have amazing sauce added to them and the brussel sprouts were chopped in smaller pieces with a great sauce on them as well. The only things I would change, would be offering up a pretzel bun option and using fresh cut fries. Other than that the food is pretty amazing. Service was ok. Parking was like regular strip mall parking. The price was fair and I would return.

_Gx5feFXKlCiQXZmik3L_g.text: Bachi Burger brings together my two favorite things - Asian Flavorings and Burgers. I can't pin-point which one is my favorite because they are all different (lies, its the Miyagi Sans burger but, I didn't want to hurt the others feelings). All I can say is that when you add an egg to a burger, it intensifies the flavors of the burger with the burst of the egg yolk. ::drools::: I can't say I am a fan of the oxtail fries OR the truffle fries but, the burger is enough to fill you up and doesn't really need extras as its the STAR of the show.   Try the vietnamese coffee to finish your meal but, order it half way through your burger, as it takes a bit to brew. A nice mix of condensed milk and flavorful coffee.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vietnamese coffee brewing table side! Yum.

nqN2VE_SfdPPHzyaBJqR7A.text: I have been coming to Bachi Burger since they first opened on Windmill. My wife and I have always enjoyed perfectly prepared meals and excellent customer service and we absolutely loved the food. Yesterday we took a group of friends from out of town to lunch at Bachi Burger and it was not a good experience.   We were a group of 12 and had made a reservation for 1 pm. We were seated and had our drink and meal orders in by about 1:20 pm. We were seated on the Ramen side and it appears we were out of sight out, out of mind. We sat for 45 minutes without being even checked on by our waitress. Our fries were brought out at that time. In an hour we were checked on once and had our water filled once. It was at least another 45 minutes before our burgers were brought out. One of the men in our group left without eating because he had been away from work for two hours and had to return. Over two hours passed before we were finally served our food. The food was not up to its usual high standard. The egg on the burgers had hard cooked yolk. It has always been cooked medium with runny yolk which adds to the deliciousness of the burger. I had told everyone in our party how great the food was and it wasn't up to the normal high standards. The service was the worst. When the waitress was asked about the two hour wait for food, she said they can't control the time and gave other excuses. When asked why we were never informed of the extended time to get food she had no answer and was defensive. She did apologize but it was not genuine and I truly believe she didn't care. This is not the standard I have come to expect from Bachi Burger and I am extremely disappointed. Bachi Burger has always been my favorite restaurant and that is how I characterized it to my friends. I feel let down. Our bill was over $200 and there was no consideration given on the bill in spite of the serious issues we experienced. This experience has tarnished my formerly high opinion of Bach Burger and I will seriously question whether I will ever return. Disappointed doesn't even come close.

tSlNUpeNqbRLO_U9dcVLlA.text: At first I was feelin the vibe. Everyone was so nice and food was fast and also was delicious. But towards the end of our meal, our server was not checking up on us. I mean we understand that there's other table to tend to but it was not that busy for anyone to come check is we needed anything else.... I was fine with that but when I ordered tonkatsu ramen Togo, I was excited to get home to it. As I opened the box, there was no meat. No tonkatsu. My ramen tasted like crap without it. It was such a disappointment that I was even thinking about posting this but I did. I'm upset that my ramen didn't look like how my boyfriends ramen did when he had it at the restaurant

Ru9YPt9T5enLgUdDtJJu3Q.text: The host was friendly and sweet. The burgers had good flavor. The bottom of the top bun on both of our burgers were very toasted and hard.  The bun was so hard I had problems biting into it, but after 5 or so minutes the juices from the burger softened them up. My complaint was the lack of service. We ordered our drinks and food at the same time because it took awhile for the server to come over.  The server dropped off my water and had the host bring my boyfriend's tea. Then we didn't see him until 5 minutes after we got our food. We had to ask the host for refills. It was also upsetting to see a server sweeping the floors and cleaning, not wash their hands, and then grab plates to bring to our table and another table.  Also as we were done and looking for the server we got to hear someone that works there tell a different server to ask her table if they were going to get dessert and that everyone needed to cash out NOW.  No worries we hurried out as soon as we could find our server, and the burgers were not good enough to overcome the poor service so we wouldn't go back.

tNnzkw2doYNOgmKfsvJiaw.text: So me and my family did a burger challenge in vegas and bachi happened to be one of our stops..we saw the place on diners drive ins n dives and the reaction of Guy of the food sold me..i shouldve known better than to trust Guy..we ordered the banh mi burger, oxtail chilli fries and the duck buns...the burger was very unique..thats probably why the kids hated it..i probably wouldve enjoyed it alot more if i didnt previously just have the best burger i ever ate at BurGr..as for the oxtail fries...i love oxtail and i think that set my bar for the dish very high..it was a regular bowl of chilli fries to me..and it wasnt even regular, it was wayyyy too salty...the duck buns were ok..the staff was friendly, but our napkins ripped as they were pulled away from the sticky table..food was average at best..

Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steamed duck buns, bachi burger
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banh mi burger, bachi burger

1uBHhnlXoF5y33-5Ih48Bg.text: You MUST get the oxtail chili cheese fries! So good. And try the Apple Lychee Soda. Yummmm. Any burger you get is not just a burger but an experience.   They're a bit understaffed but the food still came in a reasonable amount of time.   If Joan is your server, ask for sides up front (lemon, salad dressing, ketchup) because you'll have to ask for it at least twice. He's sweet, just not on top of the extras.   I'll definitely be back here and will recommend it to others.

iBBYIAsiI2oDj2xPcfTIkA.text: I kept hesitating to come to this burger joint because from several people that has been here said they didnt like it.  So, I never would come here when Brad T. would suggest it until one day, Im like "what the hell, why not?"  & Lo and behold!! I have fallen in love with this burger joint.  Was I imagining how great this burger (Miyagi-san's Grass Fed WagyuBurger) was! DELISH! We also ordered the: Salt & PepperGarlic French Fries & the Truffle ParmesanFries.  The truffle fries & you dip it into the sauce that goes with it.  It is absolute heaven, never tasted a fry that is so addicting (besides Mcds fries, lol) I can eat probably two orders of the truffle fries.   The service was superb, he was very friendly and recommended some things that we should try out next time we were there.  The ONLY reason why, I took away a star because I ordered Thai tea & coffee ice cream.  The thai tea was completely watered down, it tasted horrible. The coffee ice cream cost about $2.99 (I believe) it was soo tiny!   However, I would definitely come back here but I probably would never order the thai tea or ice cream again.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dwFzOvOuUMKYgoY4e2WSww.text: I think that a big downfall for a lot of places is when there is a lot of hype and it than sets very high expectations- exactly what happened for me. We got lunch on sunday afternoon in a group of 5 and waited maybe about 45 minutes for our table so not too crazy. So glad to be sat down and given cold waters haha we all ooh'd and aah'd over the menu. Everything on there sounds darn near perfect! Such an unique play on flavors, I love Asian fusion. Sadly, I don't think it was executed as well as it could have been though.    Truffle Parmesan Fries: the fries themselves were good, pretty skinny and crispy which is how we like them. However, you can't even taste the truffle on them and the porcini cream sauce on top wasn't too great. They serve a chili garlic aioli on the side that was tasty though. Oxtail Chili Cheese Fries: generous portion for the 5 of us to have shared. The first few bites were DELICIOUS! The more it cooled down, the sweeter it got so we weren't a fan of that. I was thinking there would be kind of chunky pieces of oxtail meat but it was in tiny shreds so im not sure I really got that flavor profile.  Miyagi-San burger: Wagyu burger with chili mayo, fried egg, FURIKAKE, crispy onion strings, and CARAMELIZED BACON. Sounds heavenly right? All the flavors complimented each other perfectly especially since I added gruyere. I did finds myself wishing I had also added some arugula to cut through some of the richness. My complaint about the burger would have to be that I had ordered it medium rare and it came out pretty well do- burnt on the edges well done. Our server had been pretty attentive prior but hadn't come back around so I just ended up eating half my burger and getting full...  Other than that, the Taro bun that one of the burgers came on was great! My friend got the Shogun which has unagi, pan seared foie gras, etc and he felt that It didn't taste like it was worth the $26 it was. The pineapple iced tea was addicting but there aren't free refills so savor it if you don't want to pay for another round! I woulddd come back but don't think I'd go out of my way to eat here.

QitkZ1L2SUBtHgZo9ctrLw.text: When I come to Vegas I don't like to leave the strip but I was sure glad I left this time around. This place is RIDICULOUSLY BOMB!   I didn't even have enough time to take pictures of my food because I was too busy shoveling it into my face..LOL   This place is a MUST if you're willing to leave the strip.

ojwV0jFA0KNfqjWMUx0cHA.text: A lot of time things on Triple D are a miss (Diners, drive ins, and dives) and sometimes I wonder how these places obtain such recognition.  But I have to say that Bachi burger is the real deal. Normally food like burgers and fries are very heavy and make you get the Itus aka food coma. Buf after eating here I felt light and refreshed. The food is a nice play on Asian fusion burgers and fries so if you're familiar with Asian food you'll get the subtle nature of how the flavors come together. (hats off to the chef because there are some very cleaver combinations).  The staff was friendly and we were seated right away. I know this place is off the strip, but at 4pm it was packed. So if you want to try this place go around the 2pmish time. My friend and I came here at 3:30 pm and there was a 20 minute wait so we opted to go to the bar.  No less than 30 minutes later there was a line at the entrance and people waiting outside. The burgers here are an excellent value and the Foie gras burger was on par pricing wise compared to the one I had on the strip ($28 range) the other burgers are ala cart and were around $8-12 depending on what you want in it.   I had the spicy miso burger and that was definitely a knife and fork burger (or lots of napkin burger). The burger was cooked to perfection. I really like the Taiwanese bun it was something different than what the normal burger joint has.   So all you Vegas ppl  if you rent a car I suggest that you go out here and try it.  If you don't like it and are in vegas when I am I'll buy you lunch somewhere else*  * Note: participant must be in vegas the same time as me and must not like bachi burger. (sorry I don't go to vegas that much lol...)

DJH9y5ZF7KdBuHRMOsgvfA.text: This place is overhyped.  Yes the food is more than just your regular burgers but for the price I expected better flavors and not just overwhelmed with grease.

pf-dF-rIiMX2QgahVKNRqA.text: Bachi Burger is on our black list!!! During our last and final visit months ago we walked out when a roach crawled up our table and into our beer glass. We trapped it and gave to the manager. They said sorry but didn't want to cause panic to other guests since this place is always full. They did divulge that the exterminator had come recently which admits they knew about the roach problem.

FTXQHnmmLukjEVBilj5AIw.text: I'll have the miyagi, please; the burger, not the person. That'd be weird.   When you walk in, it appears to be your average strip mall, Vegas-born burger lounge. But, looks can be deceiving...I mean, haven't you ever looked at a photo of a Big Mac compared to the real thing?   Burgers are made to order, or you can choose among their expertly crafted selection of gourmet options. The miyagi (if you can't tell) was my poison of choice, and goodness gracious was it worth it. Truffle fries reign at the top of their game, and sit alongside so many different french fries options. But, keep in mind they don't come with your order unless requested. So, request it.   Also, speaking of miyagi, did I mention that they have ramen? Noodle house/burger joint. Super random concept; brilliant execution.   Portions are pretty generous, so before you think you can tackle the American/Asian food breed easily--maybe, you should reconsider and back down. Pricing is pleasantly reasonable for gourmet burgers, and definitely won't break the bank in order to stuff yourself.   Wax on, wax off, Bachi Burger, and keep on fighting with good tastes.

qfxE0Z8099ta36bRA-VwZg.text: Rarely do I give 5 stars to any place but this is a great burger place. My friends and I ordered the oxtail chili cheese fries, pork belly sliders and Chicken nuggets thing for our starters. The pork belly sliders we could've done without but the other two, were freaken tasty as hell! The fries were tasty to another level, The chicken nuggets things were so good, I pretty much ate the whole plate by myself.   I ordered the Ronin burger which had all kinds of delicious on it! It had an egg, cole slaw, onions and all kinds of other stuff that I can't remember! It was too good. Everyone should come here and eat here!!!

ac9UTpPuwYbgQi9WWY9-hg.text: Thank you for making some out there burgers!!!  We learned of this place on Diners, Drive Ins and Dives and have wanted to go for some time.  We had hours to kill before our plane home so we planned to end our day here and it was a great last meal in Vegas.  Hubby had the bahn mi burger and it was tasty!  I had the miyagi San burger and it was pretty darned good too.  The side of fries were great - crispy and seasoned slightly.

8hYKu0F-vISbz-7vKvW9WQ.text: One of my favorite burgers of all time comes from Bachi Burger.  The Miyagi will hit the spot every time. Ive ventured and tried other burgers.like the Bahn Mi and the one with Bleu Cheese, both very good, but for own taste buds its all about the Miyagi. Also.tried the Ox tail chili fries...its chili fries, but made with shredded oxtail which tastes like beef.  You'd never know the difference. My favorite appetizer is the Japanese sausage.  Definitely worth trying. Get those!  Oh yeah, last visit grossed me out. Our server was wearing jean that looked like they hadn't been washed for months.  Looked more like a mechanic than.a.server. I mean it was gross he was serving us food! Go shower and wash your clothes! Management! Ask you people to look clean please...even the people next to us were saying how dirty the staff looked..because it wasn't just our server.

xQLcCwRG3Yu1GfN30n-v9A.text: Updated Review. Not as good as it used to be. Would not recommend going out of your way to eat here. Shogun burger is still good, but not great.

7gWFFpyWrk-hufVVnOrQ9w.text: If the special is still offered. ORDER THE MOCO LOCO. This is a LV gem for sure. Definitely worth the drive of the strip.

XEb3rTfAN_nWBpgNkFJzFg.text: This is the go to spot when you want to spoil yourself with a really delicious and unique burger!  I don't do this very often, in fact I would never order a burger for $26!  Well Never say never! Today, my daughter was just as intrigued with the Shogun burger as I so we decided to satisfy our curiosity and see what all the hype was about...we agreed it was very tasty but not ever having eaten pate we decided that would opt for something a little more tame next time.  The fries were tasty!  Bottom line:  Good service, good food and prompt, friendly service.

xL-jUBjp8w8duGj1cpFnsw.text: How can I describe the foodgasm that is Bachi Burger?. This place could turn Vegans into carnivores. It's that good.  We come here every few months and yes it's always busy, yes there's always a wait but yes, it is always worth it!!   The Ronin, Miyagi and Kiki are my favorites. I have a hard time swaying from those three but I'm sure one day I'll venture outside the triangle because I know I'll never be disappointed with the food here. The buns are perfection, the meat is always tender juicy and full of savory flavors and the toppings are outrageously good and the creativeness of each one is what makes these burgers my number one in Vegas. I can't get enough of this place. Along with the burgers order yourself not one, but 2 orders of oxtail fries because once you try them you'll want a full serving  to yourself! Basically chili cheese fries on steroids of meaty goodness.   The donuts are also amazing!   We will most definitely be back!

Anyways, this is a good place to try if you're a burger fan who likes Asian fusion stuff too.

mj7TFC4Dr9KBd5RbzNQNig.text: Influenced to go by watching Triple D on food network and was excited to finally had a chance to come here. However, left a bit disappointed, probably due to high expectations. The menu offers a good variety of options and concepts that most might not have experienced before but did not come to a surprise for us. We ordered the Oxtail chili cheese fries and a medium Mr. Ho's burger recommended from most  reviews. The burger had a great flavor profile especially the unique taro bun that complements everything nicely. The oxtail fries were a bit overhyped. The portions were more than enough for 2 ppl however, fries and chili cheese did not taste so great. We didn't get much oxtail considering the size of the plate and tasted mostly beans than anything. The egg is a nice touch though. Service was good for the most part and finding parking shouldn't be a problem. The menu is a bit overpriced especially for a burger and steamed buns.  Tip: Does the place offer a great concept of tradition to modern in their food? Yes. Worth the price? Not so much... especially if the quality of taste was subpar and if you're craving for a burger, I would recommend looking eslewhere.

hXwVpXStVf2FV9MxW7otxw.text: Awesome burgers, incredible oxtail chili cheese fries, and great service. They have fresh buns and adult milkshakes! This is one of the best burgers in town!  As a burger connoisseur, this is a must visit place. The menu is really fun but with a Korean twist. The Bachi pickles are a fun fresh twist on kimchi, but tastier. They serve the yummiest green tea. The fries are addicting and freshly made. I highly recommend you read through the burger descriptions to find exactly what you're craving!

P7njxMo8qLtV9l2_LbSn2w.text: I live right near here and stopped coming a year or so ago because it was horribly slow service. Come in today at 12:15 and order, 10 minutes later 4 guys sit next to me and order. Wouldn't you know it, 35 minutes after I ordered they get their food and I don't have any.  Waitress offered to discount my meal since i had to leave and she'd pack it up to go. What a dreadful experience from a once great place. It wasn't busy, but clearly no management on site and zero training being done. Oh well, first review ever on Yelp I'm so irritated.

PrnSfDQR_TZLq90qCwbKeg.text: The burgers were pretty good. Although when I order medium, I expect not so much of a char on the outside of the patty. I ordered the Kiki Burger with a Wagyu patty, and I feel the style bun doesn't match with that burgers ingredients. The garlic and salt fries were so over washed with the taste of ginger that it numbed my tongue and overplayed tasting anything else. Service was bad considering I was paying 16 for a burger, the busser was rude and the server did not seem interested in being here. Overall, I would not recommend this place to anyone.

8_wy3IJ3DTnwgDQYStpHGA.text: This place is so good.   Great healthy salads, hangover remedy ramen, and out of this world burgers.

iBhe3OuT_UNZcOnfxkLBCg.text: Business traveler (party of 1) review: Saw the # of reviews, the DDD (diners, drive-ins, & dives) show & had to check it out. Day 1:  Great local seasonal beer. Had the Oxtail Chili Cheese fries: absolutely incredible (A+). Had the Mayagi-San Wagyu burger: definitely enjoyed, might have expected a more blow your hair back experience (B+).  Liked it so much, came back the next day: Day 2: Another great local beer. Had the best server I've prob had in 5yrs (Jim). Got the Spicy Miso Burger customized w/ Wagyu beef (thx Jim): A++++. Just incredible. Had teased this item on day 1 and was talked out of it by day 1 server. No fault/harm, but I much preferred the Spicy Miso. Just awesome. Also had the GRILLED KUROBUTA & ARABIKI SAUSAGE app; also amazing (A+). Topped day 2 off w/ the donuts and coffee ice cream which was decadent and filling (B+). More than I needed, but could't be more pleased.  Perfect for the business traveler one-off.   Server (Jim) was one of the best servers I've ever had. Thx bro. Give this guy a raise.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Miyagi-San burger &amp; 9Oxtail Chilichese fries

DZ1SQhnV0nmVSS5nxtuS6Q.text: During my recent trip to Vegas, I stopped by Bachi Burger with Ken L. due to rave reviews from fellow Yelper and friend Anh T. You were right, this place did not disappoint. It was nice to go off the strip and explore some of the other great food places Vegas has to offer. There are two locations for Bachi Burger, one on Windmill Lane and one on Sahara Ave. We came on a Monday for lunch. Good thing we got there early before the lunch crowd packed the place.  I'm a big fan of burgers and loved the idea of an Asian fusion burger. I ordered the miso burger and split the truffle parmesan fries. Ken L. ordered the Mr. Ho burger and a glass of their Plantation Sweet Tea.   The truffle parmesan fries were really tasty and addicting. The plantation sweet tea was refreshing, had a hint of mint flavor, and was not too sweet.I really enjoyed the flavors of my miso burger. The burger was juicy, the buns were nicely grilled, and the veggies in the burger were fresh. I also enjoyed the taro bun on the Mr. Ho burger.   I would say the star of the burgers is actually the Taiwanese style buns. They are freshly made made locally in a Chinatown bakery and to the restaurants specifications. They are slightly sweet but super light.   Note: I hear they are going to open up a location in Southern California.

eds8fMUST1T-wf9z4H57JA.text: This restaurant is a little bit small so do expect a bit of a wait. For our group of 5, we waited about 40mins or so.  They have a very appealing menu with lots of unique ingredients in their food, which is what I like.  Our server was on point. He always made sure we had waters and clearing our table of finished dishes.  Truffle Fries $5 These fries were good but not the best i've had. We couldn't really taste the truffle all that much, but it was cool because it was also topped with truffle sauce and extra dipping spicy garlic sauce on the side.  Oxtail Chili Fries $11 These fries were good as well. It was a very large portion and was the perfect sharing size for my group. The chili was a bit too sweet for my taste though. And I wasn't exactly sure how much oxtail was in there because it was super mixed up. Probably like tiny skinny shreds of oxtail. But I would still recommend it.  Miyagi San Burger $15 I got my burger cooked medium rare and it was perfect. Pink on the inside and brown on the outside. Overall the burger was simple but delicious.  Plantation Style Iced Tea $4 A bit pricey for tea but it was well worth it!!!! Delicious pineapple tasting tea. Must try!!  I found out after my meal that they had taro buns!!! Definitely getting that next time!  Overall it was good and i would still love to come back and try more of their menu items!

7GS0KhTKB0O4aNRuacZhLQ.text: HOW LONG I WAITED-- Friends' food came out at sporadic times. The ramen I ordered came out 15 minutes after the first entree was on the table. We game with a group of 11, but timing is very important when it comes to group eating.   WHAT I ATE-- Pork belly bao's were great. Spicy miso ramen was great once it came out.   WHY I CAME-- We phoned in earlier to ask if they would be able to accommodate a group of 11. The hostess was very gracious on the phone and in person.

52c5_JB2XVloN3IYvQ6PiQ.text: To ALL burger buffs, meat hounds, Asian flavor fanatics, diner devotees and to just-plain ol' hungry human beings:  I dedicate this experience to you all!  It all started one cold Saturday evening in February 2014 when the bf and I decided to pop our Bachi Burger cherry. Wait time: 25-30 minutes. Though medium-to-large groups lingered in and around the restaurant, these groups were diminishing at a pretty impressive pace. Names were being called from left to right. It didn't take long until the hostess finally said what I've been yearning to hear for the past half hour..."Rachel."  Once seated, the menus eagerly flipped open and the bf and I were enticed to such great heights. The selection of starters and burgers were bountiful but after careful consideration the lucky winners went as followed:  Ox-tail chili cheese fries: This appetizer should be a REQUIREMENT when dining here. A large, hot plate stacked with crispy thin fries immersed in generous amounts of salty and savory chili, shredded ox-tail AND crowned with a perfectly fried egg--tell me what's not to like? This portion is perfect for 2 adults with a tenacious appetite.  Kiki burger (my choice): I knew this burger was calling to me when I first read caramelized bacon and sweet onion marmalade. The words 'caramelized' and 'sweet' being the major deal breakers. Unfortunately, that's where the courtship between Kiki and I comes to an end. Though the meat patty excelled in juiciness and the bacon maintained its candied glaze, it fell short elsewhere. I was underwhelmed by the not-so-sweet-non-existent-taste-of-onion marmalade and the slight bitterness of the greens. But it wasn't a total fail for my appetite. Like a short-lived romance with an ex--we shared some good moments and also some bad--but in the end, I never really saw any great potential. Kiki just wasn't meant for me.  Ronin burger (the bf's choice): Any burger with a fried egg is pretty much en route to the bf's belly. There's no way he's going to let it slip on by. The only problem with this burger was that it was HIS and not mine. We cut both our burgers in half and traded so we could sample each others but deep-down inside as soon as I sunk my teeth into this burger I was hooked. Ronin grabbed a hold of my taste buds and never wanted to let go. It was love at first bite. So many wonderful things were happening in my mouth that made it nearly impossible to ingest. An orchestra of flavors and textures that was beautifully executing a rhapsody. I wanted to salvage the juiciness of the meat, the sweetness of the caramelized onions, the tang and crunch of the coleslaw and even the saltiness of the fried egg. Bravo Ronin. Bravo!  If my experience doesn't make you want to feed the beast then you're completely and utterly missing out. Bachi Burger is a MUST try when in Vegas. Their Asian-fusion/Asian-inspired take on the classical American burger is pure genius.  Don't believe me? Then just listen to what your inner soul is saying because I'm pretty sure it sounds something like this...  GO. TO. BACHI BURGER.  NOW!

WKNJUAFejCR8d93G43v1Yg.text: Oxtail and truffle fries are the way to go.... It's simply amazing!!! Best fries I have eaten at a gourmet burger place. The sauces on both of the dishes makes me crave for more!! Burgers are good also, but IMO the flavors get too overwhelming after the first couple bites. mfjiqMA5flaA7pA7XJZf5A.text: Forget the wait time. Forget about knowing burgers. You don't.   One bite of the Miyagi Burger and I swear my mind goes crazy over this ridiculous burger! Whoever thought furikake and beef goes well deserves a Nobel Peace Prize. SERIOUSLY. Grassfed beef, crispy onion rings, OMG bacon,chili mayo and that fried egg combined with a toasty bun makes this place an automatic 5 stars.   True to following Yelp, we ordered the Oxtail Fries and the Truffle Parmesan. Man, those fries are so good with and without the sauces, and while I preferred the classic tastes of the Truffle Parmesan, the hearty flavor combined with the delicious chili cheese makes the Oxtail a must get!  The Sake Sangria is not a bad choice for those who want to get their pre-buzz on but actually enjoy the burger and not collapse while eating it! A combination of Sake and Sangria works pretty well, and while I only had one, I think next time I'll try both styles and see which one is better!  There are so many reviews of this amazing place, and I believe if they continue to strive towards perfecting their burgers, they're unstoppable! You deserve the 5 stars Bachi Burger!

4TOjf8iJD6UMOJTKXQ2fRw.text: Oh man. If I could import one restaurant from Las Vegas to Denver, I'd have a hard time deciding between this and Osi's Kitchen. Apples and oranges, I know, but this was one of the best damn burgers I've had...ever.   First off, the entire menu looks amazing. Every single burger. Every single everything. After seriously analyzing every menu item, I eventually figured I couldn't go wrong with any of them, and opted for the Kalbi. Holy flavor bomb...seriously amazing. The bun was perfectly toasty, the sauce was so flavorful, the patty was perfectly cooked, and the texture and flavor combo was spot on.   I visit Las Vegas annually for business, and I will ABSOLUTELY make a point to come back next time I'm in town so I can try something else. But...um...maybe they could open a Denver location? For me? Please? Franchise, maybe? PLEASE?!?!?

KcyavimcMOhrgNqYxNyBJg.text: Came here last week with my girlfriend because we haven't had bachi in awhile. It was on a Friday and surprisingly wasn't too busy! We were seated quickly. The server got us our waters and took our order immediately. My girlfriend ordered the Kiki and I got the Miyagi san burger. We also ordered the truffle fries. Food came pretty quick and the quality was good. The reason why I give this place a 4 star rating is because service is pretty slow after they take your order. They tend to forget about you after you're eating and don't bother checking up on you if you need anything else or more water. Had to ask more than 3 times for water refills. Also had to remind them for my check. I do remember other instances were service was a little better, but not amazing. Overall it isn't a bad place come eat if you enjoy burgers. Oh! Before I forget avg price per burger seems to be around $10-$16

ZJFzKz4uHvOk8V6gGOsE0g.text: My family and I loved Bachi Burger before, for the great food and service. Unfortunately, both have been lacking the last couple times we've been here. We were a party of 5 and came in during dinner rush on Sunday. Our server was nice, but our drink/food runner had much better service skills and was more attentive than our server was.  The drinks came out quickly (thanks to the awesome food runner, these two stars are for you). We ordered 2 types of fries and the Japanese Sausages as appetizers. Those came out in a timely manner. The sausages were disappointing, as they are not the same and too greasy.  Our server might've forgotten us, because he took our order much later. We ordered 3 burgers and 2 salads with chicken well done.  This is where the experience really goes downhill. 2 other tables received their burgers before we did, and they were sat much later than our table. Our burgers finally arrived, but the salads had not. By this time, the place had cleared of the dinner rush.  We waited a little longer, and half our table was almost finished with their meal. I got up to speak with the manager and cancel one of the salads.  Since when does a salad take longer to prep than the burgers? I understand we ordered the chicken well done, but salads normally come out first regardless. As I talk to the manager, the salads arrive. One was sent back because that person in my party lost her appetite with the long wait. The manager said the food took longer because of the well done chicken request. We didn't order a well done thick piece of steak that takes much longer cook time. A small piece of chicken doesn't take that long to cook well done.   I was not pleased with his response to default to our preference as the cause of the issue. The manager was kind, he offered to take the cancelled salad off the bill, and said he would box the salad up to-go. I was satisfied with that, until the manager dropped the bill off with a quick, "sorry for the inconvenience" and forgot the to-go salad he promised... We paid the bill and made our getaway, it wasn't worth bringing up.  The restaurant's severe lack of kitchen and food order management needs to be addressed. You have fresh ingredients and things take a little longer to cook, I understood that as a frequent guest of your restaurant. But the way this was handled was insincere, and mediocre at best. This will be the last time I bring anyone here.

zeJwdtexY320UAVt5CvHzQ.text: Two things are guaranteed in life when entering Bachi Burger 1) Ordering Oxtail Fries 2) Ordering an amazing burger. My friend recently moved down to Vegas and started creating all these foodie spots that she really liked. When I came down to visit her, bachi burger was the first place we ate at. I went during lunch hour so there was no wait for us. It was a party of three. I looked at the menu and my friend right away ordered the oxtail fries while we were looking at the whole menu. Oxtail fries are a MUST. The hype is real and you'll see as you try it out yourself. The egg on top of the fries was perfection alongside the oxtail. Amazing combination. For my burger, I got the miyagi-San burger which is the BEST burger I've ever tasted in my life. I've eaten at a lot of burger spots and nothing beats this. It was Cooked to perfection and there was so much flavor to it. I savored every bite before it was all gone. If you love burgers or just want a great spot to eat at then try this place out. You're not going to lose. Thanks Bachi Burger!

yvPMcZ9W-H_F9HLlxAWRdQ.text: Used to love coming to Bachi Burger. However it seems that as they expand the quality has gone down. Bachi is a place we've brought 10+ different groups of people visiting town to because it was worth it. 2 months ago we ate here and the food was meh. Truffle fries were undercooked, buns burnt and they forgot all the sauces on our burgers.   Last week I took my parents there because they had just moved here and it's close to them. While we appreciate friendly servers, having your employee stand at our table and proceed to talk the entire time was not necessary. Nor was it necessary for him to come back and continue his drivel while we had mouthfuls of food and wanted to have our own conversation. Now let's get to the food.   We all ordered our burgers Med or Med Rare. They were all brought to us well done and the paltry grey color of frozen meat patties that by health code rules cannot be cooked below medium well. Again our burgers had no sauces and our truffle fries that showed up 10 minutes after we got our burgers were woefully undercooked.   Do. Better. Bachi Burger

jzei-H9LmI1Vgvsd-MV9og.text: It's pretty good not as much as other burger joints . Try it not by favorite . I like other burger joints better like in china town .

fkDWklzIJhtL_0kGHNjVzA.text: This place was very good! The burgers were cooked perfectly and had a good vibe going on! I got a drink with Whiskey and Mint and it was the BEST Cocktail I have had!! We will for sure go back to check out other items on the list!

VI9DRqTOYs23xOE7ES3XwA.text: The wait can be ridiculous but  I always get VIP treatment and not have to wait EVER. Unlimited iced matcha green tea and cherry yuzu soda, FTW! They have specials: crab dip and manga burger. Some make it to the regular menu, some don't. My faves include: shogun burger, miyagi san burger, Kiki's burger, steamed buns (pork belly or duck), sausage and truffle parmesan fries.  Shogun Burger: Wagyu Beef, unagi, foie gras, poached Asian pear,  miso butter  and Yamamomo peach on the side. It's very rich and fatty but oh, so delicious! It's worth the $26! 5/5  Peking Style Duck Steamed Buns/ Pork Belly Steamed Buns:  Duck Breast, cilantro, scallions,  radish,  boiled egg, Hoisin BBQ sauce. The buns are fluffy and the duck skin is nice and crisp, the duck meat is tender and juicy. Pork Belly is fatty good. 5/5  Grilled Kurobuta & Arabiki Sausage: Sausages with a side of honey mustard. A great appetizer. 5/5  Oxtail Chili Cheese Fries: With garlic aioli  and fried egg on top. The chili itself is a bit sweet for my taste. Not my favorite thing on their menu but it's still good and worth a try. 4/5  Salt & Pepper Garlic French Fries: Sprinkled with Maui onion sea salt  and garlic chili aioli on the side. The dipping sauce is good, the fries are ok. 3/5  Truffle Parmesan Fries: Parmesan Reggiano,  black truffle cream with sun-dried tomato aioli on the side. This is one of my favorite fries in Vegas/Henderson. Very tasty! 5/5  Ronin Burger: Angus beef with caramelized onions, coleslaw,  miso goma dressing, fried egg, katsu BBQ and  yuzu aioli. Refreshing because of the yuzu and rich beacause of the egg. 5/5  Kiki's Burger: Angus Beef  with sauteed mushrooms, caramelized bacon, onion marmalade,  Gruyere cheese and garlic chili aioli.  Miyagi-san's Grass-Fed Wagyu Burger: Wagyu beef with chili mayo,  fried egg,  furikake, caramelized bacon,  fried onion rings. This and the Shogun burger are the best burgers on their menu. It's a thich burger so you have to cut it in half and press it down just so it would fit in your mouth. 5/5

Pb_ymDXxJIV97C9QswqlBw.text: Extremely disappointed. Way over priced, terrible customer service and to top it off my son got food poisoning not sure if it was the undercooked meat or the undercooked egg. It was a to go order for over 35.00 for 2 burgers. I tried calling to inform them about my son getting I'll but the phone just rang so two days later when my son was well enough to be left alone I went into the restaurant to advise them of my sons illness and wanted to know if anyone else was sick. The manager was a young kid that obviously had little experience. He said he had not heard of anyone getting sick. Then when I asked why the don't pick up there phone he said it's broken. He offered no refund (I had my receipt) nor did he ask how my son was feeling. Nothing but a blank look on his face. I walked out and will never go back.  DQ offers better food and deals!

wRGBbLV8Sq0psH_fFcc6xg.text: Tried this place in June when I came to visit Vegas for a weekend of fun. I was embarking into an awesome food traveling that time around, since all the times I went to Vegas, all I did was party. I found out about this place through Diners, Drive-ins &Dives. Yes, I can watch that all day long. Dont judge. Im a fatty :) Anyway, enough with the intro...  Wait was about an hour. It was PACKED. I was guessing it was THAT good, that every Las Vegas partier came here for hangover cure. It was a pain in the butt having to wait outside knowing that it was 1000 degrees outside. Waiting area of the restaurant was tiny, but I managed to squeezed in.  Food: Oxtail Chili Cheese Fries- My yelper people were absolutely right about this one. YUM YUM YUM YUM! I would order it again in a heart beat. It was meaty, fries were crispy &flavorful.  Pork Buns: It was like the asian tacos. Sweet pork flavor, in a soft fluffy white asian buns. Delicious!   Shogun Burger- Had foie gras, unagi &wagyu beef. This burger was okay, but definitely NOT worth $26. Maybe it was because I am not a big fan of foie gras(duck liver), because of the gamey taste, &the burger is a little on the sweeter side. Unagi made the burger a little fishy, but the wagyu beef was good.   Banh Mi Burger- Awesome rendition of the Bahn Mi Sandwich. I definitely recommend.  Service: It was okay. Waitress couldve been a lil more friendly, but she was preggers from what I remember so I understand that her job could probably be a lil stressful.   I cannot wait to travel back to Vegas &try other dishes at this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shogun Burger, Pork Buns, Oxtail Chili Cheese Fries, &amp;Banh Mi Burger

ebLOsV2orCRREBgQo0kghg.text: Triple D definitely found a winner here.  Bookmarked this place after seeing it on TV and am so glad that I did.  I would never have thought to order their infamous Oxtail Chili Cheese Fries, however they were so delicious.  The plate was literally scraped clean.    Also their No Meat Here ... "Burger" was one of the very best vegetarian burgers I have ever had.  And I've eaten A LOT of veggie burgers.  Everything from the eggplant to the tofu to the mushroom patty was on point.  A really great combination of flavors.  I would definitely come back here, just to order this particular burger again.  In fact I can't wait to take my vegetarian sister here.  That's how good it is.

LRrbrrQSLZsaFL5PM3S3gA.text: Started with the oxtail chili fries. They were tasty and a bit spicy, but not OMG so good. I can't say I would order that again.   Also ordered the miyagi-San burger. It was so juicy and cooked to perfection, although my friends burger was a bit over cooked based on what he asked for. You really have to flatten these bad boys down and be sure to come hungry because it's a lot of food to eat!

Ek0-WNLlyCjyu98xF8ex1Q.text: Wow.... We really loved this place.  The burgers were fantastic.  We ordered various burgers and all were spot on.  From the Kiki's Burger to the Chicken/Turkey burger, all were yummy.  The fries were big enough to share and were done just how I like them, crispy but not too crunchy.  The only reason I didn't give this 5 stars is because they showed 5 or 6 different beers both on the menu and a chalkboard on the wall, but disappointingly only had 1 type on tap.  No reason was given to us as to why.  A variety of drinks from wine to beer were available.  Service was nice and quick.  Well worth the trip away from The Strip in Vegas.  Will definitely visit here again.

F682-EZPCuwfLCrKs7R1yw.text: So sad that I had to take the time to write this first of all because I loved it here. First they told us they didn't have any noodle soups  prior to us being seated which was one good thing. They were out of everything, no mixed drinks, out of every beer I asked for so I was tired of asking and said so what do you have? My kids ordered there food and they come out 10 min later and say there out of what they ordered. It was freezing while we were eating, unpleasant eating experience as I couldn't take it and informed them were done and we had to go and eat at pizza rock for a great experience!

236Bg44D0D7BsWqx5lISPQ.text: Stopped by this place after my friends that I was with in Vegas wanted to go after seeing it on Diners Drive ins and Dives.  The funny thing was only one of us actually ordered a burger, but the ox tail chili fries, which were featured was really good.  Definitely a must.  I got the spicy chicken with some rice and onion rings.  The onion rings were amazing.  I could have easily have eaten another order, by myself.  Also a must.  The chicken was good as well.  It hit the spot for me that day.  My friends each ordered the buns, one with duck one with pork belly.   The burger looked good and my friend said that it was pretty good.  I also got a milk tea with boba.  They seemed to have merged with the Ramen place next door (which is how i was able to get some rice with my chicken) so there were items on the menu that were not something you would expect at a burger place.  We were there on a Friday at lunch time and we did wait for a bit.  There were quite a few people waiting in front of us for a weekday.  Once we were seated, service was great.

VuoWeaxvVPJO1GPZTYHizA.text: we were rebels and did not order any burgers..  however! we did decide to order a couple dishes go share. if you're a fan of Loco moco or tried/had a Loco moco before, you absolutely must must must try theirs! I'm used to garlic rice but they do theirs with a creamy risotto topped with some light and crispy onion rings. the beef patty layer was topped with a sweet but super zesty bbq kind of sauce. definitely a melt in your mouth combination. are you drooling yet?   we also ordered the pork belly steamed buns. it comes with a side of the similar sauce as they put on the Loco moco. the buns were so finger licking good that there's no other way I can put it into words - just get it. try it. eat it. love it. seriously. seriously!!   between those two dishes, they were extremely filling. the food was absolutely great, our server was sweet but service was just a little behind. not sure if they were short staffed but between food delivery and closing out our check, there was a lot of awkward waiting time in between.

rxsYxjLOMeMPqhcya6Luww.text: Theres something to be said about a good burger place.  Memories of the perfect bite and good 'ol American BBQ's.  The Nostalgia remains but there is a fresh and creative twist to these burgers.  You must go and see for yourself, but I urge you to be adventurous when you order and try to be open minded about the Ala Carte menu (hence the 3 stars), it will definitely make your bill climb but lets remember it's gourmet.

NrP-iObNx0ztXbxUs5_ScA.text: Hands down the best burger in Vegas!!! Well it's quite the drive off the strip, but it's worth it.  Oxtail Chili Cheese Fries are one of those creations that are made to blow your minds away. You take one bite and your eyes will light up. You eat that oxtail and you can't even tell it is even ox. It just melts away in your mouth. If you saw all of us eating this dish you would think we were a pack of wild animals. In a blink of an eye it was all gone. It was just that good.  I tried the Ronin and the Kiki's Burger and they were excellent! There is so much going on with each burger. Each one gives unique flavors in every bite. You get something sweet, something salty, bitter, citrus, soft, crunchy... savor every bite because once it is gone you'll be wanting more.  My friends got the Shogun Burger and he wouldn't share it with anyone. It was worth $25 so I can understand why, but man I wish I had a chance to taste that perfect looking burger. Guess I know what to get when I come back.

0bDsqSg-lsiWhurE27619g.text: Oxtail fries. Just shut up and order them. Don't question it, just get them. Your meal and your overall quality of life will be better once you eat them.  Anyway, I love this place. It's right down the street from my house and definitely holds a special place in all of our hearts.   My first time going there I got the Ronin burger, which I definitely recommend. It's delicious. It's salty, sweet, crunchy, soft, juicy, tangy, refreshing, gooey, and messy. It's everything you want in a burger.   Seriously, Bachi burger is great. It's got a cool vibe inside, they have a good beer selection and a great menu of delicious, un-pretentious food.   Just go there.

6S8eLtdCj8ZpgkgqsxhFcA.text: Hands down best burger joint I've been to. Affordable and amazing service, our waiter was super friendly. His names Dan :) I got the miyagi sun burger medium well and oxtail fries. Oh my gosh. It was absolutely on point. Very satisfying meal and definitely want to come back here. Be prepared to wait in line though! But it's DEFINITELY worth the wait!!

LN5n7pTMKnjeyqHGLzmiOw.text: Bad customer service from almost the entire crew working except the pregnant lady. She was very helpful and attentive to our needs. I had to ask for a refill. Not once did we see our waitress. Not to mention the young Caucasian male host asked a few table around us if they  needed anything not once stopping by to ask us until my husband flagged him down to ask for a refill. There were many workers around just not helping like I said the only one was the pregnant lady. That's sad! We also ordered the Black and Green burger I believe that's what it's called and it was bland also they forgot to put one of the main Ingredients "blue cheese". So we asked worker since we never saw our waitress and his response was what would you like me to do. Uhh? Why do we need to answer that when yiu guys messed up on our order. Anyways he brought us two sides of it and the burger just sucked having to add your own ingredients when it should come already with it. In my opinion I would stop by the other locations and hope they have better customer service and make their customers feel welcome cause we didnt at this location.  I will NOT return here!

VtcnDLskTl0qzNJa5tEvbw.text: Finally stopped by Bachi Burger to experience everything people have raved to me about. Everything started out great - assorted pickles, oxtail chili cheese fries with a fried egg on top, truffle Parmesan sweet potato fries with pineapple ketchup. Our server seemed to be having a rough day as she messed up our order several times and forgot to bring a coffee we ordered after asking about it on 4 separate occasions. I decided to go with the Shogun Burger ($26) which is Bachi's premium burger: wagyu beef prepared medium, foie gras, unagi, Asian pear and arugala. Something didn't taste right from the beginning but our server never even came by to ask how everything was and seemed way too busy to even want to bother her despite the fact we were sitting at the bar right in front of her. About halfway through the burger I deconstructed it to find out what was wrong and I realized the beef was the issue: over cooked, dry and completely flavorless. I spoke to the manager who came to the table in a very unpleasant manner and said she would take care of it. Upon returning she informed us that she had kindly removed 10% from the entire bill which sounded great but turned out to be $7 - $7 off of a $26 dry and flavorless burger. I told her it would not suffice and she informed me that since I had eaten half of the burger, that 10% is all she could do. She offered to make a new burger for FULL PRICE and I told her that is completely inappropriate. After she went back and showed my burger to the chef who was arguing with her in plain sight which allowed me to see and hear everything he was saying, he told her to comp the burger in disgust. She brought the bill back, threw it down in front of us and walked away without saying a word. I'm not saying this is a typical day at Bachi Burger but it was absolutely disgusting behavior. The burger was just bad. The meat was flavorless and the patty was about as thick as a Burger King Whopper patty - definitely not $26 restaurant quality, especially since the other burger that was ordered was a thick and juicy correctly prepared and very flavorful patty. To top it all off, the bathroom was a complete mess with what looked like food or possibly some human excrement ground into the floor: I nearly vomited at the sight. Despite all of this, I would not expect to have the same experience again and would give the place another shot and I would recommend it to others because there are so many options on the menu.  In the end, they handled the bill correctly and comped the burger but they are completely ill prepared for handling these situations. Our server seemed so overwhelmed and busy that she was completely inattentive but was very kind and compassionate and apologized repeatedly for the quality of the food. A patron shouldn't have to argue their case for a $26 Burger - you're a restaurant, own up to your mistake and take care of it. A happy restaurant brings happy patrons who spend more and write great reviews.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail chili cheese fries, sweet potato fries with pineapple ketchup, assorted pickles, Shogun burger and Black &amp; Green burger.

aS3LsgE8fyISP-YW0SeB4g.text: Vegas is one of the best places in the country to eat and this place is just further evidence of that fact. We got the oxtail fries, banh mi burger, and miso burger. So incredibly well cooked, seasoned to perfection. You have to try this place.

jhI20i3jxyHiynlfWiSNgA.text: Let's just say I'm from San Francisco and I make a trip to Vegas 2-3 times a year and it's now going to be a tradition to go to Bachi as part of our itinerary. THAT, or I'm not leaving until I get my Bachi fix!  It's SO WORTH the trip away from the busy strip of Vegas. I've always loved Asian fusion burgers mainly because of the execution of pairing Western ideas and concepts with Asian sauces and marinate. I love the Ronin and Banh Mi burger; both had distinctive flavors but was not overwhelming! The burgers had key ingredients that were so proportionate and was just perfect with the moist patties and soft baked buns. I also tried their oxtail fries; yay for the topped fried egg. What isnt better with a fried egg?!  I wish Bachi expanded to Norcal. It would be a HUGE hit! Until then, I'll have to order two burgers each visit in order to try all their burgers. I said it Bachi -- you guys are worth the calories. I'd get fat for ya.   Bachi Faithful! :P

SCQGgchc0SOi9sBalSuXxA.text: I got so sick off of this food.  I will never eat there again.  I have never been so sick in my life. My husband and I eat out a lot.  I got really bad food poisoning.  dont know if something was bad or if the pork in the burger was not fully cooked.    Be Careful Pork must be cooked all the way if not one may develop trichinosis. (look it up)

nuKOG3WWdBYTA_fc7e0qvA.text: This burger joint remains rock-steady consistent with their high food quality and its presentations.  Dan is the man who knows how to make every visit like your first.  The food is number one.  The forethought of the seating hostess is truly suspect.  Why would you try to cram seven good sized adults in a corner table that is designed for six?  And we were among the first five parties that opened the restaurant.  Of course, we refused to accept such an amateurish and unprofessional choice.

_C_u9eDD2hFlgiHec_-jUg.text: There is nothing more to say than if you are looking for some fresh new flavors in a very cool vibe place you must go here! One of my favorites is the Ox Tail fries! Don't forget to add extra sauce and share with a friend as these are almost a meal in themselves.

ZeQhLhyNL2uZnJ0FdkWAmA.text: Bachi Burger has not disappointed other then the fact that we were seated a really hot room, I guess the air conditioner was not working in their newly added room. The service was great and everything we ordered was great. My girlfriends and I split 4 burgers in 4's so that we could each try a different burger. We shared 2 orders of Ox tail chili cheese fries and onion rings and everything was so good.   If you are traveling from LA to Vegas I would make it a point to stop by Bachi Burger to eat here, it gets pricey when you taxi it over from the strip so its a must stop before arriving or before departing Vegas.

EwS54h0toKvteUDJEImmrg.text: Love the salted caramel shake and the Kiki burger! The wait for food is long but it's worth it

OcxWacaJrdWFffbWC5WynQ.text: Wagyu beef is very good. Highly recommend. Jon said cherry shake with liquor and chunks of cherry was great. Loved the Kim Cher pickles had sesame flavor. Blue and green burger yummy.  Will come back not much of a wait if you go early-6ish.

9-RmOsKyXyJ2M-rulDZHiA.text: At diners, I usually order a burger with a fried egg on top. It's standard procedure.  At Bachi Burget I saw the Miyagi Wagyu and knew that one was the one for me. The burger has the fore mentioned fried egg, PLUS furikake carmelized bacon, chilli mayo and onion rings. Sounds amazing right? It wasssss. The bun was soft, the burger was juicy and flavorful. I also ordered truffle fries but I didn't want to put the burger down. I left full and satisfied.  Prices were reasonable and service was good. I heard the oxtail fries and the pork buns were delicious too, that will be reserved for my next trip.  Absolutely loved it... highly recommend.

PQ9EXjbZB4hvOjXX17W2Mw.text: It's a cozy interior with a good setup. Music selection was excellent. Had the wagyu beef burger and it was delicious. Good Rogue and Stone beer selection. Reasonable prices as well.

9z4ZpHyoUEBEA3yXAxN8ZQ.text: Heard all the great thing about this place.  My first time try with a group of friends.  Waitress is is rude, we wait 40min for our food .. my burger is over cook, the buns super hard, the fries undercook.  Worst burger in Vegas

ary-kBUGiqsAIdBfZBT2Ig.text: A few weeks ago, I went here with a couple of friends and my boyfriend for his birthday. It was my first time ever eating here and with all the praise that I've heard from this place, I had high expectations.   It was Saturday lunch time and it was expected to be busy. It was a 40 minute wait but it wasn't too bad--I just wish that they would have additional seating other than the 8 they had inside the restaurant. However, this doesn't affect my review; more seats would have been nice.  We were seated in and everything was so loud and fast-paced. Our server wasn't very good at listening to our orders however, but it was probably due to the loud noises (even though we practically yelled our orders). The server was also a bit irritating because when one of us wanted to get the burger cooked well-done, she asked if we wanted all the orders to come together since preparing a burger well-done would take a while and we said it was fine but she insisted on bringing the orders out as soon as they're done. We had to reassure her like 3 times that we wanted them out at the same time.   I ordered the Ronin and it was very delicious, however I tried the Miyagi my boyfriend ordered and it was even better, but to me it wasn't THAT great like everyone said it to be. Same with their truffle fries--quite delicious, but nothing too special.  Despite its deliciousness, I didn't think of it as being amazing as others think it is. I would come whenever I get the chance again, but it's nothing crave-worthy for me to come back ASAP.

BFexD2AC_Ni7H1TaZOD88A.text: Yep! One of the best "fusion" food joints there is, and it's all centered around the burger! Great beer selection, too!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #betterburgerproject

garYcSyMuzky7R4KW1EIBA.text: Great service and amaaaazing burgers! The taste and combinations are spot on!  I had the Ronin burger and I became it's master! Nom Nom nom! My friends got the Kiki burger and loved it!  The meat is soooo tender and melts in your mouth, the perfectly toasted sweet buns and tasty aoli's are the perfect match for these fusion burgers!  Can't wait to come back, will defiantly be a stop before going back to LA anytime I'm in Vegas

zwcny_l8CiC53d-WnHyt4w.text: Premium burgers with lots of fixings at affordable prices makes this place a Vegas must-try! After hearing so much about Bachi Burger from fellow Honolulu Yelpers, I added this to my list of Must-Try's when visiting Las Vegas. I've heard that the restaurant's owner originated from Hawaii(?), hence the menu's Asian and local influence. Upon setting foot in the restaurant, I noticed that majority of the patrons were Asian. Not to be stereotypical, but it seemed like a good sign to me as a fellow Asian...haha Most of the burgers are very affordable, in the $10 range, though I did see a $25 burger which came with foie gras to justify its price tag. The downside is that all burgers don't come with fries, which we had to order separately for about $4 per order. I think what makes these burgers so awesome is the unique variety of toppings/fixings you get on your burger: I got the KIKI'S BURGER which is an Angus beef burger with sauteed shiitake, enoki and eryngii mushrooms, caramelized bacon, sweet onion marmalade, gruyere cheese, and garlic chili aioli. Supposed to be a popular choice. As a mushroom lover, this burger was pretty bomb. Not the best burger I've ever had in my life, but definitely up there! The burger was juicy and the toppings were delicious and offered a variety of textures and flavors! And the bun was heavenly soft yet still with enough substance to guarantee proper bun to fillings proportions. My only complaint is that the burger was cooked in that sweet onion marmalade which was tasty, but a bit too sweet for me... KIKI'S BURGER - $10 - yelp.com/biz_photos/bach... My BF got the MIYAGI-SAN BURGER which is a grass fed wagyu beef burger with a fried egg, bacon, crispy onion rings, chili mayo, and furikake. Also supposedly a very popular choice. He really REALLY liked his burger. I didn't get to try it myself since I was getting way too full from my own burger and fries, but it definitely looked like a burger any man (or woman) would love! MIYAGI-SAN BURGER - $10 - yelp.com/biz_photos/bach... We also got sweet potato fries and the parmesan truffle fries to share. The truffle fries were pretty good but the cheese made it a little soggy. The sweet potato fries were also very good, but didn't justify the price tag for me. SWEET POTATO FRIES - $4.50 - yelp.com/biz_photos/bach... PARMESAN TRUFFLE FRIES - $4 - yelp.com/biz_photos/bach... Service was just okay, though I may be influenced because a bowl of ranch sauce bounced off the floor and some of the sauce got all over my legs, shorts, and in my BF's eye when the waitress was taking away our plates. Obviously not her fault, but she could have been a little more accommodating about it... Bottom line, delicious burgers with unique ingredients and flavors!
