aoOs-GbER5aii9P62b7PHA.text: Wow we are soo glad we made the trip!  The wait was short (30 mins) and the food was well worth it.  We had the oxtail fries, chili Wings followed by the black and green burger.  Service was fantastic!

PLDll3jTIawHiWwlLIyPUA.text: This spot was a five star cafe last year but...higher prices, smaller portions and some questionable quality in the cesar salad will have me looking at burger spots on the strip next time in Las Vegas,

2aUbpX5OIizh6mFdXmajfg.text: I'm in love with this spot!  Great food, great atmosphere! Although our last waiter didn't seem to thrilled about his bosses...  Nevertheless I have spent many afternoons an evenings here enjoying wonderful food and will continue to do so along with recommend this joint to everyone I know.  Get the black and green burger with oxtail fries. You're welcome.

hkDfsRYj-cR1uIFtJE0eTw.text: Bachi is one of my husband and I's favorite restaurants. The burgers are the best in town! We went on Thursday night and David was our server. He was attentive and friendly. Our food came out quickly as well. I had the kikis burger and my husband had the spicy miso burger. The burgers were a bit over cooked for medium but still very flavorful. All the staff was great and the manager even checked on us. The service was a breath of fresh air compared to most places in Vegas! A definite must for burgers!!!

yz-lyaM2mi9bw4bgUj_SnA.text: Best burgers in Vegas! The buns are super soft and the unique asian style flavor combinations are to die for. I've been here numerous time and have never had a bad experience.  I also try a different burger on every visit and have not been let down once.    The burgers are large and very filling but I say splurge and get yourself an order of the oxtail chili cheese fries as well because they are amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CXE-OJsi7fGNCwcwqdBVLw.text: Food is really different which I liked. Burger meat is good quality. Some of the add ons or burgers just over kill. I have the blu burger and they just over kill it with too much blu cheese. I love blu cheese but there is a line. I have had another burger that I added garlic to it. If a vampire was within 200 feet of me he would have died after one bite. Once you scrape off the excess it's pretty bomb. The actual restaurant the tables are pretty uncomfortable. They are all just flat wood. No cushion or anything. At first it's like ok I can dig it because it's different but once you have been sitting a few mins you are like this isn't comfortable at all. Add some cushions or something. Jeesh. For amount you are paying it should be 100% on point.

b9v1Ne-xEG0G7OdtXMlJZg.text: YUMazing!! Ate here late last night and wow... I knew this place would be bomb.com but it even blew away my expectations. I had the Kiki burger & added a fried egg. The bun was sooooo tender and buttery, the cheese was melted perfectly, the egg was just right, the meat ( cooked medium) was soooooo good. And the service was stellar. The entire staff was so nice and helpful. It took me a while to figure out what I wanted ( everything sounded tooo good) and they were so helpful and patient with my fermale indecisiveness. If you are craving an amazing burger w the best quality ingredients and original topping selection, this is your place! I will most certainly be back on my next cheat day to try the steamed buns and another burger =)

YO6DIM_0lToaIrfOMalREQ.text: Ooooohhhhh yeeeeaaahhhh, everything is good here, best advice I can give for the menu, is try it all.  Very juicy burgers, prepare to get your hands messy.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Miyagi-San Burger.
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sausage appetizers awesome.

THrG0NLPbhlOLCmhINQ8vQ.text: Wait? Sure I don't mind waiting. But standing next to the wait to be seated. Party of one ignored for more than ten minutes. No, I actually counted. Asked a server passing by if I may just sit at the bar. Empty except for one patron. No, we have a wait was her response. I've eaten and enjoyed your Raman a couple times. But if you don't have time for me I won't make time for you. Moving on.

rJ8Cvgz-tOaTS9wVClfd1w.text: Tip: the fried calamari is delicious. Their green chutney dipping sauce catches you off guard at first, but is so pleasantly appealing. As has always been recommended, we ordered the oxtail fries-- delicious as well, with the plate being licked clean, but still I'd vote the calamari over it (although not in the size portions).   Burger: we tried the Spicy Miso, Kiki,  Miyagi-San, and Banh-Mi-- listed in the order that I would suggest them in. Enjoy!

RHQdNCzzOcvyanYcnOQOPw.text: I've been coming to this place since the day it opened. I absolutely LOVE this place. I watched the evolution of this place. I've had almost everything on the menu. I've always had quality service when I've been there and the food has been top notched. If you're a True foodie, you need to try this place out. It's a different take on burgers and other american classics so be prepared. I feel you have to have an open mindset when coming in here. I think that people who have given poor quality reviews have not necessarily understood how fusion cuisine works and that's OK! It's been a trending place and I see whether it's the burgers, oxtail fries and even the Shoku menu will continue to grow and succeed.

RKPbewOPloyRPJ1LF2p4rg.text: Came here for lunch about a week ago...order the Kiki burger, I believe. Also had part of my girlfriend's burger; she ordered the one with curry.  The food was okay. In my opinion, it was nothing to write home about. It was good, but it wasn't...noteworthy. I've had better specialty/boutique (whatever you want to call it) burgers at the same price, and cheaper.  There was a pretty long line when we got there, which to me should denote an amazing experience. When we were eventually seated, the restaurant wasn't seated to capacity, but was fairly busy.  After ordering our food, we waited a minimum of 30 minutes to get the food. I lost track of time...it felt like an eternity. We had also ordered an appetizer which arrived at the same time as our burgers did (which to me was not okay). We asked our server about 20 minutes into waiting where our food was and he said it was coming right up.   The food here is 3-4 star quality, but the service was 2 star.   Would I recommend this place to others? Maybe.  Would I come back here myself? Maybe.

ZTrUQFDzo1kNfIHCrM3CZA.text: So we tried Bachi Burger finally, and I have to say that the burgers are tasty, but a little over-priced for what it is.  The buns are delectable, and the meat definitely is a higher grade of meat, but overall the a-la-carte pricing makes you wonder about your pocket book compared to other burger joints.  Definitely a great idea made off of the Asian fusion with burgers though.   It probably doesn't help that the to-go isn't packaged as nicely as say... Chilis and thus you feel that the to-go crowd doesn't get quite the same service as those inside the restaurant.  You'll run about $15 a person or so without drinks.  Burgers are $7-15, and if you want fries, another $3-6.   My suggestion?  Always get medium to medium rare. The well-done wasn't done all the way through (some pink) and it looked like they charred some of the outside which meant the heat was too great to cook the insides before the outside burned.  Don't get me wrong, it's great food, but getting it to-go found a less than heartening experience considering.

U-rEPaVisAWJ9JPXE-I42w.text: Service here can be hit or miss, but the food is always delicious. I will say that the burgers should come with a choice of fries for the price. The fries should also come out with the rest of the hot food. Last time I went, they were out of my choice of dessert, so I opted for the fried donuts w/ a side of guava sauce. Winner! Ultimately, I realllly want to like this spot since it's so close to my crib & the burgers are actually great, but there are just a few too many hiccups every time I visit. Firm 3 stars for Bachi.

rp9Tnnlg3RV8Nc7hSt46kg.text: boyfriends family took us to dinner here since we were in town and we are sooooo obsessed! We are already planning to go back when in town again!!   We started with the oxtail chili cheese fries, truffle fries and onion rings! OMG! delicious! I swear the best truffle fries I have ever had cause they glazed the top with the oil too!   I had the Kalbi burger and the fam had the miso, black and green, and the bahn mi burger my burger was korean bbq goodness, with the kimchi and everything! A must try! I had a bite of all the burgers on the table and was not disappointed. Ended with the lava cake for dessert and that also was delish! order it when you order the burgers as it take about 20-25 min to make =)  definitely cannot wait to try the other locations (since they have different menus)  Loveee this place!

ggIiJEWdWjA1sPG_TQUhkg.text: I try to go to as many restaurants as possible that are featured on Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives, so eventually I made my way to Bachi Burger. I knew about this place prior to it being on the show, but for whatever reason, I never ate here until this month. Not sure why it was featured because it's not a diner, drive-in, or dive.  In any case, I saw the oxtail chili cheese fries featured on the show and chose that for my lunch. My favorite Filipino food is my mom's kare-kare, so I'm definitely a fan of oxtail. The dish was heavy on the fries and the oxtail was sparse. The fried egg on top was a nice touch that gave some nice creaminess to the dish. The flavor was good and I enjoyed the concept, but for $11.50 I really expected more.

0zCBkqdLOK0ZvvVdFTaOKg.text: Great way to end a Vegas trip, limited selection for Vegetarians, but they have a delicious Veggie Burger, that is SO HUGE. I could barely finish half.   My friends started their meal with the oxtail fries & I have never seen such a happy trio! They devoured the fries.   The veggie burger flavors were fantastic! The actual patty tasted fresh and one of the best I've had.  It wasn't too dry, and the flavors were a great mix! There were bits of red bean & walnuts tucked inside the patty as well.  The patty was paired with fried eggplant, fried tofu, fresh greens and lemon aioli. The bun itself was so fluffy & light!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xAS8U-KtboPGjleP4fMWPQ.text: I love this place!! The food is awesome.. Kiki burger is the best burger I've ever had!!  This location never answers their phone though, so when I try to do a phone order to pick up.. I have to go there and order and wait 20 min.. That's not good customer service.. (Tonight was a prime example.. I really was craving a Kiki burger.., I tried to call 4 times.. It kept going to an answering machine...Its a Monday.. Not even a weekend.. So sadly I didn't get my burger.. I didn't want to wait 20+ min at the restaurant..and I didn't want to eat there.. I wanted to eat at home.. Relaxed on my day off) Also.. I hate that when I actually can get them to answer and place my order.. They make me give my card number.. I didn't have a problem with doing that until the last time I ordered.. When I got there.. My credit card number was stapled to my bag and it was out in the open for all to see!! I cancelled that credit card because anyone could have gotten my card number!! Made me very uncomfortable

ZpT-Z9DT0KTgedNIySXUqA.text: I tried the black and green burger. The blue cheese was overwhelming. I didn't enjoy it. There was also so many flies flying around and landing on me and our food. My son loved his burger. And we both enjoyed the salt & pepper garlic fries. And I really enjoyed my Plantation Style Sweet Tea.

PJXHCI4bJvxkRn7RRj_quQ.text: Arrived at Bachi Burger and waited 15 minutes for Saturday afternoon lunch.  Sat down and declared that I saw their episode on DDD and was fasinated with their menu.   Started with *Oxtail Chili Cheese Fries $11.5 (With Garlic Aioli ,Fried Egg) [5 of 5] - Wasn't expecting much from putting stewed oxtail over fries. I was so surprised how delicious the oxtail was. I under-estimated how different and tasty this dish was. The oxtail actually had really nice heat flavor and by far, one of the best chili fries dishes ever.  Finished with *The "Banh-Mi" Burger $9 (Angus Beef ,Pork ,Shrimp ,Lemongrass,Pork Pate ,Fresh Herbs ,Curry Aioli,Pickled Vegetables ,Nuoc Mam Sauce) [5 of 5] - Wasn't expecting this to taste so good, but blown away at how well all the meat flavors blended so well. And dipping the burger into their housemade fish sauce, took it to another level.  This place can brag about their burgers all they want, because it is all that. I think this is probably the best and most creative tasting burger places by far.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail Chili Cheese Fries $11.50
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The &#34;Banh-Mi&#34; Burger $9

ggKhHO4hm8Pv-xLYgUu3FQ.text: I heard about this restaurant from a friend that lives in Vegas and I've now been here a couple of times. The food is great and they have friendly service. One thing they are famous for is their Oxtail Chili Cheese Fries and it is delicious! The meat is well cooked and it serves as a great appetizer. The next thing to get is their burgers. I've tried their Ronin Burger and the Miyagi-San Burger and they are also cooked to your liking and tastes very good. I recommend to come here when you're leaving your Vegas vacation and you just have to try it!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail Chili Cheese Fries

Rhw3gtP2tbSyDiPDEzS46Q.text: Okay. I was updating this review and gave it a five star. I do have to adjust them to a four star however.   The food and creativity is exceptional. The service is generally great. Today we were there for my wife's birthday and it took over one hour for our burgers. Others were served before us as well and they arrived after us. Three times we were told the food was going to be out in two minutes even though we never asked nor complained. The third two minute statement we timed it for fun and it was 22 minutes before hey came back to tell us our food would be cooked next.   I advised the managers that on the forth time and after almost 1.5  hours  that this was disappointing as we were celebrating my wife's birthday. They did say ' for what it is worth, Happy Birthday'. I think they were genuine.   Food came out past the 1.5 hour mark and my wife's burger was medium rare instead of well done and they heated it up instead of a new one due to time. By then, my wife was not happy, the burger fell apart and was not tasty. She ate a bite and took the kids and left. I waited for the check. The team at Bachi was nice to not charge for her messes up burger.   Unfortunately when they are too busy or when they make errors they do not know how to properly take ownership and control the situation. It got worse and worse and spoiled a celebration.    So this is still a great place with quality staff and food. They just need to get to a first class five star by dealing with adversity instead positively rather than matter of fact like.   They did nothing really wrong. Just when it got bad, they were ill equipped to shine.   4 star but 5 star food.

GdGTljW-Y_0-5BsyurLHsw.text: I heard about this place from the food network, and had to stop by when I was in Las Vegas. I have to say that this place had a lot to live up to, and it was everything and more! My mind was blown! Try their Banh Mi burger or Miyagi burger! You won't be disappointed! Also my brother and I shared the oxtail chili cheese fries, and OMG! This place is awesomeness!!!!!

O_GVtCX0aB_9zwGhY7BEwA.text: The food was great as always.  The oxtail chili cheese fries are a must.  The drinks were awesome.  Every time we visit Las Vegas we will be coming here.

uZNQ8k5dwSYpy9tIHEoNAw.text: Burgers were def on point! Had the Miyagi-san & it was delicious! Service sucked though, unfortunately. The bus boy was hella cool but the waiter was AWOL most the night. The Thai was bomb! All in all, good place to eat but bad service! FYI, if you don't like your buns toasted, let them know, cuz they'll toast the hell out your buns! Lol

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Parmesan truffle fries were on point!

zTrXO-CJYrQIaBtbMfzeBg.text: This is one of the best burgers places in town! Incredible food, great staff, and amazing menu. Not only is it just a great place to be, they also serve Ramen! So cool! So tasty!

-q5CJgHJIfig6KXOJybR3g.text: Good asian fusion burgers and other sides. I got the kalbi burger and shared the oxtail chili fries, truffle fries, and pork belly bao. All were good but highly recommend the baos. Food is pretty expensive but if you're willing to splurge for a unique burger it's well worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalbi burger was delicious!

jkC778av14w1IEsQxR2Mgw.text: Another DDD stop! AND....Another repeater!  WOW, top 5 burger I have ever had for sure! The truffle fries paired perfectly as well. I will definitely be back and this is a must stop.  My burger came with bacon and mushrooms and they were cooked so well, I mean sooooo well. I had not eaten mushrooms cooked that way before and it was just perfection!

gPcvO5V-gVnGBkci99EswQ.text: I went to this location on 9/26 for lunch. It was OK. I ordered the spicy miso burger protein style and it was fine. It wasn't bad, it was even pretty good. It is just hard to get excited about this place. The service is OK. Not good but not bad. Definitely slow and not attentive.   Unless someone orders their fries as an appetizer, they probably want them with their meal, not 20 minutes ahead of time.  The house made pickles were good.   I was excited to see that they have Boba, but I didn't try it. I would not choose to go back, but if a friend wanted to, I would go with them.

uOa4VReAEA2wgfXc3tgU2Q.text: I wish I could say I had a better experience here. The food came out in waves. I was finished with my dish by the time my companions meal arrived. The service was bad, and the wait time was unjustified based on the food and service. Probably will never come back.

3i0d0sco6ELq5eUi_YaB_A.text: This place is amazing! Food is priced reasonably considering the quality and the portion of the food. Everything is fresh, staff is friendly... Definitely worth the visit

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab Artichoke Dip
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Foie gras burger with unagi
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb burger

CJH4tsyZcDGQGzBMtEYewg.text: Bachi burger is a delight to the senses! This place is actually combined with a ramen shop, so if you don't find burgers appealing, you could always order ramen!   Miyagi burger: 4.5 This burger has onion rings, bacon, wagyu beef patty, and furikake!  Ramen: 3 The soup was good, but the noodles were just okay.  They're harder than I would like, but that's just preference.  Oxtail chili cheese fries: 4.5 These fries have jalapenos so if you don't like spice, you should probably request to leave it out! But other than that, they were delicious!  This place is off of the strip, so it's about a fifteen minute drive.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail chili cheese fries, beware of the little jalapeño suckers( for those who can&#39;t handle spice)! They blend in!

tlAzwhL3HskW5yuQ33gyeg.text: They won't let you call in an order without a credit card number.  I've never heard of a restaurant that does this...  I called them while I was on my way home to pick up a few burgers but they said they needed to run a credit card first.  I said I was driving and unable to get my card.  They said "ok I guess you can just order it when you get here.". So I did.  I waited an unnecessary 15 minutes.  So stupid.  I'm never coming here again.  So sad too.  I just moved in nearby and thought this would be my go-to spot to grab food on my way home from work but don't want to fiddle around with a credit card number ever time I call in.  Oh well.  Their loss.

trnBDppiom6yjceGu2ZJWA.text: Definitely had high expectations for this place ever since I saw it featured on Diners Drive-ins and Dives, but the food was just alright. Probably because i ordered the wrong thing.    Came on a Saturday at 12:30pm... just managed to miss the lines.  We sat at the bar.   I got the MIYAGI SAN burger.  It has fried onion straws, fried egg, bacon and beef patty.  No greens.  Would definitely have liked some sort of green or something lighter to balance out the other heavy flavors. The first few bites were quite good, then it just got too heavy for me.  Boyfriend got the Korean BBQ burger; that one was much better!  I loved the gochu jang aioli! Great flavor balance.  We also ordered the kurobata sausage appetizer... it was good, but it's like Asian lil smokies. Nothing too special.  The donut holes dessert were hard as a rock and not worth getting at all.  All of the above plus 2 drinks = $60 lunch (post-tip). I am very curious about the banh mi burger and i would go back just to try that one.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Korean BBQ burger with kimchi and gochu jang aioli. Yum!
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Miyagi San burger
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kurobata sausages with mustard sauce

TnaQdgNU-FTUUPL6Ws6Sbg.text: After reading the reviews, what would stop you from heading down to bachi burger and seeing what all the hype is about?  But no no it's no hype. The food is actually, in my opinion delicious! We started with the oxtail fries, because after so many reviews about it and on top of that who doesn't love oxtail! Seeing the pictures made me want to dive in. Of course I took a picture myself. It was a perfect balance of crunchy from the fries and softness of the oxtail meet that was laid on top and the egg is perfect to balance out all the flavors. I'm not much of a heat fan so I just dismissed the jalapenos. Btw, this order is pretty big. It was perfect for my friend and I and then some but it was just the two of us so the more the merrier.  Then we ordered the Kiki burger, medium. It was nice and warm when it came out and we took our pictures for Instagram of course. Then we both dove in. The bun was nice and soft and it was toasted on the inside. Veggies looked like a spring mix and that sauce on the side had hints of citrus and sweetness that made the burger even more delicious.   Reason for the 4 stars being that the service was not great. I felt like we were being rushed and it took forever to get a refill on our water, I guess it was because it was getting a little busy but that doesn't mean that you start being rude to your customers, even if the food is great. You'll eventually lose people that way or we'll end up going to another location. But the food is the real star of the show. I wouldn't go to this location again, I'd rather go to the other location even if it's further.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The infamous Kiki burger with the sauce on the side that makes the burger taste even more better. Bold flavors.
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The oxtail fries and all it&#39;s delicious-ness piled up.

wdzBMloO6rMboFXVUWD_aA.text: Wow. I'm so glad I saw this place on Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives. It is delicious! The burgers are piled high with really quality ingredients, but be prepared to wait. Ever since this place has been on tv, people flock to it. Also, if you're staying on the LV strip, taking a cab here will cost you about $20.  We started with the Chili Fried Chicken. It was perfectly fried, without too much excess batter, and the sauce was spicy, salty, and a little sweet. You could definitely taste the garlic. The cabbage that came with our appetizer also gave it some good texture to contrast the relatively soft chicken. Two thumbs up.  I ordered Kiki's burger, and my fiance ordered the "Banh-Mi" burger with a fried egg on top. When we saw everyone else's burgers come out, we assumed we'd be full after an appetizer and a burger. We were right. Anyway, the Kiki's burger melted in my mouth, and I really enjoyed a new take on a bacon-mushroom cheesburger. My fiance's Banh-Mi burger was so interesting! You could actually taste the shrimp in the patty, which also contained beef and pork. The herbs and pickled vegetables were tasty, but be careful, because the aioli and the sauce together can get very spicy.   Our waitress was very friendly, as was the young man who refilled our waters. They each said, "please, thank you, yes ma'am, yes sir, etc.," and they were very helpful anytime we had a question about the menu. Overall, a great place to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kiki&#39;s burger
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bahn Mi Burger

4khoWnbxffb637uffTdcbQ.text: Bachi Burger is a great place for a gourmet meal at an extremely reasonable price.   Their oxtail chili cheese fries are out of this world. Also ordered the only kind of poultry burger on the menu which is a chicken/turkey mix and so delicious. Don't forget to Order one of their amazing fries that comes with a palette explosion dipping sauce.   I went for my birthday dinner and having a large group of 10 people they told us we can only have 3 separate checks with a max Of 3 payments per check............ To break It down if there is a group of 4 and each of which would like to use a debit card to pay ....... All hell breaks loose and staff gets very defensive.   Great food great atmosphere, staff is a little arrogant but I can put up with bitchy girls all day for this food.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My donuts and coffee ice cream for my birthday
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My chicken/ turkey burger. SO GOOD !!!

FM7HiJPlYQmwxTIcCI0_SA.text: Went to Bachi Burger last night with a mean burger craving. All the amazing burger places are on the strip, as a local the last thing I want to do on a Friday night is go to the strip.   Ended up getting the salt and pepper garlic fries with fresh jalapeno and minced ginger to start. They were served with some sort of aioli which was amazing.   I got the Kiki Burger. Angus beef, sauteed shiitake, enoki, and eryngii mushrooms, caramelized bacon, sweet onion marmalade, Gruyere cheese, and a garlic chili aioli. I also added some grilled shishito peppers which gave the burger a nice heat. The burger patty itself had a light and sweet BBQ marinade to it. Overall, one of the best burgers I've ever had. Definitely would recommend checking this place out.

fLXLRhipzOwUIn9xPaZYAg.text: I ordered a burger and sweet potato fries and they were very good.  My low score is because as previously reported on yelp the service was not as attentive as it should be.  I got refills of my green tea but the glass was empty for 5-10 min each time before I got a refill.  Also I ordered my burger with bacon and it did not have any bacon.  Aside from that, the burger was tasty and delicious.  I would go back even though it has limitations as noted.  If not for the items noted above, It was at least 4 to 5 stars.

c2dBBH9GgaxG7EMRZejoxA.text: Been here many times now, on a fairly occasional basis because this place gives me the cravings. Their burgers are very unique and are very tasty. Personal favorite is the ronin - fried egg, carmelized onion, japanese coleslaw. Really great balance of flavors. The also do a really solid chicken wing - very crispy and great flavor. They also do some pretty good shakes. The only miss was the crab artichoke dip - definitely had a bit of a fishy smell to it and was fairly bland. Overall though, burgers and truffle parmesan fries are bomb. Service is ok, not bad. 4.25/5

mXPkLtdHSPTLyg_8JKR6bA.text: Second time visit for me, first time for my DH. At lunch time tge wait was only 5 minutes which was great. The the food was tasty and I enjoyed it.

Fc1mGlA98DbHdCO79ExaEA.text: Bachi Burger sells gourmet Asian inspired burgers at a premium price. The burgers are good, but can get pretty pricey.  My favorite thing was the truffle fries. The burgers were good too but just pricey. I ordered the Kiki burger, which had sauteed mushrooms, angus beef,  caramelized bacon, sweet onion, and garlic chili aioli.

GSJHiqWYWnUt51NQKK3twg.text: Get your sh*t together, Bachi Burger. It seems like every time I dine here there is some policy that has changed.   One day you could get onion rings as a side, the next it's a hard no even though they still make them to put on the burgers. Today, the yuzu citrus aioli that has always been served with the Ronin Burger has to be requested and is a $0.50 charge even though the menu still indicates that the burger is served with it.   The burgers are still delicious (thankfully), but if you don't ask for your fries crispy they will show up soggy and damn near raw.   It's so disappointing that a restaurant that serves a consistently good burger cannot be as consistent with their service. The lack of service and consistency in menu policies really drives my business away and I find it difficult to recommend this place to others.

CKuBkDD079O9qw_vshmniQ.text: Creative menu that blends classic American comfort food with Asian influence. Affordable menu with fancy ingredients like oxtail, Parmesan Regiano, truffle, and more! So many of the ingredients I had never heard of before!

5CVi7Wntu6E6zC3S2M66-w.text: Great service gal, great music- we love hawaiian vibes so so much, Aloha is our favorite flavour. We came here for Caesar salad, they are out of chicken for this salad, they are out of tan tan ramen, they are out of tan Katsu shio, they were out of a entire list of things we were not interested in.  I'm way bummed, aside from Monta this is our very favorite restaurant. It's grandparents day at my 12 year old school, I took her out early to bring her to her favorite requested restaurant Bachi with my two teens and my mom.  Just got news they are closing right now. They just opened at 11 and they are closing their doors right now.  My heart hurts for this place, I LOVE THIS PLACE, big big bummer!  We are hangry! We ordered at 11:20 and it's 11:55 still no good seen.  This waitress is magical!

lZ5mggVk74CGYCFcW46MYg.text: Every time I go to Vegas I need to go to this place!!!  I tried almost every single burger and all honestly they don't make a bad burger!   I would probably say my favorite is the shotgun burger, it has Asian pear and foie gras! So so delish!  Also make sure you order their truffle fries!   As for the appetizers the must haves are the sticky buns and ox tail chili cheese fries! So delish!   This restaurant is also linked to a ramen place which is also very good! Try the burgers first then the ramen!  The service is really good. I think the waiting room is a bit small so we always just wait outside. I would suggest not going during rush hour otherwise the wait will be over an hour.   The also serve alcohol so that's a plus!

0vtE5Nx4yls62BKm3UVuRg.text: Wow, what a shame. This place must be under new management because my first visit a few years ago was enjoyable.   Totally different story now though.   Terrible service. Dirty silverware. Exposed wiring in the ceiling. Not a single appetizer brought to our table, even after waiting for 45 minutes.    Once we noticed the party next to us get seated, served AND finish their meal, that was it. My family & I walked out and we'll NEVER go back.   I highly suggest you stay far, far away from "Bachi Burger".

XYJ85RWfuETCA222hPkRSg.text: I had been raving about this place to my hubby for the past month and finally got him here earlier this week. I did have to take them down from a 5/5 to a 4/5 due to a repeat burger being less impressive and so-so service.  Last time I came my party ordered the oxtail chili fries, but it was too spicy for my tastes. So this time we went with the truffle fries. They were awesome fries, but I can't say they screamed truffle. Next time I would either get those sweet potato fries again or try the salt and pepper fries.   Hubby and I both ordered one of burger specials - he got the lamb burger I'd absolutely raved about and I tried a burger that's served on a bed of risotto. Unfortunately, that lamb burger just didn't hit the second time. My hubby flat out hated it. I thought that was strange because of how much I enjoyed it on my first visit. I took a bite - while it wasn't as awful as he led me to believe, I had to agree that it just wasn't doing it for me. The red sauce on top is pretty darn sweet - overly sweet, which is not his thing. I usually enjoy sweet on my burger, but I like for something like a sharp cheese to help balance it. When we finally managed to wave down our waiter, we expressed our disappointment and asked if we could swap out our burger (which only had two small bites taken out of the huge patty) for another (more expensive) burger. But our waiter informed us that wasn't an option - all he could do was charge us for a new burger. Hmmm....  Thank goodness the burger I ordered was not only awesome, but huge enough to share. As I mentioned before, this burger sat on top of a bed of risotto. It was then topped with fried onions, siracha bacon jam and two fried eggs. The risotto was cooked perfectly and had a simple parmesan flavor. The fried onion rings were skinny cut and crunchy - just the way I like them. And the bacon jam was chunky and delicious!  I definitely want to go back to this place and try to confirm the 5/5 rating that I originally gave it.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle fries
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Special Burger - burger topped with fried onions, two fried eggs and sriracha bacon jam on a bed of risotto

wKYo9uGhtAOKpL8sHywOtw.text: Got the Shogun Burger $26: wagyu beef grilled unagi PAN SEARED FOIE GRAS (very mushy and overpowered by pattie asian pear and peach (made it sweet)   Miyagi-San's Burger $16: wagyu beef chili mayo fried egg furikake caramelized bacon crispy onion rings made it even sweeter than the shogun burger.  Truffle garlic fries was also very good and comes with a dipping souce.  Both burgers are very juicy and tasty and seasoned to perfection. But the Foie gras (duck liver) was very soft and cant be detected within the burger. Pricey place but very good burgers overall.

lYb_tLmvEOcryFcWGDWOcg.text: Hubby and I decided to finally try this place out after friends from California begged us to eat here with them. I was honestly disappointed because I was expecting a lot from this placed based off of the hype surrounding it. It was alright.. definitely not worth the $120 bill it came out to be.   Appetizers: Bone marrow Duck steam buns Oxtail fries  Entree: Loco Moco burger   I enjoyed the loco moco burger a lot, the risotto was amazing and everything blended well with each other. The bone marrow was alright, I feel like the toppings overwhelmed the natural fatty taste of the bone marrow so it just ended up tasting like toppings... None of us really liked the oxtail fries because it ended up tasting like regular chili Fries without any elevations.. I was the most disappointed with the duck steam buns; the were very chewy and hard to eat, I choked on it and couldn't even get a clean bite through.. I've never had duck with that consistency before and using a knife to cut through was still VERY difficult.   Overall, I gave this place a 3 star because it was mediocre. The server was nice and kept checking back in with us. I feel like the idea of a fusion Asian burger place is awesome but they could've done better with ththis execution of Some of the items on the menu. I did however like their apple lychee Italian style soda and the loco moco burger  I would probably explore other burgers next time I go here, but I am in no rush to eat here again.

J0cSY3d2HIxEeJxZuZJH-w.text: I heard of this place from Diners, Drive ins and dives, and was in the area so I had to check it out for myself  Awesome burger! Pribably one of the best I've ever had.   Cool vibe, friendly staff.  Overall a very nice place to enjoy a lunch or dinner

PdjTzCjLd3zGSMYWBOkHvg.text: I love everything at Bachi burger! Fusion burgers at its finest. Although not a cheap burger in town ( average burger around $16) it is worth every penny. You can't go wrong ordering any of their burgers, however my personal favorite is the sho gun burger with wagyu beef, foie grad, unagi, poached pears. Their beef is high quality and your can taste the difference. Their truffle fries with porcini cream sauce are to die for, and their oxtail chili cheese fries a hit with anyone I bring here, and I love their calamari. Their presentation and quality is very consistent and I am always happy with the service. They also offer freshly made milkshakes, adult milkshakes, and a variety of other fun beverages. If that wasn't enough they also offer ramen. My favorite ramen dish is the tan tan man. Packed full of flavor and has a nice kick but not too spicy.

mhRG2ude0c54nWk9nxZ8kg.text: This place is a bit far off the strip, but if you have a car, I highly recommend trying this place!  The unique thing about this place is that they serve ramen and burgers. It was so hard to decide what to get (so make sure you go with friends so you can each get something different and share). I decided to get a burger and my boyfriend got their spicy miso ramen with extra noodles and pork. I forgot which burger I have gotten but it was huge! It was delicious though. It had fried onion rings inside, bacon, and an egg! It was juicy and had the right flavoring.   My boyfriend's ramen was also delicious. It was even more so because the weather outside was cold. They charge you $1/$2 for extra noodles, and they aren't kidding about it when they mean extra. They give you a lot. We had so much left over, even after sharing it between the two of us. Their bowls only come in one size. The soup was delicious. It wasn't too spicy, therefore we added more chili oil, chili powder, and whatever spices we could find. They had the option of making it extra spicy, but we didn't want to risk it on our trip.   We also ordered a milk shake. I highly recommend you do. I got their strawberry guava milk shake and it was perfect with my burger. I didn't know how strawberry and guava would work out, but it does. It's rich and creamy. Each flavor was not too strong. We also ordered their oxtail fries as an appetizer. It was a good size plate filled with fries, melted cheese, beans, and other various stuff on it. It was good, I just wished it came out sooner. The fries came out like a few minutes before our food came out. By that time, we ended up not finishing the fries, barely touched it, because we were so full off of our own food.   The overall pricing is not bad, it's about $12-$18 per burger or ramen, dep

VadGwZgYl6rnNboDuGhVWQ.text: Bachi Burger CURIOUS. I've been wanting to try Bachi for the past two years and never tried it until now finally. Marking it off my list makes me want more.. The unique twist on the menu caught my eye and the flavor combinations are enlightening. I came by last night for dinner and the wait time was decent, not too long maybe about 15 minutes or so. The inside is very clean, modern and at the same time casual and trendy. They offer a wide array of burger selections and even have a menu for those who prefer ramen. The server was very attentive and the service here is excellent!  DRINK: Red Sangria   FOOD:  -PORK BELLY STEAMED BUNS -OXTAIL CHILI CHEESE FRIES  -MIYAGI-SAN'S BURGER   The Sangria was very excellent as it was very fruity, lush, and boozy.   The fries were on the top of my bucket list to try here. It was fun to try and tasty at the same time, but pretty much like chili cheese fries.. could have had more oxtail meat with it (you know what I mean carne asada fry lovers?!)   I recommend the pork belly steamed buns, they were savory and took the first few bites without the sauce it was fine both ways.   As for the burger (wagyu beef , chili mayo, fried egg, furikake, caramelized bacon, crispy onion rings).. it was very satisfying and has everything I crave thus matching my taste buds quite well. It was definitely full of so many flavors and cooked just how I wanted it (medium well). To be honest I was stuffed though from my appetizers, so I only ate a small fraction of it. The next day this burger still tasted great.. as I ate it as leftovers for lunch today.    Come here for a wide variety of asian fusion inspired eats and find a special drink to enhance each bite!~

VMFXaVZag7iRLOyNPGyipw.text: My husband and I chose this location due to Yelp reviews and it was so worth it.  We were on our way out of town and starving so got there right when they opened. The music is loud and thumping but you forget that the minute your food comes. I had the Miyagi-San and my husband had the Ronin. We thought we'd each have half of each burger but that didn't happen.  After the first bite you have to sit back and breathe, they are so good!  WOWOWOWOW!  Fabulously tender and so many wonderful flavors. We will go there every time we are in Vegas.

KNpJBMPeJ5Rr-ij3_ek3dg.text: I rarely give out 5 stars but this place is awesome!   I've been here twice already, last time I got the kiki burger.  Fries are delicious, love the sauce that comes with it.   Def would come here again!

-Olw-tHLq4PIMdapKFYyGQ.text: *drools*  Absolutely loved this place! Came here once while in Vegas and I'm so glad we came here. We were staying on the strip, but we had a rental car, so we drove here.  I ordered the black and green burger with salt and pepper garlic fries and momotaro soda.  The burger: Absolutely delicious and very very filing. The patty was pretty thick and had a lot of flavor in it. What made it really filling were the mushroom, bacon, and blue cheese. When you throw all of this, it makes for a really great burger, but do make sure to try it while on an empty stomach!  Fries: The fries was very good. Crispy and had the right amount of flavourings. However, do make sure to share it because the portion is meant to be shared.  Momotaro soda: First time I've tried peach and strawberry soda. I tasted a lot of peach, but not a lot of strawberry, but I'm not complaining.  Price and value: For burgers, they're pretty expensive at first glance, but once you factor in the stuff they put in, it makes sense and the quality of the ingredients are high, so I'm not complaining.

_DqmJxR2t7MVWOPgwVmhfw.text: Delicious burgers and milkshakes, friendly staff, AWESOME music selection (EDM lol). This place is a must-try!

CKwmxbt6mW3LAtT2_RpXeA.text: We love it.  The place&staff are friendly and clean.  The burgers, fries, and drinks are OUTSTANDING!  I'm speechless....2b continued

IQS2SQwvIYjilI0Gfd3mgw.text: Burgers here are unique and have the perfect combination of flavors. The wait and service is very slow though. The demand is just too high.

uFnpMa1vwhTLqF15zGs1pg.text: Went here after seeing this place profiled on one of Guy Fieri's programs on The Food Network.  This is an out of the way place for me.  The drive wasn't particularly worth it for me.  When we got there, the wait wasn't that long, considering it was a holiday.  Service was ok.  The burgers were spot on...very tasty, but I wouldn't drive here again.  Still deserves a 4-star rating, though.

LnCQ1HgSBArWlr1bcia3vw.text: I went to this joint back in feb 2014 and was the first of several highly-anticipated-first-timers.  Rumor has it the place was feature on "diners, drive-in, n dives" (I'm sure I got the name of the show with Guy F. wrong)... I will only review what my hubby and I had and experienced. Service - 5/5. since we were one of the early arrivers: ordered, ate, and paid the tab all within 45 min Fries with truffle and aioli sauce - 5/5. damn, it's good and fresh off the fryer. Sweet bun with roast duck and sauce - 4/5. it was only good.  I had better at authentic Chinese restaurants. Shogun burger (my other half's breakfast of the day) - 10/5. YES, 10/5!!! IT WAS THAT DAMN GOOD.  I was only lucky to stole a bite out of the shogun while my hubby was bz with his phone researching our next destination of the day. The $25 shogun is worth every penny! It is worth a trip back to this place just for the burger.  Vietnamese ice coffee - 4/5. Usually when I'm hungry, everything should be better, but this didn't do it.  Overall, because of the shogun burger and the estimated mean, I gave it all the stars it deserve.  If the joint opens one up in northern Cali with the same or higher standard, I would never dine there, instead I will quit my job so I can work there as many days as I can to eat the mouth watering burger daily;

gAhQY4yEMwu41PRMVOj_Cw.text: BEST BURGER EVER!!!  I wish Bachi Burger was located in SoCal.... Sigh...  I ordered the Truffle Parmesan Fries with sun-dried tomato aioli and I almost inhaled those the minute I dipped that first fry into the aioli.   Then came my Ronin burger and WOW. I want more!   PLEASE COME TO SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA!!!!  -RM

Z_ifItV7bnheP2SkztjVoA.text: I have never had Bachi Burger and was very excited to try as I have heard great reviews about the food. When we arrived it was an hour + wait and we still put our name down. We came back 45 minutes later and found out a different lady was working and had skipped us. When asked she made it aware to us she skipped us even though we were there earlier than our spoken time. The hostess that was working 2/17 between the time of 2:30-3:00pm with black glasses and nose ring was extremely rude and condescending and we then told her that we would not be eating there due to her rude energy. If you cannot serve do not be in the service industry. Sorry Bachi Burger but one rude employee can tarnish a lot. On to the one at Sahara!

J6smk6pNLzHquAqn3e7-rA.text: I am always coming back here! I crave it and it's by far my favorite place to eat! Fried egg on your burger is a MUST! Doesn't taste the same without it! Great atmosphere and it feels good to be back in Vegas!

sKqr6zYutDhznidjIBYowQ.text: Why must you be all the way in Vegas?! Wish I could try everything on there menu because every morsel of food I tried when I was there was a party in my mouth. The service was great too. At first, the hostess and I were not seeing eye to eye because some group got sat before us but the whole thing was sorted out and we got sat ASAP. Would return here in a heart beat. I'm sure everything is great but the oxtail fries and the pork belly sliders were my fav!

DJJcFmbrVB8V6sEXJwCpvg.text: This place rocks!   My dad lives in Vegas and this place is right down the block.  This is now a must stop every trip!  We split the black and green burger and the wagyu burger. The black and green burger has bleu cheese, roasted garlic, bacon, mushrooms and spinach.  The wagyu burger has a fried egg, crispy onions, caramelized bacon, and chili mayo.  Both were awesome, but I give it to the wagyu burger.  The fried egg pushed it over the top.  Both burgers were cooked perfect.  We also ordered the salt pepper garlic fries, Truffle Parmesan fries, and sweet potato fries.  I would say the Truffle fries are best without the sun dried tomato sauce they provide and the garlic fries were best with the garlic chili sauce.  I give the garlic fries the edge as the truffle fries needed more truffle oil on them.  The sweet potato fries were good, but I am not really a fan of sweet potato fries.  If you like them, these are great.  This place is great and I would drive out of my way to get my hands on these burgers.  Bravo Bachi Burger, keep cooking!

nUKjpl5dKv15y2BjNVgIHA.text: I had the Ronin Burger, an order of garlic fries, and a drink  The restaurant is a nice enough dine in establishment with a good selection of drinks.  I was with a group of friends, we had ordered and ended up waiting a while for our food to arrive (roughly 10 minutes for the fries and 20 minutes for the burgers). It was a long time, but I was with company and it only made me hungrier. I think part of this was due to a large 10+ person party arriving just before us, so it was probably just bad timing, but still, it was a long time to wait after ordering our food.  The burgers are expensive, but the size and amount of toppings compensate for it. I found the Ronin burger to be extremely tasty, but unfortunately due to the sauces, the bun got soggy really quickly, so after half of it I didn't want any more and just picked at the rest of it.  My friends didn't seem to have the same problem though and they got different ones (my apologies as I don't remember what they ordered).  Overall 4/5 stars, I'm interested in coming back and trying something different. If the wait is just as bad without a huge group and a different burger ends up soggy, then I may adjust to 3/5, and if it's not the case, I'll adjust to 5/5 (as those first bites were very tasty).

szSk4fVG2cXm-oKerczejQ.text: You can't go wrong with a place that has been on Triple D....at least that is my opinion.   I vistied the location on Windmill for lunch and will definitely go back.    We were seated immediately and greeted by a friendly server.   Considering it was lunch hour rush, I was impressed with the expeditous service and the repeated attention by the server.  I ordered the Kalbi burger which was melt-in-your-mouth delicious.   The bun was fresh, soft, and slightly sweet...but the best part was the bun to burger ration was perfect.   In no way did the bun overpower the beautifully cooked Angus burger.   The kim chee was homemade and full of spice.    The Japanese marinade gave the burger the right amount of flare needed to call it a "BBQ burger".  Overall, you have to try this place.   Fresh, homemade buns with a medium rare Angus beef burger that is juicy and flavorful....you can't go wrong by this place.

KOMHyNQkdQR8HONtiNVXKg.text: I was looking forward to trying this place after seeing Bachi featured on television.  Service was great, people were great, but I just couldn't appreciate the fusion of Asian and American when it comes to burgers.  If I were to go back, I'd go with a typical American style burger.  Not that the food was not good, it just didn't appeal to my palate

WRuzqiba-45s50SzoawQMA.text: Well, first the wait was long, so I figured there must have been a good reason. There were many tables open for so e reason though.  We stayed, and got some drinks at the bar while we waited. First, my husband got a milkshake and thought it would be cool if they could put a shot in it. Since it WAS a bar and all. Well, the bartender obliged, but all the while telling all of his coworkers how crazy it was and weird and laughing about it. Making us feel pretty bad.  So we sit down, it's freeeeeeeeeeeezing cold inside. People are visibly shivering. We get our meal, I got the no meat burger, the consistency was so weird and mushy,it just feel apart in my hands!!( I've had plenty of '.no meat' burgers that at least had the consistency of a burger!!!!!)  The waiter was supposed to deliver us our fries with our burgers, but he comes back to our table, when we inquire about them and acts as if we NEVER ordered them!!!!!!!! He said it would be another 5 or so minutes.. By the time we would have gotten those fries my burger would have been STONE COLD!!!!! So I said forget it, lets just go....... It was an awful experience, never going again. Honestly, I felt like I was in that show "Kitchen Nightmares".... Get a new manager for real.  THIS PLACE IS HIGHLY OVERRATED!!!!!!!!!

0hV7kD0-N_E2XFc9H-9qsA.text: These Asian fusion flavors will make an indelible impression on any burger fan willing to branch out and try something different. In fact, many food critics say "Bachi Burger" might just be the best gourmet burger spot in Vegas (which is a pretty bold statement considering all the burger joints on the Strip backed by famous chefs).   Burger "connoisseurs" unwilling to experiment any further than some avocado or pepper jack, however, might be scared off by this menu. For instance, the Ronin Burger features Angus beef, carmelized onions, Japanese cole slaw, Miso-Goma dressing, fried egg, Katsu BBQ, and Yuzu citrus aioli. The Banh-Mi Burger includes Angus beef, pork, shrimp, lemongrass pork pate, fresh herbs, curry aioli, pickled vegetables, and Nuoc Mam sauce.  Don't be intimidated, though -- there are other options for those with simpler tastes and you can always build your own burger by starting off with an Angus patty or Wagyu patty and adding ingredients from there. Fried onion rings, applewood bacon, grilled onions, cheddar cheese, etc can all be added to any patty for $1.50 each.  There are also a variety of different sandwiches to choose from and I could honestly fill up on the fries alone. The oxtail chili cheese fries with garlic aioli and fried egg are extremely popular, but the more traditional fries are also a big hit -- mainly because of the savory sauces that accompany them. The garlic chili aioli, Yuzu citrus aioli, sundried tomato aioli and pineapple ketchup are all HIGHLY recommended for dipping or drowning the fries of your choice (the options are regular, garlic, sweet potato, and truffle Parmesan).  If you're not much of an adventurous diner, you'll probably stay away from Bachi Burger. Your taste buds will definitely be missing out, though.

X_ZA-Y1vcy6VaaFKg73ZgA.text: I'm seriously not a big fan of burgers, but Bachi is the ONLY burger I'd crave for.  Goodbye In n Out!!!   Bachi has the most ingredient detailed, marinated patty, and best sauce EVER!!!!!!!!  My friend order the Truffle Parmesan Fries and it was FTN yo!   I will always throw down money for the cab ride whereever I'm staying in Vegas because there is NO WAY I'm missing out on BACHI!!!  Thanks for making my stomach smile!

IrNKipmIT2NunLNS4X6OTA.text: This place is awesome, well the food at least. (atmosphere is so-so) The burgers here are nothing but magnificent. With an Asian infused menu, all of the burger choices garner not so typical ingredients. I have tried 3 different burgers and haven't been disappointed. The patty is grilled to perfection and the ingredients are fresh. I would recommend trying this place. Price is a bit on the high side, but once you are finished you will not regret the price one bit.

Mz98TFURq5XaU4g8o94HlA.text: Location Definitely not in the "glamorous" part of Las Vegas, but easy to find.  South of The Strip at E. Windmill Lane and S. Bermuda Road, it's about a 10-minute drive from The Strip..  Atmosphere Not quite Southwestern, not quite Asian, not quite...identifiable.  Yellow walls, dark tables, dark chairs, low lighting.  A bar along the right side of the wall.  Tables and chairs are partially hidden from the front door thanks to the Asian-inspired folding screen behind the hostess stand.  There's patio seating, although it was closed because it was a little cool outside.   Service Our waitress was very friendly.  The food was a little...slow.  We ordered burgers and fries and our fries were gone (and we were eating the dipping sauces) while we waited for our burgers.  Food/Drink Of course, the burgers took a little while because they're so delicious!  No, I didn't order what Guy Fieri had; I don't eat pork.  Instead, I ordered the Miyagi-San Grass Fed Wagyu Burger (chili mayo, fried egg, furikake, crispy onion ring).  It was absolutely amazing!  The right amount of juices dripping from the burger when you bite into it.  The soft warmness of the buns.  The right mixture of toppings on this particular burger.  I made sure to eat mine slow so I could savor it as long as possible!  The French fries are delicious!  We ordered both the Salt and Pepper fries and the Parmesan Truffle fries.   Definitely go for the Parmesan Truffle fries; it's an unique twist on an American favorite!  Dipping sauces were just perfect with them, too.   Definitely a new favorite in Las Vegas!

ovOhWdodvGqFWpMdnwPW1g.text: Saw this place from DDD and decided it had to be included for my diet cheats in Vegas.  Ordered the oxtail fries $11.5 Pretty good. All the guys loved it. It was something different to try.   I ordered the Mr. Ho's burger $9.5 and the rest of my group ordered the Kikki burger $10 and 2 Manga burgers $11. Mr. Ho's burger was good, I assume intended to have a sweet and savory balance however I think mine was more too sweet.   The bf got the Kikki burger which I really liked. He interpreted it to be like a mushroom swiss burger. If the gruyere cheese throws you then don't worry because I didn't taste it. It was yummy to me.   My friend who ordered the Manga burger Loved it. He described it as melting in your mouth flavors. I had a bite but guess I didn't take a big enough one bc I didn't have the same reaction. The bf said the bite he had was good and tasted like a big chunk of crab mixed in. Overall I think a good choice but it was the special for the day when we went.   One of our friends who wanted to try and maintain his diet ordered the Ahi tuna burger. He said it wasn't anything special. He had a better one in Austin.  I also ordered a side of the Parmesan truffle fries $4 but with the gravy on the side. Nothing spectacular. Just regular fries if you need a side with your burger.   Overall, I will be going back to try the other burgers when I'm back in Vegas. Worth the trip to go off the strip for lunch. Also we went at about 11:30 and it wasn't packed but when we left about an hour later there was a long wait so we were glad we missed the lunch rush.

Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chef specials. A guy leaving said the shogun burger was worth it.

nR4Otwqt4M_TrJGPcZheYg.text: Bachi Burger is ruining my life!! Why? Well, it's because I'm so insanely jealous that it has captivated my boyfriend's heart in a way I never will.   On our latest  trip I asked my boyfriend what his favorite part of our trip was. To give some background info, we spent a few days in Vegas, a day in Disneyland, and a couple days in beautiful Camarillo. If you had asked me which of these was my favorite part of the trip, I would've answered "dancing with my wonderful boyfriend at a wedding". His answer?! BACHI BURGER!!!  So apparently, Bachi Burger is better than Disneyland- the happiest place on earth. It is also better than anything we did in Vegas (including winning money). AND it is better than a couple romantic days lounging around with each other.  Fine, I suppose it's delicious, but sheesh- cut me some slack. It's not like I have a third pound of perfectly grilled wagyu on a house-crafted bun, a specialty sauce, or come with a side of truffle fries. I'm just me. Just human- not godly burger.  Anyway, the shogun is a $25 burger and it's super tasty and loaded with stuff (unagi, peach, foie gras, etc.) but i'm not sure it's worth the $25. I'd have to try it again to let you know. I really liked what I ordered, the Miso burger, but my boyfriend's Miyagi-san burger was REALLY good. So I guess I can forgive him.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Miso burger. Good, but the miyagi or shogun are better.
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Miso burger. Good, but the miyagi or shogun are better.

Bdzr2bybZq4UCq1bACevJg.text: The burgers are good, but there's a lot going on there. Whatever you decide since they have a pretty extensive menu, remember to order the oxtail fries!!!  Order: - Oxtail Fries - we should have gotten 2! - Salt & Pepper Garlic French Fries - good, but can't be oxtail! - Spicy Miso Burger - Shogun Burger - flavor explosions were insane, but you can't really tell it's a burger! - Bachi Caesar Salad - not sure why this was ordered, but I think he was still drunk - Sweet Tea - Soooo GOOD!!!!  TIP: If you can't come all the way out to Vegas, they just opened one up in LA!

emAkX2bmW0pgsdfbnVRyhA.text: Came here after seeing it on DDD. The service was very slow but friendly. We came for a late lunch. My husband and I split the Ronin burger which was pretty good, and the pork belly stemmed buns which were just ok. The truffle fries were good too.  Overall we were underwhelmed.

vu0R-ceoi5uhmeZ3j8Iv8Q.text: Hands down the best burger I've ever had! A little more on the adventurous side I had the shogun burger, besides the amazing patty it has unagi and foie gras.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hands down the best burger I&#39;ve ever had! Shogun burger

4WRJ1cceOqXvsid_I-h4JQ.text: 3.5 overall.  My boyfriend and I came shortly after they opened, so we definitely beat the rush and were seated upon entering!  That was a plus, as we were in and out within an hour.    I noticed quite the price increase compared to the previous yelp menu photos and their provided online menu from June 2012, so I'll list the prices for the items we ordered:  1. Truffle Parmesan fries ($5.50)- I love skinny fries! These were cooked to a slight crisp, which I definitely enjoyed.  The black truffle porcini cream provided a nice savory saltiness to the fries, but the sun-dried tomato aioli really sealed the deal.  I'm not a huge fan of sun-dried tomatoes, but this aioli rocked my socks.. I found myself spreading it on my burger throughout the meal!  2. Kiki's burger ($11.00)- I do love me some mushrooms! I found the burger to be rather bland, even with the 3 types of sauteed mushrooms, bacon, and sweet onion marmalade.  I liked that the bacon had a slight smoky flavor, which paired well with the sweet onions and mushrooms, but I didn't care much for the garlic chili aioli.  The aioli definitely just tasted like garlic chili and mayo, and I preferred spreading the sun-dried tomato aioli on this burger to amp up the flavor.  The bun totally reminded me of cha siu bao (bbq pork buns), and upon first bite, the onions and bacon really made me think it tasted just like one..Must've been my mind playing tricks on me!  3. Mr. Ho's burger ($10.00)- The taro bun was what intrigued me!  The bun was like a taro bun from a bakery- purple and sweet! Overall, I thought this burger was really sweet and saucy.  It was a bit too sweet for me and my boyfriend, though.. It might have been due to the sweet taro bun and the sweetness of the  lup cheong (Chinese sausage).  We ended up only finishing half of this burger, but oh man! The cold leftover half (which we snacked on a couple of hours later) was so good!  I assume that the flavors settled and had absorbed into the bread while the burger cooled and dried out.. That must've also helped to mellow out the overall sweetness.    The interior was nice.. An unfinished, modern, cool, and relaxed feel.. Service was good, music was loud, and they allowed guests to sit and have a drink at the bar while waiting for a table. I'm glad to have tried this place out, but based on the items I ordered this time, I think it's just ok.. I'll have to come back and try some other items.

Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cross section of the &#34;Mr. Ho&#39;s burger&#34;- cooked medium..loving the purple taro bun and sweet lup cheong (Chinese sausage)

MzlcIW9BW6XfjnX9CBBzvw.text: I used to rave to people how great this place is. Don't get me wrong, the food is still delicious; however, last weekend I came by and have decided that I will not go to this location again. We got into the restaurant the same time as a large party of 7. We stood behind them as they were getting greeted by the employees. Looked like it was a server that was setting up their table. He cleaned off the table for them and put together tables to form a big one. At this point, we were still standing behind the large party. About 6 minutes later, the server sat the party. We then were able to move up closer to the "host stand" and waited for our turn to get seated. Nobody greeted us, nobody looked at us. The server that sat the large party kept walking pass us back and forth as he was getting the large party water and asking if they had questions on the menu (keep in mind that the large party was seated right next to the host stand, so we were for sure within sight). I kept trying to make eye contact with someone, but nobody seemed like they were paying attention to the host stand. After about another 7 minutes, someone finally saw us and said "someone will be right with you," which still took another minute for a server to come greet us and seat us down.  I told the server in a polite way that we were standing there waiting for awhile, not only did he not apologize, he just said okay and walked us to a table. It seemed to me that the workers didn't really carry any customer service whatsoever. As we were eating, we also noticed the several parties that were coming in had to wait quite awhile to get someone's attention. Even though the food was really good, I will not be returning to this specific location due to the lack of customer service.

FgwLGKiSrzf3bfwypEe14A.text: Amazing place. Service and food was off the chain!! A  MUST HAVE IS THE FISH BURGER....& THE LAVA CHOCOLATE CAKE...I'll take a picture of it before it's all gone lol. Love this place even with the long wait  I had the Emily (the waitress, loveedd her earrings, and she was really courteous, informational & just a complete pleasure) & Ryoji (who periodically filled for water, who btw is complete eye candy)

XIhAnpS_9R4N13ogD9UHOg.text: Pretentious. Kinda sums up my experience there. We just happened upon Bachi burgers driving down Windmill Lane.  The staff was friendly, but gave off this arrogant vibe "your lucky to be here".  Beer, btw, is $7 per small glass. So 2 beers, for 2 people, will set you back $28 !!! They feel special and don't mind raping customer wallets. The burgers were good - but not $30 good for two burgers.   Next time, we will just hit Smash Burgers.

Do yourself a favor and get the pork belly bao's, and the OXTAIL CHILLI CHEESE FRIES! Do not get regular fries when you have all these options.

-dL_VT_n4jExHuQrPTUXJQ.text: I have been here on many different occasions and the food is always worth the Terrible service. This past visit was probably the worse I have experienced. We walked in to our surprise there was no wait when they usually always run a long wait. After we were seated it took over 10 min for our server to come over. We ordered 2 different cocktails that they were out of so we had to stick to just ice tea. After ordering our food the wait for our food was over 30 minutes really for a wedge salad. After our server took our order she was never to be seen again someone else delivered our food and we were never checked on through out our meal. After we were done with food and left parched because no one came to refill our drinks she dropped off the check. Server again was no where to be found so someone else took our payment which took another 10 mom for them to bring the card back for us to sign. If the food wasn't so good I would have stopped going there a long time ago.

8_2r8BidtbDoWsChWO24gw.text: Ever have that placed that itched and you couldn't scratch it? Well yeah, this scratched my burger itch this morning. K2peZUhEf7HeGE9NaEEI_g.text: We stopped here after seeing the on Diners, Drive Ins & Dives. The atmosphere was fun, way trendy & the music was really loud! We started with the Ox Tail Chili Cheese Fries, they were good, but the chili was very average, kind of like you'd get out if a can.  I had the Miagi Burger. Let me preface this by saying we are from the Midwest, we are cattle people and always have a beef in the freezer, so I KNOW good quality beef. The burger smelled. I don't think the meat was bad, it tasted fine, but the smell was so overpowering, I could hardly gag it down. I'm not sure if there was an oil on the burger or what it was, but the smell of it was too much. For what it is, I thought it was overpriced, but that seems to be the norm in LV.

2_QfouzP2ABdNJ1jBugs0w.text: Saw this place on Diners, Drive In & Dives. The Mi-Yagi burger was to die for and the truffle fries were out of this world. A must go to place.

U2er3fLVgUGVviG54SCT2g.text: I love coming here for burgers because they're consistent on their flavors and the way that they cook their burgers. The service is top notch and the place is clean. The burgers have gone up in price gradually over the years, but it's still worth the price. For this visit we ordered the Kiki Burger, Miyagi-san Burger, Oxtail Chili Cheese Fries, and the Pork Belly Steamed Buns.  Burgers: Both burgers were amazing. They cooked them to a perfect medium-rare. The flavors for the Miyagi-san are so good that when you break open the egg, you want to dip it in the juices on the plate. The Kiki is also good with the mushroom and onion combo.  Oxtail Fries: I don't know if you can beat chili cheese fries with and egg on top. The flavors and ingredients are perfect together. This could be an entree on it's own.  Pork Belly Buns: These are always good. The pork belly is tender and the bun is soft. The hoisin sauce is a lot tastier than normal hoisin sauce you get at a Chinese restaurant.

qIOEAp3FqtltI5wyxQynMA.text: This place is so. Freaking. Bombbb.  You really can't go wrong with Japanese American fusion.  If you love the idea of assorted Japanese mushrooms and a big slab of caramelized bacon on a juicy burger you've got to try the Kiki burger! I typically get mine cooked to a medium or medium rare and it is absolute PERFECTION.   Several friends have also recommended the Ronin burger so if you want that extra protein from a fried egg in your burger, the Ronin's the way to go! This one's packed with flavor from some seriously saucy katsu bbq and yuzu citrus aioli.   Personally, I actually prefer Bachi Burger over Gorden Ramsey Burger over at Planet Hollywood :P  Keep in mind that these are gourmet burgers so expect to pay $12+ for just the burger alone (fries not included).

V3G4a3Q5MwwA_3SaQKNcqw.text: I used to love this place when it first open. I think it has changed ownership since the original opening and it's just lost a bit along the way.   The last time I went here I experienced longer than usual wait times and the food was decent. For the price they charge for a burger I would just expect more. And honestly they have done much updates to the menu over the years which is disappointing.

V3tObrLxg8vO3dqsKtMPbw.text: I really want to like this place because I always hear great things about it and I LOVE a good cheeseburger, but it's just not my kind of burger.    I got the Kiki burger and the bf got the Ronin burger with wagyu. Whatever the glaze is that was on the meat was too sweet for my liking and it was on both burgers. With that being said, the meat was still cooked well and was good quality. I would come back and give it another chance and order a different burger. I also would come back just for the oxtail chili cheese fries because that was so so good!

zKmM6OBWj1UmHPdFEvoVjw.text: First Time in Las Vegas and I was told I had to try this. For a family of 5 our total was $150. That was for 5 grass fed burgers and an order of Ox-Tail fries. The burgers were okay but the fries were mind blowing. I've never had fries with so many toppings be so good! Great flavor with a bit of a spice and a over easy egg on top. The service was great, the waiter was knowledgeable of the menu and knew which burgers were best. In my opinion the burgers were pretty bland in flavor but the meat quality was good.  Try it out!!!

7tveJSgBJ_XN7keC_29sUg.text: Food: 4 stars; I got the bachi fish and they improved their ratio of fish to greens from the last time I went, but the fish is a little too sweet for my liking. It's still really good though! The salt and pepper garlic fries are the best too!   Service: 1 star; the service on a Saturday is pretty terrible. It seems like they don't have enough staff to accommodate the influx of people, but also, the workers are just not attentive, nor friendly. Of the 3 workers we dealt with, not one of them seemed happy or friendly. Maybe it was just an off day for them... We tried flagging someone down for about 8 mins and not a single worker was looking around at the customers or paying any attention to them. They were all standing with their backs to the customers which seems like a big "no-no" to me in the serving world, but perhaps that's just me...One person even walked by and ignored us when we tried grabbing their attention. It wasn't until I got up myself and talked to someone that we finally were able to get a server to come over to us.    Overall, I like this establishment, but I feel like they just need to step up their game in customer service. Even a little bit would go a long way!

-Sc93SvX_0mql6CVYuSPSA.text: Honestly the service alone (in both locations) is enough to make me hate this place. They are ALWAYS slow- slow to seat, slow to greet, and slow to serve. Good luck getting refills or sending back a plate (which you will need to do either for cook or special order- they ALWAYS make mistakes with orders) or even getting everything you ordered because they don't check on you after you get your food. We ate at the Windmill location recently after Christmas 2017 and they weren't even busy and we still experienced terrible service. It's not necessarily all the server's fault- they only had two people on the floor.  Although the food is okay, I'm done with Bachi Burger in both locations because of service.

dyDclQ608hHnxSwO5l1LOg.text: I'm a fan of reviews, especially honest reviews. Just finished up my burger and fries. Had the "Wagyu" burger and Just Fries. The service was great although there was only about 6 patrons in the restaurant. Here's the review, the "Wagyu" burger was good, cant say I noticed a difference in the meat beyond a normal angus burger, but ok, we'll say it's "Wagyu" beef, had good flavor, thanks to some sort of sweet sauce it's either cooked in or marinated in, the bun was great and the veggies fresh. Now the Just Fries, some of the worst I've ever had, period. Undercooked, limp and greasy, change your oil please.   Was hoping for a better food experience, especially since the reviews were great. So I'd ask that you start being honest with your trivia of the place, my $11 "Wagyu" burger wasn't as good as Red Robin's $6 burger, and I'm glad BB doesn't doesn't include all I can eat fries.

The Fish burger is made from a cod with a miso paste flavor that I use to eat in Hawaii all the time. Truffles and Plain fries with pineapple ketchup and aioli sauces are so yummy with the burgers.  Perfectly cooked burgers and fries with a Sauvignon Blanc on my lunch break, just nice!  Service is always friendly and nice.

nEUKCaWcsY334bi3QowrKg.text: Absolutely fantastic! After seeing this restaurant on Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives and finding that it was right in my neighborhood, I knew that I had to try it. I had the Miso Burger and an order of the Oxtail Chili Cheese Fries. Both were excellent and I will be coming back for more! VDxx3b4Pvi-thp3REoDSBw.text: This is one of the things I look forward to when in Vegas. This time was no different. I craved for the burgers and oxtail fries only to be disappointed when I finally had my taste!   Our party of 10 arrived around 11:45am. While the restaurant had a few diners already, we were told by the very rude guy up front that it would take 15-20 minutes so the staff can get caught up with orders. Totally fine except he was extremely rude about it. When we were finally seated our server was great. She took our orders and was pretty efficient.   Our food arrived and we immediately noticed that it didn't look the way it did before. Nor was the flavors the same. My beloved favorite Bachi Burger was no longer the way it was before. I was extremely disappointed.   Not only the food was a total disappointment but the whole place seemed to have been trashed! With only one restroom available, the womens, it was gross and very dirty. The owners need to invest in this place in order for this to survive long term. It is no longer the same Bachi Burger I waited hours for. It's now a place I will definitely avoid!

YuCqJ8GcCnB89ld7PvXrhg.text: Came here on a Monday night around 8:15pm and there was no wait. The ramen menu wasn't available during this time, which wasn't a problem for us.  My friend and I shared a Miyagi-san's Grass-Fed Wagyu Burger and our favorite Oxtail Chili Cheese Fries, which were both great. The serving for the fries seems like it has gotten smaller compared to a few years ago though.   The servers were attentive and friendly. Apparently, the chef is very big on presentation so they won't cut the burger for you. However, they will give you plates and a knife for you to do it yourself. It wasn't a big deal.  Try this place out if you're looking for affordable quality burgers and chili cheese fries.

0r4bA4Kz-dgwdvKXAoFsyw.text: Came back because I effin' love their burgers. This time around I ventured off to try the Kiki burger: Angus beef patty, sauteed mushrooms, caramelized bacon, sweet onion marmalade, gruyere cheese & garlic chili aioli.   This burger wasn't as great as the Miyagi but it still was a contender. The patty came out to be juicy. The mushrooms added an additional umami flavoring. While the bacon and onion provided the sweetness component to the meal. The cheese allowed the burger to have a creamy texture. The mixed greens was the perfect touch to tone down the saltiness of the ingredients. Yet another fantastic dining experience from Bachi. Compliments to the chef! :D
