hR99yRRbdZX4LQiWRWou8A.text: I was so excited to come here after seeing it on Guy's 3D. I hate duck so we had the pork belly buns. OMG. There was every flavor imaginable in your mouth. And the bun was just so good on it's own. It was stellar. I also loved their homemade pickles because where I come from, we eat Japanese pickles with everything Asian. The pickles (and everything else) was plated very aesthetically and just lovely to look at. I got the Miyagi-san and it was okay. Maybe I was satiated so my brain wasn't as receptive to it. Or maybe it was that the steamed buns were so good that these paled in comparison. Or I just chose the wrong burger combo. Whatever it was, I didn't feel the beef had nearly as much flavor as the pork belly packed. I wished the beef was marinated more or something. I did love the bread though which was squishy and soft.   My bf got the Honeydew boba and that was disgusting. They did not put nearly enough powder to make it taste sweet. Whoever made that should be retrained! I also did not like the ice cream cookie dessert. And aside from the hour-long wait due to construction, it was okay. We will definitely be back and hope the service has improved then.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Think this is the Korean burger
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I think this is the samurai. Just look at tasty and soft bun!
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Aioli fries

x09snBr5rr81_2LnbtzOww.text: Have been here many times and it has always been great but came here 2 weeks ago and the service was horrendous. Being that it was a Saturday night and the place was maybe 80% full, that's not a good sign. I may give it one more shot, but very disappointing.

fdUfhWd0Kw9xfrU6nL0kHA.text: Don't go there. Service is bad and slow, you have to ask several times to get anything. Asked to get a napkin and they completely forget about it. Wouldn't be a big deal but I had to do this for several things - very unpleasant. Very unorganized and understaffed. Burger was cold with little meat and a big bun. Considering that this was a $15 burger I should have gone to McDonald ... at least it's cheaper, service is better and food is even better. Last time I went to this place.

JOXYpEm-g8zPHnT-fv-Hjg.text: WOW. Just wow. I don't remember the last time I was so impressed and happy with a burger.   I opted for the Ronin burger, my friend got the Miyagi burger and we split it so I can have the best of both worlds. I would get the Miyagi burger! Burgers are similar because they both have a fried egg, onion but the Miyagi burger's crispy onion rings and furikake compliments the burger well giving it more of a Japanese flavor.   Also tried their house made sodas. SO good. Omg. I have never had something like that. It was a little fizzy and tasted so fresh. I got the Apple & Lychee. Refreshing, light, and just the right amount of sweetness. There's nothing like that here in LA :'(   Oxtail fries, on the other hand, didn't really win me over. Yeah they were good but you honestly can't really tell it's oxtail. Just tasted like shredded meat to me.   Truffle fries are good though and the sun dried tomato aioli is really yummy. Truffle fries are half the cost of oxtail so I'd say skip the oxtail and just get the truffle fries.   Truly wowed by this place. I will most definitely come back next time I come to Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bachi fish
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Miyagi burger
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ronin burger

gNjVHb7aPVAexoCSYxkgTQ.text: I was in Vegas for work and picking up my boss at the airport so was looking for a good lunch spot off of the strip.  I read some great reviews of Bachi Burger on Yelp so was excited to try it out.  I sat at the bar and it was easy because the wait for a table was a little bit.  My waiter was really friendly and gave a full explanation of the menu and his recommendations.  I ended up going with his favorite which was the Miyagi-sans Grass Fed Wagyu Burger and the fries.  I loved the pineapple ketchup for the fries as I had never had that before.  The burger was delicious too.  It was massive and I didn't think I was going to finish it but I devoured it.  Unassuming spot in a strip mall but great burgers!

VC9HvUsv-zRVU5_aJM56mg.text: Call it Ono Burger instead of Bachi Burger because their Hawaiian-style burgers are so, so good.  Ever since Manapua Man closed shop about five years ago, I've been missing my favorite, chubby little hand held snack. Now it's back, split in two, double the price, and served with high-class condiments. Bachi's steamed buns with kalbi short ribs, cilantro and aioli is like gourmet Manapua. For $9, they didn't quite fill me up, so I suggest you go Hawaiian style: convince your buddy that she wants fries, soda, and dessert, then start bummin.'  The homemade sodas ($3.50) are the best I've ever had. Bachi also offers a small but delicious selection of beers--Rogue Hazelnut Brown being one of them (thanks Joe W.).  I highly recommend the Kiki Burger and the steamed bun dishes. I wouldn't waste stomach space or expense on the fries--just bum them from a friend.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The donuts with gelato.
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry pop tart.
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steamed pork bun with kalbi short ribs--ONO!

O5TE2O8ADSL5F0thYvvt_A.text: I write too many 5 star reviews but what fault can be found with Bachi Burger? It's perfect. Miyagi-San, Lonely Bird, 'Just Fries' with delicious pineapple ketchup, adult milkshakes, go hungry, leave stuffed and euphoric.

MXgRNhOrwpLX-9Bk_G1Umg.text: I come to Bachi Burger everytime I'm in Las Vegas. The food A+, service A++. What more could you ask for. I've tried most of the burgers and none of them disappoint. The waitstaff here is top notch and truly make the experience wonderful.

IPe5Vref-l_pLg6absYU-Q.text: from out of town and have heard about this place from friends. We stopped by on a Saturday afternoon and there was an hour wait. We could not wait because we had plans. We returned Sunday evening for dinner and got seated right away.   My table had the stir fried edamame with garlic, chili, and ginger. yummm! We also had a miyagi-san, green and blue burger, and kalbi burger. They were all fabulous! The truffle parkesan fries are addicting!

FtmqAGRVPLVmfOaVY7vFow.text: I was a little bit Leary about taking my husband here sine he is extremely picky about his burger and will not eat it if it's not very well done. They catered to his order and he actually gave it a 10.  Kudos to this place. Excellent food.

cQEnygJWBEEdWxH0jfEYtg.text: This is so delicious I almost don't want to review it and let other people in on the place. We got the Kiki burger and miyagi, I think. They were both fantastic. The salt and pepper garlic fries were the best part. What a unique Vietnamese flavor. Atmosphere was mellow with good tunes, clean tables, and great service. Only negative was that the women's room has a broken door, so it couldn't be closed....seems like something that should be fixed immediately. Totally going to be my only burger spot from now on. Next time I will come for dinner and get a beer. Yum!

GsJLqzv72P0mw7SM2ONC8A.text: Delicious hamburger :) I got the Ronin burger, and the meat was so juicy. I've never tasted such a burger so delicious. I tried Father's Office in California and I thought that was good, but wow this is super amazing! I have yet to try Umami Burger in California but so far, this is my favorite burger!! Their pork steamed buns are super delicious too!!

7y3QTUn8WRFW9Oo8XSGipw.text: Food is great, service was awful. Some of the food was cool when we finally got it. Each member of the dinner party was served at different times. They stopped serving many vegetarian options and made mistakes on the last person served ( 10 minutes after the previous person). Too bad, used to be one of my favorite spots.

9mxu3PGke2hY5gYbXbhjWg.text: We've been here many times and can highly recommend the burgers, ramen and karabuto sausage. My new favorite is the Bachi fish.  Luscious cod fillet, grilled with a sweet glaze, served on their signature Brioche buns with a house made tartar sauce. Best fish sandwich around.

vc_GvSyuXru5eswDDWValA.text: Went here because of Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives. Burgers are exotic and non-traditional. If your a traditional burger kind of person, don't bother. Burgers are juicy and very meaty. Noodles are delicious as well, next time I personally would prefer noodles over the burger. Service was so-so, hence no 5 star rating. Will go back and try something different.

hdONM3tX_cmGBu6_w-_EHg.text: Burgers- yes. Flavor- yes. A must. But the grilled veggie sandwich??? Trust me, skip it, it's awful. The fries are just ok for the price. Homemade sodas are sweet & fruity. You want a juicy burger, this is a great place. Want anything else...like seriously anything else, go elsewhere.

oKQoKjqZ0Px39fs5KGk89Q.text: Creative menu items, lots of choice on all the food and drinks... But the service is average at the absolute best. Two tables that arrived after my two top were attended to before we were. We were only served when I made a snide remark as a busser walked by and heard my irritation. Our server was very attentive until the food got to our table, then we had to ask for our check and sitting with our bare plates for a while. Good food for what will be my only visit.

FXVQYEZ-nWkgWCNQlFZcBg.text: Oh Bachi Burger you have made my day! I waited all day to finally try this place out since everyone reviews made it seem like I'm missing out. So all I can say to my fellow yelpers "Thank you" this place is yummy in my tummy.  When my family and I walked in a young gentlemen greeted us and sat us down. I asked him about the burgers and which one is the most popular one. Kalbi burger and Kiki burger is what he suggested. My bf ordered the Kiki burger and I ordered the Ronin burger since it looked delicious from the pictures everyone posted. We ordered the side of fries, the truffle Parmesan and the garlic salt and pepper fries. And the perfect way to end our meal is dessert, the donuts were mouthwatering.  Overall my experience was top-notch!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry milk tea boba
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Apple lychee soda

mzjFq5BOX3GSbEJg54TM1w.text: Damn, what can I say about this place that hasn't already been said.   I'm genuinely surprised to see this place pop up on the little thing that suggests which reviews I should write. I've been going to this place since it's soft opening and have been in love ever since.   From the get go, Kiki's burger has been my favorite. I mean, anything with a fried egg is going to win my heart. But, recently they have had this manga burger which is soo good. It comes with the dynamite on it, which just add soo much flavor. The fries are good. The service is good. The drinks are good. Everything is just great.   I'll never stop going here and I'll never stop recommending it to my friends. They have since opened a second location, which I have not been to. Hopefully it's just as great as the original.

53U84Jnq62-VRiQtK1F8Fw.text: I've had the pleasure of eating a meal here on at least six occasions. The Diet Coke flavor is delicious. I like their sweet potato fries as well. Everything on the menu is high quality and tastes good. The burgers, however, are simply spectacular. I recommend to all.

zhbdXxcBJxn9GGb3FlJfVw.text: I have been to Bachi several times, by myself, with family, with friends and each and every time consistently this place produces! The BEST burger ever! Whatever you choose from protein style, to turkey, to wish they had buffalo but that is another story. They prepare for you! The staff keeps you happy and the drinks full! Love love love their green tea! No matter where you sit from the bar, to any seat in the house you are made to feel comfortable and never rushed despite the waiting line to get in!

vjodGHWJZ4DEy7Q8zAgBIA.text: So I decided for once to do a review while we eat. Well where to start, well the AC is playing up, so its hot in here, the wait time was quoted at 10-15 minutes, it took 20 mins to seat us, close enough. The strange thing is, we asked for drinks while in the waiting area, the hostess did say that was a good idea, then went back to standing against the "bar area".  Okay, at this point, it is only fair for me to say i'm in the hospitality business and the way the whole AC playing up thing is being handled badly, for the review I will look by it, but as I'm sure the management will be reading this, a quick couple of pointers, serves some ice water to the people waiting, no cost to you but makes waiting in a sweat box nicer. Also, how about running to home depot and picking up a couple of floor fans to at least get the air moving ?   Actually, just talked to the manager, it seems the AC will be working tomorrow and the owners do not want to spend the money on fans.  Just seated, serves is nice, cold drinks served very quickly, smart lady.  Anyways, on to what everyone wants to know, the food.  Yeah, it is that good, ok, its better than good, it is probably the second best burger I have eaten.  I had the kiki burger, minus the onion, great burger, the fries were the truffle oil ones, very nice as well.  Proof yet again that quality ingredients gives you quality food.  Desert time, only thing they have is the doughnuts , let's see...  Mmm yeah ok, not the best ever, a little on the tough side, the ice cream is refreshing though, if a little bland, throwing a coffee bean on generic vanilla ice cream doesn't cut it.  So all in all, a very good meal, in a less than optimal setting.

zVwDMwLjULLayD8cdjffdw.text: Awesome service and a very inviting atmosphere. The food is amazing, any burger that you get is delicious and I always supplement my entree with sweet potato truffle fries.

xiBWw3_7o5b2DxHk0eHZFw.text: Excellent ! Always a joy.. I wouldn't give it the 5th star due to the long wait and odd seating

Qw60usMjs-RU6wYeD2B9WQ.text: Dined here on a friday night, the wait wasn't long. As a vegetarian I was disappointed that my only option was the No Meat Here..."Burger" but it looked pretty good, so I gave it a go along with a side of fries. When my "burger" came out it was verryyy high and I felt way to overwhelmed to eat it. But I was starving so I cut it in half (which I think if you decide to order this burger just ask them to do it for you, much cleaner) and after just my first bite I was hooked! I was nervous that mushroom patty, eggplant and tofu would be too much but it was the exact opposite. Every item in the burger was a perfect compliment and I loved it!   Also Bachi Burger has a yelp check in special of buy one beer get one free! The only thing is, its for after 11pm but the incredibly attractive manager was kind enough to give it to me since I was an out of towner. Even our waiter and the serving staff were extremely friendly and made sure we enjoyed our meal. So you have great food & service, don't think about it give it a try!

9Syo19jvOsIsdwotPClmzg.text: We took a taxi out to come visit this place and it was well worth it.  We had three burgers  Oxtail chili fries  Spicy miso Miyagi San grass fed Waygu  Kiki   Of the 4, by far, oxtail fries was amazingly good. I love oxtail and this was a great take on it!   As for the burgers, I really enjoyed the Kiki the best. The mushrooms and the sauce had a lot of flavor.   The one they sell the most was the miyagi, which was good, the crunch from the onion rings were good, and the flavor of the yolk mixed well.   Spicy miso for me was just another burger. The shredded lettuce overpowered the whole burger, and wasn't the most pleasant over power flavor.   The burgers were really big. Between three people this was more than enough food, I think 5 people could have split all this food and had a good bite of each and still be just full.   I think for flavor, I still like Unami burger for the juiciness of the meat, but I think you get more value and more uniqueness for what you pay.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jGAxHv5AdxFKIrd7Vw2bdQ.text: I am not a huge burger fan-- but I love Bachi Burger! Prior to our Vegas trip, I made the suggestion to my boyfriend. And after extensive research (not really-- we just looked at Yelp photos), we opted for Bachi Burger over Gordon Ramsay's Burgr. We went right before they opened, so no wait!   We were seated immediately and ordered some beers. My boyfriend ordered a Guinness on draft and I ordered a White Ale. The White Ale was very light and tasted similar to that of a Blue Moon.   Now onto the food! We ordered the oxtail chili cheese fries since it seemed like a popular choice-- and it was amazing! The oxtail chili, jalapenos, garlic aioli and a fried egg on top of a bed of French fries made for a delicious starter. My boyfriend ordered the famous shogun burger and I, the Miyagi grass fed burger. My boyfriend loved his savory burger which included unagi (eel) and foie gras. My burger was nice and juicy-- both burgers made with beef wagyu and cooked medium rare. Perfection!  In addition to the amazing food, we had a wonderful server. Great value for the food. Unfortunately, Bachi Burger is quite a drive off of the strip. Totally worth it but not feasible if your only mode of transportation is a taxi.   We will definitely be back!

Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White ale. Tastes like a blue moon!

hU0ojdI932PlXWp0Bte6Xw.text: Decided to check this place out due to the great reviews on yelp and we were not disappointed.   Party of 3 order:  Appetizer  Calamari - only thing special  about this dish was the sauce and hint of sesame oil...won't order again Truffle parmesan fries - not bad but will use the precious space in my tummy for maybe the oxtail fries next time   Entree   Pork belly Steamed bun - tastes like Filipino  siopao! Spicy Miso burger - not spicy at all but very good nonetheless. We were worried about how well the apple vingerette would taste in the burger but it was very subtle. Kids burger - my 9 year old son devoured it and said it tasted 'fresh'. Be careful with add ons...my son wanted cheese which tacked on $1.50 to his $10 meal  Dessert Portuguese donuts w/coffee  Gelato - nothing special about this dish. Was basically a donut hole smothered in cinnamon. Chocolate peanut butter souffle - came with vanilla ice cream and some blueberry sauce. It was much better than the donuts but would probably skip it next time and get dessert  elsewhere.  Service Our waitress Emily was ok. She asked us if this was our first time there to which we responded "yes". Usually this is their cue to tell us a little about the menu or make recommendations. Instead she responded with a "okay let me know if you have any questions". She was not the most attentive and we had to ask other employees  to grab our waitress for us multiple times.   Overall it was a good experience and we definitely  plan on coming back to try out the rest of the menu items

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Miso burger was delish! Highly recommended.
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle parmesan fries w/ sun dried tomato aioli was okay. Wouldn&#39;t order again.
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duroc pork belly steamed buns are perfect for those not so hungry days. Tastes just like Filipino siopao!

FiMubk76qPhyX6FDpq8lTA.text: First of all, wait staff was attentive, friendly and apologetic.  Otherwise this might be a 1 star review.   However, this was a very disappointing experience. I had been to the location on Sahara and had a great experience and great food. I wanted to bring my friends here and was disappointed it wasn't as good as I remembered.   After we ordered, it took maybe 5 minutes for our ramen to come out which was pretty fast. But our burgers took another 20-30 minutes to come out. We thought they forgot our order. When the food came, the burgers were over done and the buns were too toasted. We saw a little boy at the next table whose bun was burnt! We ordered two medium burgers and one medium-well and all three were well done and too dry.   The ramen was very good so I would get that again.   I would hesitate to come back here as it's hard to tell if it'll be any good. Maybe I would check out the Sahara location again since it was pretty good.

DcYK5kmVn0gGGN4xXjgj9g.text: Great burgers and fries with an Asian influence. Very busy spot so expect to wait. The parking is also difficult. Make sure to order fries with the burger and you won't regret it.

RTFx3oJ87H53B5OcmBYyTg.text: We need one of these in New York. And there should be one closer to the strip. I didn't mind going out of our way to come here though, it was totally worth it. I wished that more people came with us so that we could have ordered a wider variety of food to try but there's always next year!   We started with the duck baos, which were tender, juicy, and flavorful. We also got an order of truffle fries with spicy dipping sauce to share. For burgers I got the Kalbi burger, fiance got the Kiki, future-bro-in-law got the Shogun. I think the Kalbi was the best of the three. The Kiki was good but a little too sweet for a burger.   Overall, we'll be back for sure, especially for the oxtail friese! See you again next year!

3PQJIj1HWWOYFgDA51KMIA.text: Is it? Is it the best burger in Las Vegas? On the strip, you are definitely not going to find the best burger in Las Vegas. Trust me. I tried looking -- this means I spent a lot of cash paying for subpar burgers. Luckily, just before you hit Vegas on the 15, exiting East Windmill Lane, you have Bachi Burger. The Asian inspired burger joint was showcased on Diners, Drive-In, and Dives, and I immediately made plans for a Vegas trip -- I made it my first stop.  We started things off with the oxtail chili cheese fries. Most times, chili cheese fries or poutine has fries that are left soggy from the sauce. I liked how the fries were still intact and crisp. The ox tail was tender and was almost chili like -- cooking for hours helped make it into a mush of things. The garlic aioli and fried egg made everything so creamy and smooth. I liked the edition of the cilantro. It gave the dish such a freshness and helped with the richness of the oxtail. With the help of the jalapenos which were quite spicy, the dish was complete.  Though the oxtail fries were good, we all came here for the burger. Morse specifically, I came here for the Ronin burger. This burger had angus beef, caramelized onions, jalapenos, coleslaw, miso goma dressing, fried egg, katsu bbq, and yuzu citrus aioli. I know that seems like a lot of ingredients, but all of the flavors worked. I am a firm believer that a good burger has to have gooey melted cheese or a strong cheese presence -- cheese is always a must. I was surprised that this Asian inspired burger, with no cheese was so delicious. The beef patty was cooked perfectly medium rare with a nice crust and pink in the middle. The spicy jalapenos and the sweet bbq and citric aioli all bounced around and filled my mouth with flavor. If you were to get one burger at Bachi, this is the one to get.  Not feeling like another burger, we decided on the pork belly steamed buns. Filled with an irresistable duroc pork belly, the meat was cut thick. The skin and fat on the pork melted in your mouth and created such an unctuous flavor. The boiled egg added more richness to the steam bun. The cilantro, scallions, and radish helped balance the rich fatty pork belly. Interestingly, the chinese black vinegarrete and hoisin bbq sauce gave the salty and sweet flavor of the mini sandwich.  As a dessert, and to send us off in a proper manner, we ordered the malasadas. To me, the Portuguese fried donut balls were out of place. To go along with the Asian style burgers, they should have an Asian style dessert. To me, the fried donut balls were a bit stale and not "melt in your mouth" enough. With the help of the delicious coffee gelato though, the dessert was passable. I wouldn't have minded if it were just the coffee gelato by itself.  Bachi Burger is a Las Vegas pit stop for sure. Next time, I will have to give the decadent Shogun Burger a try. That one has foie gras and is $25. Though not on the strip, it is a perfect spot to eat for lunch on the way in or on the way out of Las Vegas. Even if you want to kind of step away from the busy strip, it's not far of a drive to go to Bachi Burger. The inside has all tables and no booths. You just find a seat, grab a beer, maybe a nice sake to compliment your burger, and have an awesome meal.  For those who are in Los Angeles, well, Bachi Burger is coming! It will be in West LA, on Sawtelle. Not quite sure when it will open, but I will keep an eye out for you.

ztSo-5ED77I8bBzedYE92g.text: Parking (3/5) Location is in an awkward area, its behind Subway, so its easy to miss. Easy way to remember is to turn in when you see the Subway.  Atmosphere (4/5) This place is trendy and the atmosphere suits the cool fusion food vibe. It also has home modern art when you walk into the restaurant. Ambience is on a bit noisier side but its suits the burgers and fries restaurant vibe.   Service (5/5) Service is excellent. When they were busy there is usually 20-30 minute wait. They will not sit you until everyone from the party is present. Waiters are excellent and they are not pushy. They will explain the menu and they will give you enough time until you have made your selection. Our waitress gave us a great service and took pic of our entire party upon my request.   Food (4/5) Let me be very clear here, I am reviewing the food, but I am also reviewing the value that you are getting for the food.  I went to this place for UYE that I hosted. I took pics of my friends food, but here is what I got.  Kiki Burger w/ Fried egg ($12.50) Angus Beef patty, Sauteed Shiitake & Enoki mushrooms, Sweet Onion Marmalade, caramelized bacon, Gruyere Cheese, Garlic Chili Aioli and Fried Egg.  The burger was very juicy and the meat was extremely tender. This burger is little bit sweet because of the marmalade. You can taste the gruyere cheese and the bacon in every bite. Getting an extra fried egg on this burger was a mistake on my part. I would not recommend it.   Truffle Fries w/ pineapple ketchup ($6) This was disappointing, fries were not fresh and there wasn't enough truffle sauce on the fries. I liked the pineapple ketchup, it made the stale fries worth eating. I would highly recommend it.  Overall (4/5), this is an excellent gourmet burger joint. If you want to get away from regular burger joints and try something new then this place is it, but you have to be ok with fusion food.

64FZlvk2ATIZoraLijRSSg.text: One star for horrible service. Rude, said they were understaffed, and wouldn't seat us even with many open tables and plenty of staff around. Mind you I was a server and now manager so I know they were being inconsiderate when I watched atleast 4 tables leave and they STILL refused to seat us. Food came out cold and wrong from what we ordered. Tasted ok. Overall disappointed in the amount of money we spent for crappy food

GKSluEk9GjS3W9LP1aK6jA.text: WE LITERALLY WAITED AN HOUR TO GET OUR FOOD. We went up three times to ask where our food was and they kept saying: "oh just couple more minutes" AND EACH TIME THEY TOLD US THAT 20 minutes passed. AND THEY STOPPED SERVING BOBA WHEN BOBA WAS THE WHOLE REASON I WANTED TO COME HERE. THERE IS A PICTURE OF BOBA IN THEIR SIGN. HOW DECEIVING.  The name of the restaurant is appropriate.  Our group of 15 were all hungry and excited to eat when we arrived ... then  BACHI ... which means misfortune in Japanese.  The staff was just going thru the motions, not very accommodating, and customer service was lacking.  Yes, it was near the end of the working day for them but closing time is 11:00 pm and the staff needs to continue providing good customer service to the end.  The food strangely came out in increments and the wait was one very long hour.  When the food finally arrived, we were starving and devoured our burgers ... which made our stomachs ache after ...BACHI.

ojOPiGciEMy1z31_uUL3ew.text: Horrible service! First of all, I repeated my order to the server 2 times and it was was still wrong, had to ask multiple times for a drink refill, waited about 30 minutes for our food, waited another 20 min or so for our check, waited 30 minutes for the waiter to come around to pick up our checks then waited another 30 min for them to return our cards. They had no courtesy at all to give us an update why it's taking so long to charge our card.  We had a party of 6, the trainer informed us we could only split the checks 2 ways but we wanted to split it 3 ways and she said that couldn't be done. The trainee was actually able to split it 3 ways. I don't understand why we were told 1 thing but eventually it was able to be done.   Also, someone in my party wasn't satisfied with the salt and pepper fries and asked if she can get it without the ginger flavor and the trainer said he will fix it. About 15 minutes later someone else in my party asked about the fries and the trainer said "I can get those fries out of your way if it bothers you" REALLY? Where's the customer service?  This was my first time here and I do not plan on coming back here. If I could give zero stars then I would.

AMPgoSbAjjmOFkxhs3hZsw.text: I can't believe I haven't been to this location even though this one is the closest to where I live... This one seems to be a joint venture with Shoku Ramen. They actually give you menus for both at the same time. Maybe I'm a tough critic, especially when it comes to Asian-themed things, or maybe it's because I know what True Wagyu beef from Japan tastes like, but I feel like I'm the only one who doesn't really go ape-shit over this franchise. It's good but not mind-blowingly good.  After delaying this choice for a while, I finally tried the Kalbi Burger this time. It's a Korean-esque burger that has that Kalbi marinade plus some Kimchee inside. Don't worry. It's not spicy. I didn't really like it that much. The quality is fine, it's just this particular burger definitely isn't my thing. Try the other burgers first if you haven't been to this franchise before. Service is excellent overall. This place is always busy, but the servers did not ever forget about me and kept my drinks full. Food came out fast despite me going in during lunch hour. This joint can run up your bill pretty quickly. If you have to have an appetizer, then your burger and fries (which are NOT included), and you have to have an alcoholic beverage to go along with your fancy burger, then top it off with some dessert, you're looking at $35+ easily per person. This is definitely a joint that you go to for the hip-ness of it.

pNPu6u-5pbW-Q-rDfGx1hA.text: Ingredients are top quality.  Perfectly cooked and the sweet Asian flavors work great on the burgers...and I usually get the "boring" lettuce and tomato burger. I have dreams about the amazing truffle fries and my mouth is watering now thinking about them.

-COfHpQalD45XbPdmZSrvg.text: Honestly all the hype about this restaurant is overrated.   Oxtail chili cheese fries overly sweet & barely any oxtail.   Takoyaki was yummy big chunks of octopus.  Sausages was a tad salty.  Kiki burger, again too sweet & you couldn't taste the bacon very thin but meat was cooked perfectly.   Miyagi San was ok nothing special, sane scenario about the bacon.   Service was fast & great.

Kj7KyELj6ij_TcQa5PNebw.text: Watched it on Triple D and visited this place. Tried the Banh mi and Miyagi burger with salt and pepper garlic fries. Lives up to its Guy"s reputation . The Banh mi burger has a class of its own. Unique flavor , soft bun , kicky burger patty with the pork pate and the picked veggies on the side makes this one hell of a choice. Miyagi was good too but nothing spectacular. Now to the Garlic jalapeno fries. Killer is the definition ! Wowow, this is something you don't find anywhere else . Crispy fried jalapeno , scallions and garlic with skat and Pepper makes this a must try at this place . Overall it's worth the visit and its claim to fame .

n7LV8f_Qh9edlQfoQzjlbA.text: Service is crap. We got here and waited 15 minutes before anyone acknowledged us in the slightest.   After they did, we were put on the wait list although the restaurant was clearly not full. So we waited about 10 minutes to be seated.   We eventually placed our order and almost a full hour after we arrived, we were served with food.   Whe it came, the food was decent. I had a myagi-San burger which was good but I would have been happy with a saltine cracker at that point. Maybe if I come back in a couple of years I'll get to see what it tastes like when I'm not in a ketonic hangry rage.

HS3ZdEimRS1cf5bGeRSCAg.text: BACHI BURGER Saw this place featured on Triple D, and when I heard it was burgers with an Asian twist, I was sold, and I made it my mission to try this place if I was ever in Sin City!!! It didn't disappoint, as the burgers were absolutely delicious! The oxtail chili fries are a must-have and all the burgers were yummy, exotic, and had a nice Asian Fusion twist to them to make them stand out from your average American hamburger. Come with your appetite, as the fries alone will fill your stomach!

FjtwzL-XOSx0Ts6oqotXlA.text: Always awesome.  Ramen is good not amazing.  Burgers are my favorite there.  Always get the Kiki burger and truffle fries.

J_z597vV4wpE0kZgZ35CaQ.text: Food is good but the last two times the service was horrible! Today it was slow and I was waiting by the host stand just got completely ignored and ended up walking out. Just because of that I will never go back! Great job on acknowledging your customers

dIZw4ykDSO06TideXuq3Jg.text: Food was fantastic! My boyfriend and I have been wanting to try this place for a while and decided to come for lunch on New Year's Eve with an out of town guest. We walked right in and got a table immediately. Our server was very sweet and prompt even though it was a full restaurant. Another guest came to complain to our server that they had not yet been greeted after 10 minutes and a yelling match ensued in the back of the house when she went to get the other table's server. Apparently one server was not pulling his weight and was told to go home. It was actually quite entertaining.   We had Oxtail loaded fries which was out of this world!  Also had the delicious Brussels sprouts as a shared app/side since the sandwiches are a la cart. We enjoyed every bite of the Banh Mi burger, the Kiki burger and the pork belly steamed buns. I am looking forward to going back to try the noodle bowls. They looked huge and delicious!! Between the three of us, we had cocktails, beer, and a few of their delicious and refreshing teas.   The four star review would have been a five, but one bathroom was out of order while the other was in disarray, they were out of a few items that we asked for, And because there were seats outside, but apparently the patio was closed. It was a beautiful day out and I love indoor/outdoor options.   Overall, I can't wait to go back and would definitely recommend!

VWdG7X7d75wbpjA0CSJ18Q.text: Yum to the E.  Very good burgers.  Nice egg on top.  Ox tail fries.  Wagyu.  Yummy!  We definitely recommend this place.  Give it a try and you won't regret it!

D11gTHC6w_fyv2cb5BOo-g.text: Stopped by for dinner this past weekend! It's been awhile since I've been here. I've been wanting to try bone marrow for a long time and they had it on their menu! So I ordered that along with the oxtail chili cheese fries for me and the "No meat here" burger for the wifey with an order of their salt and pepper garlic french fries.  The bone marrow came out first. I didn't know what to expect but it was AMAZING! I'll just call it meat butter. I spread it on toast and the overall flavors and texture was out of bounds! The oxtail chili cheese fries as AMAZING as well. So much richness and flavors. The kicker was the fresh jalapenos that added the necessary fresh and crisp (and spicy) element to this plate. I couldn't even finish half of the plate. The wifey enjoyed her burger and the garlic fries even more.   Service was great. Our server was patient and friendly.  The quality and love they put in this food is noticeable from the presentation to the actual taste. Highly recommended!

oorVrL_hC65ZPz64DpIr-A.text: It's an ok burger. The bar area is odd. You sit at a big plastic looking wall.  Too tall for the bar stools to fell comfortable.  Ordered a med rare and received it rare. Just fries were okay. Asked for salt but didn't get any.  Was over charged for a beer by 12.00 dollars!  Had to wait to get server over to fix our check.  Not a great experience.

GCHDlFYiIqqZSgmXMzaMRw.text: Burgers are delious! I wanted ramen though and it's under contruction.  Others in my party had burgers though and I had the pork belly buns and we had Parmesan and salt n pepper garlic fries and everything was good! I took off one star because of the ramen.  The service was excellent!  I would come back again for another burger!

-vLZ0QKSzc0czCrSagV-Uw.text: I never would have come here on my own, so I'm glad I was brought along. I was told that there was amazing boba here, but when we arrived, they didn't serve any. Water was good, however.   We ordered the oxtail chili cheese fries and shared two burgers - the spicy miso burger and the ronin burger. Both burgers were great, but there was something about the miso burger that stood out a little more. The fries were amazing, and I would have finished them had I not been wearing a crop top and out with a cute boy I was crushing on. Hahaha.

0j3BDHtN8g4YWd1Mso3kMw.text: Will never return.  Their speciality burgers are too weird for me -- ingredients I've never heard of like lup cheong sausage, shisito pepper and yamamomo peach.  On my husband's first visit, he ordered a regular burger.  It was okay, but at $15 it should be.  We had lunch here this week with friends who like the restaurant.  We didn't want truffle fries, so we ordered the "Salt & Pepper Garlic Fries."  They were good, but had raw slices of jalepeno mixed in.    Not wanting beef, my husband ordered the chicken/turkey 'burger.'  He said it was okay, but he wouldn't order it again.  Not wanting beef, I ordered a fish sandwich.  It's cod.  It should have been fine, but it stunk; smelled fishy which means the fish isn't fresh.  It also didn't taste good; I only ate half and left the rest.  It took a long time before anyone came to take our drink orders, even though half the tables were empty.  One bathroom was closed, so my husband used the second bathroom.  He said it was disgusting -- then an employee walked out of a stall and out the door WITHOUT WASHING HIS HANDS!!!!  The restaurant is over-priced; the food is too weird for me.  What ever happened to a traditional burger?  If you want a speciality burger, I recommend Burgers & Brews inside the M.  And the whole bathroom thing.....

7X5SYL88Cs__BIhhPO35JQ.text: As you can tell by the photos, these are not your average burger. Yes, many places pile all sorts of things on top of a meat patty and declare victory. This is not that. This is the burger equivalent of hanging the Mona List in the Eiffel Tower above a tower of Faberge Eggs. Things don't just go together between the bun, they team up to create one of the most unique food experiences out there...particularly when their allies in the fry basket are competing for your attention.  It's a 5 minute drive from Mc Carran airport. Make this your first stop.

vYQ0QUx6kc0aoRo-Ya8ycw.text: Came here for dinner on a work trip to Vegas. A co-worker had heard nothing but good things and after looking the place up it sounded like a good idea.   The place had a few open tables but the lack of servers/service made seating take alot longer than it really should have, and honestly the service was even spotty once we got seated.  The food we got made up for it all tho. I ordered "Miyagi-san Grass Feed Wagyu Burger  with Salt and Pepper fries. Both were excellent and delicious. I loved the jalapeno touch they added to the fries.    Co-Workers ordered sweet potatoes fries which were excellent along with a Black and Green burger and rissoto wagyu burger. The both also enjoyed their meals.  I would absolutely come back. Even with the spotty service it was good enough to where I would like to come try some other their other burgers. Price point is basically $20 a head if you're not drinking.

BsawXQXRDm2PenNzqCQTBQ.text: We went on a Monday evening about 9pm.  The tables were full, but they were able to seat us immediately.  We went HAMmer on the menu.  We got calamari, wings, garlic fries, oxtail fries, oreo shake, and the shogun burger.    Ok, I had the burger, and it was totally worth the 26 bucks.  The wagyu was tender, and it was just a whole lot of fatty goodness. It was maybe on the sweet side, but it was fine by me.  Good balance of flavor.  I'm coming back to try more stuff

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shogun burger.
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. We did oxtail fries with the chili on the side and I ate it like soup.  (Fatboy status)
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calimari

1yVrceQVg3ZH2BmEEUeDOA.text: Great experience and unique burgers!! This place not only has a great burger, but an extraordinary one. The theme among the burger variations focuses on Asian ingredients and the umami is strong! Bachi has also joined forces with a ramen restaurant next door, so both options are available and the menu is  is extensive.   The Kiki burger was sampled, along with their famous salt and pepper garlic fries and a wedge salad. Fries were shoestring and cooked well, but the topping mixture was what set them apart. Fresh garlic, cilantro, and shaved jalapenos tossed with hot fries and a sprinkling of S & P really gave the potatoes a bright and zingy flavor. The wedge salad was not only good but presented creatively (see photo) and the dressing tapered homemade. The Kiki burger was awesome. While the char on the exterior of the patty was a bit overdone for my taste, the toppings on the burger were yummy and the bun was soft and tasty. Service at Bachi was excellent. The interior needs a little better upkeep and more appealing environment; i.e. table surfaces look shabby and floor not that clean.   If you're looking for a different burger, Bachi is your place, and I will return! Hopefully, to try some ramen too...

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Condiments for spicing it up...
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cute wedge salad. Love the presentation!
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kiki burger

Z8QBaULAKMOchQ8CTXassA.text: My most favorite asian fusion spot. They nailed that category of food. The truffle fries are also the best combo!

L9EaX_psOJDzEQf_YQw7ww.text: THIS HAS GOT TO BE THE PLACE I WILL FOREVER KNOW AS THE BEST TASTING BURGER I'VE EVER HAD IN MY LIFE(no exaggeration). I had the Kiki burger with angus beef, shiitake&eryngii mushroom, enoki onion marinade, gruuere cheese, and garlic chili aioli. I also ordered the oxtail chili cheese fries. The burger was unforgettable. I wish I could had taken 2 or 3 to go. The fries were decent. Nothing really spectacular and they cost almost as much as the burger themself. The main downside of why I couldn't give this location 5 stars is because of the service. It took approximately 20 minutes for our waitress to take our DRINK ORDER, not food, and then about another 20 minutes to give us our check after we had asked for it. Otherwise I would totally recommend this place for the delicious and great pricing burgers.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The oxtail chili cheese fries. It was about $11 and it was decent, though for that price I&#39;d definitely recommend getting a burger instead

w0PEszANHW4Wx7HEDDx0cg.text: This was my first time eating here and all the staff was incredibly nice except for the one girl who was there Tara she was rude and wanted to argue she had an attitude. Charlie and Dillon were great with customer service and was doing anything to make our visit great after Tara was being rude. The food was really good.

JDnwkXsC0sYOwb2wxsm3Cg.text: When I want some burgers during my Vegas trip, I make sure to come here. My best friend recommended this place to me and I was so glad he did! Prices can vary depending on what you order, but I've always averaged at $20+ for a burger/fries/drink so it's not really on the cheap side.  I've tried about 4 different types of burgers here and they just don't disappoint! Meat is super juicy, their sauces are amazing and bread is delicious as well. I just don't care what people say after eating their garlic fries, it's very good! *5 star for the food.  Service is very good, just not good enough to give 5 stars though. It took some time for the waitress to help us out, but from there she made our experience pleasant. *4 stars for the service.  For a relatively small restaurant, this place seats a decent amount of people and is very clean. Downside is that it can be a challenge to move around due to the lack of walking space. *4 stars for the atmosphere.  Thinking about their burgers is really making hungry again. Can't wait until my next trip!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

33gmZrEHjZTD3w3EDRgqmg.text: + Miyagi-sans Grass-Fed Wagyu Burger  + Oxtail Chili Cheese Fries  I enjoy fusion burgers and this place doesn't disappoint. The Miyagi burger was very flavorful and the Oxtail Chili Cheese Fries were the perfect compliment to my burger. The food was good and the service was good.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Miyagi

sNCjM7D6pGsaiwZL85ORbw.text: I went here once before. Food is good, but there is always a wait. I am typing this now waiting in line as we speak. The reason for a low rating is there are open tables ready to seat people, yet I have to wait 25 minutes for a party of 2. Unacceptable. Hire more waiting staff.  Edit: We finally got seated but took much more time to get our order in, get our food, and then our check. We won't be coming here anymore.

8WK1i602j4CEQS5R7tzKJw.text: This place had the best burger in Vegas. When I go to Vegas I will definitely come back to try out their other burgers. The waitress was very helpful and told us what was good and the best choice everyone picks. She also kept refilling our drinks without us asking. Best service ever hands down. It was this young skinny female with glasses.

KcT2Xd26gOOnSUDyTm9FvQ.text: I am not a fan of burgers at all but Bachi changes the entire game for me. This is a great environment for family dinners and gathering with a group of friends. Sometimes they could get pretty busy so wait time to get seated could range from 15-20 minutes. Once you get seated they take your drink orders and you look over the menu to see what you want.  I usually order the Kimchee burger with Oxtail fries. It is so good together. Everything on the menu in my opinion is savory and I think that's a huge plus in my book. They also have a bar if you want to order any other drinks. The wait time for your food is roughly 15 minutes, average. Because of the fries I usually don't finish my burger but the portions are big for one person to get full off of. Overall, great experience here!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail Fries

Ze080IKe9X7fRCgtyC7HcQ.text: This is a small-ish place in a strip mall. But it's got a menu packed with unique eats. Kalbi on a burger? Count me in! And they've got some seriously delicious french fries too. Cilantro and jalapeno on top of garlic fries? Love it! They also have some unique sodas, as well as adult milkshakes.  It can get crowded at peak times. Service is attentive and friendly. Food was piping hot and yum. Not much in terms of ambiance and decor, but the food is the star here.  It's actually two restaurants in one - when you are seated, you'll not only get the Bachi Burger menu, but also the menu for Shoku Ramen.   I was pleasantly surprised on my latest trip here. I ate here once in 2010 and was not a fan at all - I really didn't like the burger. But my view has now shifted - I'm a total fan!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BHHOIBtEu4p6tMHeXz4ICQ.text: The best burger place there is. Visited back in march. I had Ox tail chili fries which have layers of flavor! I here that an Ox tail chili burger maybe in the works! For my burger I had the 4 mushroom burger, can't tell you what type of shrooms but the flavor was amazing! When I am back in Vegas I will be dropping by before the drive back to Southern Cal.

CPp1zlTVSemcsP2RRNccQg.text: HATE  Nothing.  DISLIKE  Lack of cocktails (especially for a place open late).  LIKE  The overall menu concept. Apple-lychee soda. Ronin burger. The Lonely Bird. Open 'til 2am. The white chocolate gelato that came with our "pop tart." Our funny server.  LOVE  Sweet potato fries.

8HnEL821uSArJu-is5lCOg.text: Here currently on a Friday night. Had us wait 15 minutes to sit down in a not so full restaurant. Also made tables after us wait...after being seated for over 5 minutes someone finally came and said "hi". No one really had a spring in their step.  All the employees are kinda just hanging out. I know the good here is good but from the service side isn't looking like the greatest choice.

h_ZVxsG1mJngPP85Yacb4w.text: Oh my goodness is this the best thing I've ever put in my mouth?! YES! I came here after reading other reviews and I have to say it blew my expectations out of the water.  I'm slowly working my way through the menu but my favorite so far is the Kiki burger.  What I like about Bachi is that they take a lot of very powerful flavors such as bacon or blue cheese and mix it with more delicate flavors of mushrooms or miso and you can taste every single ingredient and they compliment each other so beautifully.  It's a balance of flavors that few chefs are able to accomplish. The burgers are so moist it almost seems a shame to put the sauce they make for your specialized burger on but you must! It makes all the flavors pop.  Once you're done, you wish you had room in your stomach for more.  My usual appetizers are the peking duck buns or the pork belly buns.  You can't go wrong with either and they both are so tender and savory you'll be licking the plate it came on. My usual sides are the parmesan truffle fries.  I had the oxtail fries and they just didn't do it for me.  They were heavy and I felt they had this odd almost bitter taste to them.  They looked like chili cheese fries.   The service is always excellent when I go there.  The servers are all nice and want you to have the best experience possible.  During my last visit there, I had a server who was just recently hired and wow! They train their staff well because she knew all of the menu items and she was personable and attentive.  PS! I went there while they were filming the kitchen segment for Dinner's, Drive In's and Dives.  Although they weren't officially open, they were kind enough to allow my friends and I to order out.  I HOPE MY BURGER WAS ON THE SHOW!  Also, you better go there now before the episode airs in about 6 months because after that, you wont be able to get in the door.

Qwe-dgeMjzCFVoJD9d6KxA.text: Finally tried it after hearing all the hype! Now if it was just food im rating then it would be 6 stars all the way! I dont think it would of mattered what burger you ordered because of our party of six, we all ordered different burgers and each different burger was as flavorful as the next! Pricewise I think is just a bit high to the point that I would only eat here once in a while. Depending on when you go, you might run into some ridiculous wait times which equals to ridiculous service times. When you do sit down, hopefully you took advantage of the your wait time by going over the menu and are ready with your order. So as soon as you sit down, put your order in and I recommend getting appetizers because those dont take as long to make! That is why they didnt get that 5th star from me. I can understand their burgers are made to order but from the time our order was placed until we got our food was about 30 mins. Our appetizers, (we ordered 3 different types of fries, one being the oxtail fries was bomb!). By the time our burgers showed up, I was literally licking my empty plate of oxtail fries cuz it took so long! Overall, I had a decent experience because we went on a late wednesday night. The 4 out of our group of six have been there at least a couple times and they have told me they waited about 45 mins to an hour just to get seated those times.

xII-l28DbkGLNoje6cTj2w.text: Pork belly on the steamed buns, Kalbi burger and oxtail chili cheese fries with a fried egg - feast of kings. If i had to choose my last meal on this earth, i would want to go to this place. What a gem to find in Vegas. Superb. Saw on food network and had to visit. Wish they had one in San Diego, CA.  Absolutely loved the food and experience. When back in Vegas, Bachi burger is a must have. Deserves 8 stars not 5. Above and beyond!!

3ZP3ozZi-_mQAJT50PJ0lw.text: Met a couple of friends here. Casual atmosphere and they do not take reservations.  Had the Ronin Burger and it was good, but not great. Expected more after all of the reviews.  Our group had the Sweet Potato fries, Salt and Pepper fries, the regular fries, a Ronin Burger and the Crab Sandwich.  Overall consensus was that it was OK, but not outstanding as expected.  Service was good and they have an extensive boba, soda, and drink menu. Skip Bachi and go to BurGR if you only have time for one burger joint in town and don't mind the strip.  I probably will also not bother going to the Bachi Burger they are opening in Westwood when in town, since Father's Office, 25 Degrees and so many other much better burger places are in LA.

12r2H_pChzcNlGOven_Zjg.text: This place is basically an asian spin on burgers. The service and food is great, but the burgers take a LONG time to make. I recommend ordering the Ox Tail Chili Fries to start off and eat while you wait for your burger.  Also a good snack are the sausages or the shrimp chips.  As for the burger, we have tried them all. Our two favorites are the vietnamese Banh-Mi inspired one and the Ronin japanese inspired one. The rest are good, but these were the best (and that includes the foie gras burger).  Solid place, great flavor, good prices.  Just be patient waiting for your delicious burger.

7hblsZcnPtQMKUPkZTUjuQ.text: Ate here again today for the second time. Due to the weather, both my wife and I ordered a noodle bowl. Both were delicious although very different in terms of spiciness and contents. I had the Spicy Miss bowl and it WAS spicy although not overly so. The wife had a very simple noodle soup that she enjoyed very much.  Service was excellent. Again...we will be back.

Pp-X_k1HCIIBOC_iHyNzZQ.text: Awesome. After seeing this on Diners, Drive-ins and Dives I had to visit.  It was quite crowded on the evening we went but we were promptly seated at the bar. The server explained everything and made his recommendations. The Green and Blue burger was the best burger ever (grass fed beef with blue cheese). The buns are freshly baked and don't compare to anything I've ever eaten before.  There are some exotic foods but also the basic burger and fries made to your liking. The staff is friendly. I would eat there again and again!

H0PlNBfuCm_OoLvrrcgVoQ.text: So tonight was the second night within the week that I have visited Bachi Burger.    Wednesday Night -Oxtail Chili Cheese Fries with a fried egg:  one of my friend, Spanky who didn't order any fries, could not stop eating this yummilicious fries.   -Ronin Burger-talk about explosive flavors from a bite of this burger...how amazing is this?  Was a very creative and innovative burger.  Spanky, who had ate dinner earlier, had to order this burger because it sounded so freakin awesome.  He down half of that burger in literally 3 bites, AND the burger was a decent size.  I shared this burger with my other friend, since he wasn't too hungry.  However, he said he should have gotten his own burger since it was so good. -parmasan truffle fries-I could definitely taste the truffle and the sundried tomato aioli made it so much more better.  We had to order an extra ramkin of this yummy sauce.  It cost .50 cents though.  Sure it doesn't break my bank account, but I think they can easily bring in the bucks with this because it is just that yummy.  But I have to say, the oxtail chili fries made this one forgettable.  -I end the night with the rootbeer float.  They gave me so much icecream!  nom nom nom...  Friday Night -Oxtail Chili Cheese Fries-What can I say...YUMMY.  This alone is quite filling for 2, note to self. -Kiki burger:  well, i honestly thought the star of this burger are the different type of mushrooms that are in it.  When we got the burger, i was unable to taste the mushrooms :(  The bacon was overpowering everything else.  Still, a good burger.  Service:   Wonderful Ambience: Contemporary Nice Feel Food:  GGGGREAT!!

yipjqqGu-3CUXWgLcBuuaA.text: We were visiting from NY.  It was so delicious we came back before we returned home.  We loved the Ronin burger, the Banh Mi burger, the Miyagi San burger.  My favorite was the Kiki burger.     Sweet potato fries were yummy!     Plantation sweet tea was unique and super refreshing.  Must order the Lava cake.  So warm and scrumptious.

AdCkwhKPDk3r2Bh8Af63YA.text: wendys makes a better burger. they try to had to be different. had a mr.ho's burger and it the only way i can describe the way it taste was like breakfast food gone bad and had some weird cinnamon after taste . also had the ronin burger not as bad but still not good. who puts arugala on a buger?  the service blows btw had to wait twenty min. for a check,( and not impatient costumer time) was just disappointing  i had heard many good things

MgUOqnP5es1LNWyb9hcoPw.text: I absolutely love this place , the lonely bird is my fave with the fresh strawberry lemon aid  yummie, our server Daniel was great too , very on point !! Love this place !

NxG9xIKE84g3iW4zkLZZmw.text: I will start with the good and end on the bad. The food was awesome our server was great even when annoying large parties were asking her to take their pictures while she was trying to work. Only warning was my husband does not like spicy and I did not see anything that would indicate that Garlic fries were spicy however I could have missed it as we were starving. now the bad. We arrived with a party of 5 and were quoted a 20 minute wait. Multiple small parties were put in front of us and the Hostess would disappear often while we waited once for almost 10 minutes. Finally 45 minutes later we were seated. Normally we would have left before 45 minutes but we were starving and it was far off the strip so we knew anywhere else would not have the same quality of food.

7TIA7Sv7w941rUvJ6zL9Zg.text: Am a HUGE fan.  Definitely the place to go for a delicious, out-of-the-ordinary burger experience.    I visit every so often for lunch with one of my friends from the office, and we are quickly making our way through the menu by splitting our plates...    Favorites:   Pork Belly Steamed Buns Bahn-Mi burger Sweet Potato Fries  ..  but can't say that I have really had anything that wasn't above-average... Even my friend's grilled cheese was phenomenal...

flc7nhFa3hh0jWe39n9J8Q.text: So I recently went to this place to satisfy my cravings as it had been over 6 months ago, or even longer since my last fixin here. I can't remember bc it's been way too long. If you had asked me to rate this place a year ago, it would've been a solid 4.5 stars! Now, it has fallen down quite a bit as with their new renovations of adding an extended bar, (limiting their space to seat customers) and the huge lack of customer service...I for sure thought that didn't really matter to me as the food is the only reason why I even came. That got shot down quickly as my bahnmi burger was just not the same as before. It was too salty and the patty was way too dry. What happened to the yummy pickled veggies?? Maybe it was just an off night for the chef, but I will say I'm willing to try again. My lychee martini was tasty, but bartender left chunks of ice in it. Let's just hope this was an off night!

acdb3egHVGw3VSM_pSnxhg.text: First of all, it's behind Subway....we had a little difficulty finding it and circled the parking lot before finding it.  Service:  Slow like many reviews said, however, we weren't upset at all.  I didn't read the reviews before going here because I was thinking with 200 reviews & 4 stars and all our friends recommending it, it's worth a try.  So I didn't know about the slow service.  I just commented during dinner how we had finished all our appetizers and our burgers have yet to arrive.  The reason why I think none of us were upset was because the staff did seem very nice and were just new or something.  Oh and my boyfriend also commented that I should not have ordered my appetizers when the waiter came to ask for our drink orders because he seemed really flustered that I interrupted his order of doing things.  Also the appetizers came out way before the water did, which I thought was strange.  Food:  Sweet potato fries were really good.  I loved the yuzu citrus aioli that came with it.  Truffle parmesean fries was pretty good too.  It came with a sun dried tomato aioli, which I thought wasn't as good as the sweet potato one.  I think it really depends on personal taste, because half of us liked the sweet potato one more and the other half the truffle one more.  Garlic, ginger, and chili edamame was really good.  I love the flavor and it's so much better than plain salted edamame that I am used to at Japanese restuarants.  Oxtail chili cheese fries was ok.  I wasn't a big fan of it.  I think I would have preferred beef over oxtail.  I really couldn't tell the difference except for the occasional fattier pieces of meat.  I also would rather it came in a smaller portion because it was a meal in itself.  As for the burgers, we got Kiki's burger, Banh-mi burger, and 2 BBQ Angus burgers with some add-ons.  No one in my party enjoyed their burgers that much.  I was ok with mine, but it wasn't that good.  I think the main problem (completely our fault) is that we didn't realized it was BBQ, meaning sweet BBQ sauce.  No one like that the patties had a sweet taste and was competing with the other sauces.  My brother took probably 3 bites and bagged it home for his dog, saying that he would prefer In-N-Out...and all the other great burger places in Philly.  He thought that even though he ordered medium, it came out too dry for him.  His girlfriend had the Banh-mi, with the BBQ and curry aioli, I don't think she even touched the fish sauce.  She didn't finish her burger either.  My boyfriend thought his burger was ok but the bottom bun was soggy, probably because his egg was running down the side when it was delivered to the table.  My burger was ok too.  it didn't wow me though.  My boyfriend and I were the only ones who finished our burgers.  Also their boba drinks are not made from fresh fruits.  I was hoping they were, but good thing I asked before I ordered one.  I did try the green milk tea boba and it was ok.  I don't think I will come back here again.  If I do, it will only be to do take out for the sweet potato fries and edamame.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kiki&#39;s burger
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banh-mi burger

YI1co21Kip-9JbrW0ZOiKg.text: 3 stars: A-OK  People who know me know that I enjoy eating off the strip.  Any burger joint with oxtail and foie gras on the menu instantly piques my interest.  So we went to Bachi Burger.   The burgers were excellent. In fact, I went so far as to say the shogun burger here blew Hubert Keller's Rossini out of the water.  And the absolute piece de resistance was the oxtail chili cheese fries.   I recommended the spot to everyone who would listen. I texted pics of the oxtail chili to encourage folks to go and check it out. Anyone who saw that fried egg sitting on that mound of chili and fries would certainly be compelled to go and order a plate for themselves.  Skip forward a year and change, and a visit from that Ferry guy with the frosted tips and that DDD show.  Inevitably, there's more patrons, the food quality suffers, and the portion sizes decrease. Getting on TV is both the best and worst thing that can happen to a restaurant.   People who went there in the past have reported back, telling me how it's just not the same anymore.   So now what?   I guess it's time to look for another place before DDD ruins it.

wXMvWaTe87vvG5ilwtP01g.text: What do you get when you ground together beef, pork, and shrimp an put it into a burger? You get cr-p! I had the ban mi burger. They put too many different ingredients together that didn't pair well and it made me sick. I dont know what all the hype is about. The food is expensive and bad.

bV4T2FS8Ihtxz8Z37NQMDA.text: Totally worth coming here!! Everything that we ordered was awesome! I ordered the spicy miso burger with a meatless patty. It was very good! The fried egg with the swiss cheese and the shishito pepper was on point! The spicy pepper and the gooey egg brought my palate to a new level of love for the meatless burger. Being a vegetarian can be difficult at times. I really miss beef but these new replacements are making it easier to stay the path.   Great customer service. Excellent food. Open area seating. It was a great stop after spending the day at the Hoover Dam. Sucks that they are temporarily closed.

tQdyFWh4DajMKXd23asBMA.text: Great burgers for the grade of meat with a good sized burger. Depending on the kind of burger. I had their black and green burger, which was amazing. This one really brought out the umami flavor and that tangy taste.   The price is on the higher end side, but it's decent priced for whats it's worth. Service was great here with the dining area being really spacious.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle fries
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black and Green Burger

N490a82KW8EtUWeMBPwxBw.text: Wow, I'm surprised I haven't written a review for this joint yet. Been here numerous times, we used to go here a few times a week the first few months they opened.   The burgers, appetizers, all dishes, and drinks are delicious. Haven't been disappointed yet.   I usually bring my out of town guests here and they always request to eat here. On my last visit, met an older couple that stopped in because they saw it on TV and someone recommended it to them. Highly recommend them.   2018 Yelp Review #26

zv2EQCDI4NvM4N23QzeHvg.text: This is my go to place for burgers anytime I am in Vegas. I first heard about this place as a recommendation from a fellow coworker that lives in Vegas, so I decided to give it a try. When I put it in my GPS, I had a little bit of a hard time finding the place at first. The restaurant is located on the far end of the shopping center almost towards the back, but once you know where it is, it seems almost ridiculous that it was hard to find.  When you first walk in, you are immediately greeted by the host. I have never had to wait for a table any time I have come here to eat, so that is always a plus. During my last visit, I decided to try something new and order the Kiki Burger. It was Angus beef burger topped with enoki mushroom, greyere cheese and some kind of garlic aioli. The burger was cooked a little more than I desired, but it was still juicy and savory with each bite and there were no regrets.  I also ordered the strawberry lemonade. This drink was bottomless and I am so glad it was as it was absolutely delicious. I liked that they used actual straw berries and lemons to make it instead of from concentrate.  Overall, for two people the bill came out to about $35. It is a little bit on the pricier side for a burger, but completely worth it.

HKkG6cYm2_gltjm6HXKBjQ.text: Saw this place on Triple D and I'm so glad I did.  OMG!  The burger was bomb!!! I have never had a burger that tasted anything like this one.  I had the Mr Miyagi!  Get this one!   My daughter and I shared it and she raved about it as well.   We also had the regular fries that came with this delicious ketchup.    I would definitely go back and recommend this place to anyone.  I honestly wish I was hungrier so I could have ordered more things to try.  The dishes that came out to other tables looked and smelled so good.   Can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mr Miyagi burger!  Amazing!

CFVFmUrVcRb6JmL9AKvaMQ.text: Bachi Burger is an Asian-inspired burger restaurant and it was featured on Guy Fieri's Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives (foodnetwork.com/videos/a...). This popular Las Vegas-based burger restaurant originally had two locations in LA (one in Pasadena and one in Sawtelle Japantown), but both locations were shut down in 2016. Our group came here for lunch on Friday and we waited about 20 minutes. Service was slightly slow, but it wasn't exactly a deal breaker. *** Pork Belly Steamed Buns (duroc pork belly, savoy cabbage slaw, boiled egg, hoisin BBQ - 3 pieces, $11): It was a pretty interesting take on pork belly bun. Pork belly had good soft texture and it tasted slightly vinegary. Overall a good appetizer, but not amazing. Kiki's Burger (angus beef, sauteed shiitake, enoki & eryngii mushrooms, caramelized bacon, gruyere cheese, sweet onion marmalade, garlic chili aioli - medium rare, $12.50): This burger tasted a little bit like Hawaiian burger but without any slices of pineapple. Sauce tasted just right with a slightly sweet aftertaste and burger didn't taste too greasy. Sure patty wasn't super juicy, but it didn't taste super dry at the same time. I would definitely recommend this burger! *** I don't think Bachi Burger is absolutely a must-visit place in Las Vegas, but I am pretty satisfied with what I had here.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kiki&#39;s Burger (angus beef, sauteed shiitake, enoki &amp; eryngii mushrooms, caramelized bacon, gruyere cheese, sweet onion marmalade - $12.50)
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Belly Steamed Buns (duroc pork belly, savoy cabbage slaw, boiled egg, hoisin BBQ - 3 pieces, $11)
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu (Dec 2018)

IaU83SvcLTA42BXSPN7ZzA.text: Man this place is amazing. From the ambiance and decor, to the service, to of course the food.   Got a Mr Miyagi San grass fed wagyu beef burger. Medium rare, it was one of the best burgers I've ever eaten. Couldn't get enough of it and the beef, is so tender and fresh. Amazing!!  Paired with truffle parmesan fries and a mushroom sauce to dip. Those were great as well.   No complaints here. It's a definite must stop by when you're in Vegas!! You won't regret it.     The staff make you feel so welcome as well. It was a nice experience overall. I wish they had one in MN.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle parm fries with mushroom dipping sauce. Yummm
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mr miyagi San Burger. Impeccable

1lu20pxG-49pfdKbkJ9slA.text: I'm not usually a fan of fusion, but this place is an exception! The Bachi fish burger was amazing, the fish just dissolved in my mouth.  The portions aren't very large for the price, and don't come with any sides so be prepared to spend a little more than usual.

miewx9trAgFwHpzDDPhE7g.text: I have an out of town guest and he requested to hit Bachi Burger. Went to the Sahara location 2 nights ago and the sign said temporarily closed. Tried the Windmill location tonight and guess what? Yuuuup- temporarily closed. W.....T.......F?!?  Had to satisfy our burger craving so we hit up Fukuburger on Buffalo. Let's just say Bachi is playing chess (if they are allowed to play -ahem-....) and Fuku is playing checkers.   Come on, Bachi. Get ur stuff together and re-open!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Windmill location on 2/9/19. Soooooo bummed....

VFEaUMX3FO0FwFK408MOqw.text: The ramen was closed when we went. But the burgers is different. Soooo good and juicy. Service was outstanding. I would totally recommend this place. It's different than your average burger joint.  The oxtail chili cheese fries was to die for. I would totally come back here.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail Chili Cheese Fries
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Eu7JOfNxrEJ5eUgijXYQrQ.text: Came here on a whim after shopping for some ingredients for dinner. This was nearby so friend's wanted to come here for lunch. It's been a few years since I've been to this location, or at least a year, Bachi Burger in general  "Pork Belly Steamed Buns" - Duroc Pork Belly w/ cilantro, scallions, radish, boiled egg, chinese black vinaigrette and hoisin BBQ sauce.   The pork belly overall was pretty good, as well as the bun. All the other toppings made it too sweet than anything else. I think i could probably omit the hoisin BBQ sauce and it would still be good.   "Truffle Parmesan Fries" - Topped with Parmesan Reggiano w/ a side of black truffle porcini cream and sun dried tomato aioli  This was fairly decent. The fries were freshly fried topped with a small amount of parmesan reggiano. I tasted more truffle "flavor" in the fries than the black truffle porcini cream though. This was quite bland overall. The sun dried tomato aioli was non-existant. We were not given this Lol !   "Kiki's Burger" w/ angus beef, sauteed shitake, enoki, and eryngii mushrooms, caramelized bacon, sweet onion marmalade, gruyere cheese and garlic chili aioli  This is typically the burger I usually get when I come to Bachi, granted it's been a few years since i've been to a Bachi Burger. Overlying theme of their burgers is firm, mildly overcooked burger patty, sweet everything... Lol.   "Fresh Strawberry Lemonade (bottomless)"  The strawberry lemonade was pretty good. The waiter did pretty good in keeping in eye on the levels of our lemonade and made sure to have it refilled before it was empty.   Overall, i'd probably get the steamed buns, fries, and lemonade again, but not the burger.. Lol.. oh man i feel like im one of those to a BBQ place and gets sides, and not the meats... not saying ive done that before.....

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle fries
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shogun burger
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1IonFifZFLFGJFP-5vhO2A.text: Asian fusion gourmet burger joint - with lots of traditional Asian ingredients not commonly found on burgers. I urge you to trust the chefs at Bachi and enjoy these incredible creations. They have crafted these delicious and unique burger  creations that blow my mind with every visit. The first bite is always, "Mmmmmm ..."  The edamame is enough to share, but I eat the whole bowl. The edamame is spicy goodness! It's got great flavor of chilis, garlic, and saltiness. It's super messy to squeeze out the edamame pods and so worth it! You will be licking your fingers, great flavor!  Burgers I've tried include Black & Green, Kiki's, and Miyagi-san. They're all fantastic and unlike any other burger. I would order any of those again. Kiki's is Bachi's take on bacon, mushroom, swiss. Miyagi-san is a burger with bacon and egg among other things. Black and Green is bacon, mushroom, and blue cheese. In the last year I've gone low carb (keto) so I order these "protein style" with no bun. I've had the buns and fries in the past and they're wonderful.  I generally have the iced matcha green tea. I like the casual atmosphere and the service has always been fantastic. Last time I was there during a college football game and watched that on TV.

hC6fN8PVwto4ldotfmvIzQ.text: My most recent experience at Bachi Burger was "meh" = 3 star review.   When we got there we were immediately greeted and sat at a table. No waiting, score!!  The server introduced himself and let us know that there was no ramen being served that night. That was a bummer because one of us planned to order ramen.   This was my first time visiting Bachi Burger since becoming a vegetarian. I opted for the "no meat here burger" and just fries.   The burger was "meh". Not horrible but not the best thing either in my opinion. The texture was different, the "burger" pretty much falling apart. I ended up eating it with a fork and a knife. The flavor was also not my favorite, though it's hard for me to describe it.   The fries were the best part of the meal. As good as they were, I think the fries were over priced for what you got.   With not many vegetarian options and the one I tried being "meh" I can't say I'll be back anytime soon.

GLhqOUGeqSnoBiHik48EwQ.text: I always have an amazing experience whenever I go here. I have been here multiple times and I always recommend this place to my friends whenever they are in town. With my last visit, I ordered the chicken wings, sweet potato fries, and the shogun burger. They. Were. All. Amazing. Everything was great, had a nice presentation and the food itself was full of flavor. Also, staff was friendly and was attentive. I can't get enough of this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken wings
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet potato fries

afmM9Dt3nQLuHycJJn7EKw.text: This restaurant is definitely worth it.  If you're tired of the same old burger joints, this is a must try!  Love the mixture of Asian cuisines and Western ones.  But you must come with an open mind.  This is an Asian fusion restaurant.  Food.  Delicious.  I tried the spicy miso burger.  The patty was so tender and full of flavor.  It basically melted in your mouth.  Before you realized it, the entire burger was gone.  Their fries were yummy too!  My daughter had the ox tail chili cheese fries.  She said it was very good.
