D0W98MK72xfGgV9knvFr_Q.text: We are now bonafide Bachi burger addicts.  Me and hubby both live the Kiki and parmesan fries.  These burgers are huge, and I get full half way through the burger.  But it is soooo good, I eat it 'til it's gone.  It is pricey, but hey, it's gourmet style.  You want cheapy asian infused burger, go join them teeny boppers at the fuku truck and wait forever!  Lol jk.

SfSwla-bcaDZrTGfOeBCnA.text: Bachi Burger is a hipster's burger joint. Great asian fusion burgers grilled to perfection. The dining area is actually a gallery of Japanese photography.   I tried the Kiki Burger which was great since I'm a fan of burgers with mushrooms. The Garlic Chili Aioli that came with it was really tasty.   I also tried the Crusty Crab Cake sandwich which was delicious. The crab cake was nice and thick and probably too much for the bread to hold. They really don't skimp on the amount of crab here. I also liked that they put avocado to pair with the crab cake. They also add mango and tangerine jam for a sweet contrast.  The sweet potatoe fries here are outstanding. Each one is crisp on the outside and fluffy on the inside.  I'll need to stop by everytime I'm in Vegas.

HQTznPsuPyzDPks8ElEN0A.text: These Asian fusion burgers are amazing and so unique! I've tried the banh-mi burger, ronin burger, and the turkey/chicken burger. All delicious! The only downside is the burger buns tend to get soggy quick because the meat is so juicy. The food also takes awhile to come out...I understand it's not fast food, but it seems to take a lot longer than it should. The parmesan truffle fries are so good, I can't get away from ordering them even though I keep telling myself I need to try some of their other fries (salt/pepper or sweet potato). If none of their specialty burgers are to your liking, you can make your own custom burger with a variety of options and toppings. They have kobe beef too!  They also have an extensive drink menu with home-made sodas and even Thai iced tea :D I'd recommend trying the apple lychee soda...so refreshing! For the alkies out there, they also have a wine & sake menu!

Xq6KbA1zSXFqFSgDI4EO1w.text: This is one of the best burger places in town! I have been here about ten times in the past couple months probably, and I am still satisfied and trying everything on the menu!  If you like the whole Asian-style burgers, you will have to try this! Oh, and don't forget to try the Oxtail chili-cheese fries! To die for!!

PX059zFIHhgZ7mvhL0dq1A.text: Oh man Oh man! A trip to Vegas would not be complete without a detour to Bachi Burger.  The Ox Tail fries are on point and the Bahn Mi Burger is deeeelish. Saw this place on Diners, Drive In's and Dives and was not disappointed.  The service was excellent and the wait time wasn't too bad.  By far one of my most favorite dining experiences to date.

TWH7mZdzcfvAGF4A0niXEg.text: Believe the hype - Bachi Burger is really good! Not only are the burgers really good, but the toppings and flavors are all really interesting and exotic. They have standard cheeseburgers as well, for those who don't want to branch out, but for anyone interested, they have burgers with all kinds of different Asian toppings (slaw, kimchee chi, different cheeses and bacons, lots of mushrooms, sauces, etc). Even for specialty burgers, the price is pretty good, unless you get up into the really fancy stuff (wagyu, crab, foie gras, etc).  My husband and I went and got one 'normal' specialty burger (I can't remember the name - Ronin maybe? It's the first one on the menu) and one of the more extreme (blue & green or something like that), an order of truffle fries, and one beer. Both burgers were REALLY GOOD, but I preferred the Ronin. The bacon on the other one was just a little too overpowering for me. Truffle fries were excellent as well. The whole thing cost $40 with tip and we had plenty of leftovers (not that you could save them long - the burgers are so loaded with sauces & wet toppings that they're soggy in an hour).  There was a decent-sized crowd in there on a Friday night, service was very prompt and friendly, and I love that it's near my neighborhood. MOST IMPORTANTLY - Bachi Burger is unlike anything else in the area! I love a great, new, unique, independent restaurant that's NOT on the strip!  Really, the review is only 4.5 stars because of one thing - the decor/ambiance inside the restaurant. It's kinda bland and the lights seem to be too bright, but because of everything else, I'm rounding up to 5.  I wish Bachi Burger all the success in the world so they can become longtime residents in the area and maybe inspire some other unique independent places!

uor4UHet450GPUyb4bVvkw.text: Warning: Don't come here if you're really hungry. There was a serious wait to get our food.  I really like the concept of this place. A restaurant that centers around offering quality burgers with an Asian flair. The price is on par for the burgers although they now offer a Wagyu beef burger for $23. Yeah. Kind of steep but I heard it's somewhat worth the price by dinner companions who ordered it.  I wish I could give them a 3.5 because the wait for our food was LONG and it wasn't even busy.   I ordered the Kiki's burger. It was as if all the right components were there but something was missing. Maybe salt? It needed something to transform it from good/really good to orgasmic.  The parmesan truffle fries were bomb though. Also, our server was really nice.

evjZCkgREf87aiDsc6X4Rw.text: I've come here a few times and I'm always extremely happy. The service is amazing and the whole crew, not just my server says thank you as I left. They paid close attention to details such as refills on my AMAZING plantation tea, everyone should try it. Now the food! I custom make a BBQ burger with bacon, cheddar, and onion rings. The bun is delicious and unique. The patty is big, flavorful, and cooked perfectly. And the rest is just as amazing. I would recommend Bachi Burger to anyone. They truly have the best burgers in town!

WwsLyhbRkAVoOj7eQWNQXg.text: HANDS DOWN the best burger joint!  Pros: +great service +amazing food +oxtail fries +kiki burger  Cons: -there isn't one in San Diego!

COdPIjr6KqBZpoY0qS9n4Q.text: Great food and presentation, great service, great atmosphere always clean. my third visit there every one is positive. I love latest rammen addition to the menu and sapporo on tap. One of my favs in town. Must try.

Io-7HastGN_gKVf1iHNBNQ.text: The portions and flavors are perfect! Love the Pork Belly Steamed Buns, Mr. Ho Burger and Oxtail Chili Cheese Fries!

NzGvZWMTJcjK8iITWsxgGg.text: Asian Fusion Burgers...sounds interesting.  So my last day in vegas  I thought I would check this spot out since it was very close to the Cancun where my friends were staying at.  We decided to call in our order a head of time since it was a pretty large order to go.  We decided to order the Ronin, Kiki, Kalbi, and Banh Mi. Im a big fan of peking duck so we also ordered the steamed sandwiches in beef short rib and pork belly.  Hahaha the order keeps goin we also ordered the sweet potato fries parm truffle fries, and porteguese donuts.  Burgers: All burgers were cooked medium $ 9.00 each Ronin-  Im not a big fan of coleslaw  so this wasnt my favorite Banh Mi- With the all the fixings(jalapeno, cilantro, and special sauce) I actually was surprisingly good...it worries me when they call it banh mi and its not actually viet banh mi...but a good twist to their version. Kiki- I like all the mushrooms on this burger and the aioli i think is what made it good. Kalbi- This one my friend like and she isnt found of spicy.    Its the sauces and special dressings on the burger that really make them work.  Steamed Sandwiches: 3 pieces each Peking duck - love peking duck.. Their version comes with eggs which was different for me. $ 12.50 Beef Short rib- my friend john really liked this version. The meat was very tender. $ 14.00 Pork Belly- This one I really like the best.. Marinate pork belly that is grilled.....hmmm pork!!! $ 12.00  Fries: $ 4.00 each Sweet Potato fries- I have had better they were a bit dry. Parm Truffle fries- interesting and different. For 4 bucks each I was expecting a bigger serving or fries.  My friends asked what is the brown sauce stuff on it...hahah I guess the truffle oil sauce!  Portugese donuts: $5.00 for 4 pieces w/ vanilla ice cream they were basicly cake donut holes rolled in cinnamon and sugar. I never tried them before but my friend loves portugese donuts. He actually like them a lot...to me they were a lil dense but I assume they are supposed to be like that.  Service: The guy at the registar and who helped me with my order was very nice.  He even asked me where the party is at since i ordered a lot of food. I laughed to myself and told him um no where we are just having dinner at the Cacun resort.  "Oh can I come too!" LOL! He was a reallly nice guy and he helped me carry out my order to my car.  He even offered me water or soda while I was waiting for my order to be ready.  Nice change from the strip where all the wait staff are very superficial and too good to be working where they are working at.    The restaurant itself was nice.  I thought I was at the wrong place cuz it is actually set up very nice not like no regular fast food chain. Its an actually set down place.    Would I go back to eat here again when I visit vegas..most likely.  I really like the Pork belly steamed sandwich a lot.  But they are a bit pricey. For peking duck 14 bucks for 3 pieces is alot...i can order a freaking whole duck for that and the steam buns.

Fp5hQz3vXZP8EN-jVUp1dQ.text: Delicious food and probably the best burger in Las Vegas.  BUT make sure you have plenty of time to wait...  Once you put your name on the list its a good 45 minutes before you get any glimpse of your food.  If servers here worked in an emergency room patients would be dead in the grave before they got their name called...

60K8mxiSy_CXFnC07E30wg.text: Its over priced burgers gourmet style. I would prefer pay for cheaper Fatty good food, Fuddruckers, oxtail in the cal hotel, any steak and eggs late night specials.   I thought the idea of Oxtail chili fries sounded interesting, but it was like the chili just overpowered the rest.

GjHgX6aWYXyWyoPjuJWvPg.text: I made my pilgrimage twice in one weekend while visiting Las Vegas. Friday night, 10pm, there was still a 25 minute wait-- a testament to how good this place is! I scored a single spot at the bar right away- the advantage of traveling solo.   I had the steamed bun with pork belly and truffled fries, both excellent. If I had to nit pick, I'd say the truffle gravy is a bit strange, and the pink dipping sauce along side is a distraction. Possibly consider moving the truffle gravy to the dipping sauce location and just toss those crispy thin fries with truffle oil.  Sunday, on my way out of Vegas, they were not serving at the bar, so I waited 35 minutes for my one-top table. Service was fast and efficient. I had my old favorite, the banh mi burger and their onion rings- which are amazing. Thinly sliced and tempura battered- perfectly crisp.   This is a don't miss spot- although you need to plan for a wait, it's well worth it!

ayLhIe9SBSeVJOU04CYnNg.text: My first time today for a late lunch. Had a Ronin, and the wife had a Kiki. I must say, they are all about the flavors here. Layer upon layer of deliciousness. Service was great; but this is no fast food burger joint, and it was well worth the 10 or 12 minutes. Parmesan-truffle fries were a fine accompaniment, cooked the size and crispness I liked, and the drizzle of sauce was just the right amount. There was a little extra aioli for each item. and while I like them all, both the burgers and the fries were awesomely self sufficient. I'll be back with my wife (I'll drop the kids at McD's) again, and often. I think trying every menu item before the end of the year is a laudable goal. Thanks for being so close to my house, Bachi Burger!

B2IVPtVtQDaDDVYkqqAngA.text: Since I loved coming to Bachi so much the first time, I came back a 2nd time a week later, but they were closed for a private party.  Three days later, I made a return.  Unfortunately, the service was extremely slow, taking 35 minutes to get our food.  On top of this, the waitress did not come one time to check on us.  When we asked about getting our fries, they informed us that it was up to us to ask them to bring it out before our burgers if we wanted the fries first (even though they automatically brought us our fries first on our last visit).  We ordered the peking duck steamed buns, which were very good, but not as good as burgers.  We also ordered the sliders, to which they forgot to add the fried eggs we had wanted.  The waitress gave us a %10 discount for all these mistakes and the slowness of the service, but I left feeling very dissatisfied.  I can understand the wait if the restaurant was packed, but almost 40 minutes for food when the restaurant is less than half full is incomprehensible to me, especially when the waitress doesn't even come to check on you.

sgh2kDmed8TQ3JUK0r9iHg.text: I wasn't impressed.  The Oxtail Chili Cheese Fries was very good but the Miyagi-san's Grass Fed Wagyu Burger and Ronin burger were not.  Both burgers were relatively tasteless and whatever taste was there was interesting.  It is definitely not worth a taxi ride from the strip.

7ASny-afjXI6vCLb1C-Mdw.text: Saw this place featured on the Food Network and had to try it!   BAHN MI BURGER!!! Who knew that a pork-shrimp burger patty would be everything I ever wanted in life??   Pair that with the truffle fries (drizzled with their insane mushroom gravy) and you've got it made. So glad they opened up locations in Los Angeles!

6KeufE325rL5tas65bEZkQ.text: Went here for the featured DDD Dishes, we tried the oxtail chili fries an the pork belly buns. They were lacking salt! Overall the service was good. They also have a ramen house that was not serving at the time we went, which was a bummer!.

YobCCnaMRDAfhFgXONj0jA.text: Best Burger EVER! I'm so glad my sister made us stop here on the way to from CA to Vegas! The whole table order their most popular burger, the  Miyagi burger and garlic truffle fries. What a delicious combination! The burger and fries are good to share if you aren't starving. The juices from this burger is like no other. Definitely a go-to pit stop before or after Vegas.  From my experience the service was pretty good. Our waiter went out of the way to wish my friend and I a Happy Birthday, also. But I can understand why other people on this yelp page complain about service - - I got some nasty looks from other servers, but I'm not gonna let that take away from my own waiter and yummy food.  I'll be back!

rSM7g2IUQoscRvZqiPnscg.text: DAMN these burgers are amaaaaazing. i've had miyagi-san's burger and the oxtail fries, and i was SO blown away by the first bite. their menu is different from the usual burger stand, and all of the flavors of the different comp are lovely. plenty of seating, great atmosphere, amazing staff, and the food is impeccable! suuuper fresh and delicious. will definitely be coming back as often as i can!! don't hesitate on dropping by!

MXww_kzHYziGIEhoofrodg.text: Burgers are 4 stars, definitely solid (not outstanding, but solid), but their ramen was garbage, 2 stars.  Burgers were well prepared, and the flavor combinations were interesting and tasty. Plus their truffle fries were delicious.   Their ramen sucks. They got the appearance right, but their broth was just awful, and the pork belly was reminiscent of dried bacon. I actually ended sending back a tonkotsu black garlic (which I rarely do), and requested the more forgiving spicy miso...which also disappointed.  Manager was nice, other servers were somewhat subpar.

QvKBiQ_UqQkv4C8a3SDlbA.text: I ate here a couple of weeks ago and I got food poisoning! That sucked! I will NEVER eat here again!!! The food wasn't even worth getting sick from either.

l0mpc20q4OyxMnpJrrzSiQ.text: Ahhh darn it. I had such high expectations but Bachi has disappointed. I thought the oxtail fries would have chunks of meat, but it's just basic ass chili cheese fries with an egg on top. Also, its sweet. Why?! :(  The ronin burger was good, I would say 4/5. The bun was really soft and fluffy. This was sweet as well, which I would usually like, but with the overly sweet fries, it was a sugar overload.  The pork belly bao were okay, not bad but not amazing. Would not order again. The best part of the meal was the burger and my strawberry lemonade.  Unless a friend was really craving Bachi, I wouldn't bother making another trip out.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail chili fries - overrated. Would skip unless 4+ people in party.

w3R2ipcMLNRyFVs6U6QDTQ.text: When they first opened, I thought it was a bit pricey and the food was good. I heard they got new owners and this is what happened: ktnv.com/news/dirty-dini... Ick

Pw8juVdZlCxgzPGiW82TgQ.text: Such a great burger! Get wagyu it's worth the extra few dollars. Fries are amazing but they need to bring back the sun dried aioli please?!?  Natalie was our server and she was great! The sliders are really good here too. There will be a wait so get there early.

1r8YLDZtBq8t-fGaOQ-poA.text: When you come in you intend to get the whole burger exactly as they have it in the menu with all the ingredients. This was not the case this time around.  The Bahn Mi patty was not in stock at all today.  They recommended a plain beef patty.  I honestly thought they had a better thought process than this.  I'm sorry, but don't even think of selling this perfect burger without all of the ingredients.  With this being the case today, I couldn't believe they wouldn't even offer some kind of discount for a burger that wasn't complete.  The Bahn Mi burger is suppose to have shrimp in the patty.  This was left out and I was given a plain patty.  I left there without giving a tip for the first time ever.    I gave the stars I did today because the truffle fries and the pork buns were spot on as always.  I removed stars because of the lapse in judgement in recommending an incomplete product and not thinking of giving a discount of any kind.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The delicious pork belly buns.

tfDvw7cn5vOT4EAODYuzcg.text: After trying out other food spots in Las Vegas, I found that nothing could really beat the flavors I experienced at Bachi Burger. For that, I needed to update my review to 5 stars. Wish they had one of these in the Burgh- I'm still dreaming about that Bahn mi burger!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bahn Mi Burger- It was pure heaven.

PZc3Nx6ZfCpWEpttXJ-8rw.text: amazing!!!! it was my first time here and i love burgers.... this place has the most amazing burgers with waygu & angus beef. we ordered the black and green burger & the kiki burger they both had so much flavor and made to perfection. it was like a party in my mouth :) filled with flavor!!!! the salt and pepper french fries were soooo good!!! the truffle fries were amazing, our fav! they take there time making your perfect burger but its totally worth the wait.........  not to mention the customer service was very good as well, super attentive and friendly!!! we will be def returning here more often we are hooked!!!!!

q0rWR78fjZdeYveuI_yttQ.text: Great burgers, but not my favorite location.   Environment: It was my first time coming to this location, and while it was the busiest of any other location I have been to, I would say it does not have the best interior. The floor plan is not very open and makes the restaurant feel a little long and disjointed as opposed to the more open floorplans of the other locations which I have been to. However, they do have different types of seating such as a patio and a bar which could appeal to some other types of people.  Food: As with any location of Bachi Burger, the burgers are great. My go-to is the Spicy Miso Burger, which has a fried egg and shishito peppers which are the standout ingredients in my opinion. Additionally, I have tried other burgers before and am delighted with each one. From the appetizer list the oxtail chili cheese fries are great and filling, however if you are looking for something lighter I would go for the pork belly bao buns which are nice and light and don't fill you up too much to the point where you won't be able to finish your burger. I have tried a couple cocktails here however I wouldn't particularly recommend them. They don't have a ton of flavor and are either too strong or too bland in my opinion.  Service: Service was okay, but not the best. After waiting and being sat the staff did seem like they were busy but it was somewhat unorganized, with multiple people coming up and trying to take our orders for different things, making it a little confusing to know who is exactly was our server. Despite this everyone was nice and personable and it is not something I would fault them for to the point where I would be deterred from coming again.  All in all, this location is closer to home for me, however I think I would rather wait to get Bachi Burger until a day I'm on the other side of town to go to another location just for the environment and the availability

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cocktails
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly bao buns

17I7jb9GxRbebO1s8im00w.text: Went here for the first time yesterday.   I got the burger with bacon, fried egg, cheese, onion rings, and I think a chili mayo.   Really really tasty burger.   I kinda wanted the yolk of the egg to be a little runny but it wasn't.   The flavors all together was spot on.  Burger was flavorful and tender.   Bun was a winner.   I wish it came with some fries but that's how things go.   We got the truffle garlic fries and it was enough to share with 4 people.  They were a little slow refilling sodas but other than that, the service was very good.  If I wanted a delicious burger and was feeling okay with spending $15 for it, I would definitely go to Bachi Burger.

n3j_gnacC7yAh51fVugOeQ.text: Bachi Burger is pretty tasty. This location in particular has combined with the ramen place next door so they also serve ramen and other dishes here of the Japanese culture. On the Bachi Burger side of the menu, gotta give some credit to their oxtail chili fries.   Oxtail Fries are definitely a shareable portion - eat them alone and you may or may not be too full before you touch your burger.   Burger-wise. There are angus and waygu beef options, waygu is 3/4 dollars more expensive. Well constructed and tasty burgers here!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ybFFjk0OHphL-BKMzcEvQw.text: Went to Bachi burger on Thursday for dinner at about 6 pm. We ordered and got our food, but then was told we needed to leave because they were closing. There were 3 other patrons in the restaurant that had just ordered and they were told to leave. The burger was good. The rest was ok. We finished up our meal and were rushed out the door. The excuse they used was that upper management told them to close. No other explanation. I would call to see if that are even open.

VUhoMZOlLBJlqX_2GkjonA.text: Bachi Burger never fails!! Honestly the burgers here and the best I've ever had! They're great quality and taste amazing! The staff is friendly and welcoming. The oxtail fries are so good and any burger you try will satisfy! This is definitely my go-to for burgers!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pSXDEpB6B4hcVn5u9HDjxQ.text: Bachi burger, oh my have I heard a lot about you. Friends of mine rave about your burgers and eat you (burgers that is) each trip to Vegas.  With all that being said I knew I had to, just had to try your food.   First off, I need to say that I will try it again and try sow thing different! So I made a take out order of the wagyu burger with lettuce, tomato & onion with an order of fries.  The fries were shoestring style cut and ok, maybe if I eat in then they would be crispier.  Now for the burger. Ordered it med, which it was! Nice thick burger sandwiched between a delicious bun. However, it had no taste. I know the meat is the star of the show but it had no seasoning. Now I'm not sure if it's supposed to be like this or not so I'll have to try again but for a first experience....disappointed!  I hope that the flavor doesn't just come from all the different sauces or specialty burgers, the taste of a  plain burger will set standard for their other burgers.   I plan on giving it another try next time I'm in Vegas, hoping for better.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The entrance
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu again
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

A2qZWDWfBWx5N_L9tC2AkQ.text: We came here to fufill our quest to try DDD joints wherever we travel.  We tried the steam buns and the oxtail fries for appetizer just like in the show.  That came out quick and delicious.  We ordered burgers and Ramen.  The miso Ramen was quick to come out and my son loved it.  The aroma was impressive. The burgers took another 15 minutes to come out.  We all like to eat together. So we told him to go ahead and eat.  The Burgers were good but I don't think 5 star worthy.  Anyway, it was a good night out.  We enjoyed this place.  Not sure if we would do it again.

Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kiki burger

VaWDH4t8lqhSmNeZp5vjew.text: This review is my 3rd time going to Bachi Burger, however I do not remember the last two experiences lol. We came around 11am and there was no wait, our server Jasmine was incredible! All in all, we ordered Steamed Buns with Pork Belly which were AMAZING, Shoyu Ramen which my friend said was great as well, and the Bison Burger!   I had the Bison Burger, and this is why my rating is 4 stars. The Fig Jam included in the burger was too strong that I couldn't taste the Bison. The burger was cooked how i ordered it. and the fries were average and well seasoned.

XGiV7r020FjpR6w-qzgILA.text: Great burger, kind of small, but that is me im kind of a pig. Staff was freindly but they are horribly managed. I believe they forget they are at work and are to layed back and unprofessional around the restaurant. The building is layed out backwords the 2 entrances are rediculous. this is just negative feedback that could help this gold mine. a little pricy for my taste, But my KIKI BURGER WAS FANTASTIC. And the front of the restaurant faces windmill ave. and they are storing broken equipment from the kitchen in plain view of guests really? they need to get this together. The triple D show is gonna have people flock here so get it together.

PHHtY1nJh6-JTOff1DWwpg.text: MMMmmm. Pretty dang good. Definitely a different spin on burgers. Not traditional, and would not recommend someone who is in search of the 50's diner burger.   Asian inspired and innovative! They serve a variety of different kinds of drinks like lychee green apple soda and other unique sodas (no refills though). The macha green tea is delishhh and plenty of refills. We did not have to ask for a refill for our green tea, very attentive staff.   So far, I have yet to try any beef burgers. I've got the "Lonely Bird" and the "Crusty Crab." I would definitely recommend the Crusty Crab because it was light and delicately flavorful...  Only complaint, and not much of a complaint, but I wish fries came equipped with a burger... but how can something as delicious as truffle fries come with an already delicious burger... it's almost a sin.

6OJJTbgOPGiwUmPd76WA3A.text: Once again, Bachi burger does not disappoint! Today we had the sweet potato fries to start, then the chef's special: Spicy Miso Burger and the Lonely Bird burger.   I almost want to retract my previous review of the Ronin being the Death Row burger. The spicy miso burger is definitely a knife-and-forker. The lonely bird was a picker-upper and held it's own. I swear everytime I come here and think that I had already tried the best burger, something new proves me wrong. Never a dull moment in the food adventure at Bachi Burger. Thanks to Melissa our server today for the recommendation! You guys are awesome!

N5ouswnfsWmhraTDbDD9-Q.text: I had suggested Bachi to a co-worker before I tried it because I mistakenly assumed that this place, as its namesake suggests, sells only  beef-based burgers.  After he went 3 times in a week, filling me with stories of a crabcake burger that blew him away... well, I had to see for myself.    My girl and I met for lunch and both ordered the Crabcake Burger.  Based on the reviews, I asked her to meet me early... but then got lost trying to find this place since it's sort of tucked into the back of a random strip mall on Windmill.  It was almost exactly noon when I walked in and, while there were certainly people in the resto, it wasn't packed the way I was expecting it to be.    Service was quick and efficient and... when the Crabcake Burger came out... the angels sang.  It was wholesome deliciousness that I hoped wouldn't end.  The crabcake was slightly spicy and had a hint of asian flavor... and the battered, fried onion ring perched on the cake was just the right touch.    Loved Bachi and am looking forward to going back.  Also, for those vegetarians among us, there are options for you too!! While I didn't sample, there are soy veggie burgers on this menu that sounded delish!

bsslBWJKWqkUMKD28GVyoQ.text: I truly expected more! I mean it wasn't bad but didn't blow me away.

Nb60AxTwUD9IB8lOPQetzg.text: Been here twice so far.  It has become a place to go when I'm in Vegas.  The first time there I had the Miyagi-san.  It's a messy, salty burger with all kinds of stuff - egg, onion rings, bacon.  It is oooh so tasty. I had the Lonely Bird on my next visit.  That's their poultry burger (as if you couldn't figure that one out).  It's very good as well. I've tried a few of their different fries as well.  My favorite is their Salt & Pepper Garlic Fries.  I'm glad my server informed me that their are jalapenos in it even though I did not see that listed on their menu.  It made want it even more.  And more I shall have on my next trip to Vegas.

j-LjUx00svNamWxjcOOIYg.text: Went with my husband and I loved it. The reason I took off a star is that our app (Oxtail chili cheese fries YUM) arrived well before our drinks did. The burger was perfectly cooked and tasted amazing (though my husband wasnt a fan of the asian flavors).

Xil5Us6N5gnb4mmCWmWINg.text: Do not eat here! Food poisoning went to emergency room! We were so excited to eat here the food was good on the way "in" but went to emergency room for food poisoning do not eat here!

oAJt2vlk_8N9ju0dOktZ-g.text: Hands down best burgers I've ever had.  Between the 5 of us, we practically ordered half their menu, and every last bite was amazing.  Their edamame sauteed in garlic butter and truffle oil is so flavorful and mouth-watering.  Favorite entrees were the Ronin and Spicy Miso burgers and the Peking Duck Steamed Bun.    Wish we could have tried their Portuguese Donuts with Coffee Gelato, but they were out -- we'll be back though: this place is worth the drive away from the main Vegas strip.

whoH9ShObTEpslHtptxR6w.text: We visited Bachi Burger because it was recommended by friends.  I ordered their No meat here burger which was a Shitake mushroom Patty topped with eggplant, mixed greens and tofu.  It was very hearty, I did not miss the meat!  The sandwich was so huge that I had to use a fork and knife to eat it.  The bun was the best bun i've every had with a burger, wish I could have taken a dozen home with me.  We also ordered the truffle fries and I tasted my friends Ox tail chili cheese fries which was unreal!  My husband had a Angus burger which he will talk about in his own review.  There are many other menu items that i'd like to try.  Going back there again the next time I visit Las Vegas.

_uQ4-qO5QQSbRJsmWMjV7w.text: Made is to Bachi Burger after reading rave reviews....omg. yum.  I tried: The Ronin-Fave! It is soo incredibly good, I wish I got more then just a bite of it, I might order it next time I go...  The Kiki- It was also really good, I would order it again.  The Lonely Bird- This one was just "eh" to me, compared to the other burgers. I probably wont ever order it for myself, but recommend it to those who enjoy turker/chicken burgers...  That's Cheesy- This was REALLY good, for a grilled cheese. I'm not quite sure I'd order it again though.  The bachi pickles were also really interesting, I ordered some and no one at the table really liked them. I gave them all a try and thought they were some interesting flavors and textures...it was worth the try, but wouldn't try it again.  the FRIES: Truffle parm: YES, Yes, YES. So good, I almost ordered another order...but we really didn't need anymore food.  The garlic salt and pepper: these were also nummy! But I suggest the truffle parm over them!  When we were done eating I ordered the Pop tart, but they didn't have any...so I ordered macadamia nut toffee cake...it wasn't bad...but I wasn't impressed with it. We also ordered a strawberry smoothie, which I felt tasted a little off.  Go and Enjoy it! It was awesome!!

gMv0xdhh-QjCg_UACTzYEQ.text: This place is fantastic!  We came for lunch and of course there was a wait...We split the Kiki burger with garlic fries and of course, we had to try the onion rings...Delish!  The burger was cooked perfectly, juicy wagyu beef with mushrooms and cheese.  I can't wait to go back and try something else like the oxtail fries or pork buns!

WqckY6WJNh5JORM-AULVxg.text: First off, it was a little bit hard to find going west on Windmill. The parking and door is around behind Subway. I think there was another door on the Windmill side it looked like.  I met a couple of my friends here for lunch at around 12. It was not that busy when we got there, but 30 mins later bigger parties starting arriving and seemed to get busy.  I got the kalbi burger which was topped with kim chee and a kochujung mayo. SO FREAKING GOOD! It came with a side of cucumber kimchee as well. Surprisingly, I would have liked it to be a tad bit more spicy, but the flavors were all there.   I got a side of the truffle parmesan fries as well, and those were very very delicious. I haven't tried anything with truffles before but heard its awesome. And.. IT WAS.   My friend got the ronin buger, and he said he didn't care for it too much. He didn't really like the pickled slaw. My other friend got the peking duck steamed buns, which looked awesome! We both thought it was weird that it had boiled egg in it. But she said it was really tasty, but could've used less of the cilantro. The next time, I will get that, and I love cilantro so hopefully they pile it on.  I got my boyfriend the bahn mi burger to-go since he was at work. So, we shall see if he likes it.. Then we can return, so he can get the full dining experience.  I have to say.. service kind of sucks here. Or at least when I was there. We never got our waters filled until we had to ask. Expect to wait 15-20 mins for the food.. but worth it for the food. We waited for a good 15 mins with an empty table and to-go bags, and ended up going up to the cashier to try to get our checks, where they said they'd be with us shortly. We had to wait another 10 mins before we got our check. With our waiter passing us, he didn't take our check with payment, so I ended going back to the cashier to pay. I saw another table try at least 3 times to get their waiter's (same guy) attention for something. The woman finally went up to guy to let him know they needed something.  Overall, service was definitely lacking.. but the food most definitely NOT. Will be back again to try that peking duck!

tWQRBeDvBPaX8kd9II-Jsg.text: I had the Ronin burger :))) This is the best burger that I ever ate! I am looking forward to go back to Vegas just for this burger.

ge0mqYpsvuyIcgm4jAW8Cg.text: My hub and I have had this place on our list for over a year, came once before but wait was ridiculous, so we went next door to Shoku Ramen and we loved it. Anyway, we came back tonight, place is packed, hostess guy said 35 minutes so we said cool, but can we just eat at the bar? No! We don't serve food there, and mind you it has about 12 seats and no one was sitting there. Well, ok , then we will have a drink there and wait. So we have to order a drink over this stupid glass wall, and who knows why, something about a sushi bar, blah blah blah, makes no sense, especially since we work with the health department on restaurants opening and have never ever heard of this dumb partition, anyway, what a total waste of space for a place this busy, they could have turned tables like crazy if they would just serve some dang food at this bar!?!?  So after about 2 drinks each and forty minutes later and no one leaving their tables, we pay our bar tab and are about to leave but the hostess man says, our table is ready! Ok what the hell, let's just stay and see what the hype is about.....waitress comes over and I say quickly he will have the black & blue burger, and I'll have Mr. Ho's, and the truffle fries. Food comes about 20 min later, and the truffle fries are ok, some brown goop on about 5 fries, no truffle flavor, and they look like McDonalds fries but not nearly as good...then we get our burgers. My burger was on a purple bun, and I thought it was blueberry so I ask the waitress, she says it's taro, ok so what's that, and she says some thing called taro, it grows out of the ground, mmm whatever. It is a good burger, interesting to say the least, cooked perfectly, hubby said his burger was great but he won't be back due to the wait. I say fix the bar issue which is valuable wasted space, and suggest people sit on the patio which we didn't even know was an option.

wZg5IfO-xe7pwbcpVTfScg.text: So when you walk in to a new restaurant after the Yelp cycle has been kicked up and there are so many 5 star reviews from random people or even some friends you have this level of anticipation and expectation.  I alluded to this in a previous review. Its probably not warranted but, its unavoidable! So I went with a few friends to Bachi Burger, giddy as a school..... boy.  Bachi is oddly located in a strip mall so I missed it on the first pass and unfortunately for them they have an entry door on either end of the place so I imagine it can be hard tracking the new arrivals.  The venue itself is a small sit down type place that is clean, modern, and simple.  The 2 flat screens on the wall had news and foodtv running for some entertainment variety.  Our server came up quick after being seated and drink were served right away. The menu (if the name didnt give it away already) is asian inspired and has several options for food and drinks (yay boba tea). I ordered the Kiki burger and the truffled parmesan fries.  The first thing you taste on the burger is the bun and oh boy was it tasty!  Its an asian style sweet bun and it is awesome. The meat was very fresh and all the ingredients had a good harmony together and everything tasted great. The fries I expected to have more of a truffle flavor but, fell just a little short.  The only thing that kinda bugged me was our server kept trying to take plates that had a little food left on it. Now here is the kicker I would highly recommend this place to anyone here in town but, it only got a 4 star review from me.  Why? Because 5 stars is perfection. And this place fell just short on the flavor profiles. Everyone at the table agreed it was a great burger at a great price but, we just weren't blown away. I will be coming back shortly and ordering a few other things and will update this review then!

CCwb-4b4uX3pUHdIXlVSSA.text: Seriously the BEST BURGER I have ever tasted! YUM!!! It's a very unique place with VERY tasty food! I can't wait to go back just to try something different. You are missing out if you don't stop & try this place. It's close to the 15 & 215 fwy just before you make it into the Vegas Strip!

-a86BYc6eLTkWUssR56PCA.text: We were in Vegas on business with a group of five. We ate here twice and the food and service were the best! When we come back in town, we wil visit here again! Try the sauces. They are great.

D7rLoB9qTTVdxPvCWC2ucQ.text: First time here , but the first impression is always the lasting one.  I ordered the Kalbi burger and some salt & pepper fries.  The burger was perfect.  The fries were amazing. I'm definitely coming back.

uNCHxdU2U_SCGNSk9Jb3aw.text: Absolutely amazing burgers, but like others, we had very slow service, even though there were 5-6 people around the entire time.  I had the Ronin Burger, and I definitely see myself going back to try others. The others with me had Kiki's Burger, BBQ Bachi Burger American Wagyu, and some of the Steamed Sandwiches.  I highly recommend avoiding the steamed ones, as they are extremely small - nothing but a bun with meat, nothing else, and not a lot of either. Absolutely not worth the price for them. (2 tiny things for $8.50 or more depending on meat).  Everything else was great, including the truffle parmesan fries and garlic salt & pepper fries.

KP-eh1FCAG6CZY_QDxZ8dg.text: Stay away from this store.  They gave me the absolute worst service of my life, and told me that I'm not important as a customer.  They said I should have known that it would take over an hour to get a burger.  Maybe if the line was out the door, but there was no other customers in line in front of us.  Yeah the store was fairly busy, but not over the top.  Lot's of other problems like the bathroom that hadn't been cleaned etc.  But my vote is 0 for this place.  I'll never go back!

th6E88Z_Ixh-d5agGi7eRA.text: Had my fair share of a few burgers here, and I will say, It's food that evokes a "wow" response and steady head nod of pleasant surprise and satisfaction.   Although all their burgers are awesomely crafted and unique in their own respective category, my personal favorites to my taste would have to be both the Miyagi-Sans burger and the Black & Green burger.  The Miyagi-san is a grass fed wagyu burger with furikake, onion rings, caramelized bacon, fried egg and chili mayo. The flavors aren't overdone and easily craveable. As for the Black & Green, it's a grass fed waygu as well, with mushrooms, spinach, point reyes blue cheese (Medium/full flavored), roasted garlic and bacon. Very deep and rich without being too strong and overpowering. If you are a fan of blue cheese this burger does your fandom some righteous justice. Bonus is that their buns are fresh, sweet and made local! Mmm, respect.  For fries, I go for the Truffle Parmesan and if I have a partner to share with, the oxtail chili fries is the perfect plate with plenty to go around. for dessert, I have only had the chance to try their donuts. Covered in some quality cinnamon sugar and matched with a perfectly complimenting mocha ice cream. Although, tends to be a bit doughy and undercooked as I have come to find.  Service is service, nothing really outstanding or outlandish, but prompt and knowledgeable about their food. All in all I appreciate this place because the attention to quality and detail, and in that respect they put out some amazingly delicious and unique food.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RAKbpMQy1GWhgQs2tEivjQ.text: I make a stop at  Bachi Burger whenever I am in Vegas, even when it's a matter of hours and not days. I am still in love  with the Pork Belly Steamed Buns, but my go- to burger lately has been the Ronin. They renovated the inside and it looks great, much more inviting. The drinks are always interesting and delicious, it's never the standard fare here. I really appreciate that, because who wants to pay for a meal that they can make at home? I can make a cheeseburger, however an Angus Beef burger patty with Caramelized Onions, Japanese Cole Slaw, Miso Goma Dressing, Fried Egg, Katsu BBQ, and Yuzu Citrus Aioli is not as easily done. So the Ronin is a delicious meal that I highly recommend. I always leave Bachi Burger full and happy.

fkUfbXPP8RIczn3yKorVJQ.text: Just lost my Bachi Virginity! It was awesome! Myagi Burger is where it's at!   #BachiAloha

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black Garlic Ramen(has another proper name) it was delicious! They should serve the broth as a drink!
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brussel Sprouts with Bacon and Garlic!
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salt n Pepper n Garlic Fries

wOMtf3annEWRGEGG2fdYDg.text: It was the worst idea and mistake to come here otw back from our Vegas trip.  Where do I even begin?! I'll start with the one pro - Parking.  Now all the cons - We had to wait literally an hr and a half for our food to come out and arrive when there were hardly any ppl dining inside. That was as long and if not longer than our wait for the oyster bar. And maybe if the food was good then I'd cut them some slack, but even then the wait was unreasonable and inexcusable. The food definitely did not live up to the hype that my friend had said. He said it tasted much better than the Pasadena location which I think closed down, but i thought it was even worse. That same friend I went with also said he heard what appears to be the manager yelling at one of his servers. Yes, the service wasn't good (and he wasn't even yelling at our waitress). But that was totally rude, unnecessary, unprofessional, and uncalled for to yell at a worker in front of guests and customers. By the way, my friend also kindly asked if we could get comped some fries while we wait or in lieu of having to wait and a worker said she would ask our server but no one ever got back to us. Never going back again especially when there 1001 options to eat in Vegas!

DAdaR6T0scWC9PGIbE9F2w.text: Thus was my first time coming here and the burger was amazing. The meat is infused with different flavors and is packed with so many things.

tUYv52eyP3dcEpgy8VYLYw.text: Love love love. I always want to try everything and so it can add up but it's great when you know you want a burger with some Asian plates and flava!!!!

uYf2VpW5e8BPcZxjIK6XKQ.text: The hamburger meat is good, although expensive since you have to order the fries separately and the service is a bit slow.  This place is for you if you have time to wait, an adventurous pallet and extra cash in your wallet.

Ke3-vyTgQjvUdhPfF-D-Fw.text: Best burger in town! Hands down, the tastiest and sumptuous treat for anyone who is looking for a unique and palatable concoction of an out-of-this world burger!

OeCOkU_urRXzWisNmNvI4A.text: Oh Bachi, how I've longed to come visit you.   After a long wait, my family and I gorged on a wide selection of their menu.   We ordered the pickled vegetables, oxtail fries, Spicy Miso Burger, Kiki's Burger and Kalbi's burger.  Despite many raving reviews, I personally did not care for the Oxtail Fries. It was like chili over a bed of fries .. and the oxtail did not add much flavor, even the egg yolk (which was very minimal) did not wow me. I expected a lot more punch but it just tasted like chili over fries. If you didn't tell me there were oxtail in it, I wouldn't have known. For nearly $11, I was super disappointed.   Out of all the burgers we tried, I LOVED the Spicy Miso Burger. It was so good, mouth-watering as I reminisce the burger. Delicious combination with the egg in it this time, and a wonderful flavor with the spiciness and miso-sauce. The burger was cooked to perfection at medium, and I thoroughly enjoyed it.   I would rank Spicy Miso, Kalbi (the Kim Chee was alright. nothing too spectacular since I've had much better Kim Chee but there was a lot of flavor in every bite) and then the Kiki's   We randomly tried the pickled vegetables (see picture attached) and it wasn't anything special. It was good though, just very dainty.   The reason for the 3 stars as opposed to 4 is because I've had a lot of these different wacky speciality burgers and I only thought the Spicy Miso burger was worth the price. The food didn't wow me to the point where I would necessarily come here again because there's just SO MUCH more places to visit in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pickled vegetables

ZIXS9jkKISAjvwdK2Ve5_w.text: Miyagi San and oxtail fries were amazing! Miyagi San was the most flavorful burger I've ever had hands down.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Miyagi San burger was soooooo flavorful!

auxroAaJ_ske3zzMMzKjjw.text: What??  I haven't written a review for Bachi yet either?  Their bread makes the burger. Of course, their meats are top notch, and the toppings are creative.  But the bread.  Oh, it's perfect!  The oxtail chili fries... Must get.    And, their green ice tea has free refills.  And it's tasty.  Writing this makes me want to go back to Vegas!

oNVm6GRHIu1WgTmiC99TuQ.text: We've been twice now and we might need to make this mandatory for every Las Vegas visit. Our first visit we weren't sure what to expect and were pleasantly surprised. I don't remember what exactly we ordered, but judging from our most recent visit EVERYTHING IS good. Our first visit it was pretty packed, second visit not as much, but when we sat down several more tables started showing up. Our first visit we had great service, this second time not as good unfortunately. It wasn't as bad but our waitress wasn't very attentive but there may have been a possibility she was waiting a couple of tables as well as bar tending. On to the food, we shared the chili garlic wings, oh my gosh. Honestly, we both could have gotten our own order of wings and been very very happy, we shared and were still quite happy. I got the burger with Kimchi and subbed for a wagyu burger, it was delicious! We also shared an order of fries which were pretty good as well. I love that you can add an egg to any burger, that just puts it over the top. Whatever you get here you'll enjoy, love this place. (Yelp LA Challenge #14 of 100)

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chili garlic wings, crazy good.

QfS8wR6uoBjxzWXI0hl6PQ.text: If you really want me to get to the point: you can get a better and cheaper burger at Five Guys.   For being a "gourmet" burger place I kinda got my hopes up. Strike one was that my mom mentioned to the server that we don't eat pork meat (but we can tolerate pepperoni in small doses) but still brought our appetizer with pork mixed in. She said that it stated it had pork sausage but it's not like my family had any idea what the heck the name of that sausage meant it was a pork sausage but whatever.  When our food came our burgers were dry and kinda overcooked. Both my dad and I asked for medium rare so it's a shame seeing wagyu getting cremated that way. It was still edible and besides it wasn't cheap so I wasn't gonna waste it (plus the hangry-ness needed to chill out).  If I gotta say something positive their momowhatever peach strawberry soda is really good.  Anyways, long story short if you want a good burger worth the money there is other cows in the sea... or something like that.

0qyS74iySmO0grD9mRCV7A.text: Buns were better than Umami Burger's. I can't give a better and more detailed review because I had only tasted a bite (too full from earlier) However, the truffled fries were much better at Umami. This place is open until 1am on Fridays and Saturdays. And it's merged with the Ramen place next door, so they have the Ramen menu available as well! Another reason to come back another time.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffled burger poutine style - So good you won&#39;t miss the buns!!! Delicious!

wo3w1Su1P-fSL6sNZzaWVw.text: We stopped here just after leaving the airport. Really tasty food, good service, nice place overall. I have no complaints especially with having a Bruery rotating tap!

a_LWJFGTYR0CzngAtTaQtg.text: Definitely a must if you're in the area. Burgers are awesome. Made to your liking. The different varieties of burgers is amazing, but decided to build my own, and I must say, it was an absolute winner! The oxtail fries is also unreal, very tasty, and the portion size is great for 3 people. The plantation iced tea is probably the best I have tasted. The blend of pineapple and mint, makes it taste perfect, very thirst quenching!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Create your own burger, sensational!

z1hdht3oJdXCoE6WTSBqcg.text: I was disappointed by my visit to Bach Burger for the first time. We took out of town guests here telling them how great it is. We waited 45 minutes for a table. I m so confused what happened to the Spicy Miso burger. I have had it a couple of times at the Summerlin location and loved it! This time the burger was smothered in a red sauce that tasted very similar to the sauce on the Kalbi burger. My friend got the Kalbi burger and although I love spicy, kimchi, and kalbi, that burger just did not have a good flavor. The sauce was something like a Sriracha sauce but overpowered the entire burger.   Also, I have tried the Truffle fries here and don't like the taste. The salt and pepper fries have a strong pepper taste and among 4 people we did not even finish 1/3 of the fries. The sweet potato fries are the best among the fries choices but the dipping sauce it comes with is gross. Way too sweet and strong of a taste, not complimenting it at all.   I don't know if it was an off night or the chefs are just not as good or ingredients used were different. I really don't know why the experience was so different from the Summerlin one. We are big Bachi Burger fans and tell people we meet everywhere to try it and it's too bad this was a bad experience for the high price.

jol7DhaQjIx4kmbgslUkBQ.text: Whenever you need me Whenever want me, You know you can call me, I'll be there shortly Don't care what your friends say, cause they don't know me at...BACHI BURGER! - Wiz Khalifa (roll up)  After all these years, I finally made my way to the infamous Bachi Burger. The wait is kinda long as there aren't that many tables inside but since the weather was nice, it wasn't a problem. I'm not sure how I would feel about the wait if I was hungover and standing outside in the summer vegas heat though lol  Since I had peking duck buns at the Wynn buffet the night before, we opted for the pork belly buns instead and they were delicious. The oxtail fries were quite good, not standout-ish but a nice change of pace as far as fries are concerned. The Miyagi wagyu burger was tasty, and maybe a little messy but the strong flavors were there. The egg was nice but I prefer smaller pieces of bacon. I definitely recommend sharing a burger though with someone (especially if you're planning to order other things) because the fries are a huge portion and the burger is also big enough to be shared.   Definitely worth taking friends that have never been before.

4sqqs2ZF8RuX2vqFaPPuYQ.text: I love love love this place!  My parents also love this place!  Every time they visit Vegas, we have to go here to eat to fix their cravings!    So here's a little scoop on Bachi burger....the owners are from Hawaii so they know what flavor is all about!  Their burgers are not your ordinary burgers you find at some plain old American place....no, they add some Asian essence into each of their food items!  From the Miyagi burger topped with a fried egg and furikake to a kimchee kalbi burger that is to die for!    Not only are the burgers BOMB, but their appetizers satisfies each and every one of those taste buds on your tongue.  A few of my favorites include the oxtail fries (which is a MUST order), the arabiki and kurabuta sausages, and even the duck skin and pork belly buns!    I was born and raised in Hawaii, and us Hawaii peeps know that food in Hawaii is the best!  Living on the mainland sure makes you crave things you can only get back on the islands. Bachi burger is the perfect place to fix some of those cravings!     I cannot wait to go back and try a new burger!

s91sWO7lh0wrHqIbWWdbaw.text: Went here for my birthday for my first time. Sooo good! Friendly service. Delicious, quality burgers. Nothing like it. The place is a little small and pricey, but it's okay. Their fries and pineapple ketchup is super yum!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Birthday lunch!

BRNgSfa0d3-IISUL9bh4RQ.text: The food is like no other ! Throughout all my dinning experiences I can say i have never had such an amazing burger and oxtail fries ! Customer service is good and they are very attentive . Definitely worth checking out for lunch or dinner

7wTX9b4HGzRSxy7TAtw2lw.text: I've FINALLY tried this place (just getting around to writing the review now) and let me tell you, BELIEVE THE HYPE! There's always a wait (about 15-20 mins both times I've been there) which tells you the quality of the food but after actually tasting their burgers I'd gladly wait 30 minutes for a table here.  Their burgers are huge so I've never ordered appetizer, however I did try one of their milkshakes and that was way too sweet (I still finished it). I always get the Miyagi-San burger which according to our server is the most unhealthy and consequently most delicious. He's right. I've tried the Shogun and Spicy Miso and I just keep coming back to it!

4dO3P6UTAOK0QdGn0Hf0wA.text: This place's food is amazing. Gourmet burgers and ramen... It's interesting that there's 2 separate kitchens, which I think sometimes have a hard time communicating. Anyways, we got the oxtail chili cheese fries, the truffle parm fries, the calamari, and all different types of ramen (6 of us eating). The fries were great! Lots of flavor in the chili, and a great dipping sauce for the truffle fries. The calamari was delicious!!! Came with 2 dipping sauces, 1 of which was a super interesting basil sauce (YUMMY). I always get the tan-tan ramen, which is a red seafood pork broth, very tasty and always recommended!!  The downside to this place is the service. The waiters and waitresses are usually always nice, but not the best quality. We always have to ask for refills on the water, generally have to wait a long time to be greeted after being seated, and always have to get up to make our payments because they take forever to come to the table.  Also, it's a little pricey. Plan to drop $15-20 per person. The iced tea was $4 each with no refills, oxtail fries $11, and ramen $9-$11 each bowl.  I like this place but pass a lot because of the prices and the service.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle parm fries with a relish-mayo dipping sauce
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail chili cheese fries with a fried egg on top!

Bq1wxm1CgsWyWLjUfQwjqw.text: Heard about this all the way from Hawaii had to check it out. If you not used to the hear wait in your car, there is always 15 to 20 min wait. Got seated pretty quickly as I was greeted by all staff members! Had my favorite beer Hitachino! Almost ten dollars but worth every penny. Tried the oxtail chili cheese fries and roasted pork on bun. Fantastic. For the main course was miyagi burger and kalbi burger, on point like island flavor Alan wong's American fusion. A must try at least once in LV...

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kimchee and kalbi!
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wax on wax off no way I can finish!
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aZAci9c6MGfz9VqicBlqvg.text: Food here is excellent. The burgers are amazing, fries go well with the meal. Left here super full.   Service here is hit & miss. We once waited over 20 minutes to get acknowledged I. The doorway and another 20 to have 3 groups in front of us seated when servers, bartenders etc are having drinks behind the bar. Another time we waited almost 45 minutes for a seat by was acknowledged and kept informed. I guess it just depends on the day.   Overall, if you are willing to wait for service or lack thereof the food makes it more than worth it. They could step it up though.  Recommend: based on food alone yes. Good luck with anything else.

IAFVQOYV2XlpyAZLfsn0GQ.text: My family and I visited today. This was our 2nd time at Bachi Burger. Our 1st visit was great, but a couple of years ago, and we decided to go again today. Let's just say it was not a pleasant experience. The service left a lot to be desired. Our waiter was SUPER slow, came back to our table multiple times telling us things we were ordering were out (mini corndogs, crab artichoke dip, bison for the bison burger, to name a few). He took at least 20 minutes to bring our drinks, recommended an appetizer, but when asked questions about it, he couldn't answer. We could see him reading the bartenders book to mix a drink that was ordered, and it left a lot to be desired. The food was decent, not as good as we remembered, but not bad, which is the only reason for the 3. The service was the worst part of our visit. I do not plan to visit again.

PuLybAPODGuvhGh8ukSFjA.text: Whenever I go somewhere new, I look up DDD's in the area to try.  Bachi Burger came up, and even though I don't remember seeing them on the show, I wanted to try it.    It's a little confusing because there are more than one locations in the area. I went to this one, which I think(?) is the one that was on the show.  The location is in a nondescript strip mall.   I got the pork belly steamed bun appetizer and the bahn-mi burger.  The port belly buns were good.  Pro tip: be careful if you bite in to the bun, the strip of fat at the back of the pork will all come out as one chunk that you can't bite through.  Consider cutting it with a knife or eating the whole thing in one big bite.  It comes with a hoisin type sauce which is quite good.   When I ordered the bahn mi burger, the waiter asked me if Medium was OK.  I asked for medium-rare at which point he warned me that the burger contains pork and shrimp, but they will make it medium rare if you want, so I did. The burger was very good.  Portions appear small here but are quite filling.  It comes with fries which are also very good.  Nothing knocked my socks off, hence the 4 star rating instead of 5.  I think this place has the potential to be 5-star (perhaps I caught them on an off-day).  I would come back and try more entrees in the future if I come back to the Las Vegas area.  My waiter was young but was on the ball and on top of things.  The waitstaff refilled my drinks competently.  There is a parking lot in the strip mall so no issues with parking.  Pro tip: if you see Bachi from the road, you will be tempted to park on the wrong site.  The entrance is on the inner-side of the parking lot.  I parked and walked in but was on the wrong side of the restaurant and had to walk through it to get to the greeter station.

FIVt3ld2cEC-zSmNnoKYOA.text: Awesome!!!!!  Our server, Dan, was great... he went through the menu with us and had great suggestions depending on our likes.... he did not do us wrong!!!!  We started with the ox tail fries.... delicious!  I was surprised at how sweet the meat was, but the spicy from the peppers and onions was a great counter to the sweetness... I had the miyagi-san burger, and it was maybe one of the best burgers i have ever had!!!!  My boyfriend ordered the spicy miso burger, that too was pretty great!  I will def. be coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail fries

x5Pg4HFlwSiEeyvoVZcQGA.text: Forget the tourist food on the strip.  You will not be disappointed with Bachi.   5 stars from the Foodsnob is very rare as everything has to be perfect from concept,  cleanliness, service and of course the food.   Went with large enough party and got to sample a few different signature burgers - all were amazing.  Order the truffle Parmesan fries and a beer. Simply heaven.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum

2foRhLm2Zdu7ROtJ1PndnA.text: I don't know what happened...we used to love this place and now the service is horrible. At first we thought it was just a one off, but now we gave it 2 chances and are extremely disappointed. The last time we went the woman chef in the back was yelling and scolding her staff and wait staff so loud it became uncomfortable for the entire restaurant.  This time, I took my co-workers on a lunch break and it took us 15 minutes after being seated just to get greeted, get a drink order and put in our food order. Then it took 15 minutes to get our drinks and 40 minutes for 2 burgers! Not once did our server Rachel acknowledge us or sincerely apologize for the wait. Working in the service industry, we tried to be understanding in the beginning, knowing she had multiple tables. But after we ordered, we were her only table! How does a water and a Coke take more than 15 minutes? Rachel avoided eye contact when we tried to get her attention. We had to ask the woman cleaning about the status of our food. We loved their burgers but it's definitely not worth waiting over an hour for a consistently crappy experience.

tsIc0FnIhaidRw88yphQww.text: Everytime I go here, it's awesome. We have nothing like it in Jacksonville and the dishes are so unique and flavored so well that you ask yourself "why didn't I think of that?!?"   This go around, me and my buddy had the oxtail chili cheese fries, pork buns, Kiki burger, ronin burger and the Parmesan truffle fries.   The oxtail chili cheese fries were really good. The oxtail was so tender like pulled beef and made the chili so much better than just regular ground beef chili.   The pork buns were great! The pork belly was braised really well and the pickle and eggs together in the bun made the perfect combo. The side sauce (homemade hoisin?) was the kicker that sent it over the top.   The burgers are sooooo good here and so original. It's hard to describe the intense Asian flavors and the combinations that each burger has. All I can say is that you must try for yourself. Every burger I've had here has that perfect balance to create a tsunami of umami. Sweet, salty and savory mixed with sour pickled... And that potato bun... two perfect pillows holding everything together.   The Parmesan truffle fries are everything you expect. Shoestring fries topped with Parmesan cheese with a hint of truffle and topped with a porcini sauce. Really good side dish for the burgers.   Service was impeccable and the cleanliness was comforting. Always a great experience and will always come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Parmesan truffle fries and a Thai tea.
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Andre and his Kiki burger. Oxtail chili cheese to his left.
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ronin Burger

zqQf8zKED0nIStjL0t-bTQ.text: Bachi Burger is amazing. I'll be here again and again. We enjoyed the shogun burger ($26) waygu beef, bone marrow appetizer and ox tail chili fries. The Burger was worth every cent. The combo of flavors is unique and blended well. I was pleasantly surprised with the unagi. The bone marrow was wonderfully decadent. The fries are delish but I would pass next time. I think these offer the 'full' feeling the restaurant is trying to push. I will come back to discover a better alternative.

7UkXiYsF2h4M39NOttyM9A.text: Food tasted great but the service was awful! We ordered the ox tail fries and pork buns for appetizers and 4 burgers. The appetizers came out lightning quick and we ate them up as we were super hungry.  As for the burgers.... they were no where to be seen. We waited and ordered drinks to pass some time and the waitress assured us our order was next. But as orders came flying out the kitchen, none of them was ours. We saw people who came after us getting their burgers and new sets of customers who were barely there for 15 mins to get their food. Our order should have been priority but they decided to put our order behind the orders of newer customers. Our waitress began to ignore us knowingly they jacked up order.  It took us well over an hour for us to finally get our food and when we finally got our food the waitress basically threw the burgers at us and tried to avoid eye contact with us. They ended up comping us a round of drinks but that doesn't make up for the time lost and the poor service.

J3EEXLtOQspGnVjaQnP2cQ.text: Let me start out by saying this: I have been here twice and I have not had the privilege of eating here even once!  Visit #1: Walked in an waited 10 minutes for the hostess to acknowledge that we were waiting for her. She was at a table speaking with other guests and looked up at us at least 4 times prior to coming over, and all the while acting as though we were inconveniencing her. We gave our name and was told it would be a 20 minute wait. She promptly went back to the same table to ham it up with the customers. 45 minutes later, we walked out, amazed that a simple, accurate wait time could not be provided.   Visit #2: Provided our name to the hostess and was told it would be a 15-20 minute wait. It was busy, so we were asked to please wait outside (mind you, it is summertime in Vegas). At 20 minutes I went back in asking how long it would be. The hostess advised another 5 minutes. 15 minutes later, my daughter PASSED OUT OUTSIDE because she was too hot and because we couldn't wait inside. Obviously we left immediately after that episode.  My opinion? This place is not worth the wait, or the irresponsible manner in which they give their wait times. The service is severely lacking. I won't be back, and the sad thing is, I can't even comment on the food!!!

mVclkLQVsbiaazJtPiLMVw.text: My family came here last week and we really love this place. Service was great;however, The ramen noodle was a little bit salty. Other than that everything was great. We definitely come back.

OK5qMhVzhvHq-lmDwtcNeA.text: Burger was okay but not worth $16 and took too long to come out. Fries were overpowered with truffle oil. Ramen broth was extremely salty. Service was very bad. A few times I looked for a waiter he or she looked away.

1-Pt6qj53JMBaPIeG8MqWA.text: Do not miss this stop in Vegas. The best burger I have ever eaten. The Wagyu burger is amazing.

qvDYj8y1MAwc8SX5rKLlHA.text: We came here while visiting a friend out here. Omg eat here. It's so fantastic. The salt and pepper garlic fries were super tasty. Me and my friend spilt the Kiki burger and the spicy miso. Both were great. Can't really go wrong with anything in the menu. Hidden gem for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is the spicy miso burger.

GDzY9rRxxLgUYcoGLs-mww.text: Two stars because the service was very slow. Don't bring a group of 10 in because they sat us in the back by the kitchen. It took over 45 minutes to be served and out food came out in stages. The pretty much forgot about us. So for a dinner that we paid over $200, the service should have been better and also the seating. On the other hand, the food was very tasty. Next time I may do a takeout.

Zn3JEWX-pych6nk4Ss02yg.text: One of my absolute favorite restaurants!  The burger quality is perfect.  I usually go for well done because I don't like ANY pink but when I come to Bachi I make sure I order it medium rare because the flavor is SO much better.  The service here is quite slow and often times they have forgotten an item we ordered but to me its absolutely worth the wait.  We always get the garlic chili edamame, truffle fries and salt and vinegar fries.   We also love the Oxtail fries but really recommend to buy it when you're with a bigger group since it is  A LOT of food.   ENJOY!  :D

d2vZe3Sn_KvrBYtPVjFteg.text: My overall experience at bachi burger was excellent! The food was delicious, high quality meats with fresh ingredients that didn't leave you feeling bloated. My wife and I enjoyed this place very much and appreciate how welcoming and hospitable the staff was. The organic ice coffee was superb! (Thanks Kevin) We highly recommend this place! We will definitely will come back when we're in town.

DpBZTvZ-D1h34nMreHEZ3A.text: I've been here multiple times and it is consistently one of the best burgers around!  Positive - Fun atmosphere. Amazing burgers. Try any of them! The Oxtail Chili Cheese Fries are the best! They always have some new menu items and appetizers that are worth trying as well.   Negative - None so far!

J0wRLAYU5go2xeBS1gwomg.text: Ate here for the first time tonight. Food was delicious!! And all of the staff was very friendly and fast, from when we got there to when we left. I plan on coming back!

6SBoKL8OohFoMxwKuYD-qw.text: OXTAIL CHILI CHEESE FRIES.  This clearly is the most popular dish at this place.  Every table around us had this on their table, every.  The service was spotty as we visited during lunch.  After our starters, the food began to settle in and the mile high burgers finally came out.  At this point, I was stuffed, but had to put down this spicy miso burger.  It's not the cheapest place for a lunch, but it's so worth it.  Oxtail chili cheese fries: By far one of the best dishes I've ever consumed.  The shredded oxtail was so tender, the flavor of the chili has a sweetness to it and it goes so well with the salty fries. The sunny side up egg just makes it even better.  Truly amazing, it's a must get and you'll be disappointed if you don't.  Pork Belly Buns: Not all that but still good.  I really enjoyed the bao dunked in their hoisin mixture and the touch of cilantro and radish gives it a great fresh touch.  Spicy miso burger: This this had to be at least 6" high, piled with toppings and goodness. What makes their burgers so unique is the Taiwanese sweet bun, soft, fluffy, and chewy, what a burger bun should be. There are so many great flavors in this piece, it was delicious, from garlic to peppers, onions, and a fried egg. The patty was cooked perfectly, medium.  If you're in Vegas, this place is a must.  Make a trip here, it's worth the short drive off of the strip.  As we left lunch, the place was packed and had a line outside the door.  I recommend going early.  It's a nice place with friendly staff.

4E2X47hk2f4uSLF5ZVF5Jg.text: Gourmet Fukuburger!!! Need I say more?! (only applicable if you've tried it i guess)   ...ok read this: ASIAN FUSION BURGERS!!! i.e. the Ronin Burger consists of Carameled onions, Japanese cole slaw, Miso Dressing, a a friggen fried egg!!! (yes its ok to drool) I love anything with a fried egg on top! Which brings me to their Oxtail chili cheese fries, yes fried egg topper! Ridiculous! I love their bao sandwiches also! Steamed buns stuffed with BBQ pork belly inside!   I haven't had anything here that i don't like, and i hope it stays that way! I'll keep coming back till i have everything on their menu! Thats a promise! Cheeee!!!

JaJPpdLLj8-RetBH2d2Opg.text: My friend and went, it was delicious  The service was quick and kept our drinks filled.  The burgers were cooled how we ask for. We tried the Parmesan fries. They were hot and well seasoned.   Overall  a good meal. The price for two burgers and one fry was 47 with tip. That was a little high. Retreats thought.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8xCrJW1MBMuY7AloOT5EWA.text: My wife and I are new to Vegas and love a good burger.  We live close to this location and had been excited about trying this restaurant.  We have 2 children under 3 so one day when they were napping I ran over to get 2 burgers to-go.  I placed my order and after 15 minutes of waiting I started to wonder how long it would take.  At 20 minutes I started getting a little annoyed.  After 25 minutes I was standing in front of the counter clearly a little ticked and nobody said anything to me.  I finally received my take-out and the general manager handed me the bag and didn't even say anything.  I looked at the receipt and it took 27 minutes!  I have worked at high and low end restaurants and NOTHING takes that long, not even a well-done steak.  All we ordered was a regular burger done medium and veggie burger.  Any manager with minimal customer service skills should have realized at 15 minutes it was taking too long and he was up there looking at the order tickets the whole time.  In addition, my wife said her burger was undercooked of all things and mine was average at best.    I was so disappointed that I wrote them an email on their website and they didn't even bother to respond.  Perhaps their food is better if you eat in but I have such a bad taste in my mouth for this business and how they run things, especially not having enough class to write me back, that I fear that will never happen.  So very disappointed.

vaU7eBlFgovOGSSu3LWzqw.text: Spectacular.  Best burger I've had ever, anywhere, ever.  Sure you're gonna pay for it.  But it's well worth it.  I do it paleo style so no bun.  The sweet potato fries are totally legit.  My recommendation:  Build your own: protein style, bacon, fried egg, avocado.  Sweet potato fries and a Matcha iced tea.

Csc_SUzQ9Cc1AxWmxS8ylg.text: I dine here frequently, mostly when visitors are in town.  Their burgers are consistently delicious, for lunch and dinner.  Now, here's the critique that you need to pay attention to.  I have twice dined here after 8pm.  In comparison with the lunch crew, here are the differences:  1)  Service is still good, but it's not as quick as the fully staffed lunch crew. 2)  The food tends to be more salty during the evenings.  I'm not sure if this is their intention for you to purchase more beer or a matter of preference by the kitchen.  Compare the ramen and definitely the oxtail fries.

15nDX20ojf2tLcLvWI3TAg.text: Waited for 53 minutes (probably more) to get the first item in our order. Ordered 3 burgers, 1 truffle sweet potatoes fries and a vietnamese coffee.  No one, including our waiter, bother to check up on us, informed us of any delays in the kitchen, or refill our water. It was as if the staff was too ashame to face us.  All it takes to turn this experience around was to check in with us and keep us posted that our meal is taking a little bit longer to prepare.  Maybe we would have like an appetizer in the meantime.  It took me 5 mins to finally flag down a person to ask about our order.  She did not even bother to ask what our orders were. Then it took her another 10 minutes to come back and let us know what our order is coming....which actually took 5 mins to come. Once our food did come out, we had 3 people check on us within 10 minutes. One lady, who I assume was the manager,  even came by to give an empty apology for the long wait. She did not bother to look at our table. I am extremely upset and disappointed.  I used to recommend this place to everyone that comes into Vegas but that will no longer be the case going forward.
