Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kiki burger
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mutation-San

ZCJCbSEt12USiRksPAn5Ug.text: We ordered the Miyagi-san burger, KiKi's, and truffle fries.  This was plenty of food for two.  The Kiki burger did not have much caramelized onions, which was the flavor I was craving for.  The Miyagi-san burger was delicious.  My favorite part of that burger was the fried onion rings.  Overall this place has great service and good food, I would recommend eating here.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Miyagi-san burger

DyuWQuEw5O9ZvE6VfNp62A.text: If you like special burgers and visiting Las Vegas this is the place to go but go early!  Wonderful selection of items great salads.  Friendly staff and good parking  Very worth a taxi ride!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burgers of all kinds!

R3MjuilvXE48VGZOTft7jg.text: Bachi Burger used to be my favourite restaurant. I came here for my birthdays, prom, etc. I was particularly fond of their "No Meat Here" burger, and always made a point to get it at least once when I came back to Vegas during my visits from college.  However, the last two times I visited Bachi have been rather negative. In January of this year, my grandma and I waited 45 minutes for a seat that we were looking at the entire time we were waiting. No one was sitting there, and it was already clean, yet we weren't seated. When we were, however, I found out they didn't have the ingredients for the burger I go there for, so I ordered the same thing as my grandma-- some fried rice. Not only did it take ages for us to get our fried rice, but for some reason, my grandma's plate didn't come out until 20 minutes after mine. We got the same dish.   Then we tried again today, myself, my uncle, and my grandma. My uncle needed to get soup because he got his wisdom teeth pulled, and they weren't preparing soup. Apparently that side of the restaurant was closed during lunch hour. Also the bathroom was broken.  Bachi used to be a hidden gem on my side of town I loved going to with my family and friends, but it's been in such a decline these past couple of years. It's sad. I had a lot of good memories here. I hope they take these local reviews into consideration so they don't lose all their local customer loyalty. Unfortunately, they've lost mine.

GP75NJKgLLV9EAjYgjQa2Q.text: OMG!   The burgers are soooo good! The truffle fries are amazing! And the ramen is good also!  Please check this place out one of my go to spots when I'm in vegas

eUcl-Fq_-ZkqEB13zTIkAQ.text: Horrible service Very disappointed  We were the first guests to arrive at 11am. We were promptly seated. There were three of us. My husband and I ordered burgers with oxtail chili fries and my mother ordered ramen with a side of rice. Our fries came out in 5 minutes. Our burgers came out maybe 10-15 minutes later. But my moms ramen and side of rice order still haven't come out. We were done with our burgers after 10 minutes and still the ramen haven't come out. The female server said it was coming out. Another 8 minutes pass and finally the ramen finally arrives but the side rice still not on the table.  Another 5 minutes or so pass and my mom ask for rice since she likes to eat ramen with rice. The assistant supervisor comes by to finally drop off the rice after almost 10 minutes of asking for it with no apology for the delay and walks off. My mom is so upset that she barely touched her meal. I ask to speak with a manager and she returns. My mom expresses her anger about the horrible service and she talks over my mom and tells us that the rice was not cooked or the ramen. There are two different kitchens. One for the ramen side and the other for the burger side. She also had a defensive attitude. My mom told her that she didn't like the ramen and do not want to be charge for it or the rice. So she quickly grabs the rice & ramen and walks away. Still no apology. I was very disappointed with how she handled the situation.   An excellent guest recovery for what happen would be for her to have automatically remove the rice & ramen off the bill and offer to comp the entire meal which included the two burgers & fries since our food did not come out at the same time; and they forget to cook the ramen & rice. We had to ask her to remove the ramen & rice off the bill. An apology as well would have eased the situation. It was obvious that they forget to make the ramen & rice. It was a very disappointing dining  experience. The burgers and fries are definitely good but the restaurant lacks management empathy & sincerity. Very very disappointed and will not return because of the very poor treatment that we received.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shotgun burger
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BO7J2oc8cT3HqR_Fgpc_rg.text: So good!  Haven't had anything I haven't liked. I always try to make a trip there whenever I'm Las Vegas.

FW5u5suxHYRoOk_XdUwMkw.text: When I found out that Bachi Burger had a $25 Shogun burger, it was so sinfully delicious sounding, that I had to have it first thing once we arrived in Sin City.  Having arrived at almost closing, around 10pm, we were no longer allowed to eat at the restaurant, so I ordered my $25 Wagyu and foie gras burger to go.  The AC was broken on this particular night, as was the bathroom.  As soon as you set foot inside, we started sweating as if we were in a sauna.  I waited for my order to come out.  Once it came out, I took it out of the box to take pictures.  I said to myself, I might as well scarf this thing down; and so I did.  I don't know if it was because I was sweating while eating the the burger, or because I was being rushed, or because it was in a to go box, or whatever it was, it was a bit overrated.  It was good, but when eating a delicacy, you probably need to eat this thing on a plate, and eat it slowly to enjoy and savor the flavors ingredients.  The bread was great (mildly sweet with a glaze), the meat, well it is Wagyu and of course better quality, and the foie gras was nice, jello'y and fatty.  A small bed of lettuce gave it a bit of crunch and healthiness.  I've also had a fish sandwich here on another occasion.  That time I was severely dehydrated and so it got in the way of my enjoyment and being a connoisseur.  Next time will have to eat here in normal conditions/circumstances.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Threw an egg and cheese on it
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Threw an egg and cheese on it
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $25 Shogun Wagyu burger with foie gras to go

D1ZVU5uS8jWLRy-uH1u88A.text: We've gone to Bachi Burger twice now with each visit we've made to Las Vegas.  It's an interesting menu, as the burgers are asian inspired and if memory serves, share a combination of savory and sweet in some form or another.  The first time I ate here last year, I tried a burger off the menu.  The beef was very tasty and the quality and freshness was undeniable.  Would I have made a burger like this at my place?  No.  The second time I ate here, which was last week, I requested a "regular" burger which wasn't on the menu because I wasn't feeling like having savory and sweet, and they obliged.  Again, perfectly cooked and seasoned.  The food does take awhile to come out, especially if you're in a large party, so don't expect anything "express" style.  It's an enjoyable enough place if you don't mind the wait.  They're usually very busy.  If you're hankering for a more traditional burger, they'll hook you up with a smile.   No complaints about this establishment.  It's in the "take it or leave it" category for me.

q_eOEdE4AHKuJFdeUWiPFA.text: Unfortunately, we will not be returning to Bachi Burger. The last time we came here for dinner my boyfriend's burger was literally RAW. Both of us lost our appetite and could not believe they actually had someone working in the kitchen that would send out such unacceptable food.   This experience made us question the level of professionalism and training in the kitchen. Bye bye forever, Bachi.

capd4_pBwL7SCK656IrU9A.text: To continue on with our foie gras kick, we paid Bachi Burger a visit. It's located about 10 minutes off the strip. No glitz, no glamor.  Just some good grub.   Set up was casual with TV screens everywhere, as typical with other burger joints. Bar in the middle that serves alcohol,  BOBA teas and fruit juices.  Adjacent and connected to a ramen place. Pretty  gnarly that both menus were presented (most likely same owners) and they welcomed ordering from either menu. A burger and some ramen??? Sweet!!  THE FOOD GIST:  The OXTAIL CHILI CHEESE FRIES were quite EYE CATCHING. Our friends posted a pix on facebook and I drooled just looking at it. Bookmarked it instantly.  How can you sit next to someone who ordered this dish and NOT want to have a bite?  This is a MUST HAVE for that very reason.   Overall, this dish was heavy and was a meal in itself. It was loaded with "pulled" oxtail, chili, cheese and topped w/ an oozing fried egg....CRAZEE!!  The fries were just the right size and everything went well together. Loved the garlic aioli!!  SHOGUN BURGER:  Hats off to Bachi Burger for creating a pretty magnificent burger.  The medley of ingredients are standing O worthy and complement each other well.  Check it out:  wagyu beef & unagi. pan seared FOIE GRAS, poached asian pear, miso butter and yamamomo peach. A hint of sweet and savory with every bite. BEST GOURMET BURGER in my eyes.  I recommend DECONSTRUCTING it with foie gras on the side.  I would take a bite of the burger, then a bite of foie gras. YUM-O!. I could've  also done w/o the patty since I'm not a big meat person and it was a bit too heavy.    I was feeling guilty and had to get a HOUSE SALAD: No bueno. It was blah. Dressing was lacking and greens were a bit too bitter for me. Not an arugula fan.   STRAWBERRY LYCHEE LEMONADE:  The waitress was so sweet and patient with me.  It took me forever and a day to decide on a drink.  I was back and forth between a boba tea and soda.  She assured me that this drink was really good and I went for it.  It was refreshing and made w/ fresh strawberries.  Lychee flavor was very mild though.   SERVICE: Friendly service and food came out at an average pace.   TID BIT:  1) Outdoor seating available 2) Kid friendly.  3) Only 1 public bathroom. Long wait time :(  The hubs and I really enjoyed our experience.  We sat their eating away and were at one with our food.  Will surely be back to try other burgers.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shogun upclose...so good :)
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I deconstructed the Shogun burger
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shogun burger

TALVOjZEjkBzkyOV-CYaiQ.text: Great meal off the strip.  We got there pretty early for dinner and had no wait but larger parties that got there later had to wait for quite some time before they were seated.  The brussel sprouts were delicious and probably my favorite part of the meal.  The bacon and pear had such a great crunch and provided a nice salty/sweet aspect, plus the sauce was the bomb.  I was going to order the shogun burger but they were out of foie so I went with the miyagi-san's which was also quite tasty.  The truffle fries were ok, I could have gone with something else and the mushroom sauce wasn't for me, it was a little floraly and sweet.  My only problem with the restaurant is that service is pretty slow and I can't imagine what it's like when it's busier so I definitely recommend ordering an appetizer, which came out pretty fast, so you don't get hangry.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle fries and miyagi-san&#39;s burger
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brussel sprouts delicious!!!!!!!

LWKu729Ko2k6PyUmbGsiww.text: I love this place.  Every time we are in the area this place is a must stop!  Everything we've had here is unique and really good!  If you drive by this place and don't stop here, you should probably just quit for the day and drive home because you've already failed to be happy.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UdPqOaYGnsgM7A295njbGA.text: Friends were on a long layover here so I picked them up and took them straight here to eat. We sat and were getting ready to order when two workers came and told us the health department was there and their water isn't hot enough, they are getting shut down. The second worker said "we will make it up to you" and told us to leave quietly, but that's all he said so not really sure what that meant. Some people were currently eating, not sure how that went for them. Seems like they were trying to quickly and quietly get people out before health department made an announcement. I know restaurants have violations from time to time but I'd there is no hot water early in the day when there are very few customers, you should know it's unacceptable to serve food. Not hot enough to wash dishes or even hands!  ** they lied. They were on dirty dining a week later and were shut down for a week due to the massive roach infestation. Nasty.

Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gyoza
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wings

Oygejo5FfVvcHCJCzkx9gg.text: Stopped here on the way to Vegas, my friend saw this place on Drive ins, Diners and Dives. We came on a Saturday about noon, lots of seats open, but soon after more people came trickling in. We were greeted by a friendly host and our waitress was just as friendly and attentive. I ordered the black and green burger and OMG was it DELICIOUS!! Seriously the best burger I've ever had! It was so full of flavor and tasted so fresh. We ordered two sides of fries and those were good. We stopped here on the way back from Vegas too it was that good!!

yOo6UktAtf1LUW9JLhnAdg.text: My favorite burger spot in town. Only down part is that it gets real packed and food can take up to 20 mins to get ready. Otherwise it's a solid place.

q3LqGkgoiAptXgaXLCylpg.text: Prologue: My girlfriend and I like to stay at an RV park on the south end of the Strip, which is right down the street from this restaurant. We usually arrive in town right around supper time, so this place made perfect sense as our first stop for some nourishment after a long drive up from Tucson.   The Plot: We started by sharing some Peking Style Duck Steamed (Bao, a.k.a. Fold-Over) Buns followed by a Kiki's Burger cooked medium.  The Scene: The portion sizes were good and just right for the two of us.  The buns were tasty with a nice combination of flavors and textures and all of the ingredients complimented each other very well.  The burger was perfectly prepared with a nice crust on the outside, cooked evenly throughout, tender, juicy, and had great flavor. The bacon and caramelized onions were also cooked perfectly, very tasty, and enhanced the flavor of the meat quite nicely.   The Rest of the Story: I appreciate that the fact that poultry is much more flavorful when served slightly under done. However, the duck meat in one of the buns was rather chewy and probably should have been cooked more thoroughly. I would have also expected more crispy skin in a dish called Peking Style Duck.  We thought the amount of greens served in the burger was a bit too generous. There are better ways to make a burger sandwich look tall when serving. For example, we expected the portion of meat in a specialty burger to be bigger and thicker than it was, especially when you consider that this sandwich was served with no side dishes.  Epilogue: The service was prompt and courteous; however it was somewhat overbearing. We ended up having to tell three different wait staff a total of four times that we were still working on our meal and not yet ready to have our plates cleared away.  Although we expect the prices at restaurants in Las Vegas to be higher than in Tucson, we still thought that this restaurant was somewhat overpriced considering it's off the Strip and caters to mostly locals.  Photo design by Billie Z.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kiki&#39;s Burger
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Peking Style Duck Steamed Buns

E8zQP-pi2UmMSgkbpPjBdw.text: They gave me exactly what I expected. I realized this morning searching for breakfast in a town that isn't awake before 10 that I never praise the establishments that give me exactly what I was expecting. The wagyu burger was awesome, perfect temp

luoIQlIztcX2daIJfHcQ0A.text: Come for the burgers. Ignore the fancy fries. That should be your plan when coming here. Every burger that I have tried here is delicious. Especially the Korean one with Kimchi and marinate on the meat. The pork buns are great but the burger was the star. I have been here before and they did not disappoint. Previously tried the regular burgers also. Also good. Have not tried their Ramen.

99apVLu1_6bXAoFR-Aex-A.text: I like Bachi Burger - and was a pretty big fan at one time. But I'm just not as impressed these days.  Most recently, I tried the "No Meat Here" vegetarian burger. It was a good attempt to make an interesting sandwich. Sadly, the burger itself was just not that good. Too dense and bean-y for my taste. All of the other additions to the burger - no matter how creative - won't save it if the main 'burger' is not great.  My date had the steamed pork buns, which he didn't finish. "Just not that interesting" was his take.  We shared the Truffle Parmesan Fries - and these were actually disappointing. Almost no Parmesan that we could see or taste. The Truffle Porcini Cream had a generally mushroomy taste, but only the slightest whiff of truffle - and there was only a drizzle of the sauce on the whole order of fries. Basically, it was just 'fries' with a garnish of sauce. I'd like to see a good deal more cheese, and wouldn't mind the sauce being served on the side - if messy finger food is a problem. But please use more truffle if you are going to advertise it as such. I will go out of my way for good truffle fries.  I have had excellent food here.  Just not recently.

XsOQNRdDTMN0iuup_xLXuw.text: The food is absolutely fantastic. It's so fantastic that by the time I leave the restaurant after giving this place yet another chance, I think that maybe it's worth all of the issues. But.. after multiple visits over the past three years. It's just not worth it.  The fact is that this is the worst managed restaurant on the planet, and the food is just so outstandingly good that it somehow scrapes by.  Come into this place and be prepared to wait. There's always a waiting list. However, it's artificial. Look past the list and you'll see a restaurant with multiple empty tables and a complete bar counter that isn't sat. Management refuses to properly staff the restaurant.  Every now and then, you'll finally be sat at one of the multitude of empty tables. Don't get your hopes up because management hasn't staffed the kitchen either. Be prepared to wait for a very long time.   It's okay though. Look at the menu. This place has a decent selection of draft beers and an impressive list of bottled beers. The long wait won't seem so long as you partake of some drinks. Hell, the restaurant and the wait staff wins cause it's free up selling. Except, management won't stock the bar. The list of 5 draft beers? They only actually have one of those. They're out of the rest. This place is literally throwing away free money.   These are not one time experiences. I searched through my credit card history, and I've spent over $1500 here in 2016. I'm scared to look at the other years. I've been here multiple times and two things are consistent: the food is outstanding and this is the most mismanaged mess of a restaurant on the planet. And it has been that way for years. Just imagine how shitty this place has been managed that the amazing food just can't save it anymore.   Ha, there was this one time where I ordered Ramen, and this place ran out of chopsticks. Chopsticks. I can't wrap my head around how that is even possible. How do you run out of an eating utensil? It's the most absurd thing ever.

IDgMQoX-Z9WjFlMp1ZBGqg.text: Some of the best burgers in town! Been here a few times and can never complain about any burger I've gotten. The truffle fries are a must have!

UTMXwv2hHlYcCDkt2nKZ7Q.text: I had a meeting down the street, so I was conveniently located right next to Bachi (and I've been meaning to try this spot for nearly six months). Based on photos and the menu description, I wanted to try the spicy miso burger. It is BOMB! I slammed it and would love to go for one more. It's honestly not that spicy but has a small kick that brings a great flavor with the rest of the sauce, fried egg and shishito peppers up in there. Next time I'm bringing a friend to share some Parmesan truffle fries.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Miso Burger is BOMB

iA44j_crB9beqv7MsDt-hw.text: One of my favorite culinary movements that's finally penetrating non-coastal cities here in the U.S. is proper Asian-American fusion, and for that reason I really wanted to fall in love with Bachi Burger. The menu was spot on, but the product delivery fell just a tad bit short of what I've had elsewhere.  Star 1: How were the service and atmosphere?  No complaints about the service at Bachi. Service was fast and friendly, and while I was ever so slightly irked that I couldn't order just a single pork bun to try it with my burger (instead had to order three and later hate myself) everything came together. Star Granted.   Star 2: How were the portions relative to the cost?  As I've now harked on at length, $15.00 is my cap on a sit down burger spot with very few exceptions. Bachi must feel the same way, as their most expensive burger the Miyagi-San comes in right at $15.00. The burger isn't quite as large as the oversized bun and the even more oversized onion rings allude to, but it's by no means a rip off.   From there, my three (small) duck pork buns were $12.00, or $4.00 each, which also wasn't a deal nor a ripoff. Star Granted.   Stars 3 and 4: How was the food?  Honestly both of my dishes at Bachi Burger were just okay -  I started with the Duck Pork Buns, which, while obviously freshly prepared and with good ingredient proportions, didn't have a ton of flavor. The cabbage and carrots and egg downplayed the duck a bit to the point where the accompanying sauce was needed, and the bao was ever so slightly sticky, which can happen if they sit out for two long.   The burger was a similar story. The absurdly large bun was unnecessary apart from optics, and while I like the onion rings I did end up picking two of them off so that I could actually taste the burger patty, which was decent but not packed with it's own inherent flavor. The cheese and egg paired nicely, but all in all this was just a good burger - not a great one. Single Star Granted.   Star 5: Would you eat here every day if you could?  Vegas these days is so stacked on Asian and burgers alike that I can't say that i would. No Star Granted.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duck Pork Buns: $12.00
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Miyagi-San Burger: $15.00

3Ief8aA2QsaT5044mhL1fw.text: I'm originally from Hawaii & moved to LA, visit Vegas occasionally and this place makes me feel like I'm back at home. From the minute you step in to this place, there's a good vibe. The music is very local and the people are very welcoming. We came during lunch & looked like there were many tables available but the wait was 15 minutes. I didn't realize this place was also a ramen joint so my boyfriend ordered a burger & I got the spicy miso ramen. We also ordered the oxtail fries. The wait wasn't too bad either. They let you know that the burgers & ramen come out of separate kitchens so it will come out in variations.  My ramen was tasty & had a flavorful tamago in it! The burger & the fries were huge! We could not finish even half of it but all the food was great. Service was superb, Our waters were constantly refilled. Next time I'm in town, I will definitely get a burger for myself!

GH6qSpstEVrsNjsTI7b8Ng.text: Amazing burgers! Everything we ordered was incredible - the Miyagi Burger, the Bahn-mi burger, and the pork belly buns (to die for!)

Z9sHegVw7MOKGR1RyiQsoA.text: Never Fail here!!! Best service from Dylan!!! This place is awesome!!! Ono food!!! Locals from Hawaii, you guys need to make this place part of your visit!!!

smkkFRUjWtrKl6j3GRGpdw.text: Love Bachi Burger. Unfortunate that they are always understaffed. I feel bad for the servers busting their butts with little to no help. Ramen is also awesome

EvJptTaiDmxsBJpVBx55KA.text: This is the Alpha and Omega of all Hamburger venues. The gateway to all things good and just in the burger universe.   I used to be obsessed with hamburgers and have tried them in many ways, shapes and forms all over the world.  Although there are many interpretations of "The Hamburger", typically, they all either tasted very similar, or very bad.  Bachi is the exception.   It is my opinion that the Wagu Bachi Burger with cheese, double patty, is the greatest "crossover-hamburger" of all times.   There are a lot of other great, and unique items on the menu, however, I would come just for the Burger. Furthermore, I would not diverge from the "The Standard Burger" on your first visit. They have all sorts of unique versions, however, trust me - just ask for the wagu with cheese and maybe a side of mayo.   Yes, they are a little slow. So? It's worth it.   Easy parking. Very nice staff. A fabled ramen bar in the back that may or may not ever open - but who cares?   This review is all about THE BURGER.   Japanese sweet yet grilled smokey heaven.  And yes, I feel awful for eating cows...But I was a vegetarian for many years and all it got me was sick, tired and longing for a burger...a Bachi burger!  Hurry , go now!!!

1P15J_nlXr-ZoKLLO9ixPw.text: Unbelievable meal!! After traveling for more than a week supporting local establishments we decided to give this place a go based on DD&D episode, it did not fail to please. The Brussel sprout app was simply an amazing combination of flavor. Try the Banh Mi  And sweet potato fries w the most amazing Citrus Aioli!

CxxtvsgDJ6urpoL8jIUjxQ.text: This update is almost 6 years after my previous review, and I stand by my previous review, for the time and place.   You know, sometimes places have a gradual decline and go downhill... This place has fallen of a cliff and is an unrecognizable shred of the magnificence once exhibited. I just don't understand. Once upon a time, this place was standing room only and understandably so.   Tonight, it was suspiciously slow. And understandably so. There is a problem when 'the vendors' are responsible for not having anymore fries, anymore mac and cheese, which has miraculously showed up or anymore strawberry for the lemonade. They obviously knew something before I did.  The burgers are still great and the buns are still heavenly.   Bachi Burger.   "Strap it down, and get your stuff together."- Jeff Spoder

zgt2M0y210LfbQcQCa7pSQ.text: If I lived around the area, I'd probably be here very often and probably very heavy but YOLO (is that still the catchphrase of the day? lol).  We ordered:  Miyagi-San burger:  This was pretty good! It has bacon, fried egg, onion rings, chili mayo and furikake (which is apparently a seasoning..thanks, Google).  After staring at pictures, this is one of the burgers you must try.  Ronin burger:  This burger has Japanese cole slaw in it which I've noticed was just added slices of that red ginger you get when you eat at Japanese restaurants.  There's also caramelized onions, fried egg, yuzu citrus aioli, katsu bbq and miso goma dressing.  I've only tried this and the previously mentioned burger but this one was my favorite.  Actually, we both liked this one the best.  If you're generally not a fan of ginger (like moi), you will hardly taste it and you'll survive.  Salt & Pepper Garlic fries:  I asked for recommendations on the fries and was told to get this one since it was the waitress's favorite.  It has jalapeno, sea salt/pepper and surprisingly more ginger than I was expecting, which didn't make it that great for me.  Get this if you are, again, a fan of ginger.  We couldn't really taste anything garlicky about the fries (and the sauce as well), but more of the jalapeno.  It comes with an amazing garlic chili aioli sauce.  Truffle Parmesan fries:  We really liked this one the best (compared to the other fries).  There's black truffle porcini cream on the fries along with a sun dried tomato aioli.  I think we liked these fries mixed with the garlic chili aioli  together.  Milk tea drinks:  These were THE most bland drinks we have ever had with its non-sweet flavors (honeydew and lychee) and too soft tapiocas.    For drinks, I was told that they do make their own beverages and I did see this one soda that seemed appealing (apple and lychee).  Other than that, we look forward to our next Vegas trip and we'll definitely be back!

n7517hiCoOOGB7WZohAVcQ.text: BEST BURGERS EVER!!!!  I am drooling just thinking about it.  Ordered the ox-tail fries and kiki burger and both were really amazing!  Fries portion was seriously enough for 3 people and burger was well portioned too!   The sweet perfectly baked bun and Asian fusion flavors of the burger really were really spectacular and my taste buds were going crazy, YUM YUM YUM! The sauteed mushrooms and carmelized bacon marmalade were a perfect touch!  Service could definitely use some work as the servers weren't that attentive or seemed happy at all. But the food was amazing enough to let me look pass that!  Once the LA location in California opens up I'll definitely be visiting!

hSoWD5Byru3_e1t2D8KNCw.text: We have been here several times and always got good service and great food. I don't know what happened to the management but we have been sipping water waiting on basic burger and fries for nearly 45 minutes. We have been checked on once but still waiting. The waitresses are snots that think they are too good to wait on people - you're a waitress, stupid!  Doubt we will be back ever again.

v0m7i7AYIKSjnOuuKy4fgQ.text: This is my second time coming here and I ordered the ronin burger. The burger had an egg carmalized onions in a tonkatsu sauce and I think it was cabbage. Its a decent sized burger and it tasted really good. I just wish that the egg was runnier. We also ordered the truffle fries and sweet potato fries. Which were pretty good. We had two orders of fries and split between 4 people. Most likely youre looking at a $16. But it is well worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ronun burger
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Couple of couples...sweet potato fries and truffle parmesean fries

kvPMS-XnLq81jUyECyHqAw.text: Oxtail Chili Cheese Fries 5/5 These fries were a ridiculous combo. Ive never had a broken egg on top of fries but this worked out very well. It didnt completely sog the fries as long as you at em fast enough. Ive usually had carne asada or pollo on top of fries so the oxtail meat was refreshing.  Truffle Parmesan Fries 5/5 This is easily one of the best truffle parmesan fries ive ever had. Generous servings with a good truffle aroma sprinkled with parmesan. the Chili dip was a good complement as well but you dont even have to use that for these fries to taste good  Ronin Burger 5/5 Im a sucker for onion rings or grilled onions on a burger so this was a easy choice for me. The katsu bbq sauce made the burger irresistable not to mention the meat was prepared well. I ordered the angus beef medium rare   I highly recommended anyone in the area to come eat at this place!

oldfpfCNRXgsId2bnRO5yw.text: My favorite burger joint in Las Vegas. I love their Bachi Fish, cod is always cooked to perfection and melts in your mouth. Fries are great too as well as their (papaya)boba drinks. A bit on the pricey$ side, but still worth trying.

nGbrGR9OjhFYyIEKuSCr8Q.text: I've gone here many times and every time I go here my experience is always great. When it comes down to being greeted, seated, and ever served. I always have a pleasant time.   The environment vibe is classy and also modern. When it comes to the food they have a great presentation when served and plus it's delicious. I ordered a medium rare Ronin Burger and it was made just right.  I would recommend this Restuarant if you want a well, unique and one of a kind type of burger here in Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Ronin Burger (medium rare)

0D0bHHjwOuGFNKRXrxvjtw.text: Recently went here and was amazed at how wonderful this place is. I was seated immediately and brought water as drink order was taken. I ordered an appetizer of the Chili Garlic edamame. This was Salty, with just enough heat to give you a thirst for a nice cold beer. They have several great beers on tap. Fortunately the y had a beer on tap that I recently had at Hakassan. Hitachino Nest Beer White Ale. I then Had the Rhonin Burger.  Angus Beef  Caramelized Onions  Japanese  Cole Slaw  Miso Goma Dressing  Fried Egg  Katsu BBQ  Yuzu Citrus Aioli.  I added aged Cheddar for an added bite. Cooked a perfect medium rare as I like it. You need to cut in half to start the egg just oozes down the burger making your taste buds yearn for that perfect bite. It was a perfect bite. I will with out a doubt eat  here again. The service was excellent and attentive, and you know how I feel about that. Prices are moderate. I will say this joint is jumping at lunch time and the staff handled it well. Good place for group lunches. If you get a chance go check this out if you have not. You will not be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

inuGEmavG-Sc67qMPHBMqg.text: Bahn mi burger was a nice surprise. The bun was fluffy and soft with pate. Shrimp with the burger and a slice of grilled pork. I didn't care much for the dipping sauce and thought it didn't need it. I ordered the fried rice for my youngest. He liked it but thought it wAs a little spicy. I ordered the pork rice ball. He enjoyed that a lot.  My husband ordered the MiYagi with fried onion rings, egg, garlic aioli served on a soft bun. He thought that it was great. My older son ordered the tonkatsu ramen and he slurped that right up. We ended our night with the chocolate cake and caramel salt milk shake. Both were ok. I thought that the cake would ooze out a bit but no luck.  I los ordered the plantation ice tea and had them add boba. Got my boba fix after all. I would recommend you give this a try.

ivcDtt0Ba4ZkQxMX82GGRg.text: I bought the Miyagi burger and it was the best burger I've ever had!

WjNrDNzbEnl_qQOfqkvh2A.text: Such a great customer service! The hostess, Melinda, was very sweet and prompt. She made sure we were comfortable while we were waiting and even got us water. All of the cocktails offered here are well made and delicious! Thank you so much for such a great experience! :)

7pwbMY-nSDySEpwBM12Xaw.text: Ate here for the first time. Loved the Asian flavored burgers and can't wait to go back to try more. Had a ginger soda which was also delicious. Service was a little slow but otherwise great.

PhlzSqPDFSpa_R2YOMQC7Q.text: OMG! I came to Vegas for Iheartradio and i had to eat this place.   WOW. I am lost for words. I got the   KIKI Burger-Angus  Beef, Sauteed  Shiitake, Enoki and Eryngii Mushrooms, Caramelized  Bacon, Sweet  Onion  Marmalade, Gruyere  Cheese, Garlic  Chili, Aioli  Miyagi san burger -- Chili mayo, fried egg, Furikake caramelized bacon, crispy onion rings  Ronin burger -- Angus beef, caramelized onions, Japanese cole slaw, miso goma dressing, fried egg, katsu BBQ, and Yuzu citrus aioli  Hands down some delicious burgers. I WILL COME BACK. Service was on point and you got to get out of the strip to try some 'better' goods. WIN!

ZoGLecYetLf9ucEFhoGOow.text: A little disappointed. While the creative parings and toppings were high quality and tasty the taste of the meat in the burger was a bit lacking.  We ordered the sausage app, the sausages were tasty, served with a nice whole grain mustard. They were just sausages really, nothing special. We also had the chili chicken, that was pretty tasty.  I had the Spicy Miso burger and it was spicy! My sinuses started to clear just from smelling it but not too hot to bear. It was tasty but again I was disappointed with the flavor if the meat itself. The meat was a bit bland, hard and dry. I got the impression that it was a frozen wagyu patty. So while the overall burger was good, it was more like I had all these tasty toppings, sauce and spices wrapped around a bland burger.   I give Bachi props for the unique creation of an Asian/Burger fusion and the creative tastes but in the end an inferior or frozen beef patty will bring a good burger down and ultimately why I couldn't give them 4 stars.  One tip if you get one of the burgers with a fried egg, be careful with the over medium egg..... Bite the wrong way and you could have a blast of hot liquid yolk shoot all over you! LOL

LQTFNQ2CTVrBHoCHZrS1hA.text: Just tried this place and WOW!!! Oxtail chili cheese fries are a must.  Service was friendly and fast.  Little bit of a wait as its a small place and people just keep pouring in the door. Be ready for a 20 min wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Be hungry!

Nq5GBWJgVJGX4dbp72YexQ.text: Recommended kiki burger and oxtail chilli fries. Ronan and miayagi burger is also oaky to try

QkHBCKQLyPD7-y8ehUIkOw.text: Damn, what? This place shot up the list of my favorite places to eat in Vegas.  I'll start with the burgers. First of all, there wasn't one burger OR sandwich I did not want to try. Everything sounded absolutely delicious. I wish I had a slider of each them. I ended up getting the kiki's burger and it was just what I expected. All the ingredients (garlic chili aioli, gruyere, all the Asian mushrooms, sweet onion marmalade, caramelized bacon) came together really well on top of the angus beef patty. Although I gravitate to simpler burgers (i.e. Father's Office Burger in LA), this burger was just a burst of flavor. It was inventive and delicious.  Now for my favorite part of the meal: the oxtail chili cheese fries. After my first bite, I seriously exclaimed: HOLY CRAP WHAT IS THIS. It was insanely delicious to me. The fries were incredibly crispy, and the oxtail with the chili was just superb. Topped with cheese and a fried egg, damn. It just doesn't get better than this. I would never think to put oxtail on chili cheese fries, but props to the people who figured this out.  Every time I come to Vegas, this is where I'm going to want to eat.

uTBr-iwcZUPRg4RnBFwLRg.text: Always a must stop for me when coming to vegas. The burgers have so much flavor and so juicy. The fries can hold their own as well. Cant go wrong with the truffle or the sweet potato. Love this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Double patty miyagi-san

Cew2n7gOB_rWDdbRsO_Byw.text: OK so we're in Vegas for Thanksgiving & while watching TV on the Top Ten best Burgers in the US #7 is in Vegas. So I'm Like "Let's go" :D of course because its on TV it has to be good... Right??? OMG Bachi Burger became our #1 burger spot every time we're in Vegas...

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. These little Pork Belly steam buns are absolutely GOOD. Da BomB!!!
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The #7 best burger in the US. THE US. The Bachi Burger :D
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. WoW the Ox tail fries... Yes Ox tail... this for sure is SOOO better then any chilly cheese or carna asada fries!!!

q4pz78DLWhyCnuvvnpR0eQ.text: Yum. Have tried a few DDD places, but this one was outstanding. Myagi-San and Kalbi Burgers were cooked to perfection (medium rare...would hate to ruin Wagyu beef!) The Parmesan Truffle Fries were nicely seasoned (read salted!) were most places these days seem to think salt is a commodity like gold. Completely happy with this food!

Y_VXh4RqrAJCYXUvmn_kqQ.text: This is a great place, especially for the price. It rivals Holsteins and BurGR for quality, but at a better price. Our server was very friendly, patient, and answered my multiple questions about their different sauces. We shared the egg onion ring burger and the mushroom burger. They were both awesome - even my son's burger was surprisingly good for a kids' burger! My son scarfed his whole burger, and he is usually a slow eater. The truffle fries were great with the mushroom sauce and sun dried tomato aoli. The spiked milkshake was good too, a little strong, but who would complain about that?! What's not to love about grass-fed wagyu beef, funakoke seasoning, Vietnamese mint... It was a blend of happy ingredients having a party in my mouth.

KYe_FKvCpi_dd1dMVcIP7A.text: Amazing burgers!  I love this place!  It was recommended by several friends, so I came here with my family, and it is possibly one of the best local burger joints in town.  Not to mention the homemade sodas.  Mmmmm!  We pigged out and order the kiki, fish, and kalbi burger along with sweet potato fries, truffle fries, Peking duck rolls, and finished off with Portuguese doughnuts.  The short review: Get the fish burger, sweet potato fries, and a Cherry Yuzu soda.  The fish is rich and just as good as a beef burger.  The sweetness in the fries pair off really well with the bitterness of the Cherry Yuzu.  The longer review:  The kalbi burger is really good, but also really sweet.  The first bites are tasty, but then my tongue got a little sick of the sweet meat.  Surprisingly, the kimchi on the burger wasn't overpowering.  The truffle fries are cooked just as well as the sweet potato fries: crispy yet fluffy.  The truffle gave it a richness that contrasted with the Parmesan shavings.  But, the truffle is only at the top, so everything under the first layer are regular fries.  I wasn't too big on the doughnuts only because I am not a fan of cinnamon, and the accompanying ice cream for the doughnuts were loaded with cinnamon flecks.  Loaded!    The atmosphere is really hipster.  The servers are young and relaxed.  The decoration is modern with an Asian theme, but still reminds me of a local coffee shop in Seattle.      Overall, the food focuses on contrasting flavors that complement which was done really well.  The quality is very high, and the atmosphere is awesome.

0-wb82cBm_lo2gCVcUzKNA.text: I don't get to eat at this place often since I live so far away but when I do I get all smiley! I went in for a late lunch last fri cuz I was in the area. I don't remember our servers name but she was pleasant and fun to have . I ordered the KIki burger and I was not upset about that decision at all. It was incredible and yum so yum . Everything was great until I noticed some yelling like talk coming from the kitchen. It was a female and she was not sounding nice. I couldn't really tell cuz I wasn't trying hard to not stare but she seemed to be a shorter Hawaiian chef that didn't seem to be happy. I don't know why she was so mad , she makes great food why the anger? If I wanted to eat with anger I would go to my dad's :). I will be back cuz the food is good and the servers treat me like family but maybe the back of house should take a chill pill and relax . It's just food :)

VKcR132_rizKvYeFhES5xA.text: Been here twice now since moving back to town. Had the Ronin Burger.... Best burger I've ever had!!!!!! Had the Veggie burger on the second visit and it was the best veggie burger I've ever had!!! These peeps are now my go-to burger joint in LV!

4BVufVJ50kRlolZVWJ16DQ.text: Love to eat here.  Friendly service and good food.  Veggie gyoza is very tasty! Of course the burgers are awesome!  Make it a destination when you want something different!

gfalx-CpBXG-JN5c---a2Q.text: I had the Oxtail Chili Cheese fries as featured on Diners, Drive-In's, and Dives. Awesome!  The burgers are super delicious as well and really great service.

0tSC1LInq4SHNS482Ot4-A.text: So, recently I got a message from someone that works at Bachi Burger, I don't know if it was the owner, but they agreed with me that the restaurant was indeed too stinky from the egg smell, and actually hired repairmen to fix the problem and encouraged me to come and try them out again.  After I told my husband to "suck it, I told you so," about the egg smell we decided to come and try Bachi Burger for dinner.  They were right, there was a huge improvement on the smell.  When it comes to eggs, my nose is like a shark.  I can smell eggs like they can smell blood from miles away.  While the smell wasn't 100% gone, it was at an acceptable level that didn't bowl me over as it did the first time here.  And overall the food and the service was really excellent.  I wanted to try some different things so I got the only salad on their menu, a mini chop salad, which was fresh and delicious.  My only complaint is that they don't have a huge variety of salads, but what they do have is delicious.  We also tasted the pork belly buns which were phenomenal, as was the lonely bird burger I had.  Normally I would try to stay on the beef path on a burger place, but seeing that Rick Moonen had enjoyed this sandwich, I wanted to give it a shot.  I am not a fan of chicken burgers but this was flavorful and great.  My advice, if you have complained about Bachi Burger in the past, and you happen to be somewhat near to the area, I would give them a second try.  They are definitely going to be on my regular rotation for restaurants.

u40nfZh1InI-ajjz_q5Q4Q.text: I have been in Vegas for a very long time and have never tried this place until today. Everyone tells me how amazing it is, so my boyfriend and I decided to go in and check it out. The menu was very different, but unique. We ordered the Miyagi-san's Grass Fed Wagyu burger and regular fries that came w/ pineapple ketchup. The ketchup was very good, we thought it tasted even better inside the burger. The burger was different yet unique like I said before, but it definitely was not worth what we had paid for. Our bill came out to be almost $40 with just the order of two burgers and fries & all we drank was water.. Probably won't ever go back to another Bachi Burger to spend that much on just two burgers.

fORa-ZHazLIqnVD6znvJNw.text: I love Bachi Burger. My wife and I have been there two or three times.  The Bachi pickles are awesome! It comes with approximately 8 different types of pickles (radishes, garlic, etc.), all of which are deliciously different.  The edamame with garlic, ginger and chili are positively addictive. This was the first place I'd ever had edamame stir-fried with seasonings. I thought it was a great idea and have been experimenting with different flavor combinations at home.  We've tried the garlic salt and pepper fries and the truffle Parmesan fries. Both were delish!  The Peking duck steamed buns are very good and have a nice, sweet sauce.  We've tried the Kiki's, Bahn-Mi, and Kalbi burgers. All were perfect fusion burgers. Very unique but made perfect sense when you ate them.  The only bad thing is Bachi Burger is on the other side of town from me. Love the place!

25Ba0-oGpMksdp6G6-KGYg.text: During my recent business trip to Vegas, Bachi Burger was BY FAR the best meal that I enjoyed!  Arriving during the prime dinner period, my friend and I immediately noticed the good amount of people waiting to be seated.  Note: they do not take reservations.  Our party of 2 put our name in and sat down, fully expecting to wait the 30 minutes that we were told by the hostess.  Shockingly, within 5 minutes we were called up and seated; sometimes being just a party of 2 helps a lot!  I ordered the Miyagi-san's Grass-Fed Wagyu Burger, which came topped with chili mayo, a fried egg, furikake,  caramelized bacon, and crispy onion rings, as well as their salt & pepper garlic French fries, with a side of pineapple ketchup.  From the first delectable bite to the last, this meal was fantastic.  The burger was prepared perfectly and every bite was FULL (FULL!) of flavor.  The fries were great and the pineapple ketchup was sublime.  I enjoyed three burgers during this recent Vegas trip (Bachi, Fukuburger, and BurGR) and this meal was by far the best!  The two locations are off of the Strip, but do yourself a favor and go!

x8d2ZsDs0KunA-BRxu-kmw.text: Food poisoning! Me and two of my coworkers are here and all got food poisoning. When I called to tell the restaurant the person I talked to didn't seem too concerned and then said the general manager would call me. It's been over a week and I haven't heard back.   It's now been 3 weeks and I still haven't heard back from management.

R_KXYCU6Ch7cyPyKfq7a_g.text: as seen on DDD.. (diners, drive-ins and dives)..came here wanting to come so bad..decided to place our orders to-go..took awhile because it was so damn packed..for such a small place..i ordered the bachi burger..it was good, but it wasnt GREAT. Somethings missing, but i cant complain. On to the oxtail chili cheese fries..i must say, it was delicious, but i only had like two pieces of oxtail meat..but then again i was on one.. french fries topped with chili, oxtail meat, cilantro, and a fried egg.

0RPh1RS9AguYCehxbhhbbw.text: I have never had a burger with Japanese flavours until this place and I was amazed. Prices are a little high but worth it and this location is by far better than any of the others because of the expanded menu you get from ramen ya that shares the space.

riYPUmPx6XoeBwNWKI11KA.text: It's not a burger joint...  So said a friend of mine.  Is she high?  Not always.  Is she insane?  Totally.  But she does have a point.    Where can you get a burger with kim chee or miso dressing on it?  Want a braised short rib sandwich in a bao bun?  Even Burger King won't make it this way!  I had the Kiki's burger.  I'm a bacon whore and this thing has caramelized bacon, so c'mon how could I even think about ordering something else?  I asked for it to be cooked med rare, which the waitress was more than happy to take note of.    When my bacon came out, it was delish!  It wasn't quite enough for my taste, but it was placed between (what looked at tasted like) sweet bread, some damn fine shrooms and  a thick, juicy patty.  Other than more bacon, I would have liked a more flavorful cheese (or maybe just a bit more) and for the meat to be cooked less.  It was more pink than red, but it was still tasty.  Aside from my bacon burger, we had sweet potato fries (awesomely crisp on the outside and tender throughout) and truffle fries (quite ordinary and plain, IMHO).  I also had an iced green tea, which was really dark and dense (the way I make it at home) compared to most other places I've had it.    Overall, the food was good.  Not mind blowing, but definitely a departure from your typical neighborhood burger joint.

TeBpCqsu27psCj-Ay6QIcQ.text: My older brother put me up on this spot. My girlfriend and I were looking forward to hitting up the slider truck but spent way too long talking with our good friends over at Fruition! We wanted a decent meal before our trip back home to SD; so off to Bachi we were.   It's a little off the strip but way worth the drive! We ordered the Ronin and the Kiki burger and just ONE order of the truffle fries. We both split our burgers so we could kind of have our own sampler plate. The Kiki was bomb, but the Ronin was better! Wanna know what was better than the Ronin? THEIR TRUFFLE FRIES! We had to order a second order they were so damn good! This is going to be a frequent stop for us on our many trips to Vegas!

o7qSWjimnC4ByVWgy7yX7Q.text: I tried it for the first time last week and the SPECIALTY BURGERS were great! I tried the KIKI BURGER and it had sauteed shitake, enoki and eryngi mushrooms, caramelized bacon, sweet onion marmalade, gruyere cheese and topped off with garlic chili aioli! The burger was fabulous! And as I looked around at my friends, they had the same "mmmmm" feeling.  Funny enough -- of the six people there, 4 had the KIKI burger, 1 had the Kalbi Burger (w/ Kim Chee), and another was adventurous and made her own burger with Wagyu Beef, fried egg and bacon!  Unless I am mistaken, most burgers are made with Angus beef or  Wagyu ... and there is a bit of sweet flavor to it!   Watch out Carl's Jr because if this is in your town, I will definitely pay up for Bachi's Specialty burgers at $8.50  than your Angus burger at $6!  If you're going to have a burger, you have to order fries with that, right? Right! So, add the sweet potato and/or truffle parmesean fries to your order!  So if you can find your way here, definitely go - hope you enjoy your meal as much as I did!

hmlLsIGv-JlRBcM496GU1g.text: Several of my friends come here often and always checked in on facebook so I decided to give it a try. Their burger was pretty good and we got this pickled combination dish, man, who would have though pickled garlic can be this good!? LOL.  But anyways, it's definitely a place where I will go back to :).

uMY6_qLn2pL_yfNKYhpXwg.text: I have been going here since the doors opened. Unfortunately the quality of food and service is going downhill. The last few times I have ordered burgers the buns have been stale and hard. The first time I overlooked it. Things happen. Tonight I ordered the Crusty Crab burgers to go. I waited for them to be prepared then took them home. I live less than five minutes away. Once again the buns were stale and hard. This time I called to complain. The manager on duty said the buns were fine. He offered to replace the buns.. Not remake the sandwiches. That was a horrible remedy for a bed situation. I will never go back again. What a shame!!

dQbXrEF5075DCfmKpvNCFg.text: This place is worth going back to, good food and nice atmostphere  the food: I had Lychee boba, crusty crab, and banh mi burger. lychee boba, wasnt all that special, kind of pricy for boba, but i mean it was a sit down restaurant, and i dont think i ever saw this before so it was worth trying, tasty, but pricy.  the crusty crab, first of all i remember the smell being super crabby. it was not the delicious kind of smell, but it was a good tasting burger. kind of like a huge crab cake on a burger bun. not too greasy, but the sauces on this thing was memorable.  the banh mi burger, yes this was some good stuff. this is something i always wanted, hamburger meat on a baguette with the fun little side pickled vegetables. delicious! this is a good place to experiment your eating  the restaurant: it was not too fancy, but very clean! i remember the place being in a weird kind of lot, with other random places, but this place is a nice place to eat at, with lots of random asian like decorations. its to look around when your waitng for your food. clean bathrooms and all.  the service: the service wasn't above and beyond but good, i remember the food coming out at different times, which doesnt sit well with me but it is a relatively small restaurant, so i guess they do their best. the people are very kind, and helpful when picking out random goodies on the menu.   all in all this is a very nice place to eat at.

B1kZjyS9ZXUaDdF92Go7TQ.text: LOVE Bachi Burger!  Best burgers we have had.  The Mr. Ho's on the taro bun is simply amazing.  The Black & Blue is another favorite of ours.  All of the fries are wonderful, but the sweet potato fries are my favorite.  IF you have room for dessert after the main course, try the Portuguese donuts.  You won't be disappointed.

jJL78sn2ZlsiAX-AqvRv2w.text: Amazing burgers !  I had the Kiki burger and it was the best tasting burger I've had in my whole life.  The service was excellent. I drove from Arizona, over 90 miles to eat at Bachi Burger and it was worth every mile !

C55wgmjLg9RgHShiK9FeHg.text: Just about perfect.  Nothing to improve on food quality.  The Kiki and Kalbi were delicious - my wife and I tasted each other's.  Asian fusion flavors sets these apart.  Great menu with lots of options - encourages return visits.  We're back again next week.

6IfYp8cfsblh3FeQikROGA.text: If you are looking for gourmet Asian influence burgers this is the place to go. I had the crusty crab burger as well as a regular burger and both were fantastic. The fries alone could bring me back. Just outside the strip 10-15 minute drive but well worth it. The only bad thing was that the service took a bit of time. Other than that the food was amazing.

NBxDTT2E-O7dCu7ysG5CJQ.text: This place is amazing.  I had a Bahn Mi Burger, which was an amazing combination of flavors.  It was maybe the best burger I've ever had.  Everything on the menu looked great...plus they had some more unusual beer selections (like Dogfish Head, which you rarely see out West).  Next time I'm in Vegas, I will go here.

LsEQzWEZ6Uf3zcCgfZ_0SA.text: One common thing about good restaurants is that they get better each time you go. That's how I feel about Bachi Burger. Personally, I'm the type of person that likes to sit down, take my time, and enjoy my meal, and this trip to Bachi Burger was even more enjoyable because of the music they play in the restaurant. There's just something so perfect about having a great meal with great company, and good music in the background. Their Burgers and Steamed Sandwiches are all great and you can't go wrong with Truffle Parmesan Fries.

8om6hyRNFG2lXeFCJIwgLw.text: Super dissapointed because I heard great things about this place. Waitress forgot our drink order for the group of six, then forgot mine two more times, then tells me they didn't have the drink I wanted in the first place. I order a different drink and by now we all have our appetizers. I have to ask for my drink two more times before I received it. Ashley didn't apologize once. The appetizers were wonderful! We ordered the pork dumplings, the chili fried chicken, the sausages, and their Parmesan fries. All were hot and lived up to the hype. We ordered the wagyu burger medium and received it overly well done. At this point we had a long day and were over the experience. Ashley didn't check back on the food till we all finished. Gave us our checks and didn't even thank us when she picked up our credit card receipts. One person at our table also had an over cooked burger but the one who had the pork belly steamed buns said his food was amazing. Left hungry and dissatisfied.  I was shocked of how terrible Ashley was. Spent $40+ a head for that? I think not again

_KRxDKNQDe8SqeHc6k9T4A.text: Went with two other friends tonight, everything we got was absolutely spot on.  The fries were fresh and crisp and well seasoned, the burgers were delicious, and we tried the homemade pickle appetizer, which was very good for the most part.  Prices were fair, service was prompt, and knowledgeable, and they had an interesting selection of beers as well.  I will be driving the 20 minutes to get a burger there sometime soon I get the feeling.

6G3ATX9ysC6i17VaD4f-oA.text: This place is so addictive!  I am constantly thinking about Bachi Burger and how I want more.  The sweet potato fries are delicious, the burgers are inventive (but not so much that they taste weird).  The service is friendly.  They are always happy to explain what a menu item is if you have questions!

LpHwnWfrZlSmtTRrL8lYSA.text: I so wanted to try the oxtail chili fries, but we had too much on order already.  I got the 8 oz grassfed burger, and it was delicious.

Ss82gdzz4YUC42x9RSEhOA.text: I LOVE, LOVE, LOVE Bachi Burger!  I had a problem recently with a take out order and the manager actually got my number off the order, and called to offer me a free lunch to make up for the problem.   Yummy food and customer service personnel who care about customer service, what a concept!

azpo9WTfCH6F2ojvRG3Qaw.text: 2 Words to describe - FAB ULOUS!!!!  Try the fish burger, the sweet potato fries, it's all simply delish!

q-bpGYZf3XHXExjnJH6PAw.text: YUMM! most amazing burger ever! I work late and they are open late. Amazing food and excellent prices. Staff has definitely improved in the past year so despite previous complaints regarding staff. Fret no more. try the Manga Burger! YUMMY! Don't ask what's on it. Chances are you can't pronounce it anyway. Just eat it and ENJOY!

dPgBSVwUXoDHe0_9dUcymA.text: I always enjoy a good sandwich, so my wife and I checked this place out for dinner. We ordered the fish sandwich, crusty crab and sweet potato fries. The presentation of the food was great and everything tasted really good too. Their whole thing is to serve gourmet burgers and sandwiches with a Asian twist. All and all, it worth a visit.

gUXA4Tc_ZGPimwr3f_utEA.text: First off, Taylor, our waiter was very kind and accommodating. The food was very savory, full of flavor and absolutely delicious. The food took a while to come (almost an hour). We ordered the oxtail chili cheese fries, tantanmen ramen, spicy miso ramen and spicy miso burger. There was a mix up in the ramen orders and the waitresses that brought them out were very rude about it. I'm all about service and I was pretty shocked to get an attitude from them, especially when the mistake was on their end. No apology or anything. The food was so delicious though that we just brushed it off. You must order the chili cheese fries. It was sweet and savory. I wish there was more oxtail on it though. I had the spicy miso ramen. The broth was very rich and flavorful. It can get quite pricey with the add ons. It comes with chasu pork. The meat literally melts in your mouth. I had my fair share of ramen around Orange County and their pork beats them all. The noodles were cooked to perfection. It had the right amount of chewiness. Overall the food was great. I would definitely come back the next time I am in town but I hope for better service.

NQH64_NVc7BeGLeTbsI5WQ.text: as a las vegas local, this is a must go to place when I have visitors in town.  pork belly steamed buns are soooo delicious!

8Iib3nBcGum5lOmpUpMv6Q.text: Bachi Burger is one of my favorite burger spots in Vegas due to the fact that it is completely different than most places. I have been here several times and I still haven't been disappointed.

B3kpvT4oLJdQmU9lPnxdKA.text: Food - great! Service - SLOOOOOOOOOWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWW Price - over!  Me and my hubby tried Bachi Burger for lunch today.  We got the water but no straws and the waiter was too busy to hear us ask for it.  We ordered Kalbi burger and Kiki burger along with side of Shrimp fries.   The Shrimp fries are basically veggie chips kinda thingy with shrimp flavors for $2.75 we got about 7 chips on the plate...really! That was pretty disappointing!  Our burgers took about 30 plus minutes to arrive...but the flavors were awesome!  Good place if you have too much time on hand and okay to spend little more than average burger place.

lwoIaqVilYO4KyWSoI5sMQ.text: We have made another fan of Bachi Burger. One bite and they are sold. Service has been really great. This place can't be missed.

YYoR9hG2GQIC00HcY-udXA.text: Was in town and was recommended to this place. I was with a party of 6 and the place was not very busy. We were never greeted or told how long the wait was for the next table. There was an abundance of seats so I wasn't concerned with the wait. We had prompted several servers numerous times with no acknowledgment. We then approached the server with the hope of getting seated. They seemed completely oblivious to our presence. I would have liked to have tried their burgers especially after reading all the great reviews. Unfortunately they failed miserably. I would like to have given them the benefit of the doubt but there was simply no excuse for the lack of service.

5cGjqNnp9wRQqZ-dkJJMdA.text: Man this is my favorite place to eat in town period. The best burgers in town on or off the strip. Its like a Japanese Hawaiin infused burger place with a fun menu that is just oozing with creative takes on burger restaurant staples. The service is amazing (thanks Lantz) as well. They are very attentive and know their menu inside and out. If you go make sure to try the Wagyu burger, get an extra patty, some bacon,  throw a fried egg on it and add some shishito peppers wash it down with Morimoto Soba ale then get the pop tart with plum ice cream for dessert. You will cry.

esP09TMSCv3RhrnV4HYqXA.text: Once again, the upwardly mobile citizens of Las Vegas who have moved out of their trailer parks and into tract homes have sold me down the river.  First of all, the music (like so many restaurants in this town) is so loud that you can't have a conversation with the company at your table.  Is this to cover up the Mexican families 5 little brats screaming or the weathered strippers puffed up boyfriend seated next to your table's homophobic rant about how 'he crushed that little f**'' ? Anyways the service is very poor from the tattooed waitress I had.  Certainly no training or even effort involved.  Bad attitude, although it did make me feel like I was back home in Portland.  She plopped down my undercooked $13 burger with no fries and left, never to be seen again until she plopped down my bill.  No thanks Bachi. I will never be back.

KrVAQolamFpkPOShQNyR5A.text: OMG..This place is awesome! ! Ordered a banh mi burger, green tea, pork belly bun, and oxtail chilli cheese fries with egg on top.  I will definitely come back for more when I'm in Vegas.  Service,  quality, and presentation is awesome..

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious! !

HGqid9fMNjWBRXufuFK4KA.text: Shared a Miyagi burger and oxtail chili fries with my hubby for lunch. Talk about flavor-packed!  We love this place!

k6ykkm5vvbLm8Y-uiteqsA.text: Good food...fast and friendly. We got all the appetizers and had a sample of them all was so delicious. Love the Ox Tail chili cheese fries!!

mhotXEZ1M8bZmEoqBUdcWw.text: Came here at recommendation of a friend from Bay area who claimed that he MUST eat at Bachi burger everytime he is in Vegas. Ordered the oxtail chili fries and the shogun burger. The fries are crispy and not oily but I can hardly taste the oxtail in it. To me it tasted more like a regular chili cheese fries with some shredded meat. The Shogun is good IF you can finish it. I can only handle 1/2 of it. I love the Asian pear in it, somehow it makes me feel the burger is not as heavy and fruits make it healthier. My husband is not a burger eater so he ordered the ramen which is just average.

5USXt8G_fdR_g0JmIkTkGw.text: food great once again... but...35 minutes for a burger. .too damn slow half therestaurant empty tables kitchen help should be replaced... i'm just sayin!###

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green waygu burger...excellent
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle fries

pu5w0QM_3jZMRVFcBnp3PA.text: This is definitely the best burger place i've tried anywhere. If you're more of a traditional person, this may not be for you. For everyone else, you'll probably find the best burger you've ever had.   I would list out my favorite things but everything I try is more delicious than the last. The things I've had and loved are the Bhan-mi burger (current fav), Miyagi-san, oxtail chili fries, pork belly buns (if you do nothing else before you die, eat these), and the chili fried chicken.

tGO3_lbV0Q94ntnntsgXfQ.text: In a town like Las Vegas where it's very difficult to sift through all of the countless restaurants it's refreshing to find one that has quality, and value. The Miyagison burger is a "bucket list" burger. The best in the world.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OPFtxfsOZUKuygMSTdKyUg.text: Bachi burger serves asian fusion burgers.   One word for this place: innovative.   That being because the different choices of burgers and sauces, etc all compliment eachother with all around goodness. No burger is the same. & they don't use the standard mustard and ketchup.   I always order the Ronin burger. Something about that combination of flavors keeps me comin back for more. Everytime I think of bachi, I think of that flavor! I've been conditioned to it! :)  The ronin burger contains Angus beef, caramelized onions, Japanese cole slaw, a fried egg, Katsu BBQ, miso goma dressing, and the yuzu citrus aioli. All in between two warm and soft hawaiian sweet roll buns. The beef was cooked to perfection - medium rare, just the way I like it.    The oxtail fries are a must try. They load up the plate with pulled oxtail meat with cheese, chili, and a fried egg. The fries were perfectly hot and crispy.   The Parmesan truffle fries are a great side as well! They too have that same crisp and hot (fresh from the fryer) texture and man oh man I love those esp with the side of sundried tomatoe aioli sauce. They also have ketchup on request AND pineapple ketchup if you want a kick!   I notice that they also have special seasonal items that are always changing and they are usually unique as well so keep your eyes peeled!!   Their beverage menu- again, unique and fun. They have different sake combinations as well as different types of beers. My bf really likes their Japanese white beer Hitachino Nest White Ale. I've tried and it and it makes a great pair with any of their burgers.

a1VkzjzhRwzXDxSgzT30qA.text: I don't even know if the owners read yelp but they should.  I used to love coming here and loved bragging about it. What happened slowest service ever, hostess with major attitude and doesn't smile.    Last night I wanted to introduce my friend to bachi because I talk so highly about this place, major fail !  The guy host was kool he put our name down and said it was about a 45 min wait.  There was no room to sit so we walked across the street And set a timer on our phone to come back in 30 mins just incase we get called sooner.  While waiting I just looked up yelp reviews out of boredom and I read a one star review from a guy below, how they told him an hour and he came back earlier and they skipped over him and the hostess was super rude to him so he didn't even get to try the amazing food.  I thought it was unfortunate. Then same shit happened to us but we made the mistake of staying.   We came back in 30 mins instead of 45 and there was a gal at the host stand this time, we gave our names and she stated,  " I called you guys and u weren't here so u have to be put on the end of the list, that's why I tell people to tell me you're leaving. Our cooks a falling behind today"  Wtf woman u didn't tell us shit because u weren't the ones to put our name down.  The guy then came back n told her we were up next. Nice save dude and thank u.   They appeared short staff, our server Ratha super sweeetheart she gets 5 stars.   Food slowwwww I feel bad for the cooks the hostess said you are slow, but I still love the food so yum.   What killed it was the host chick, whatever you're going through leave it at home.  You're the first face people see when they walk in.   Reading more about past employees it makes sense, having a bad boss is like a cancer.    The food is still great but I'm hesitant to bring my friends here from out of state because of the service.  And that sucks because they really want to try bachi.  Maybe I'll just make the drive to the other location.  I think I will take them to Holsteins to be safe.  I now owe my friend a better dinner, and I should have listened to yelp.   Dear cooks your food rocks! I will miss your food:(

Meg9UtqC7QmBZcp99Yec4A.text: Yummy!  Had the Banh Mi Burger.  it was a teriyaki burger with vietnamese dipping sauce (fish sauce) with turnip and carrot (vietnamese salad) on the side.   The Mr Ho burger was a hamburger made with lup cheong.  I think the banh mi was better.  The truffle fries were just ok.  I gave this place 4 stars was the wait help and hostess could have been friendlier.    When we visit Vegas again, we'll surely go back to try other dishes.

C0VsGKbGV8p9slFuzlpDlQ.text: Great place to go with friends and colleagues. Only drawback is when they are busy things can take quite a while. But amazing burgers and they do the egg spot on every time.

p0p5rcZYvj5NXHiSQxsMDA.text: Came in after searching Yelp for a burger place. And WOW! GLAD WE DID! We had the build your own and added an egg which was phenomenal!  From the patty to the bun everything was fresh and tasty! We also had the pork belly sliders and some truffle Parmesan fries which were also amazing. Then we had the Portuguese donuts which were.served with coffee ice cream!  Yummy little fried dough balls rolled in cinnamon sugar! Be heading back there in a couple days..it is that good!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The basic burger with a fried egg.

rxgyNZySmurJQc57VNvLkQ.text: Phenomenal!!  Incredible!!  Superb beyond any unit of measure!!  Can you tell I love this place?  Now, I only eat organic, grass fed beef so that does limit my burger eating but I still think this place wins hands down over other burger places!  My favorite burger is the Black & Green (with bacon on the side for my hubby).  The sweet potato fries are so good but get the sauce from the garlic fries!!  The garlic fries were not very garlicky which I was a bit sad about. The buns are amazing!! The adult milkshake is soo good but thick so best as a dessert!!  Service is fabulous!!  This is my new go-to burger place!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The black and green burger with grass fed beef, sautéed mushrooms, spinach, roasted garlic and blue cheese!!  YUM!!!

73OlN-arhl8njlDaM67Izg.text: I love Bachi Burger! I get the Spicy Miso Burger with a veggie patty (they can substitute a veggie patty into every burger on their menu which i love). The service and drinks are great too. Love it here!

U64VelpnPaoIpsZHuHEIRA.text: Just go here and try one of their burgers, you will not be disappointed!   We hit this on our way out of town based on my friend's recommendation and I am thankful we did. We shared a Kiki burger with an egg and truffle fries which were both bomb! Also ordered the pork belly slider which were damn good as well.   As Samuel Jackson said, "Mmmhmm this is a tasty burger"  Can't wait for them to open up in LA!

MIEFXWJB4lpoWRUKC_1Bzg.text: Food was pretty good, but service wasn't. The hostess looked like she hated her job. We were not greeted or even given a smile. She barely even made eye contact. As for the food:  - Kalbi Burger- 5 stars. I got it without the kimchi and it was amazing!! - Banh Mi Burger- 4 stars. It was pretty good, but the combination between hamburger and Banh Mi was a little too weird for me.  - Truffle Fries- 3 stars. Nothing special. - Duck in steamed bun (forgot what it was called) 1 star. Tasted like all of the nasty parts of the duck were used. I could barely bite a piece off. It was chewy and bland.  Back to the service, it was a really long wait for our food to come out. There were a bunch of empty tables, yet the the wait to be seated was about 30 minutes. It looked like there was only one waitress on our half of the restaurant. For a weekend, they should've been more prepared.

vT_HXCufsRjyhN8ouxQGew.text: YUMMY! After stalking Bachi Burger on Yelp for a few months we finally decide to head down and check this place out.....but it was closed!! :( SUPER SAD FACE! But not to be derailed by their holiday closing we returned the very next day 37 seconds before they opened. Yeah, cause thats how Tanya S rolls!  When you first enter you notice how clean everything looks. Nice tables, lighting ext. The ambiance was on! We were immediately greeted by the hostess who took excellent care of us as well.  We started of first with the pecking duck buns (~$12 for 3) and they were SO good. The pecking duck was toped with a slice of boiled egg and some greens.....it also came with a dipping sauce that was so tasty.  Next we had to share the Truffle and Parmesan fries (~$4). These were AWESOME! The tamatoey dipping sauce was perfect and the overall taste just won me over.  I had the Ronin Burger (~$9) and it was amazing! It was a teriyaki based burger with fried egg on it, Asian slaw, and caramalized onions. Every now and then I would take a bite and get a little too much ginger for my taste but the burger was amazing! The meat was cooked medium and the bun was so good.  We had planned to try desert but by this time we were stuffed! So on the menu next time we venture to BB: Ox Tail Soup and the mini doughnuts.   If I wasn't already taken I would marry Bachi Burger....just saying

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duck buns.....these were tasty
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Robin burger....sooooo good!
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kiki love....yummy

zfx6M9vXJLmd8cHPi4D29Q.text: The service was absolutely ridiculous, there was not enough workers. The food was extremely poor quality and tasted horrible. We walked in to a huge line, no host to even greet us and take our name. The host themselves couldn't read their own paper and didn't know the names to call when calling for tables. They claimed to have called our name, but it was never called and two parties ended up sitting before us. The food was poor quality and noodles weren't cooked, no egg came in the soup even though we were told it did. We ordered a beer and chili sauce that never came. We had to go track someone down for water and the bill. When asked if we could split the bill with cash and the rest on card they said no because the card had to be swiped first. We then told them to split the bill between two cards and the waitress came back and said that she only swiped one card, without even asking. I wouldn't recommend Bachi Burger. I've heard good things and the group that I was with, went in the past and said that the food and the service has done a complete 180.

rlbOMtL1sfGoHwCifzk8cw.text: Went here last year, everything was really yummy. My Toronto BBF recommended it and it was no mistake!  The truffle fries were sooo good. The drinks menu was extensive.  Excellent music!  What was interesting when looking at their menu and their decor, was that the owner is from Hawaii! Cool! Extra points for that! :)  Recommend!!

6fZ_pKukjhOd-ClRv3l5EQ.text: I'm writing this review as a long time customer who will never return.  I've been eating here a couple of times a month since they opened. At first I used to go in with my family and friends, but eventually the service sucked so bad I started taking my food to go.  No big deal, as I live two blocks away, and I still loved the food.   Recently they instituted a policy that you had to give a credit card number to place a to go order. That's right folks, you have to give your personal financial information to a nameless stranger over the phone for...a cheeseburger.  Ridiculous.
