vL_qwsSZwolSDUflAUePCw.text: I love Bachi Burger! The food is great quality and thankfully they are more than open to modification (in my case for allergies).

WnCtzzKJ1DQKozmvUQBjKw.text: I love all things oxtail,so I was excited to try their oxtail chilly fries. It was ok but the strong and salty flavor of the chilly overcome the delicate taste of the ox tail. That was a small let down for me. One order of the fries was enough to feed both us. We also got the Kiki burger which is excellent and banh mi burger which is ok. I eat tons of Vietnamese sandwiches everywhere. I will save my money and get a real banh mi else instead. I will come back and try more burgers and the truffle fries along with dessert since they look very good. Bottom line: good quality food and hip place.

Hn7MY2AjkOU0aiNj-EVgRw.text: Coerced two more coworkers into bachi burger lunch.   First, we tried the stir fried ginger chili edamame. Yum yum and yum. They are a total mess to eat but worth every spicy finger and lip licking moment.   I went out on a limb, after great debate, and tried the spicy miso burger. I was apprehensive about some of the toppings. I should have known NO bachi burger would lead me astray. It was excellent. The burger was way more than mouth sized and sandwiched between a pillowy eggy bun. Amaze!  We also shared the best sweet potato fries that exist! And, of course, I washed it down with my fave, apple lychee soda!!   Full on food coma ensued and I struggled through my remaining office hours.   Bachi burger = True lunchtime adventure and joy!

Hk3WYyH7jOfxIIpCqSNMBQ.text: I wanna say first I'm a burger and beer kinda guy. I've been here twice so far and each location I've been to has had fantastic service. I don't think you can go wrong with anything on the menu. Seriously!!! I've tried a lot of it Try the Cherry Yuzo soda it'll keep you coming back for more.  I truly love places like this. They've honestly put an amazing new twist on something so classic.

IJxb-bLl8h22gylYEbmH9g.text: Boba and burgers... what can be better than this!  It covers all the bases when it comes to Asian food. Finding a place like this in Vegas... money. The Wagyu Beef Burger (Miyagi) has a very nice, sweet crunchy crust on the patty. The Ronin burger on the other hand, has a softer, melt in your mouth angus patty. It also contrasts the sweetness of the sauce with something else (something i couldn't figure out because i ate it too quickly) sour.  It's not just about the burgers for me though, not like Umami burger in LA. It's about the entire experience. The fries... the fries. I believe it's the garlic fries, but it is tasty. It emanates a slight bit of heat from the peppers. The fries also seemed to be cooked with some fish oil, which makes for an interesting flavor combination with the sauce.  And finally, the boba. Chewy, and simple.  5 stars  Almost forgot... get the portuguese donuts.

25YbgXUd3pNH2bs7HRvZBw.text: This was my second visit to Bachi Burger on the way to the LV strip. Delicious, creative burgers.  I ordered the spicy miso and the parmesan truffle fries. The fries were honestly some of the best I've ever tasted.   The combination was great,  the food was well prepared and service was friendly. Will definitely go back in the future to try different burgers.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy miso burger.

Q061cAPKKGO291W6eQQsGQ.text: When you're middle aged and been married for double digits, you start to not care if a restaurant is hip or trendy.  You just want good food.  This place, located in a small, suburban, strip mall, is decorated with open ceiling painted black, colorful prints of Asian cities, fake bamboo mats, and cheap track lighting.  Just the sort of place for young Asians with Pink hair and dragon tattoos.  But with all this hipness, it also delivers some delicious food.  I don't give 5 stars readily, but for these flavors and reasonable prices, I couldn't give anything less.  So forget about the ambiance and go for the great food.  While billed as a burger joint and food shaped like one, this not just a hamburger but rather a fusion of western comfort food with Asian and Polynisian enhancements done with great success.  The meat is high quality and generous.  The flavors integrated and complex.  Don't ask me what the names of the ingredients are because I think they are in another language, but they are delicious none-the-less.  A few things we have tried:  Sweet Potatoe fries:  thinner cuts of sweet potatoe, fried, and lightly salted with sea salt.  Comes with a sauce that is slightly spicy.  Salt and Pepper Garlic Fries: slightly spicier than the sweet potatoe, but I like it better.  The sauce is also spicy.  Kiki's Burger:  This is lighter flavored burger, slightly sweet with mild cheese.  Really good for the sensitive palate.  Kalbi Burger:  The first time we visited, my wife was scared.  She couldn't recognize any of the ingredients. When I pointed out that this burger had Kim Chee, which she likes, she gave it a try.  This burger is loaded with flavor.  It has sweeter flavors from the teryaki offset with sharper flavors of onion and garlic.  The Kim Chee offers a nice crunch.  This is my wife's favorite burger.  Spicy Miso:  This burger is loaded with flavors.  The egg is a real addition to the spicyness and meld of teryaki and onion.  This is probably my favorite so far.  Bachi Fish:  If you want to go a little lighter, the fish sandwich is outstanding.  Again, lots for flavors that meld.  The fish says it is pan seared but looked like it was fried.  But not too greasy and not overcooked.  All sandwiches are between 9 and 14 dollars and are ala carte.  So with two burgers and an order of fries, enough for my wife and I, total will come to about $30 including tax and tip.  While it might sound like a bit much for a burger, the flavors make it a bargain.  On the drink menu is an impressive list of some of the best beers on the market.  Based on that, I imagine the Saki is good, too.  But I haven't tried either.  Either will add about $10 onto your bill.  I guess I'm a little too cheap to go the extra distance.  So ingore all the BMW and Lexus machines out front and enjoy the food.

c8LC2yJS8U9pdj_LOcCyjQ.text: Normally I hate the words "Asian Fusion" but the sample size of various Asian cuisines is large and authentic enough not to butcher various cultures. I'm a fan. Easily the best (flavor : price) burger place in Vegas.  Burgers: So far I've tried the Miyagi, Kalbi, and Bahn-Mi burgers. And for the most part, flavor profiles are retained throughout the various cuisines. The Kalbi burger evokes Korean BBQ and Kimchi, and the Bahn-Mi burger tastes like the sandwich. What makes the burger special, however, is the texture profile. Unlike Umami burger, there is a light crunch on the outside due to a combination of caramelization and maillard, the same found on top-end steaks. Doneness is perfect and the burger balances texture and moisture, rather than having the patty soak into the bun.  Fries: Salt & Pepper fries. Delicious. Reminds me of Filipino/Vietnamese flavors (ingredient hint there).

f3bvfXlnJQg7JM9kzHMkyg.text: Amazing burgers, that were both cooked and seasoned perfectly. The prices were a little bit on the expensive side for a burger, but it is not too much more than you would pay for a burger at any other sit down restaurant. The one area where they excel over other places is that they cook the burgers to your liking, but also have other foods that most sit down burger places wouldn't off. Additionally they have some incredible in house fruit flavored sodas.  The feel is not too bad, but it would be way better if it was located elsewhere, and not in a strip mall.

Pg4EYu99-k3Y763dYsg1TA.text: When you think Vegas strip you think good food. Now when you think of a Vegas Strip Mall you can think of Bachi Burger. Located in a strip mall off the beaten path this burger joint does something unique and special with the gourmet burger craze. The beef is Japanese as well as the interesting toppings. It's not cheap but it's also not going to leave you disappointed and still starving. The have different styles of flavored edamame that far exceed the typical steamed and salted you get everywhere else. They also have some great beers to accompany the amazing burgers and a few are from Hitachino Brewery, like the White Nest  Ale and Red Rice Ale. Check out the menu online and I bet, no Vegas pun intended, it will make you want to go.

XlZGPySWgeNvN4ofoK6itQ.text: I was just here and ordered an appetizer and waited on the food to come to the table. We literally sat there for 30 min waiting hungry. We finally get checked on and 15 after they come back to let us know that our food somehow got pushed back. They were kind enough to offer something free. I declined and asked to have our food packed so we could leave. Keep in mind the restaurant was getting busy and we were just sitting there, while others could be seated. I didn't realize how pushed back our order was after realizing about 5 other tables received their food. If one of our food orders was going to take longer to cook, it would have been nice to know and I wouldn't be annoyed about all this. Unfortunately this will be my last time coming to this place. I'd rate this with no star but they won't let me. PLEASE REVIEW AND RETRAIN YOUR EMPLOYEES!!!

iuW6dNRUsukSaCpDGdzvAw.text: Fabulous ! Loved the 2 burgers we ordered and split. Kimchi and the Kiki burgers were what we ordered along with garlic fries which also came seasoned with ginger and jalapenos. Cooked medium rare as we ordered, great flavor on a perfect bun. Service was also casual but attentive. A must stop when we are back in town again.

QNxUSNSfwdLKZPk2gjwi3g.text: Server told me I didn't order sweet potato fries but i did and then the fucker tried charging it to the bill and he was rude about it. shitty customer service oh fa sho  I ordered the lonely bird and it was truly disgusting they took forever to make it too and no other customers were there i'm disgusted this spot is all HYPE peace bitches  in&out gang por vida

UpVGq2TdeX7_1_216zFhFw.text: This is "Our Place" for casual dining. It's usually always packed 'cause its THAT GOOD, even on a Tuesday night. Everything about it is awesome; food, service and cleanliness.

KXSWiM3g-yPoBhmsxiX-Kw.text: If some people haven't noticed, I've been on something of a reviewing spree.  If you are indeed keeping track, this will be the final review for tonight.  The road to Bachi Burger was an interesting one, as we were heading to Monta Ramen, then to Carnegie Deli at the Mirage, and somehow Bachi came up and none of us in the car had ever eaten there before.  So it was decided, to Bachi we go.  We walk in, and are promptly seated.  the place was smaller than I had imagined, but on a Wednesday night, it wasn't busy, so there was plenty of space.  We sit down look at the menu, and are pretty much floored.  The three of us had no idea what to get.  The entire menu sounded amazing, from the Ronin burger to the Kalbi burger to their special of the night, the Spicy Miso burger.  After hearing the description of the special, we decided at least one of us has to order it.  And the other 2 ordered the other aforementioned burgers.  To round out the meal, we each ordered some sort of side.  We had the sweet potato fries, the garlic salt and pepper fries, and the parmesan truffle fries.  Thoroughly satisfied that we had ordered almost half the menu, we waited anxiously for our food.  The wait was a tad bit long, but the music there really helped the time go by.  They had played really nice throwback, old school music along with some hits from earlier this decade.  Lauren Hill, Ice Cube, John Mayer, Talib Kweli were some of the artists I remembered (It Was A Good Day was the song by Ice Cube, such a chill song, and a very fitting considering the meal we were about to just demolish.)  They also had ESPN on the 2 tv's in the restaurant, but it was just sportcenter at the time, so nothing too exciting.  Finally the food had arrived, and we were ready to pounce like tigers.  The burgers were without a doubt amazing, all of us taking a bite, then rotating the plates, so we could taste all the burgers and their deliciousness.  I had to give the burger of the night award to the Spicy Miso special.  The waitress highly recommended it, and she definitely wasn't lying to sell product.  The fries were amazing, with the parmesan truffle fries stealing the side order show.  They tempted us with dessert, and boy, did we fall for it.  They had hyped up their dessert special of the day, and they once again did not disappoint.  I dont remember what it was called, but it was only 5 bucks, and between 3 people, barely 2 bucks added per person.  Granted the serving was for more like 1 person, we were all so full, that it filled up all the left over spots we could have left.  After it was all said and done, we definitely agreed we have to come back.  I can't wait to see what special they'll have next.

ovtBBve_SFkLUMfTXDNZcQ.text: my favorite burger spot the miso burger was amazing the OX TAIL chile fries were bomb the wait was long but well worth it!!!

0ftVyppO7ZAwxIBbilmWVg.text: Ok so when I heard of this place from my buddy Jon D, i had to go at least check it out.  And I would agree with him 100%, perfectly 4 stars.  Not quite 5 stars, needs better desserts.  Our table of 11 people had tried all the desserts and I would say that the custom pop tarts were by far the best.  The Portuguese Doughnuts were quite overdone and very hard and worst yet oily/greasy.    But lets concentrate on the positive shall we?  Well the service once you get past the long wait.  And in our case our table of 11 people, we were told that it would 1:20 minutes wait.  Any by reckoning, they had drastically underestimated the time, since it was Black Friday and there were so many people there.  But we got very lucky and a party of 6 people had decided to just bail and take off, so were pleasantly surprised at the short wait time of only 1:10 minutes.   As for the food, it was as I like to say "pretty ok".  Nothing stuck out as awesome and nothing was completely a Fail either.  We had ordered most things on the menu.  Kalbi burger, Mr. Ho's, Peking duck bao, pork belly bao.  All in all a good list of choices available for you to eat.  Fries were pretty good.  Drinks were also good.   Now for the one sour point.  Well i have to take a star away, as the service here was a bit on the leisurely side.  It could take them about 20 minutes before they would come back to get you something that you asked for.  This happened several times, no napkins, and also quite some time to refill drinks.  Now I will say that perhaps it was more the short sighted manager on duty, who probably didn't expect that Black Friday would be so busy?  But I think they were understaffed this night.    Otherwise I can't wait for the LA branch to open up in a bit.  I was just in the Sawtelle area of LA over President's weekend, and saw the sign that they were coming soon.  It was rather bitter sweet, as they took over from a small Mom N Pop grocery store.  But alas progress marching on.

ef0e7QRuAzz0yuP7RK5t9w.text: First time here, my mind was blown at how interesting and delicious all the food was. That was a year and a half ago. When I came back to Vegas recently, I made sure to revisit this off-strip place...I had good memories about the momotaro drink, ox tail fries, and delicious burgers with taiwanese style buns and perfectly cooked meats. I think my expectations were a little too high for the place after dreaming about it for so long, but nonetheless, they were still met! We ordered 3 different burgers and cut them each in half so that we could all get some variety.

CG7_s7oJCvr1cdGpyOdIqg.text: Had the Banh Mi Burger and Truffle Oil fries. Everything was delicious.

aJNcMNBGu6gU0gTDyJ7N-Q.text: So this place I went to after reading the amazing reviews on it. I've always been a huge fan of gourmet burger places so this I had to try!  First of all, we were sat down by the server Anh, he was extremely helpful in not only deciding what to order, but made sure we were at a table where we could easily see the NCAA game playing.   For an app we had the chili fried chicken which was spectacular. Way better than I expected. Also, I decided to try this strawberry lemonade they had. Honestly one of the best tasting drinks I've had anywhere. This is a MUST. As for my burger, I had the Ronin burger which has caramelized onions, cole slaw, and a fried egg on it. I have to say, it was a pretty damn amazing. Now mind you, as far as gourmet burger places, I'm from LA so I'm used to Umami and Stout (the Shu burger at Stout being the best burger known to man) but for an Asian Fusion style burger it was fantastic.  The only reason I'm not giving this place 5 stars is merely because I still consider Stout in Hollywood the best gourmet burger place around. But as far as Vegas is concerned, I've yet to see a place that beats it.

6EDvh53zQwLFSt7zP9shsg.text: This place is located leaving vegas pass Mandalay and pass the north las vegas outlets on las vegas blvd. Then turn left on windmill and its about three blocks in.  We got here about 10pm on a friday and the wait was 5 minutes. The waitress was friendly and ask us where we were from and then ask what type of burgers we liked and then gave us suggestions which was really helpful.  We ordered the Miyagi burger, Bahn MI burger, and truffle fries it was all so yummy!!!!. The Miyagi burger is made with waygu beef which is the best beef. The char on it was perfect. The truffles fries were yummy but I would like more sauce on it but still yummy. I will definitely be coming back.

Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffles fries

7I4fRE_XEfBxlE19vnJuHQ.text: SO happy we stumbled upon this gem! The amazing infusion of excellently asian flavors into these exquisite burgers make this place our favorite burger place we have ever been to, and we travel A LOT! As you can see by my photos, they were incredibly appetizing, the sweetness of the brioche and other magnificent ingredients made the Blue & Green burger spectacular! The husband and I are both not fans of bleu cheese, so we subbed it out for the deliciously amazing gruyere cheese. The one bummer is the expensively lavish pricing when it does not even come with any fries or sides of any kind... They have a M-F happy hour from 3p-6p I believe, and it says they have milkshakes (& adult milkshakes too) on their, but it's listed as the exact same price as they are regularly on their menu.. odd.. He go the unlimited iced Matcha green tea, which was very diluted, and around $4, my pomegranate & Ginger soda was only 1 fill for about $4.5 & very strong and delish. I took.it in a to-go cup, added water & ice and finished it all the way thru Whole Foods after. As you can see in the pictures, we also ordered the Kale salad, which was about $9 for my meal I believe, and since these burgers do not come with any sides at all included (that price you see next to the burger is legit JUST the price of that individual burger), we ordered sweet potato fries on the side additionally, for around $4 or $5 for that small portion that you can see in the pictures I uploaded. It came with some sort of Wasabi aioli ( it tasted like Wasabi, but was not sure of exactly what it was), and when I asked for ketchup I was brought a little dish of very odd tasting ketchup, not sure what it was, but somewhere else on the menu I remember glancing over they are option for pineapple Ketchup, so it could have been that, but it's hard to put a finger on exactly what that funky taste was. There were some tasty looking items, and fun milkshake creations, including adult milkshakes, but we were so full that we will have to come back again and try that next time. Our bill for just those items was close to $60.. a bit pricier than we expected for that meal, despite it being very tasty. They had so many delicious options, we seriously cannot wait to go back for more... Maybe if we win some moola on the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet potato fries are extra, the burgers do not come with any sides... pricey
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kale salad
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Medium Rare Blue &amp; Green burger with gruyere cheese subbed for the Bleu Cheese that it comes with

obgFxFK3LTJeTyi69nOHOQ.text: A little over a year ago, I saw signs for Bachi Burger while I was in LV, and  wondered about it. This year I had the opportunity to research on yelp and make plans to go on my most recent trip there last month.  So, having done my research, we aimed for Bachi Burger on our first day in LV. At first when we arrived, we were a little discouraged because there was a group of 6 or so folks that looked like they were waiting in line outside the door. Luckily there was a super nice guy at the front of the line and he suggested I go inside and see how long the wait would be and get on the list. Good thing! The wait for larger groups was long, but they sat my party of 2 immediately. The wait for a table would have been 5 minutes, but we were more than happy to sit at the bar.  Our food choices (shared) were the Oxtail Chili Cheese Fries and Kiki's Burger. I just could not pass up the fries, based on everyone's reviews. Ohhhh, they were really good!! I found them to be more of a "fork & knife" kind of fries, rather than finger food, since there's so much going on in there--chili, cheese, fried egg, aioli....All of the flavors went so well together, and yet you could taste the individual components, too. Yummy! The Kiki's burger was also really good. If you're thinking "mushroom bacon cheeseburger" ok...but there's so much more! First of all, three different mushrooms (shitake, enoki and eryngyii) make the mushroom flavor profile so much more complex. The cheese (gruyere) was strong enough to keep up with the mushrooms, and the sweet onion marmalade added a counterpoint of sweetness that just well, sang.   I ordered a house made soda--the cherry yuzu--which was also good. I'm not usually a soda drinker, but I just couldn't pass up the yuzu. It was a little more cherry flavor than yuzu, but that's ok.  Service was very friendly, and yes, like others have said, it was kind of like being at home in Hawaii--so many local-looking faces both working and eating at Bachi Burger. Hm, now could we just convince them to come home and open up a place here?

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail chili cheese fries!
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kiki&#39;s Burger

LIeLQ1_30shvLw-o6NHO0w.text: What happened to this place? A few years ago the line was out the door, taxis dropping tourists off, 1hr wait to get on. We went yesterday 5pm and it was a ghost town. Literally empty (see pics). Waited 7 mins at host stand before being seated. Another 10 mins before waiter acknowledged us. Food took forever to come out. Service was sooooo slow. Anytime we needed waiter we had to hunt him down. Only one waiter and one host and they both gave off the vibe that they hated their jobs.  Appetizers were good but burgers were disgusting. Everyone in my party said they were nasty and we all got really upset stomachs from them.  Place is also grungy inside; seats and tables rather damaged up.  They opened an Asian restaurant next door and it too was completely empty.

8K80HXGWhGqEMREx5E_rUw.text: On the Bone Marrow appetizer, the pineapple added a complimenting sweetness to this dish and they worked very well together. But I will say the Ox Tail fries will forever be my favorite dish here!!

Nmb2yrE5LDRCZhpVnW7x1Q.text: My family and I went here on a trip to Vegas and based on some serious good reviews and recommendations had to try it out....hands down best burger I have ever had! We all got a little something different but I decided on the Ronin medium rare holy cow this was awesome! the wagyu literally melts in your mouth and the fresh veggies just are a nice added touch My wife got the ....then the absolute topper was the chili oxtail fries holy cow the best fries ever. I didnt tell the kids what they where eating at first and then they were a little weirded out, but still thought that these where the best chili fries they had ever had...  The day we where there it was packed but didn't set us back from getting in quickly for a party of 10 and fast service...waitress was so nice and on point. The dont have a ton of beers on tap, but decent enough amount to select from...but did have a great drink menu with some nice choices but not this time. I am not a huge fan of Vegas but next time I will be back to conquer another one of these burgers.

Rc7SfmPGkaZFD3ZnAzyRkQ.text: The Banh-Mi Burger was outstanding!  The Asian style seasoning may have spoiled me for life on burgers! The Truffle/Parmesan Fries were excellent as well!

WR1HE8BCQ-aZPivb65pnZQ.text: Hey there fella, you want a burger and some sides? Nah. We're out of half the items you ordered and are out of some others you didn't. But, you can rest assured the service will be sub par and ambivalent.  That's pretty much how I feel my experience went. It's a shame because there's potential here. When I asked about the large number of items that they were out of, I was told the owner just hasn't ordered stuff, and they're out of a lot of beers too and that it's because a lot of people are always coming in.  Eh, I'll probably help them out by not coming in, that way they won't run out so quick.

8Dg6mZIjs1Qb0qxUkY6MBQ.text: I must have been unsensibly hangry when I reviewed Bachi last time. Yes the service is hit or miss, but the burgers and fries.... amazing.   I've tried a few of the burgers, but I never stray too far from the Myagi-San. We have an off-and-on relationship, and we like it. The ox tail fries are delicious, but warning for those sensitive to spice -- ask for a few less jalapenos!   The wait can be anywhere from 5 minutes to 45 minutes, but the burgers are so juicy and delicious, I think it's worth it. Maybe just don't come with me when I'm hungry.

9K2Z8BNs5avjqJL9gwtwmw.text: So this place was highly recommended by coworker when visiting vegas. Arrived Tuesday evening around 8:30p and was told 30min wait so we agreed. Asked for menus while we waited and noticed the empty bar. Approached the host about sitting at bar and was told that they only had two servers and couldn't handle the capacity seating. Later we discovered there were actually more than two servers and empty tables in the very back. After ordering our drink menu the waiter forgot to bring our drinks and had to ask another waiter to please bring our drinks which they brought over within couple minutes after asking.   As for the food, we ordered the oxtail chili cheese fries, Miyagi burger with onion rings, tonkotsu ramen, and banh-mi burger.  First off the oxtail fries has chili beans cheese garlic aioli and sunnyside egg on top. The chili beans seemed to overpowering over the rest of ingredients and tasted more of a chili fries dish. My Miyagi burger was ordered with med done but was dry and not that much flavor when compared to the Banh-mi burgers so not consistent. I suggest medium rare for more juicer flavorful burger. Banh-Mi burger was basically a Vietnamese fresh roll burger which seemed off.  And the tonkotsu ramen was okay. Thought the noodles seemed over cooked. Overall the quality of food and poor service didn't justify the higher prices paid. Vegas being the mecca of food, I know there are much better burger joints for less money.

DuhiiU3Hs_KUY0QYg5VACQ.text: I thought this place was okay, it was a little over-rated.  We had the Miyagi burger and the oxtail fries.  the oxtail fries tasted like the chili came out of a can.  The burger was a little too big to eat nicely.  I appreciate all the fillings, but when you cannot eat it with one bite, it's almost not a burger.  Price was a little high, service was good, nice atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Mryg7gxKd2xbb5jxRMoMUw.text: I've only eaten here a few times. Each time service has been slow. I will never know why. It could be the kitchen got back up with orders, or maybe the waiters/waitresses put priority over other people for different reasons.   I try to come here when it's not "rush hour." Judging from people reviews they are slammed during rush hour which makes me believe the owners don't hire enough people.   The food is good. I will comment the food is very good but to be honest it's easily strip prices for very simple food. I didn't know this restaurant was on diners drive ins and dives. I came here to try it because I live pretty close. Which in my opinion is overrated.  While the menu is different (Kalbi burger, truffle fries, wagyu burger, etc) I feel you can pay similar prices by actually going to an Asian restaurant and eat the actual food the burger is inspired by.   This isn't a place I would go for burgers unless you want some fusion burgers.

OgoxTbGA5Fa0tWhlhnrtWg.text: There's a reason there tends to be a wait at Bachi Burger. I love the fusion of flavors, and these burgers are too good to pass up! My go to is the Spicy Miso Burger, and I love Salt & Pepper Garlic Fries to go with it!

_o10RZa8eqi1x2Seui9-tA.text: Came back to Bachi Burger after dining here 3 years ago. The food is still very delicious and great quality, however the service was below average. The restaurant was empty, only about 3 tables with customers. The food took a very long to time to come out, the cooks were getting into arguments in front of the customers, which was embarrassing and took away from our dining experience. Hopefully the customer service improves.

AOt0vAJPVL0_iP3iHC4o2g.text: My favorite is red velvet milkshake. I hope Bachi burger sees my review and bring it back. My favorite burger...All of them, except for lamb (it was o.k.) Now they serve ramen.

-fF-5r4evY1pxIN4wsiw9Q.text: I've heard great things, maybe it's just the burgers that are great.....the fried rice is so greasy!  we felt it was inedible. The Spicy Miso looked promising but looks are deceiving. The broth appeared full of color which I expected a world of flavor it was bland boo! Then the wait was so long, we got our appetizer after our meal came. The staff seemed distracted. I won't return I can get a great burger lots of places this experience didn't really make me want to go back. Overrated in my opinion.

AptDxrGfZyWWSGOeKQos8g.text: Well this is probably the last time I will come here.  We arrived with a party of 6 @ around 7:40pm, on 7/26. Was greeted by an asian female, that stated she was having someone training tonight, a male with short hair, (from Hawaii, because he mentioned he was from there)  Anywho the female trainer stated they could only split checks 2 ways. The girl stated she was going to split the check into 2 ways. Not really what we wanted since there 3 couples.   We ordered our burgers and it took approximately 20-30 mins to receive it. It would've nice to get an update instead of just silence.  After we were done, it took them about another 20 mins to realize we wanted the check. Then the entire bill was on 1 check, we asked Hawaiian dude to split it and he comes with 3 checks! HOLY CRAP, looks like you can split it 3 ways! Either A, trainer girl didn't wanna do the extra work or B, she herself didn't know how to do it.   It took a ridiculous 30 mins for them to run the cards for each check. Again no updates on why they were taking so damn long. The girl then explained afterwards on why they took so long, complications with using cash and card, different POS, blah-blah-blah. Next time don't let a customer wait for an entire tv episode. Be attentive!  We saw you guys avoiding eye contact!  So we spent an unnecessary 2 hrs at a fast casual burger place. Bachi Booty.

EXXmgwjK3rpN8TqazZNizQ.text: Monday night we went to Bachi Burger. We were so excited because the menu looked so fun, but our visit was so disappointing. We had seven people with us and spent roughly $130 and every order was messed up.   Our order wasn't super complicated, 4 people ordered the bison burgers with different levels of done-ness. My brother wanted his rare and with lettuce instead of bacon. 2 of us the KiKi burger, both well done and my daughter had ordered a well done cheese burger.   When the food came no one got their burgers cooked the way they wanted. My brothers burger had bacon, no lettuce and was very well done. My mom had to ask twice for them to bring him lettuce. Once after the waiter started tending to another table and he rolled his eyes when asked. Only one person got refills on their drink and it was once. The burgers had such potential but wasn't as flavorful as we were expecting. The bison burger has Brie cheese on it, but it was literally the size of a 50 cent piece in the middle so you only got a bite or two with it.   The women's restroom was disgusting. Pee every where. Literally.   Honestly we won't be going to Bachi Burgers ever again. I wish we had gone with our second choice.

gqb2WJwnf_qpEMfkYH0XLQ.text: I haven't reviewed this place yet, but I think it's high time I stop procrastinating on it.  This place is just amazing. Great burgers, great ramen, great dessert. On my first try I had the spicy miso burger and it was wonderful. I've been going through and trying a bit of everything since. I wish I could eat here every day it's so good.  The atmosphere is very modern and dark with tons of tables close together. It can get pretty loud and crowded but it's worth it. The desserts are sinfully good and bad. Get the donuts on a cheat day! Those are ridiculously good!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The sinfully good donuts... get them on a cheat day!!!
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The unbelievably good oxtail fries, they were also tasty the next day.
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I think this was the spicy miso burger. Super amazing!!!

IjgCY5rZcruVl1b6W9B7_g.text: I'm not a frequenter to this place, as this is my second time eating Bachi. My first was several years ago at the Sahara location. This joint has scrumptious burgers. This time, I got the Kalbi burger. If you're a fan of spiciness and kimchi, it'll probably be your favorite! The ambience is casual with upbeat music shadowing in the background. I tried some of the tonkotsu shio out of my girlfriend's bowl which was good, but nothing too special. The service was good; neither overwhelming nor did I have to deal with a server abandoning me until check time. Lol  3.5 for the ramen 4.5 for the burger 4 for the service

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalbi Burger!

kwqNi1jd4Fm5uAzVS4O7oA.text: Went with a couple of friends on a Sunday afternoon. Our wait was maybe 20 minutes, impressive with the amount of people that were in the restaurant.   Wait staff was efficient, drinks were filled promptly, and the food was incredible.   I'm not a burger fan, so I opted for the ox tail fries. By the look on my server's face I knew I made a good decision.   The fries were crisp, the toppings were just perfect, and the meat was nice and tender. It was a great flavor combination.   Not being a burger fan I probably won't be coming back here often, but would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a tasty, filling meal.

5mLc_L-5vsXDDJwLrsvodQ.text: This place offers unique burgers and ramen. There was no wait - we also went around 4pm. There is usually a long wait here,  around 30 to 45 minutes. The service was very fast and staff was friendly. I ordered the white and red sangria and they were both equally delicious! We also had the truffle fries, which are always fantastic and come with a tomato type sauce to dip in. I ordered the Myagi-san burger and it was amazing,  although the egg was a little overcooked for my taste. My husband ordered the shoyu ramen and it wasn't as good as usual. There was an strong flavor of tap water in the broth. This place is amazing 9 times out of 10. I would highly recommend to anyone who likes ramen or unique Asia inspired burgers.

HpQb4Y4rEVtQIqOzc-VkOw.text: I recently visited Bachi Burger. I had the Oxtail Chili Fries for the first time, OMFG! I swear I heard Madonna's, Like A Virgin start playing in my head. I told my little boy,"Back off...this is grow people food" I finished the entire plate alone.  I was glad I took pictures of this beast before I punished it. I still find myself staring at it from time to time...just reflecting on my Oxtail Chili Fries experience.  Who ever created this dish, you made one fat girl happy.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Perfection! I want you in my belly.

KN4Yn1kgWn5tz-_azjNk2w.text: Unique.  It is definitely worth a try.  Started with the Truffle Parmesan Fries.  Can you say yummy? Next we tried the Bachi Pickles.  These pickled, mostly Asian vegetables, were great.  For the main course I had the Black & Green Burger (American Wagyu Grass Fed Beef, Sauteed Mushrooms, Spinach, Bacon,Point Reyes Blue Cheese, Roasted Garlic) with avocado.  The burger melted in mouth.  We, also, ordered the bacon fried rice from Shoku Ramen menu.  It was just ok, but glad I tried it.  Shoku Ramen is the sister restaurant of Bachi.  You can order from either menu.

0doGYaChACjCIss86ZT8RA.text: So, this place is purely awesome and a must stop for me every time I'm in LV. The oxtail fries will blow your mind, the pork belly buns are revolutionary and the burgers are quite possibly the best I've had in town.

KLiauq5Uo6tRJHm_pCDEqg.text: Oh Bachi, if this were 6 months ago you would've been a 5. But you've kind of let yourself go a little... maybe you're getting too comfortable?   Anyway Bachi Burger is one of those foodie locations that all my friends seem to want to try when they visit Vegas and I usually do highly recommend it to visitors. The restaurant is on the small side, very casual, and filled with tons of modern angry panda art. Their menu covers a huge variety of Asian cultures and flavors in a fusion format combined with classic American burger options such as bacon and fried onions. Generally sweeter than salty. If you really want to get fancy feel free to slap on a side of foie gras though. They have a nice selection of beverages and craft beer as well.   Things I like: Spicy Miso burger, KiKi's burger (underrated but I love the mushrooms and bacon and gruyere), oxtail fries, sweet potato fries, Hitachino Nest white ale. I haven't met a burger I didn't like!   Things I dislike: My waiter - he was awkward and cracked a "Ho" joke, regarding "Mr.Ho's Burger", to a party of Chinese people one of which actually had the last name Ho. It was way more weird than offensive. My burger has been undercooked the last two times so I started ordering it more well done yet it still comes out equally undercooked. I hate asking people to take things back but when they do take your burger they return it to you with the same bun and patty but new toppings. I've never been to a restaurant where they've done that and it seems strange. Parmesan fries are slightly off too lol.  Overall yeah I'd still come back and hope I didn't get the same waiter and that my burger is cooked to a nice correct medium rare. When they do get it right THAT IS A TASTY BURGER doe.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cim2db3WikJMsDbFXXqXJA.text: Can you say over rated. I have noticed any place that's featured on a tv show like diners  dives and drive ins is avoid. The restaurant was busy and waited about 20 min during lunch rush. I didn't like the place as soon as I walked in. It felt like a night club with the music blaring. I don't mind some mood music but when I have to shout to have a conversation then there's a problem.   Let's get to the food, ordered the oxtail chili with very little meat for $15 it was decent but not $15 good for some fries and chilli.  There was three of us and we all ordered different burgers. The problem with the fish burger was that the fish fell apart as you ate the burger so the fish was basically falling off the buns. The mr ho burger had way too much sauce on it and my grandma couldn't eat it. The problem with these burgers were that they were way to busy, multiple sauces that conflict with the burger itself.  I felt for the price the burger could have been bigger. Lunch for three over $60. I also thought their non alcohol specialty drinks were way over priced.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mr ho too much sauce

cYOnydmOyiD7j33sSxgOgA.text: Stopped by before hitting the strip to try what a friend called "the best fish burger". The atmosphere is casual and nicely air conditioned protecting the guests from the crazy heat. The service is friendly and attentive. Took off a star because of how long it took for our entrees to come out but the server apologized many times for the long wait. The bachi burger was delicious! I recommend it to any fish lover. With an Asian twist, the burger is plentiful and savory. It had some sort of teriyaki soy honey glaze and it was amazing. In addition to the burger I tried the truffle fries and salt fries both were delicious. The salt fries had jalapenos in it which gave it a delicious kick! We talked about the burger the entire drive to our hotel. Will return and will reccomend this place to friends!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bachi fish burger!! So good!

M2MYMBOAg3FDQl7tcBIpOg.text: So after so long I finally got to see what all the hype about was about, about Bachi Burger.  Burgers with Asian fusion, genius! Who doesn't love asian food?  Pork belly buns for appetizer = Yum! The bun finishes the taste to where it isn't too sweet, it's perfect.  My husband ordered the Miyagi burger, he said it was "the best way to wrap up out date night".  I had the Kiki burger which was delish. I wanted something simple but fixed to how I like it, medium well, mushrooms and Swiss, the patty still had an Asian flavor to it. As much as I wanted to put all of it in my belly, I couldn't finish it all, we will be going back to enjoy our burgers with beer next time, after my pregnancy. ;-)

pdbn9ifVOo7Q9oTw-Aljgw.text: Some the most creative burgers I've ever seen. Probably the best burger I've ever had.   They also had great deserts and attentive servers.

SB3P9NTIiMfSovkDNIgTQA.text: I've ate here several times and it's perfect for when you want something beyond just your typical burger with a nicer atmosphere then the usual burger joint. The food is so good!

Vf8ukg_A9X-33z2Rl-PwXw.text: This place is so good. I highly recommend.  Love the fries and the dips they use mmm Place is has a nice ambience to it and service is great.

JULNF8NgHOXjaGnrBEkoRw.text: This is one the most ethnic and unique burger places I've ever eaten in Las Vegas. It's american burgers with blast of Asian flare.   My favorite burger is the Ronin Burger it was deliciously mouth-watering , savory and sweet.  (Angus Beef, Caramelized Onions, Japanese Cole Slaw,  Miso Goma Dressing, Fried Egg, Katsu BBQ and Yuzu Citrus Aioli). with the Truffle Parmesan fries as a side was spectacular too.   This joint can get super crowded and you may have to wait for a table. I suggest going around off peak hours. The staff here is really nice and they provide great service.  Highly recommend.

dTSgzJ6HLVbXY-DJwAri8A.text: Good is great, DELICIOUS IN FACT I highly recommend oxtail fries, and the Miso burger. Both are delicious. However, service really wasn't so great. They're slow - brought the wrong beer ( luckily I know the difference in taste ) also, only one waitress was able to bring me the sauce that I wanted, the others mistook it for something else and brought that.

pOPUZwMc04UzDrjrXE0Kkw.text: Really AWSOME burger. I highly recommend this little jewel. The staff is very friendly and they have some pretty good beer too.

xLBRJKofM2S6ebKjLAG2Pg.text: Just today a friend swore by I'd and said it's the best burger she ever had. That turned into a challenge so I drove all the way there (15 minutes from the strip). When I got here the place was packed with a long wait line, but that made me more determined to find out if it's just a hipe or is it really that good.  Had the regular burger with garlic fries and oh boy was it good! The presentation is beautiful and the flavor is like a royalty chef cooked a burger. With my high expectations I wasn't let down at all. It's made the "best burger ever" list.  It's no fast food menu though. Burgers start at $11 and fries start at $4. But you can taste the high end ingredients.  Wish there was a Bachi Burger closer to where I live.  Highly recommended.

jpcGYSo7btY6hNzip7trGg.text: I have been here many times over the last few years....I love the food, its very good...that said- the staff seems clueless each time I go....once a ton of ice was spilled by a server -five minutes went by- yes it was five minutes and nothing was done- finally I saw customers get on their hands and knees cleaning it up....HUH...I have seen similar stuff happen almost every time-this clearly comes from management- which is a family of brothers- one of the brothers has an interesting story involving his interactions with the us military but no need to discuss here...just yesterday I invited two close friends to go there as they live two minutes away...their answer- NO- then mentioned something about entomology and stuff (all of gods creatures have to eat-right)...if clueless service is not a deal breaker you will enjoy the adventure here...(this review has nothing to do with the BB server who once called me by a different name FIVE times during service...I corrected him once....DUDE...)

CPc63PVwGCtC-RBXGRfm_A.text: I loved the food but the wait was too long and when we ordered a takeout we were not allowed to eat there which was a little disappointing in spite of the bar space (which I believe is one) being open. I ordered the lonely bird and my husband ordered the miyagi san's grass feb burger and they both tasted awesome! Only downside was I asked my burger without the tomatoes and they gave me one with tomatoes in it.

cASZUnAsdszvB4x7_FnheA.text: I just had lunch here and let me tell you that was one mean burger. I got the Black and Green Burger, and let me tell you that was amazing. The beef was really fresh, and I loved the bun/bread that was used. The creativity and diversity of burgers here was definitely interesting. However, the fries were a bit on the bland side. I still enjoyed the freshness of the potato. On the other hand, I was disappointed with the milk tea. There was way more ice than drink, and so I'm feeling quite ripped off. I could buy a bigger milk tea for just as cheap elsewhere. Overall, I will come back for their burgers, but definitely not going to order their boba or milk tea again. A littler bit pricy for a burger, but it was definitely high quality.

bJDB3oWkHc6alNOew9PAaw.text: Great burgers. Also had the sausage as an appetizer.  Saw it on Triple D with Guy Ferrari  (sp). Would have gave 5 stars but the service was a bit slow, I think that was due to a shift change however. Would recommend for anyone looking for a different burger experience.

BLSj3Azn5rivnKKHqL_HPA.text: Not what it cracked up to be.    Our orders (2 adults & 2 kids sharing):  Oxtail  Chili  Cheese  Fries:  Overrated.  Not that flavorful.  Kalbi Burger:  Saltiest thing I have ever eaten.  Only managed to eat less than half of the burger and needed a full glass of water to wash them down.  Miyagi san's  Grass  Fed  Wagyu  Burger:  It's pretty good, just not $13 good for a burger.  Pork belly steamed bun:  The best dish we had out of the whole order.

86-cJoe6yb4r7IoZJsW8Rg.text: This restaurant was a mixed review from me for a few reasons.  1) The menu does not indicate that shrimp is added to marinade sauces, kimchi, ground into patties, etc. LET THEM KNOW IF YOU HAVE A SHRIMP ALLERGY. I didn't know when I ordered the Kalbi burger so I am thankful that 2) happened.  2) I got a wrong burger (it happens everywhere, so I'm chill with it)! I felt bad for whoever's burger I got, because it looked delicious but I cut it in half and instead of the Kalbi burger with kimchi I found... bacon? The waiter was very quick to take it away to replace it, but when I mentioned my shrimp allergy he told me that shrimp was in almost everything! Did I not read the menu very well? I couldn't find a warning anywhere when I went online and skimmed it.  3) The replacement burger they gave me just had lettuce and the spicy mayonnaise on it. Turns out, the kimchi also had shrimp (a lot of kimchi doesn't have shrimp, so I didn't think to ask if it wouldn't have any shrimp) so instead of being given the option to change my burger, they just gave me a very plain burger.  4) The plain burger was decently moist, the bun had the right amount of crispiness. The spicy mayo was delicious!  5) Service was quick and good.  So for all that the burger was good and the fries decent (parmesan, truffle oil, something fries), the lack of clarity on their menu for shrimp related items left me very disappointed and almost sick. Decent and quick service but it left something to be desired when I got the wrong burger and then a slightly plain burger to finish off the night without any choice for a change.  *Update: Boyfriend suggested it after seeing it on the Food Network.

xrnX5YqXjXIOCisnicKZBA.text: I'm drooling as I am writing this review....  I went here last weekend and I must say, probably the best burger I've tried:  The following items I tried:  Oxtail Chili Cheese Fries:  Warning, this item requires more than 2 people to finish if you are also eating a burger. Me and my buddy made a mistake in chowing this down first. A few points, its absolutely delicious, the chili tasted great, theres a friend egg on top and some cilantro, and some sort of mayonaisse based sauce. The fries were crispy, just wonderful, but yeah just make sure there's 3-4 of you to share, or you'll fall asleep after eating this.   Pork Belly Buns: These bun taco type psuedo-sandwiches are popular nowadays. (I've tried the one at momofuku in NYC, so that was the benchmark). Tasted very good, not at the momofuku level, but very well prepared. The pork belly was well flavored, tender and the dryness of the sliced egg really balanced the sweetness and fat of the pork belly.  The portion is a little small but these really should be appetizers.  Ronin Burger  Probably the best burger you will try, the meat can be either angus or wagyu (similar to Kobe Beef) if you have the wallet. Honestly you can't go wrong either way because the meat quality is excellent. I asked for Medium Rare and it came back closer to the rare end, which is perfect. It is literally steak tartarte in the center. Well flavored, can't say enough great things. The bun was like Hawaiian sweet rolls (Taiwanese bread).  Only downside is, with all the money they are making they should invest in a better ventilation system, cause all the smoke from the kitchen made it difficult to see the other end of the restaurant, but all in all a must visit. I'm coming back next time im in Vegas.

13tYVAmX4eueEPzrjWwotA.text: Just ate there. Wow!! The food was absolutely amazing. Glad we were able to choose between ramen or burgers. I had ramen and the husband had a burger. We also tried the oxtail chili cheese fries. It was delicious. We also had the bacon fried  rice which was soooo good! I loved everything we had here. The service was great!!!

NcjJ48mr9K24xs3KzLGL4w.text: Burgers are good, fries are amazing....but service is always slow! Wait time for food is always more than 30mins and the waiters/waitresses hardly ever come back to your table unless you flag them down!

QZrjklHzO8KNLkoKENJ-rA.text: Latest visit made me think Yelp!  outside the front door smelled like manure.  when the front door was held open the smell filled the entire dining area.  not sure if it's a one off fertilizing thing by the neighbor or what.  the burgers are a great value and taste amazing.  the sweet potato truffle fries even better.  had a moment with the thai iced tea though... girlfriend and i both ordered thai iced tea.  they came in a glass about the size of a coke can.  after about 5 sips the glass is empty of tea but about 75 percent filled with cubes of ice.  girlfriend is not normally fussy but comments it would be nice to have a bit more tea and less ice for 4 dollars each.  i suggest we split the difference, order two more without ice and pour the new ones into our original glasses with ice.  i felt so smart until the waitress returns with two more thai iced teas hold the ice... i pour the tea into the old glass and am surprised that all the tea fits.  then i notice that the second round of teas came out in different glasses that were about 25 percent smaller.  that's the sort of thing people truly notice and wlll make someone decide not to return.  i feel like my 16 bucks for four teas was pretty poor value.  was going to order dessert but decided against it and now probably won't go back.

8T5QO0UrJL0OCRnjbDaODw.text: Yummy , prettytasty and have there own unique flavor. Wish the place was a little bigger because this place is very pack at night wait for 30min. Services was alright

Xr4niiAPkfjZEq0e728w3g.text: Good as usual. Small, kind of loud but a great burger and fries. Real good flavoring and a decent beer list.

sI0VMjksHwIFzidQeWaLYg.text: MY FAVORITE BURGER PLACE EVER. It is far from the strip, but worth the drive.  Way bigger portions than Umami, about the same price. Loved the Miyagi burger- it has an egg and lots of great Asian-fusiony flavors. The ox-tail fries and the garlic fries are also amazing. They also have good drinks (like boba) and ramen (but get a burger). Can't wait for the one in LA to open up! Only con is that its usually busy and takes a while to get seated. Totally worth the wait though! (:

J1SkusMg7bjEGMo_OPhkLA.text: Been here twice and liked the burgers both times. There is a teriyaki-like flavor in the meat but it doesn't overwhelmed the toppings and sauces that comes with it.   The only drawback is the speed of the food. The servers were generally prompt in taking the order, but it took the food a while to come out. One time the restaurant was busy and second time not.   I would come back but I would need to plan for more time to eat and not come starving so I don't get irritated by the wait.

PZUPUgx5Qy-IhKLpdwHzyw.text: *I don't usually write reviews.  But for this place I had to.  **Good (albeit extremely over-priced) food vastly offset by TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE that runs on Filipino time.  First thing I did when I moved to Vegas was check out all the burger reviews/joints/best-of-lists.  You'll see In N' Out, Burger Brassiere, LBS, Burger Bar...  and Bachi Burger.  So I had to check it out.  When I arrived there, there was a wait and I was hungry so I figured I'd just order To-Go.  I ordered two burgers (Kiki Burger & their Special at the time w/ blue cheese) and two fries (sweet potato & parmesan truffle).  Simple order?  I thought so.  Like the reasonable prudent person, I asked how long it would take.  Melissa let me know that it would be 15 minutes.  15 minutes sounds reasonable, right?  That is if it were really 15 minutes.  So after waiting for more than 30 minutes (I timed it) and giving a dozen different looks into the kitchen/Melissa, I asked politely how much longer would I have to stay hungry.  "Three minutes", she replied.  "What a completely arbitrary number?" I thought.  But I'll trust her.    So 10 minutes later, wondering if I was high because it didn't feel like three minutes, I asked again how long it would take.  I think she finally started to feel guilty, so she said it was coming right up.  I'm so gullible.  So five minutes later, magically as I approached they started bagging my food.  It took another five minutes to finish bagging me up (they forgot my sauce) and ring me up.    Because I was far beyond annoyed after waiting for so long when I was told 15 minutes, I asked if I could express my unpleasant experience and offer constructive  criticism to the owner/manager/person-in-charge.  Melissa told me he's not there and she's in charge.  Great.  She told me to just call later and the owner would talk to me.  So I called later...  In fact, I called later multiple times and on multiple days.  I left messages.  Nothing.  He never talked to me.   Don't get me wrong, food was good.  But spending $32.43 and waiting more than 50 minutes for 2 burgers & 2 fries is not justifiable in any sense unless I was told from the get-go what to expect.  Instead I was lied to repeatedly, never apologized to or compensated, and was not even able to express my displeasure to those who count.  Arrghh... Just thinking about it makes me so angry.  Like a big emo tornado of emotion.  Thank God for In N' Out.   Peace Bachi Burger.

3W4QGGnV4BfdDLNrz45G8w.text: Creative Asian twist on the burger.  Amazing flavors.  I've been here several times as I live close to the location on Windmill Ave.  Warning: this place is always packed full of people.  I suggest going right when it opens or at 3pm on a weekday.

dJIH9hGo_UoRctcX6AYS0w.text: I've heard great things about this restaurant, but I never decided to try it until my dad went and raved about it. When I arrived, I was surprised that it was a sit-down restaurant because I associated burgers with fast and casual dining. Nevertheless, the service was fantastic, and the atmosphere was lovely. The only critique I have to give is that I ordered a bison burger, but they were out of bison. Instead they gave me a wagyu burger without charging me extra for it. I must say, I was extremely disappointed that they didn't have the bison. However, the burger that I did get was fantastic! The beef was juicy, the cheese was perfectly melted, and the fig chutney gave a hint of sweetness. It also included grilled onions, which I loved; and this is coming from someone who normally despises onions. Love the food, love the place. I would definitely recommend to anyone who enjoys upscale burgers.

iaYQn17haW7hq5H6lKN--Q.text: Great food. Happening environment. I love their burgers. Very juicy and tasty. This place is portion control though. Definitely will be back. I also like their Summerlin location too.

xHE7DbaOB4rP4c-FP9VaWw.text: Great Burger place for foodies!!!  My friend who lives in Vegas brought me here last weekend and I could not have chosen a better lunch spot. After a few days of all you can eat buffets and high priced restaurants, Bachi Burger was a very nice change of pace. I heard this was the best burger place in Vegas. I knew I had to try it. Here's my take:  What I recommend: If you love blue cheese as much as I do, go with the Black & Green. I have no idea why they don't call it the Black & Blue. I ordered medium rare and it was delicious! It's a great burger. The burger patty if flavorful in itself, but with the mushrooms, bacon and spinach- I enjoyed it very much. One thing that I really liked about the Black & Blue is that the burger is not overwhelmed with the blue cheese. I would say it's in every other bite. Pretty smart if you ask me. Be sure to get the Parmesan garlic fries. Wash it down with a good beer. You'll be glad you did.   If blue cheese is not for you, try the kiki burger. Different cheese, different tastes, but equally amazing.

NEn1isAvxzc5qXTJBE-JmQ.text: I had Miyagi-San's Grass Fed Wagyu Burger..best burger ever (See the pic I added to Yelp)!! Also the Parmesan & Sweet Potato Fries were a winner at our table. The garlic fries were ok but nothing great. If I only had one minor complaint it's that they need more space overall (tables, chairs, bathroom, etc).

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Miyagi-San&#39;s Grass Fed Wagyu Burge

8hV8YrozjQdeeVlWSZ5_iQ.text: The food here is cooked right and no short cuts are taken. The menu is creative and well thought out. The only area that needs improvement is the service. I have visited many time and have yet to have decent service. hard to get refills and forget about the server coming back  to check on you once you have the food, except to bring you the bill!  Worth the food, not the service!

I6Wr8WWzDEmepAMz_BGu_Q.text: I don't know- just wasn't feeling it.. I was so excited about my Banh Mi burger (especially after all the rave reviews), but I found the burger to be so overloaded with toppings and sauce that the actual burger meat suffered. It just wasn't as juicy as a good burger should be, and the sauce itself was a bit too salty. Someone else in my group ordered a medium burger that came out still mooing.. When he asked them to cook the meat they were beyond gracious about it, but the "medium" burger came out rare again- hilarious- Ecoli be damned..There's so much potential, but Bachi burger just didn't work for me...

MxzfM3DFSthHKeUNsCQ2Kw.text: What a great burger! Tried the Shogun w two big pieces of foie and wagyu beef and imagine w a poached Asian pear and miso butter. It was decadent and full of fattiness and flavor. It's definitely not a light meal. Paired this with a strawberry guava shake which was nice and thick and perfect with the burger. Also shared the oxtail chili fries which were spicy and delicious.

YbQ_tiE_1mvpAC4iwxgnMQ.text: Yum! Ate here on my recent Vegas trip and it was definitely worth it. This restaurant is located about 4 - 5 miles from The Strip but the drive is not bad at all. My friend recommended trying this place out and it did not disappoint. This was by far the best thing I ate on my trip to Vegas!  I had the Kalbi burger and the oxtail chili cheese fries. I also got to taste the Ronin burger, and the pork belly steamed buns. All of them were excellent! I would recommend all of them. Bottom line: Can't go wrong with anything on the menu.   The Kalbi burger was great. I asked for it medium well and it was perfectly done. The bread itself was soft and buttery, the beef patty was moist and tasted amazing! It also had kimchi as well as some lettuce. It has a wonderful combination of Korean flavors with picked cucumbers on the side! Everything about this dish was excellent and I would come back for more!  The Oxtail Chili Cheese fries were also great but I could have done without it...although their fries were amazing! Crunchy and not overly cooked.  Service was wonderful and our server was friendly and willing to explain everything!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail fries

CU-iytFEOrGjYS9B-MtgcQ.text: Pretty bummed. What a great little place but I'm not likely returning anytime soon. My wife and I sit down at 6:30, no line and no one at the door while the team shoves a 74 dollar burger dinner down our throats over nearly 38 minutes. Seriously, the ambiance sucked as a 25 year old supervisor is running through the place like a mad man yelling table numbers and reset directions at a bunch of staff that aren't near him or listening to him and creating chaos around the room. Staff are trying to clear items not done, I was 2/3 thru my burger when the server stopped the check. Are you serious? Still no one at the door. Too many great places in town to pay 16 dollars for a medium well burger ordered mr and get rushed out of the place. Sharing review with friends. A Shame too.

5BwdL8Kl8GTYTtunnxfnLA.text: Amazing!!! We came here based off other yelp reviews and we are so glad we did! Tried a ronin burger, a spicy miso burger, and a regular angus burger and they were all fantastic! Best burgers we have ever had. They had such nice combinations of flavors with the burgers. For example the spicy miso burger came with Apple vinaigrette, and normally I cannot stand vinaigrette so I got it on the side in case I didn't like it- it complimented the burger so nicely I can see why they had it in on there! Staff was also extremely friendly and helpful as to what to pick and what influenced the different burgers.   Absolutely wonderful and we would definitely come back. We fully agree with the assessment that these are the best burgers in Vegas!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The spicy miso burger
Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The oxtail chili cheese fries were wonderful! Huge portion and nice combination of flavors

96kAa567xknUr1zhfh3oGQ.text: So glad we stopped by to check out this place.  Amazing!!!!!   Asian fushion inspired burgers are done so well here.  The oxtail fries are big and must be shared.  It's gonna be my go to place before I drive back to LA.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail Fries

Jey_bNqhItj6ZtnxUkO7zw.text: Love this place! I had a miyagi-san, a wagyu burger w/ crispy onion strings, bacon, a fried egg, and an awesome BBQ type glaze. It was on a soft, eggy, sweet roll. Bangin burger! And cheaper than anything comparable you'd find on the strip   The truffle parm fries were some of the best I've had. They porcini mushroom sauce on them is soooo good. And the roasted red pepper aioli is the perfect complement.   The fried chicken appetizer was also awesome! Everything we had was so good! I'm definitely hitting this place up again when I'm back in Vegas!

X9tr59tZp3XJdQAXIEOv1A.text: One thing for sure is, their burgers are big and juicy! I got an egg with mine which was so good! At first I was skeptical about this place because it was something different, but you know what they say...don't knock it till you try it!

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

41npifm2xn6Ql1sbflxoaA.text: I truly waned to like this place. We were in Vegas a few weeks ago to visit family and my husband recommended this establishment.  He happened to dine here with colleagues while on a business trip and he enjoyed the food.  I would like to explain why I gave them two stars.  Firstly, the wait was about an hour. There were no sufficient chairs available to sit inside the make shift lobby of the restaurant (it's pretty compact) so we ended up waiting inside the car while the car was running. Why? Well, it's summer and it is Vegas at above 110 degrees. Of course you need cool air! After an hour, we were seated and was waited on by a courteous server.  We ordered our drinks and he returned after 15 minutes to get our food orders.  Everyone in my family ordered burgers while I chose ramen.  The ramen came out after 20 minutes and we were told that the burgers will be coming out in 5 minutes. Well, 10, 20, 30 then 40 minutes went by and no burgers were in sight.  I finished my meal and my family haven't eaten yet. It was past 9:30 at this point. My Dad is diabetic and his blood sugar was low as he felt shaky.  He was not feeling well by the time their food arrived.  Shortly afterwards, we were handed the check/bill and my Dad has not even tried his burger!! How rude!!! I don't get it.  There's anything obviously something wrong with how this restaurant is managed and ran.  Tons of people running around by not enough people in the kitchen.  Needless to say, we left feeling swindled!  I do not recommend this place and definitely not going back.  Their only saving grace is the nice guy who served us. He was not the guy who gave us the check by the way.

KAbwcAGvp1D-7NsdEGJgdg.text: So I dunno if you've ever been in a situation where you're really hungry and you're thinkin, 'Do I want a Burger, or do I feel like a hot bowl of Noodles?'  So typical..... I've been there on numerous occasions and let me tell you, I could ponder that fork in the road for hours...if only there was a place that served both..... Tadaaaa! Well, it's not exactly one place, more like two places adjacent to each other by chef/owner Lorin Watada; whose fusion burger fame, 'Bachi Burger' has propelled her into Ramen game - the current 'it' food in Vegas.  Not that there can be enough Japanese fare in my opinion!  Hachi Machi, give me a Bachi!!!   Bachi Burger is a Japanese Hybrid Burger joint serving the American classic  with Japanese twists.  It's become the culinary zeitgeist to throw a bunch of 'Asian' ingredients on anything and see what whacked flavor comes out (yack) yielding moderate to disastrous results.  Innovation is great but sometimes you just have to go simple.    But when I feel like having something other than you standard Burger fare, I look to Bachi - the flavor combinations are nostalgic and the burger quality is pretty good.  Also, there's a proximity and it's open all the time (unlike the Foodtrucks that are sooo good, but just a scheduling/coordinating pain).  There's a previous review of Bachi - go ahead and read and you'll get what I'm talking about below...  Did you read it? Ok, good. Just as a summary, they serve a lot of Asian style dishes as appetizers, Chinese Bao's, Chicken Karage and Edamame, so you get a harmonic blend of Asian bites with All American Burgers. And for a guy like me who has trouble deciding on one cuisine, I get a bit of everything like an international buffet..but with good food.  Truffle Parmesan Fries:  Parmesan Reggiano + Black Truffle Porcini Cream + Sun Dried Tomato Aioli.  In my previous posts, I complained that I enjoyed what little gravy they provided for this cone heap of Fries that they stingily provide. It seems that someone was listening; upon my recent visit, the Fries came with a generous portion of the creamy gravy that made those Fries uber luxurious and thoroughly fulfilling.  The Sun Dried Tomato Aioli does not work at all with the Truffle cream, however, since there is a portion of fries near the bottom of the cone that is not coated with decadent sauce, the Aoli serves a good condiment for those untouched by the earthy goddess...  Kiki Burger   I've had the Ronin Burger which was pretty good, and the Black and Green Burger was amazing.  But my favorite is the Kiki Burger: an Angus Beef Patty with sauteed Shitake, Eryngii and Enoki Mushrooms, Caramelized Bacon, Sweet Onion Marmalade, Gruyere Cheese and a Garlic Aioli.  When I first reviewed this Burger, my biggest complaint was that overabundant smattering of the Aioli drowning out the flavor of all the other ingredients, including the Burger.  Well, much to my pleasure, they had listened; the Plate was served with the Aioli on the side, which could be knifed on to one's liking.  This made a world of difference, you could taste all the awesome flavors that this burger has to offer: The charcoal permeated through the Beef, which alone was satisfying, the Gruyere + Caramelized Bacon elevated the unctuous bass level notes, while the Sweet Onion Marmalade was savory and sweet. I added my own level of Garlic Aioli, just enough kick to spice it up before each bite....Super delish!  So, now it come down to the Battle: who won?  For Appetizers:  I don't know, they both so different!! For Main:          I can't choose - they're both sooo good!!! For Dessert:      Bleah.....  There really is no battle, if you feel like having Burgers, ie. red meat, got to Bachi.  If you cold and need to warm up with a great bowl of Ramen with some great Broth, get yourself on over to Shoku Ramen Ya.  I love both of these places and it's always hard to decide each time I'm in front of these two doors!  Bachi Burger                                                      Ratings (Out of Five Stars)                                    Food:         4.5                                                    Ambience:  3                                                       Service:      4           Always start off with a plate of Gyoza, it's like a cultural tradition of Ramen Shops to provide these half dozen, moon shaped crispy delights stuck together like little piglets.  It's always a little game to try and pick them off without ripping the skin, retaining the piping hot filling within its crackling confines.  As for t

USNrb6DNWxkXLQvNp46SJw.text: Fancy, tasty burgers and sides and drinks! What more can you ask for?   Def a place to grab lunch before the long trek back to LA.  Though the Foie burger could do without the unagi. Though I normally LOVE unagi, it did nothing to the sandwich beside made me more stuffed and cost me more money.

qbd8jJ8Z_oFPQG9RaM2N1A.text: When I first tried Bachi Burger I was not impressed, luckily I gave it another try. My team at work decided to get together and eat here one night. They were super accommodating, considering we took up almost the entire restaurant on a busy Friday night. I had the Kiki burger and was very happy with the flavor. I mean mushrooms, caramelized bacon, sweet onion marmalade, gruyere, and garlic aioli - how can you go wrong? My husband and I split an order of the truffle fries and I was really sad I had to share. The fries are slim cut and delicious. I really enjoyed the sun dried tomato aioli that came on the side, in fact I found myself slathering some on my burger. My husband had the fish sandwich and it had really great flavor. The fish was not deep fried, but pan seared which was unique and the glaze on the fish made it really tasty.   My only gripe is the wait time, since the place is so small. We recently visited and they had remodeled and made more seating. They even installed a bar/counter area to help seat smaller parties. I really like the new look and hope it cuts down on the wait time, either way the food is worth the wait.

vUqwbTkNWexXT0iq5zjy1A.text: So I came here with too high of expectations and I was doubting this burger place. Everyone put it up on a pedestal and I just thought it was some fact expensive "not worth it" places. BOY WAS I WRONG. Everyone in our party of eight received their burger in fifteen minutes, and it was like a gift from heaven. Perfectly juicy and the bun was crisped just right. Every drop of sauce is blended in with the mix of a variety of assorted condiments and vegetables on your burger, and this makes in-n-out wish it had never been born. Go here, and indulge in a burger that makes you satisfied.

photos.caption: Photo of Bachi Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I had the fish burger, but it was just as glorious as all the others. Don&#39;t judge it.

kSYhJrYOKhy0EUFKSh13bQ.text: Went to Bachi Burger on a Saturday to eat lunch with my nine-year-old son we ordered one Burger to truffle fries it took them almost 45 minutes to make a burger and french fries plus we had a 35-minute wait for seating then the Burger came to our table black and charred I told him this is a burger place you can't get a burger right she said we can make you another one I said I have to wait 45 minutes no thanks they took their burned Burger back and told me they won't charge me for it but they do have to charge me for the Truffle fries that I waited two and a half hours for I pay them for their fries and I told him I'll never return here  , fuku Burger is amazing never done me spring Mountain and Jones

rm3t195G3eCq8fFc1xsfqw.text: From their menu: Kiki's Burger - Angus  Beef, Sauteed  Shiitake, Enoki and Eryngii Mushrooms, Caramelized  Bacon, Sweet  Onion  Marmalade, Gruyere  Cheese, Garlic  Chili, Aioli. IMAGINE! Just imagine...  Sweet onion marmalade? Such a beautiful idea. Caramelized BACON? Down! Put these in between two extremely doughy, soft, wonderfully toasted buns, perfectly grilled beef patty, with a bunch of mushrooms, gruyere cheese, garlic chilli, aioli.... omg. I picked this burger because it listed all my favorite things. It's seriously one of the best burgers I've ever had. The buns were amazing FORREAL.  Ox tail fries - bomb, but the meat chunks need to be bigger. Overall, very good experience on my end. My mouth is salivating. I wanna come back here next time I'm in Vegas!

WUoixyc7Nh8jq-NEH9VSbg.text: Great food and great service...but could you please have the radio stations in the different rooms on the same channel? It's horrible to be stuck in the crossfire!

EHU_PdMoPOVDCzmQvaMwBA.text: Good burger if your in the mood to wait for it, ox tail chili cheese fries are a must!  Service is mediocre at best  @Joseph I'm a returning customer but the service issue I have is that it always seems under staffed.  I feel I'm waiting for service but I don't feel like I'm waiting on the food. Waiting for someone to get to the table  , refill your drink,  if you need something in between , waiting for the check has been my issues every time I have returned.
